review_body: 1st impressions of this hotel was that it was nice, but totally not what we were sold at the travel agent (of course not the hotels fault). The hotel had actually upgraded us from double to king which was nice, but when we saw the room we were a bit disappointed. Alot smaller than the photos look and the windows dont open, we even had a sticker covering the window so we didnt actually have a view at all. Air con from outside was very loud especially during the night but we soon got used to it. Onto the pros, bedding seemed to be changed daily which is a massive bonus but we stayed during the Corona virus outbreak so not sure if they do this normally. Room tidied every day. Rooftop "bar" is a complete joke. It's hardly a rooftop at all its tiny and the roof wasnt opened. The rooftop and the downstairs bar both closed during our stay due to Corona virus. Did not get to try the downstairs bar so cannot commend but it looked nice enough. Front desk staff were lovely and friendly. The biggest plus for this hotel is the location-its perfect. Right opposite a shopping centre, star bucks next door one side and subway the other. Few mins walk to central park if that. Right by the subway which is super handy for sight seeing. All in all a nice stay just not as 'swanky' as we were sold and paid for. It was our first time in New York tho so maybe alot of the hotels are like this, small and dingey. We enjoyed our stay and due to location would probably stay here again. NYC was very quiet compared to normal so would love to come back to experience it, once the corona buggers off!!!

I stayed here recently since I was meeting with a friend to go to the Museum of Natural History. The hotel is across the street from the 59th St subway station for the A/B/C/D trains (as well as Time Warner Center) and around the corner from Central Park. I arrived early and Franklin was super friendly and was able to get me checked in before 11! The hotel is newer, but you can tell that the building is a bit old. This doesn't bother me personally as this is pretty typical with NYC hotels, but definitely something to note.

Wonderful staff and very confident location. The room was a very good size for a NYC hotel room. The room was clean and looked nice upon arrival. Our only issues were the hotel room phone didn’t work which was problematic when trying to call and let them k ow the bathroom light had burned out.

Contented and satisfiedI stayed here on two occasions in February 2020. The location is across the street from the subway and near Cultural landmarks like Lincoln center and Carnegie Hall. easy to get to from JFK.My room was quiet, the bathroom floor heated and I could open the windows to get a breath of fresh air.Front desk staff cooperative, helpful and obliging. In particular Melody displayed a high level of professionalism.Wally, Chris and Carlos were all warm and welcoming.The price was right. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and recommend it to other travelers.

Victor and franklin were outstanding and truly made me and my fiancé feel welcomed. Outstanding customer service! Even with the small issue we had Victor made sure my fiancé and I were beyond satisfied and did all he could to be there every step of the way!!so friendly and easy going I didn’t feel rushed at all. A RAISE IS NEEDED FOR VICTOR AND FRANKLIN. It’s not easy having great customer skills Throughout your entire shift. —we stayed for 2 nights —king suite

Went on a weekend+holiday monday and got a great rate. Room was clean and modern and as it it right on Columbus Circle, very convenient. Lots of restaurants, shopping at Time-Warner Center, Jazz at JALC, Central Park, subway... all just a 5 minute or less walk.

I don't like to get lost in a huge hotel when I visit a big city, so I truly enjoyed the personalized service, exquisite spacious room and patio around the corner from Central Park and steps from Columbus Circle. This gem is a find. Can't wait to go back in the Spring.The snow covered patio was a delight and we were able to have a snow ball fight with clean fresh white NYC snow.

Great location and good price are the prosCons view was terrible. I received an e-mail the day before we went to ask if it was a special occasion and it was so I asked for a nice view. We faced a brick building, no pens and had to borrow from the desk to fill out the breakfast card for room service (way before 2am as instructed) and no one came by to take the order ticket We were waiting for it until we noticed they didn’t take the card for the order off the door and almost missed our appointment which was the entire purpose of our overnight stay Not sure I would stay there again

Two stars because it provided us a safe place to sleep, and the doorman was nice. This hotel had the worst service of anywhere I’ve stayed. I tried to contact them before we arrived but they don’t list their phone number on the website. I filled out the “contact us” form a week before we arrived but they never replied.I googled a phone number and called. The person who answered was unfriendly and unhelpful when I asked for a room with two beds. When we arrived they had a note on my reservation about my request but had reserved that room to someone else anyway. I’d have to pay an extra $70/night, or for $40/night we could have a cot.The room was clean but cluttered with all sorts of stuff to buy. It took up half the desk. The fridge was also completely full of beverages to buy, but none of it was cold. There was no space to store our own items.I tried to use the microwave but it wasn’t plugged in, and the cord didn’t reach the outlet. The only option was to pull it partially off the shelf and hold it while using.There are no ice machines on the floor. The front desk instructed us to call room service to have ice delivered to the room, but they don’t provide you with a phone number. We tried to call the front desk for help. Unfortunately they don’t answer the phone - on two different days we tried four times without success. We ended up walking down to the desk with our bucket and asking for ice. (It was filled promptly and delivered to our room.)If you have an iPhone 4, the 30 pin charger on the room’s iHome will be great for you. One nice feature- the left half of the bathroom floor is heated.

If you are looking for bright and airy...go someplace else. I guess the location allows this place to charge so much, but it is cramped and dreary. The people are nice...but that is it. Rooms at best are very small.

This is our first family vacation in NYC and this location was very convenient for us with a shopping center and subway station right across the street. Our room was very neat and clean every time we arrived back to our suite from exploring the city. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Coming from a small town in Maryland, we were not used to the hustle and bustle of the city, but the hotel’s staff was very helpful with guiding us through everything from parking to restaurant recommendations. A special thanks to the hotel’s very helpful staff, especially Nadia, Nicole, Melody, Victor and the rest of the team. You all made our stay a very pleasant one! We will definitely be back and recommend 6 COLUMBUS HOTEL to our friends!

Beware of this hotel! I made a reservation and cancelled it 3 weeks ahead of the scheduled arrival date. They never refunded my money although I followed their cancellation policy. I have called twice with very rude staff on the phone asking for my refund. To date no money has been returned. You get transferred to accounting who do not pick up the phone.DO NOT reserve this hotel unless you are prepared to lose money.

I stayed in this hotel over Thanksgiving and WOULD NOT recommend it. The entire hotel is super dark and my room smelled of mildew (believe it was the carpet) and was just generally not clean. I went to the CVS down the street to purchase an air freshener to place in the room. I stayed there for nearly a week and they never changed the sheets (even though I spilt a bit of coffee on them). There are plenty of comparably priced hotels in the area - I will never stay here again!

We stayed here at the start of our family travels, it's in a good location, not far to walk to Time Square etc.The room was really small, but clean, we are travelling with quite a lot of luggage and there wasnt room really for us to be able to comfortably get to our cases.Other than the room size the hotel was great, the staff were really friendly, would recommend this place for a good central location.

I visited this hotel, after a bad experience in another hotel. And what a pleasant stay it was. Small hotel, very well located, sweet room, nice bathroom, a very good getaway from the noisy streets. Good value for money and very kind staff .. we will be back

Terrible hotel. We stayed for the NYC marathon and the location was awesome. But it was almost $4k for a dark, old, tiny room that always smells like the sushi restaurant next door. I was crushed I spent so much on the hotel for what we got. The photos online are incredibly misleading. The “rooftop deck” doesn’t look anything like the photos.

We paid outrageous rates on NYC Marathon weekend but location could not have been better. All spaces very small. Only place to charge phone and laptop was plug at bathroom sink. No counter space in bathroom. About 24' of closet space and a couple of tiny drawers for clothes. No in room coffee service. Hotel needs serious decor update. Hotel was clean and staff was wonderful and seriously overworked on very busy weekend.

I have a subscription to the Met Opera. Staying at 6 Columbus is convenient as it's a 10 minute walk back to the hotel after the opera. It's also close to subway lines and the Time Warner Center is just across the street so I can get my Momofuku Noodle Bar fix without going far. The rooms are tight, but if you upgrade, the rooms with King beds are roomy enough. One morning I was woken by a child chattering loudly and playing with the room door next to me at 5:00 am. What kind of parent would allow their child to do that, I can't say. I complained and the manager moved me to another upgraded room at no additional charge. Slept well the following nights. Some rooms need an upgrade, but mine were clean. Hotel is near Columbus Circle so I don't know about parking as I never drive in NYC.

CONS: The hotel lobby and hallways are very dark. Rooms are small – kept banging shins on the bed frame every time I came out of the bathroom. Bathroom is small and dark, very little counter space. No extra toilet paper. The dresser in the room is almost entirely taken up by the food & drinks that the hotel wants you to buy (at ridiculous prices of course). TV did not work properly. The room had an unsettling smell if mildew. HVAC was loud.PROS: Great location. Good on-site sushi restaurant.

The room was great, the bed was very comfortable, and the service was fantastic. Any time we needed anything the front desk was on it! Some upgrading of the buildings common areas wouldn’t go amiss, and perhaps better lighting in those corridors and rooms. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

We were beyond pleased with our stay at 6 Columbus. We traveled as a family and they upgraded us to a larger room so the three of us could fit. The room was very spacious- and even better- there was a deck with a dining area and 2 lounge chairs. Wonderful for summertime entertaining or just getting some sunshine. We would definitely go back!

A few steps away from Central Park, across the street from a subway, etc...Location is really fabulous however, the hotel itself was "ok". Our room was extremely small and the cleaning was not exactly meticulous.Great little sushi place for lunch or dinner right on the ground floor - they tend to rush service though so, not the most relaxing meal one will have.The front desk team was very nice, helpful.

Took a little trip away with my husband and stayed here 2 nights. The hotel is upscale but still shows the original bones of what it was including the smallest elevator I’ve been on!The staff was friendly and helpful. Room was smaller than others I’ve been in but very lovely! The room size was what I expected with a Manhattan place and the most important thing was the bed was comfy!Great location just off Central Park and a decent walk to Broadway, Time Square, and subway access.

Unfortunately this hotel no longer offers any access to a gym facility. This used to be the main reason I stayed here. The rooms are also tired and generally no longer a good value compared to other hotels in the area.

All in all, had a good visit to this hotel. We started with clean yet dark room for three people (two queen beds) that was extremely small but doable. There was not enough room to store our clothes which meant that we had to keep the suitcases open. I did trip over the corner of the bed a couple of times and found a storage drawer under the bed. The bathroom was also extremely small with very little shelf room. The bathrobes were also strangely small/petite. there as no coffee or tea in the room which surprised me. Due to the fantastic location we were gone all day anyway. I did stay longer in New York alone and moved to a single light room which felt huge. The bathroom was larger as well. I would probably stay here again as the staff was very nice and helpful. Price and location were good too.

The location of this hotel I have to say was excellent- just over the road from the subway, around the corner from Central Park, over the road from a big shopping mall with restaurants and a market place supermarket, down the road from a pharmacy, near a lovely French Cafe, Starbucks and a sushi barBUT having said that, the hotel is definitely not 4.5 as it is described, the photos of the rooms were no where near what they actually were - we had a small dingy room, small bed right up to the edge of side drawers, a wardrobe that was free standing and could only fit a few clothes, a view out into a bank of air conditioning, no tea and coffee making facilities ( couldn’t believe this), noisey patrons who would slam their doors at all hours of the night. The decor in the lobby and hallways and the lift was dark and dingy etc etcI would not recommend anyone staying here, irrespective of its location

Booked last minute for business trip via online hotel aggregator to try something different. Great rate, great location. Hoped for a new spot for frequent future business travel. BUT Service and room quality were a disappointment. This midtown location not up to the standard of this hotel group's other properties or hotels with similar 4+ star ratings. The Details:Room - small even by New York standards. No desk or usable counter surface. This was a bed, bathroom and TV. Workably basic. (Only space in the room besides tiny nightstands and armoire for clothing storage was top of minibar cabinet and it was covered with for-sale items). Cleanliness and Condition of Room. subpar . Dust bunnies in corners bigger than golf balls. Safe broken. On demand TV, down. Some miscellaneous paper garbage from prior guests still in room. Mid century furniture looks great in pictures but in person was chipped, worn and closer to IKEA items after a college student's move than quality furniture.  Service. The real disappointment. Staff was friendly but service quality relative to price point and rating was very very poor. Example: asked about a few hour late checkout....fully understanding it might not be possible if hotel was full. Staff 's answer was to offer to either charge for another night or suggest I use the lobby bathroom to change before travel. Clearly the hotel wasn't full since I could have had the room for another night - but they were not willing to extend checkout for a business traveler by two hours?  It's 90 degrees, humid. Would have been nice to be able to take quick shower and change out of business clothing from a last meeting before going to the airport. I'd have understood if they were full. I'd have happily paid an added fee for a late checkout if that was an option too.... My options were the dismissive choice between - the the lobby bathroom or pay for another full night. Very Disappointing. Final irritation: they charge an amenities/convenience fee of about $35-40/night on top of the rate but it's unclear they provide any such amenities or convenience for this fee. On my trip, Internet was listed clearly as either "free" or available at higher speeds for a separate surcharge, the rooftop bar was closed, there is no onsite gym, And no late check out. So that extra fee for Amenities and convenience?? Name what I was paying for, please?Given location and good last minute rate, I can't give a single star. it wasn't a horrible experience but nevertheless, disappointing experience. I would not want to take my company's business here for future travel based on this one try. Would not consider this a 4 or 4+ star hotel.

With assistance of Nicole Dlugos (front office manager) we started one night in a King Deluxe (9th floor), then two nights in a King Suite (4th floor). Either size room would have been sufficient for the two of us, but with our daughter visiting from time to time the extra room in the suite was a plus. In the suite we had a microwave oven. We would have rather have had a coffee maker, but perhaps that is just a personal preference. C. O. Bigelow Body Wash, Shampoo and Conditioner in the bath was great. Read up on the history of C. O. Bigelow Apothecaries for greater appreciation. The two bathrobes were "interesting". Both the same size which I would say is small petite which was fine for my wife, but on me it would have looked appropriate for a SNL skit. Maybe a little more "one size fits most" would have been reasonable? This was our second visit to this hotel with a gap of 8 years between stays. The location to Central Park was wonderful. The Shops at Columbus Circle were right there and most convenient. Restaurants are also reasonably close, but don't bypass the Blue Ribbon Sushi Bark & Grill located next to the lobby of the hotel. Excellent sushi menu! We did try the roof top bar for an after dinner cocktail. It was most relaxed in atmosphere and service. Rooms were clean, serviced promptly and comfortable. One day we did have our "do not disturb" door hanger out. There was a know at our door, I went to see it was and was greeted by a gentlemen who handed me three bath towels and turned and left. Kind of strange. Perhaps he had the wrong room? But with the "do not disturb" sign out? Nothing lost, we were up, but not fully ready for door knocks. All in all the facility was most suitable of our needs during our stay in a very HOT New York City.

During a 2 year period I parked myself here for 1-3 nights while working in NYC, commuting in from Boulder, CO. These guys go the extra mile. They remembered me. And (or), they tried very hard to make mine a terrific experience each time ... the small things like extra clean towels or holding my luggage extra time as needed.

6 Columbus, Central Park was a great place to set up camp while we explored NYC. The best part about this property is its location. It was also clean and reasonably priced. Also, there is a great sushi bar in the lobby. The staff was very welcoming and helpful and we felt safe while we were there.

my stay here was very good. I had a nice sized room very close to where I needed to be. The restaurant is excellent. The room itself was well arranged. I like the neighborhood also, I was close to good places for breakfast.

I had booked a room at the Hudson New York on the same block, but it was inhabitable. Fortunately, the Six had rooms available and set me up with a nice one on the 4th floor. Whew. The staff was great... this had turned out to be a kinda rough trip (the airline lost my suitcase in addition to my original hotel being awful). But they took care of me. Definitely felt homey and comfortable. The large picture windows facing the Time Warner Center and the park are a plus, there was a microwave in my room (no coffee machine, but there's a Starbucks next door to the lobby) and the location couldn't be better. Because I didn't have my suitcase for 4 days of the trip :( I had to buy necessities every day, but literally everything I needed was within a block. Small gripes are: the bathroom mirror is too high, the armoire door was broken, and there are no drawers. Most importantly, this hotel saved my trip. I will definitely stay here again.

My husband and I had a trip to NYC for the dates of June 10th to June 14th (part business for him & pleasure for me - our 20th wedding anniversary is on 6-12). He had certain hotels that were allowed per his company and 6th Columbus was one on the list. We have stayed in NYC 7 different times but had never stayed at this hotel & were excited to try it out. The hotel sounded & looked great online. A major selling point was the rooftop bar. However when we arrived on Monday it was pouring down rain - my husband & I were trying to get the suitcases out of the cab but the doorman just stared at us. We took the suitcases & proceeded to walk up the stairs as fast as possible to keep from getting soaked and neither doorman (there were 2) offered to help. We got to the check in counter where the desk clerk seemed too busy to even recognize we were standing there. While I stayed near the couches I noticed another man (I am guessing another doorman although it wasn't clear what his role was) just staring at me. The other 2 doormen were also looking at us which made me very uncomfortable as if we had stumbled into some kind of secret but were not in on the surpise - awkward to say the least. *this happened all 3 times we were at the desk (initial arrival, check-in, & when we left)* I am not sure what is wrong with those guys but as a woman who was going to be alone while my husband was at a conference during the day I DID NOT feel comfortable AT ALL!!!!!The desk clerk told us the room would be ready in an hour so we checked our bags & walked to have lunch. Once we arrived close to 1:30pm we were told that the computers were down so we could not get any keys to the room. The desk clerk also informed us he had no way to upgrade us to any other room even though it was our anniversary (FYI - the new hotel we moved to gave us the BIGGEST suite they had & made a point of doing everything they could to ensure a wonderful stay)A man named Louis ushered us to the room & I must say he seemed nice.When we walked in the room I nearly lost it. I am not easily upset & in fact am very laid back however this room was INCREDIBLY dark, dated, small, and only had 2 very small windows that overlooked another building. I immediately started having clausterphobia. I told my husband we needed to get out ASAP. He got on his computer immediately to try & find another hotel. *FYI: the Wi-Fi was awful in the room!When we went downstairs to check out we spoke to Nicole. We explained our issues with the hotel although I did not voice my concern with the men that made me uncomfortable because they were STARING at us! UGH! I wanted out of that place as soon as possible - it was awful. Nicole was nice enough & honestly we hope they can take some of these suggestions & make this a better experience for future guests.HOTEL OVERVIEW: lobby is very small and dark. The desk clerk was not friendly and seemed preoccupied. The hallways are a DARK blue with dark grey carpet. The room was a dark brown and blue combination. The halls are narrow with only a one person capacity. The elevators are SMALL & we had to share them with the employees (no service elevator) - there were 2 employees in the elevators with dirty towels and sheets as we were leaving which isnt a huge deal but is kinda of gross. Suggestions: If this were my hotel I would give it a total remodel and place white walls with white tile and light grey sofas in the lobby with accent pillows in shades of blue to brighten the place up. The halls need to be some softer shaded of light grey or light blue to reflect light and brighten the place up. The rooms also need to be brightened up - paint the wood pieces a white color and replace the dark carpet with something lighter. The bathroom décor was fine and I loved the dark blue tile. But honestly this hotel needs some work.

I booked this hotel due to the close proximity to business meetings I had in the city. Though the location was convenient, the hotel itself was unacceptable on almost all aspects. The one star is for the accuracy of photos. The lack of any other stars is due to the misleading nature of the photos. Greeting: During a pouring rain, the front lobby staff opened the door but did not offer to help me or my companion with our luggage (up the wet steps). They did give us uncomfortable looks as they sized us up. I did not at all feel safe. The looks were whether we were worth stealing from or worse, assaulting. Check In: The staff was ok, but gave us a glance as though they were extremely busy, though no other person was checking in. Had they said they are wrapping up something and will just be a moment, I could understand the delay and cold shoulder. No apology, no thanks for our visit. No hospitality. Lobby: The area was dark and uninviting for a hotel. It would be great for a nightclub or perhaps an hourly hotel for one night stands, but not for a family or business trip. Elevator: The two of us and our luggage barely fit in the elevator with our luggage. Room: I could step from door to bed, it was that close to the door. The walls were paper thin. I could hear ever conversation of every person in the hall. I could hear every step and every door opening / closing. And, anything said or sound made in the room could be heard from the hallway. Again, if using the room for hourly purposes or a one night stand, it could do. But I'd never recommend this place for a family or business trip, you'd get no rest with the hallway noise and wouldn't feel comfortable having all your conversations heard by others. Value: This is a relatively expensive place to stay given the above. There are so many local and national options to this place. If this were the last room available in the city, I'd probably suggest going to a shelter - you'd feel more safe and not be surprised by the size and lack of privacy.

I as initially given a room that had a window that couldn't lock, and could be easily opened to a courtyard that was accessible by 'only staff'. Front desk gave me hard time when I said I didn't feel safe.
From check in to check out. Positive, informative and care of client!Any work trip you plan to NYC arond Columbus circle this is the spot.Location is great and easy to access any points if interest!!

hotel 60 is only a few blocks from every place I was going to on this weekend. I was greeted by a friendly and helpful desk clerk . He had suggestions on things I could do within a few blocks of the hotel .But walk out the front door and central park is 2 blocks away . They havea Japanese restaurant on the first floor that is superb well prepared sushi and not just the usual fare.i enjoyed the food and service very much

Booked by our travel company. Got upgraded and a bottle of prosecco to room from family.Very large room and lounge and very comfy. Ate in restaurant there Japanese and was very good. Rooftop bar was small but fun up there. Very convenient situation and good size rooms for New York.

The location is great, the service was perfectly fine. The room was clean and beds comfortable. The room looked a bit worn around the edges (nothing major). But the room and bath are pretty small, and the view is of a brick wall. For a 4 star hotel I expected a more impressive lobby. We ordered through Hotwire but after all the taxes it came to over $320 a night. I stayed in a couple of other 4stars in Manhattan and was more impressed than this one, couldn't wait to get back to my spacious apartment and bath in Boston (but again, they didn't do anything wrong so....)

The only reason I give it a one star is because a zero star option was not available. I booked this hotel on Hotwire requesting a 4.5 star hotel or night ..this hotel was categorized as a 4.5 star hotel however, I’d be surprised if it’s even a 2.5 star hotel. We entered the hotel into Dark dingy lobby. We received an Uneventful welcome from the Arrogant flippant front desk reception. Went to our room on the six floor. My walkin Closet In Toronto is bigger than this room ...With the view of the extremely dirty exhaust and fans from the adjacent sushi restaurant. Scratched and bumped my leg on broken drawer under bed. Safe did not work. Carpet needed replacing. Lamp shade was dirty. Room was dark (so that you cannot see how the room is in need of much needed repair and upgrade) We complained to the front desk and they put us in a brighter room much larger with a better view. But we’re going to charge us $50 usd per night. I called Hotwire and complained and they cancelled this reservation without issue and found us the Lotte Net York Palace at the same price. Which we classified as a 5 star hotel. We stayed at the Lotte for 4 days. Amazing hotel. Read my review for that hotel. Stay away from the 6 Colombus !!!

I had a VERY brief stay at this hotel about a month ago (10 hours!) and I enjoyed it. The location was great for a trendy dinner around Lincoln Center. What most impressed me is that I left my favorite (and most valuable) piece of clothing in the room when I left: my black leather jacket. What's more, I didn't even realize I left it there until about 3 weeks later. When I called the hotel, the manager on duty, Chris, checked the lost and found and told me they had my jacket. Nicole, another manager, arranged to mail it to my home address outside of NYC. I really appreciate the service and, most of all, the honesty of the housekeeper and staff.Thank you. I will stay again.

To find an hotel close to Central Park it is not easy and for sure not cheap, but this hotel is a very big surprise! Big rooms, terrace, cordiality and service from the personnel is a plus that I will remember!

This place is fine, and I’m kind of a diva about hotels. Yes, it’s loud, and the staff isn’t effusively friendly, the wifi is slow, there’s no counter space in the bathroom. But for the price and location, it’s pretty good. Everything is serviceable enough. When I return to nyc, this hotel wouldn’t be more first choice, but if I had to stay here again I wouldn’t complain. As an aside: there was an emergency water shut off that meant I had to shower at the gym across the street which wasn’t ideal. I got a whopping $25 discount for the trouble.

Great location, bang on Columbus Circle and a hop away from the Central Park. Rooms are tiny, no coffee maker. One of the two elevators was out of order that weekend which made the wait so long that I mostly took the stairs. Friendly staff, though they couldn't do much about a funny stale smell in the room. It's a shame that I will never stay here again.

I upgraded my room but it did not have a bath. then I was upgraded (again for a cost) to a room with a bath and the tub stopper was not in place so I couldn't even take a bath the first night in the new room. The lower level floors smell disgustingly of sushi. I had to move to upgrade to a higher floor to get away from the smell. The restaurant is great but I never want to eat there again.

When we arrived (& departed) there was no one to help with bags. Did not get the room we booked. Was not offered any compensation. Desk person was not helpful. Was charged for mini bar items we did not ask for or use. Elevator slow, one out of service. Rooftop bar drinks were excessively expensive.

Happy with hotel but not happy with being charged for mini bottles of liquor that I did not consume. Does someone there have “sticky fingers” and think the checking out guest will not notice?? I am still waiting to hear....

So I booked a pre-paid reservation for a colleague recently at this hotel. My colleague was charged for the full stay twice and refunded twice, one of the charges and refunds occurred after he left the hotel. This was a hassle to straighten out for our accounting department. Clearly this is a sloppy operation. Can not recommend this hotel in good conscience to anyone.

We really enjoyed our visit- the entire staff was very welcoming and accommodating. The location was close to Central Park and the subway systems, or a quick walk to midtown. Citibikes nearby in all directions, and the day passes to the Equinox gym were an added perk.

Perfect location! This hotel is gorgeous, clean and rooms are so comfortable. I’m a repeat visitor and will keep coming. Thank you to staff who are always so accommodating and friendly. A special thank you to manager Nicole Maranzino and Wally at the front desk!

A fake fancy hotel in Columbus. There is no gym: you can go to Equinox outside of the building (crossing the street...imagine during winter!!!) asking for a card at the reception ...not certainly convenient! Room not superclean and not very responsive reception.

We loved the location, it is one block from Central Park, next to the Columbus circle, the subway station is across the street, also there is a mall with a Whole foods supermarket (we have several of their prepared meals at very reasonable price), on the corner there is a pharmacy (which is always helpful) and just next to the hotel there is a Starbucks. Times Square and all the major theaters are only a 15 min walk away. The room was great, with good space for NY standards. Spotless. The decoration was attractive and modern. When we arrive the front desk people let us know that the suite we booked was not available (apparently it was overbooked), but they made the necessary arrangements to accommodate us in a big room with a dreamy bathroom (separate huge bathtub and shower), it also had a balcony and a walked in closet. Then we moved to the originally booked suite, with a separate living room and a no so comfortable sofa bed. I let them know that we preferred an air mattress and they immediately attended our request. The service was really good, the entire time al the hotel employees were very kind and helpful, although there was a small issue with the minibar (I requested to take everything away but they forgot). For every other request, they were very accommodating (extra towels, another tv control, etc). It would be nice if in the room were a coffee maker (no coffee at all.The only thing I did not like was that there was a charge from the mini-bar and I made sure no one for our group took anything, but after contact customer-service, they fixed this issue.

Obviously I can only comment on our room, which I assume was the most basic, but it was: Small - maybe this is a thing in midtown, but it was a struggle not to trip up on our suitcasesNoisy - slamming doors, loud plumbing, paperthin walls, noisy air conditioningDark - great for sleeping in, not great if you’re into natural light. Our room had once small window covered in bird droppings, facing into other buildings None of the above - even for the cheapest room - is what I’d expect from a hotel marketed as “boutique luxury”.Add to this, no interaction with the staff except for a hello from the cleaning staff.I had to retrieve our suitcases when we arrived. Apparently the “doorman” didn’t know what room we were in so had been put in a broom closet. But that shouldn’t have been surprising given the lack of any type of welcome when we arrived. This hotel had been recommended by a friend who I can only presume had a far nicer room than our’s.Of course, on the plus side, it’s a great location - a stone’s throw from Central Park and easy walk to the theatre

We were pleased all the way around. It's a reasonably priced hotel across the street from Jazz at Lincoln Center, our reason for being in the city. (For a business traveler, a desk chair would be helpful, but we didn't need one.) The staff was very helpful. We had no problems--we even got a free upgrade to a larger room (perhaps vacant because the HVAC was just outside the window--that didn't bother us, but some visitors might want to specify a quieter room). We greatly enjoyed the rooftop bar and restaurant--thank you for supplying delightful weather during our stay. I'm not sure why some online reviewers complain about small rooms or dark hallways--this is what you get in small boutique hotels in older buildings.Feels like "character" to me. (We were there just one night--if you're spending more than a couple of nights in town you might want a larger room than even the king room.) When we need to be in this part of town again, we'll return.

This hotel is not for families. I rang four times in advance (incurring call charges de abroad) to arrange two baby cribs for my children. On arrival, they weren’t there and I had to forcefully ask for the cribs. The manager tried to apologise with a few bottles of water and a bowl of fruit but that wasn’t really sufficient. After all, we stayed in a suite so expected better service. There Is also no disabled access at the front, meaning I had to lift our stroller myself into the lobby. The doorman was often nowhere to be found and only appeared when I complained.This hotel is for couples and business travelers. That might explain the vibrator in the room...However, the location is great. Close to everything.

The hotel location is a 5, really close to a lot of great things. The room and noisy hallway is a 2. First of all, we were disappointed with the room. We thought if this was a deluxe queen, what heck does a regular queen look like. It was very small and did not look like the hotel posted pictures of the room.The worst part of our experience was the noise coming from the cleaing staff. The room doors are very loud when closed. Echoes throughout small hallways. For some reason the cleaning staff goes in and out the cleaning room door every 5 to 10 minutes starting at 7:15 AM (ish). This great if your staying for business because there would be no way for you to oversleep. If you staying for pleasure and want to sleep in... forget about it.

The front desk people were not friendly / helpful. The AC/Heat unit was many, many years old. When the maintenance guy came up to fix it, because it was just "on" and seemingly no way to adjust temperature, he told me to not touch it. Basics like coffee are hard to come by - no coffee in the rooms, no coffee in the lobby. Do not recommend for business travelers.

The room is VERY noisy! Sound-proof is simply not there, the doors nearby are loud and noisy. I didn’t get enough sleep as I had to wake up every time some late visitors would talk in the hall or a nearby door would slam. Coupled with a jet lag, it was quite irritating. What’s more, breakfast is only served starting 7 a.m., so if you have to leave for early meetings, you have to get up in advance to find a place to eat in the street. Fortunately, there are some diners at a walking distance.

Wonderful hotel and staff. The communication before I arrived was impressive. Hotel is modern, updated, and quiet. I experienced none of the issues of others. Great location for West Side. About an 8 minute walk to 5th. Tons of restaurants within a 4 minute walk. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating

We needed a place close to Lincoln Center and within our budget, and I'm so happy I found 6 Columbus. What a convenient location, not just for Lincoln Center but of course also for walking Central Park and going to museums. Very friendly staff. I only wish we could have stayed another night and done more in the city. Thank you, 6 Columbus.

First the they had a water pipe issue pretty much ending in having brown water coming out from the bath and shower. Then no water pressure.... so annoying when you just want to simply take a shower after a long flight! on the top of it you always have to wait because there is only 1 person to manage check in and check out. I’m disappointed

Good Location. But the entire hotel needs deep and extreme cleaning. Or just major up dating.If you do not care about how clean the room is and bathroom, then stay there at your own risk; i would not stay there again.
user_name:
Index6
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We arrived at the hotel around noon on Saturday for a one-night stay, expecting to store our bags until check-in at 3:00 while we visited the Whitney Museum. To our surprise, the woman at the desk said there was a deluxe room available for immediate check-in, and upgraded up at no charge. In minutes we were installed in a lovely room and very much enjoyed our stay. The location across from the Time Warner complex is within easy reach of everything. Except for a minor complaint about the bathroom, which has a very small sink and no shelves for toiletries, I highly recommend this hotel.

It's NYC. You're never going to feel like your room is appropriate for what it cost. The room did appear to be clean. The only problem I found was that we had no surface space for our few personal belongings and barely any room for our closed luggage. It was a very tight room. The hallway outside of the main lobby was covered with black fur and the hallways upstairs were very dark and lacked any imagination design wise.

Great staff....all so friendly, attentive and helpful. Nice updated modern rooms, with lots of treats inside if you want them. Lots of stuff around and easy to get around the city from this location. Food available downstairs, but I didnt try it yet.

I like this hotel a lot and is superbly located, with great access to Central Park and the rest of ManhattanVery friendly staff and wonderful ambiance - worthy recommendation and nice to stay in a hotel that is not part of a huge chain

Not great, room was very cold in the winter time. They sent an engineer to look at it but it still wasn't fixed and I didn't want to deal with calling someone in the middle of the night so I didn't bother again.

I had business in the Columbus Circle area, which is an area I rarely use, so I found 6 Columbus. The room price I got was pretty reasonable (< $150/night) and I got a LOT of value for that. The hotel is pretty well maintained, the room was reasonable size, and had a nicely appointed bathroom. It has a rooftop bar, which was not open in March, and is attached to a Japanese restaurant, where you can get breakfast--a pretty good one, too!Pros:- Comfortable bed- Nice bathroom with tub and plenty of water pressure- plenty of outlets (see cons below)- Cooked breakfast with 2 scrambled eggs, hash browns, toast and bacon for $14.50--a great price at an NYC hotelCons:- The room is kind of dark, meaning the lighting needs to be improved- The desk and nightstands are not great quality and have seen better days- The bathroom does not have very good shaving light (this should be an easy fix, right?)- The outlets are all hard to get to. Each nightstand has an outlet inside a closed shelf, so you need a flashlight to see the outlet so you can plug into it. The desk outlets are UNDER the desk, so you need to get on hands and knees to get to them. In 2019 I expect better, but for the price, OK, I guess.The only other oddity is that when I checked in, there were no bath towels, so I had to request them, but they came promptly, so that was fine.Overall, I would stay in 6 Columbus again if I'm in the neighborhood.

I like the excellent customer service,The friendly staff were outstanding.The delicious food made it convenient to eat in the hotel or dine locally. It was easy to get around since the hotel is centrally located. and it was convenient to get to LGA.

Overall not too bad if you spend only one night, don't need space and have no special queries. It's well located but the rooms are not worth the price. Servie is ok. It's more like a night auberge than a hotel considering the size of the rooms.
user_name:
Discover18302207543
Tavarnelle Val di Pesa, Italy

review_body: Clean, modern decor and although the rooms are small, they're much bigger than others in the area.Great location.Nice, professional staff.Rooms are quite dark but that's expected in NY.Decent price.
user_name:
Sarah M
New York City, New York

review_body: A good value option if you are looking for a bed (not a real decent size room) in a nice location at southwest corner of Central Park. Sushi restaurant at hotel decent as well albeit a bit pricey for below average atmosphere.

+ The bed was comfortable. The tiles in the bathroom warm up. The room felt safe.- the room was dated and it was not clean. the elevators are small and there was alot of noise on the floor. It was very cold in the room
user_name:
Tour15696787329
New York City, New York

review_body: Surprisingly good hotel and value. On my short list to return. I usually feel dissatisfied by NYC hotels but not this time. Clean, convenient, good service. I had no issues at all and look forward to coming back.

Reminds of a European hotel from the 1980's. VERY small rooms, no climate control (there was a knob that did nothing), over-priced food/drink items, very little storage space, elevator is tiny and slow. the staff was perfectly nice and promptly came to fix the clogged toilet and the non-functioning television, but could do without all that bother.

This is our second trip to 6 Columbus. This first was by searching around online for a great location, moderately priced, clean hotel. Our second time there was by choice. 6 Columbus has been everything we hoped for twice now. The King Suite offers a living room with a pricey stocked minibar including candy, alcohol, sodas, and a "Lovers Kit", in case the mood strikes and you didn't come prepared. This place is within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, and so, so many restaurants and shops. The hotel is definitely comfortable for a woman traveling alone. The housekeeping staff are all so friendly. 6 Columbus is funky, not glamorous, not shiny and slick. I would gladly return here next time in NYC!

Great location for Central Park and upper west side and the 60s decor adds an interesting vibe.Rooms are quite small and there was no desk space, even in a superior room, so it’s better for a leisure trip rather than business. There were no tea or coffee facilities in the rooms, but the minibar does have whole bottles of bourbon and vodka. Interpret that as you wish !WiFi is free and OK. Breakfast is good and the bar downstairs is also a sushi restaurant.The hotel has no gym facilities on site. Apparently they can offer a pass to a gym nearby but it is much less convenient.

The double room I shared with my colleague was very small. The beds were comfortable enough and the bathroom was typical for an NYC hotel, however I found there was exceptionally less space for luggage than other hotels I have stayed in. My suitcase had to stay half open in a v-shape between the bed and the wardrobe. Annoying.

We have stayed at this hotel our last 3 trips to NYC. The location, service and atmosphere are great. The hotel restaurant is also tops. Nice place to have a drink on the rooftop bar as well. The staff is fantastic.

The hotel was very close to central park and the subway. The room was clean and tidy. The only issue we had was the sofa bed was so uncomfortable to sleep on. The hotel staff were polite. Don’t forget the room tax.

Great location and spacious rooms with excellent staff. Amazing on site restaurant too .Close to everything you need. Museums, restaurants, stores, Central Park within steps. Check out the Shops at Columbus!
Great hotel, great location with a cozy room.They have interior room with small window that are perfect for a cold winter.Room was comfortable and quiet and very close to the park and all things NYC!

Great location. The room and hotel overall is pretty dated, and very cold. If you are in NY to be a tourist and not use the room then it’s fine, for me, I wanted to be able to relax and hide away - this wasn’t for me! Also the gym was across the street and not part of the actual hotel! If I could score 2.5 I probably would as the bed was comfy.

One could almost miss the hotel as it is relatively small. The atmosphere is very stylish 60s/70s throughout the Rooms and amenities. Location is perfect, Restaurant as well, and the Roof bar just stunning. Rooms are small but comfortable.

Stay at this hotel. The location is perfect. Just across the street from Central Park. Also just across the street from the Columbus Circle subway station, a major hub. Easy walking distance to 30 Rock and Times Square. Many shopping opportunities available. Many restaurants close by including the soup place you saw on Seinfeld. The staff are very attentive. The place is well kept up, clean, and a great price point. One of NYC’s beat sushi spots on site. (My son saw Leonardo Decapprio there a month or so ago). All together a perfect place to stay that will help make your NYC trip a success.

We picked this hotel as we we going to Carnegie Hall. Great location, lovely staff, and great room. Although busy - loved that it was so quiet - great night's sleep and as one other said very clean.Would certainly stay there again. Only negative I might mention - they only supplied one drinking glass in our room both days and no wine glasses as there were options for cocktails, wine & champagne in the mini bar ??

We got to stay at the hotel compliments of someone else (a company I was working with) and we were very pleased with the accommodations. It is a tight room but what isn’t in NY. Even with a couple of us sharing the room, we never had to dance to get around each other. Compared to the dark hallways, the room had a great window and lighting. Our room had two queen beds (or were they doubles?!) but they were comfy and the accommodations were clean! The bathroom was smart and I should have photographed it but they had a makeup towel - that isn’t white. How smart is that?! They had all sorts of treats in the room that people can help themselves too (for a fee). We also made our way to the roof bar and would have lingered longer but we had a larger group than they could fit last minute. But it was relaxing, you could order drinks or food and there were plenty of comfortable options for seating. I really wanted to see one of their suites so maybe next time I’m in town...#makesmewander

Nice location, nice room, no nice attitude of the staff. No concierge. Only one lady at the front desk Named Nikia was very helpful and enthusiastic. An Asian lady named Maria at the front desk, was very sarcastic. Management needed...!!!

Great hospitality by the hotel staff, the room was very nice and most important very clean, including the bathroom. The hotel has perfect location close to train, stores and Central Park. Great Blue Ribbon restaurant.

I love Columbus Circle. Close to Central Park, Jazz at Lincoln Center and Museums! 6 Columbus reminded me of a European hotel. They honored my request for a quiet room and it was wonderfully so. We had a Queen deluxe and it was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom is huge by NYC standards. Everything worked well--bedside lamps, hair dryer, great shower water pressure. There was a closet big enough for shoes, coats and jackets, welcome in cooler weather. Wonderful sushi restaurant on site. For me view is not an issue, nor is older furniture, It was clean, quiet, and felt home like for me. Staff is gracious and poised.

We checked in today (Thursday) and asked to have a room that is private and quiet since I'm a light sleeper. We were given a room on a third floor and our window was above a huge a/c unit that is pretty loud. When we brought this issue to a hotel staff and asked to move us to a different room, we were told that they are aware of noise issue on a floor below us, but not ours, and there are no available rooms and we were offered ear plugs as a solution for the night. I believe paying for over $400 for the night you would expect to have hotel management more accommodating. Couple hours later, we heard loud music coming either from a room below ours or a building our room is facing. We brought this issues to a hotel management again, and we were told they will try to address this issue with building management next to the hotel. We were promised to be moved to another room tomorrow, however, it ruins our night, its inconvenient for the price we are paying and it affects our plans for tomorrow. In addition, when we checked room availability online, same room size we reserved was available, but when we tried to show it to hotel management, it was already after midnight making it impossible to prove that they just don't be to do anything to accommodate us right now. This hotel has a great location and a variety of restaurants nearby, but hotel rooms and bathrooms are small and outdated, FREE wi-fi is on and off and your regular cell service is very poor to the point you have to stay by the window to make a call or send a message. Overall it not worth $ you are paying.

My wife and I were big fans of the LES--Lower East Side hotel that was part of the Thompson, now 60 chain so we thought we would give this hotel a chance. The hotel is dark in tone and feels tired. Fortunately we ended up with an upgraded room which added a suite so we felt like we had some space. What was odd was that the sitting area did not have a tv. It would have been enjoyable to watch a little football with the friends who came up. The lounge on the rooftop is closed in with an outside patio. It was too cold to know if there is much of a view on the outside part. The lounge felt cramped and loud, I am not their target audience.The bathroom was poorly lit-especially so for my wife but I found it lacking. I suspect part of the cool vibe they are going for-wrong place.The staff was pleasant and efficient. We will look to see if there are other options in the area.

I visited the 6 Columbus Roof top today with friends from LES and was pleasantly surprised. The place is clean and has a great vibe. Drinks and the food from Blue Ribbon was absolutely amazing. Can’t say enough about the chicken wings and the bone marrow rice. A must. Service was very friendly and quick. Non intrusive. We were able to talk and the attendant New when to come to refresh our drinks and pick up used plates. Will return soon. Thanks for a great experience.
user_name:
LirioC
New York City, New York

review_body: Apparently we had one of the better rooms in the hotel on the 10th floor with a private balcony. The room was large, the furnishings dated, inadequate and uncomfortable. A king size bed, with bedding that was not much more than average. Small closet, inadequate drawers to store clothing. Basically uninviting. The "Private Balcony" was large and had adequate furnishings, but not clean. There is nothing private about the balcony. Yu can be seen from other guest rooms, and most disappointing, a "view" of the apartments across an ally. Terrible. No view of the park unless you snuck into a corner and maybe get a glimpse.

Stayed for 5 days on 7th Floor, Room was nice and clean, perfect for couples that want to go out and explore the city. Being near Columbus Circle made it very convenient for transpiration as the main subway line was right across the street. Staff was exceptionally courteous, and provided helpful information each day. Roof top bar and main lounge were good. One suggestion would be a better choice, more options for dining at the hotel. That said, there is a plethora of dining options within walking distance.

Amazing location, super friendly staff and super cozy rooms. Although a bit small, rooms are super cozy and romantic providing everything you need. At the Columbus square, perfect location to go anywhere! Super friendly and chill staff

Very good hotel right by Columbus Circle. Comfy bed and spacious bathroom. Needs more elevators and front desk staff. But, the staff were very pleasant. Aspects of the room were a little run down. Furniture was marked and stained. But, all-in-all, clean.

This hotel is ideally situated at Columbus Circle which is perfect for visiting NYC. Walking distance from Central Park. The room was small and clean and the beds were very good.Staff at the reception was very friendly, however the porter was unkind and not very helpful with our luggage and our daughter in her wheelchair. He gave us an unpleasant feeling.

After a long journey from the UK we were looking forward to relaxing in our room. There wasn’t even enough space to open two cases if you had one on the bed. The view from the window was a very noisy ventilation shaft. We complained but ended up having to pay $95 dollars a night extra to have a half decent room. Our grown up son and daughter 6ft 3 and 6ft 2 were given a room with a verysmall double bed when we had booked a room with single beds. When we complained they were moved to a room with a larger double bed but right next to the very noisy hotel outside air conditioning unit.

I know I have written countless reviews for this establishment but I have to mention, again, how they have one of the best staff in the business! I usually travel alone but this time I came with friends. They were also very pleased with everyone they encountered during our stay. I had written a couple of times to Nicole Duglos, the guest relations manager, and, as always, got incredible service!! She goes out of her way to make sure your stay will be perfect. I used to stay at this hotel 5 or 6 times a year but now I only go twice a year, but she treats me like a customer that stays in the penthouse multiple times a year, even though I book the standard room! She is an incredible asset to this establishment.I also have to mention Chris at the front desk who rescued me from a room where the A/C was not functioning really well. The engineer got to my room in a couple of minutes and when that didn't work, he switched me rooms immediately. That was welcome with the 90 degree heat New York was experiencing during our stay! Everyone else at this hotel goes out of their way to welcome you with a smile, like Ceasar at the door. Even though everyone must be working really hard, they always take the time to say hello. On top of the staff, there is the Blue ribbon restaurant where the food is incredible. The staff there is also one of the best in the business. Keith and Dylan make the best cocktails!The location of this hotel is also perfect. You are next to many subway and bus lines.  I can't wait to be back in January! Thanks to everyone for a perfect stay!

Once again stayed at 6 Columbus and once again very pleased. Probably the 5th it 6th time we stayed there. Rooms are clean and a comfortable size. Location couldn’t be better. Parking garage and diner up the block,Central Park a block away and everything within a short walk. Price was reasonable for a 4* hotel in this area. Will definitely stay there again

I was looking for a hotel close to Pier 97 (where the Pride Island event was being held), and this fit the bill perfectly. While the bed may have been a little too big for the room (I kept banging my leg against the corner of the frame when navigating my way around the room), it was a nice, quiet, comfortable room to relax in after a hectic day in the city. The staff was great, from room service to the desk to the Blue Ribbon restaurant. If I had any critiques, I thought the lighting in the room was a tad dark (though that may be because of my age), and since the window was adjacent to another building, there wasn't a lot of natural sunlight to help out with during the day. The only other issue I had was that, while there was a refrigerator in the room, it was filled to the brim with mini-bar items, so I could barely squeeze in some medications that needed to be kept cool (the desk was also cluttered with snacks, none of which were complimentary). I was almost charged for an item as well, but they quickly removed it during checkout, which was greatly appreciated. The location is great, just steps away from a major transportation hub, plenty of great places to eat, and, if you want to go to a great museum, check out Spyscape, which is just a short walk away.I was also pleased that I was easily able to add an extra night to my stay on short notice. Very good overall, and I will definitely like to stay here again the next time I need to be in the area.

Columbus Circle is an excellent location in NYC. Close to Central Park, Warner Center with stores, wholefood market, museums and a lot of interesting restaurants. The hotel was nice, I had a very late check in ( just got my room at 5 pm. Arrived in NY at 7 a.m so, this was really bad), but the friendly staff made it a lot easier. Rooms are clean, good size, super comfortable bed, nice bathroom. They also have a japanese restaurant that was perfect for late dining, after the musicals.

Just visited the rooftop bar with retractable roof. Could have been great but roof not open for some poorly explained reason. Was a clear warm nite. Drinks not to expensive and good selection. Food may be available from sushi restaurant downstairs but not clear. Far from a hidden gem!

I stayed for one evening recently on a business trip and enjoyed the stay. Very comfortable bed and spacious enough bathroom. It is definitely a boutique style hotel with narrow hallways and small elevators. The 1st level bar is nice - I tried the roof top bar - which looked excellent - just too hot of a summer day to be usable when I was there. If this is a convenient spot for you - I'd recommend it.

Family trip to NYC. Columbus Circle location was priority. Boutique hotel, no frills, quiet, clean room; a place to sleep, that's about it. Roof top bar, expensive sushi restaurant, Never visited. Hotel was Never bad, but never great. Would we stay here again? Possibly.

I spent a lot of time planning our family vacation to New York. We would have to rent three rooms. We chose to stay here and were extremely disappointed. Our main room had lights that didn't work in the bathroom, the mirror was so high in the bathroom that I couldn't see myself. There was no ice machine. The patio furniture was less than impressive. And in one of our rooms we spent two days trying to get the hotel to fix the water that was dripping from the ceiling onto the bathroom floor. Couldn't get ready in the morning because water kept dripping on our heads. Where we compensated? Spending $5000, the credit was $75!

This is a nice hotel in a very nice location. The property is close to Columbus Circle, Central Park, Broadway shows and about a 15 minute walk to Time Square. The room was bigger by NY city standards, clean, and quiet. My bed was comfortable and the sheets very nice. The bathroom was larger than some other hotels in the city and had a bathtub. Overall I liked the room but I had problems regulating the thermostat. The maintenance guy came up and made it better but I still couldn’t get it regulated.

As hotels go, I’ve stayed in much better, and also had worse. The hotel location is ideally situated, near to Central Park and mass public transport options. However, the hotel itself felt quite tired. Bathrooms were fairly clean, but the decor was tired and worn. Everywhere was so dimly lit - corridors and communal spaces - it was quite difficult to get around and in itself felt “dingy”. Like most people, I couldn’t find half of the places the hotel has photographs for on the website - it would be good to know they exist. The rooftop bar I went to didn’t look like the picture, although on the plus-side was quiet.Staff encountered were helpful, but disorganised. Whilst away in the daytime I had been moved out of my room due to an incident in the room above - no phone calls or anything. Apart from my hotel key not working and all my stuff being packed up by the hotel without myself knowing. When I returned to the counter they gave me another key - this time to someone else’s room - and third time lucky, I managed to get a key to a room which contained my stuff. This simply shouldn’t happen it is completely unforgivable to give out the keys to someone else’s room (by key I mean keycard), and quote disconcerting to think who might have been given access to mine. The staff were apologetic, but didn’t offer any compensation...I had to tell the manager that at the very least he owed me a beer. I certainly wouldn’t recommend or stay here again.

There are only two good things about this hotel... the location and the Blue Ribbon restaurant are fantastic. The hotel looks nothing like the pictures. Very outdated and old. Service was not good. The king bed we had was not at all comfortable and the bed did not have a fitted sheet... they used a top sheet as the fitted sheet and only a comforter that was not very clean on top. ? We could not even get a top sheet. There are many other places to stay with much better service. They also told me they would leave a gift for my daughter, as we were there celebrating her 16th birthday, but that never happened either. Good thing we love New York and our time there, but will never stay there again and will not recomednd. Also, the WiFi is free, but we were on the second floor and the internet was awful. You have to pay to upgrade to a high enough speed to do anything.

We spent 3 nights in the gloom in this hotel. It's described as boutique though to be frank I'm not sure what it means. The narrowness and gloom is accentuated with dark wall covering and poor lighting in the corridors, room and black tiled bathrooms. The rooms are tiny. The window was dirty and the huge chimney blocked any view. We asked for a kettle to make tea and coffee and we were brushed off - this is a boutique hotel and it's not available. Eventually another reasonable receptionist found a kettle, we used paper cups but had to buy tea and coffee. Everything was very expensive including the cost of the hotel so compared to our 3 night stay in Washington it was terrible.

I just returned from a quick 2 night stay here - I really enjoyed the location and my room was spacious and comfortable. All of the staff I encountered were very nice and helpful. I'll definitely try and stay here again next time I'm in New York.

This hotel has a wonderful location on Columbus Circle. I stayed here several years ago (and enjoyed it) but was very disappointed with my current stay. My petite room looked through a grimy window into a filthy alcove that didn't let in much light. I didn't expect a park view, but this was just plain off-putting. The desk person who checked me in was very unwelcoming, almost to the point of rudeness. The room itself was fine with a comfortable bed and luxury linen. The air conditioning was a bit noisy but I've experienced worse. An unpleasant shock at the end of my stay was the $20 "facility fee" tacked onto my bill. According to the desk clerk this is for "complimentary" internet! Go figure!! And finally, after I got home, my credit card had been charged for minibar items that I did not consume (or even touch).

Beautiful, sleek, classy, this place gives intimacy and the alluring possibilities of Columbus Circle and Central Park. Brandon in Reception made a world of difference with his attitude. I booked a standard room and was given a bit of upgrade. But what mattered the most was his willingness to help, where help was in the reach of possible. I was just coming out of a different hotel where in the exact same situation the attitude was exactly the opposite. The result? 6 Columbus, a SIXTY Hotel, is one of my favorites when in Manhattan

The hotel is right across from Time Warner/CNN plaza. We walked everywhere! Broadway theaters, Time Square, Central Park are all within 20-30min walk. The hotel was clean but the mornings were load with slamming doors from housekeeping and other guests- it was ridiculous. No sleeping for us. The price was reasonable for location.the other Sixty Hotels look much nicer than this one. The bar and upper deck were cool but a little tired.

From now on moving forward I'm going to be staying at this hotel, it's fantastic and so cute! The location on Central Park and on columbus circle is great, next to all the subways and whole foods too. The rooms are huge and perfect.

If this hotel was billed as a 2 or 3 star hotel then I would have been really happy with my booking but as a 4 star hotel it just isn't up to standard. To start with the positives the location is simply fantastic as you are on the corner of central park with great transport links and lively nightlife nearby. The room was also clean and the bed comfy. As with any New York City hotel room there wasn't masses of space but there was enough for us and the bathroom was pretty modern. Now onto the down sides: the lobby and he corridors are dark, dingey and badly in need of a refit. The lifts in particular are pretty grim (think slightly seedy, dirty looking and you're not too far off). The staff were all largely indifferent to the guests, not particularly welcoming and definitely book your own taxi to the airport as they tried to up the fixed price offered by $10. The room also has areas which need attention including the towels which badly need replacing and the inclusion of only 1 dressing gown in a room booked for 2 people. The AC unit was also really noisey so bear this in mind if you're not a great sleeper (again I would expect better from a 4 star)In essence this place is fine but don't go with an expectation of anything better than basic (which is disappointing considering the price and the star rating its somehow been given)

The staff was friendly, but the room was not comfortable. The sink was stopped up, the water pressure flow was low. Additionally, the room was cold and the heater did not function and blew out cold air and it was cold and rainy outside.

We stayed back in November on a combination business and pleasure trip. Great location near Central Park and Columbus Circle. There was so much to do near the Hotel it was perfect for my group.  The Hotel property is super clean and accommodating. Front Desk checked us in smoothly, and the Hotel outlets were on point as well. I had a few questions to ask during our stay and all the team members we encountered were helpful and friendly.  Special shout out to Nicole Dlugas, Guest Relations Manager. She was outstanding....so friendly and helpful. We encountered her indirectly during our visit, but she was so kind and helpful when she came and said "Hello" that she stuck out in my mind as above and beyond. You could tell she was a seasoned professional -- a great asset to the Company and your Brand. We would come back and visit just for the great service of Nicole and her teams. Thanks for a great visit...we will definitely recommend 6 Columbus to any future travelers, and to my family and friends as well . The great service is what sets this property apart from other NYC Hotels.

I've visited NYC multiple times, but this was my first stay at 6 Columbus....Im usually skeptical of "boutique" hotels in NYC, As they are often lipstick on an old out, but I was so pleasantly surprised by the accommodations, super friendly staff, and the awesome perk of a day pass membership to Equinox gym in Columbus Circle. For those who like to build in a solid workout when you travel, this is the absolute best arrangement. The beds were super comfy, the bathroom had heated floors, and the lighting/window treatments allowed for dim lighting and blocking out the sun, if you want to sleep in/take a nap. The restaurant downstairs has delicious sushi. If you want to have a quick bite and cocktail before going out on the town, it's a perfect option. Can't wait to stay there again!

This is a lovely little hotel. The rooms are small and the bathrooms could do with better lighting, but the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Definitely worth the price! And it is in a great location for shopping, bars, restaurants and Central Park.

I try to only write positive reviews, unless I feel obligated to warn fellow travellers. I've stayed in hotels all over the world and this is one of the few times I've felt compelled to complain. I can overlook a certain amount of grubbiness, but the least a hotel can do is provide basic amenities. If they fail to do that, or if there's a problem, then the management should act swiftly, apologetically, and graciously offer to compensate the traveller's discomfort instead of being dismissive, ineffective and neglectful. There are dozens of better, more conscientious establishments in New York – save yourself a headache.

I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the Subway and Central Park. The subway is literally across the street, and the park is like a block away. As a woman traveling solo for the weekend, I wasn't sure what to expect. The pictures online make the hotel look very dark, and I wasn't sure if I would enjoy the atmosphere. The hotel is very dark, and modern. However I felt very comfortable there the whole time. They have a sushi bar in the lobby, but I only went down for a glass of wine and it was wonderful. The bed was super comfortable! The room had a huge bath tub (huge for hotels these days anyway, it was a tall tub). I swear the floors in the bathroom were heated! My view was less than stellar, I was facing another rooftop, but other than that, the room was great! The front desk even held my luggage for me since I arrived around 11am, and my check in wasn't until 4. There is also a café I wanted to try on 59th just south of Columbus (it was closed the day I went there), and there was a Dunkin Donuts less than a block away, basically if you walk around the block its behind the hotel.

Room wasn't ready when I arrived after checkin time. Took another hour, but I was comped a glass of wine in the bar. That's cool. The room size was great, plus a nice small terrace, but it was winter so I didn't use it. Blue Ribbon Sushi restaurant and bar are quite good. But, a large HVAC vent blew of the wall in middle of the night, crashed to the floor, woke me up startled, scared and confused. Rough time sleeping after that. Took two days for them to repair it correctly. There was no hot water at 5:30 am the day I was departing... manager told me he didn't make his rounds early enough to check the hot water boiler and reset it. No excuses! Too late for my early am flight out of LGA so I had to take a cold shower on a cold morning. Oh yeah, the maid service was inconsistent. Thing is, I love the size of the hotel, the location is perfect for me, the restaurant, Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar is great - with more to eat than just sushi. No coffee service in the room is a pain (its a darn good thing there is a Starbucks next door) and most of the staff are very helpful and accommodating - but not all of them.I might stay here again or recommend the hotel to a friend, because there are definite positives - but this particular stay was a nightmare. Brrrr... I'm still cold from that cold shower!!!

Good location and hospitable service. Chris, one of the front desk staffers, was very hospitable. I didn't know it was raining, and I was about to walk out on the street and Chris offered me an umbrella. However, I did run into one major problem at this hotel...no hot water on the morning of 2/5. I checked out at 5:40 AM and someone else was also complaining about this same issue so it seemed to be a hotel wide issue. I know that things come up, however, it's really not the way I wanted to start my day as I was leaving for work travel.
user_name:
hlbrooksv
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It an excellent location across from the Time Warner Center that’s the only thing this dump has going for it. I booked this hotel via HT app and received a room that was up against the wall of the building next door. The TV was very old and had limited reception. I was told it was the best room they had available well rather than stay in a sub standard room in a crap hotel I checked out and moved elsewhere. My review may not have been so harsh if the hotel had tried to work with me rather than blow me off. The front desk agent was rude and condescending. Do yourself a favor walk right on by this hotel to somewhere nice.

Everything was respectful , cartering and beautiful From the door man to the young lady at the front desk who check me in(Katherine is her name ) they made me feel like I made the right choice to stay

As a 30 year actors equity member and SAG-AFTRA member / new entrepreneur and Producer - loving the Mobile/ Global office ability my Ipad gives me.... I saw the scathing brutal reviews that disgruntled travelers gave this lodging... the location was superb and then for January there was a too good to pass- up for this Canuck (30% cdn/us exchange gouge) . I even called Manager Nicole to express concerns which she soothed AND ...because I had just had spinal surgery in Germany in November she gave me a room with a bathtub.So this perfect for me room was quiet and comfortable with great 60’s vibe and vibe form the original architecture... it was perfect fo the very much required down time i mandate in NYC . THe Blue Ribbon sushi restaurant has a lovely morning breaky ( also available via room service door card ) and unique SUPERB Japanese food and I am in Japan ambience ( ginger ice cream!) , the cozy bar with musician / bartender Dylan ( Marshal Dylan) at the helm is so .Rooftop deck ( you can do your best Babs On A Clear Day impression ..I did) .Now I love to get up early and do office in a Co share space.. and initially pouty there was no coffee machine in the room - yet the Starbucks directly next door was the ultimate- the celebrities I saw ( staying at the hotel..shhhhh) and the amazing New Yorkers I met... ( I even met and signed an NDA with a new entrepreneur friend) ....could not be beat .I am a little shy with the subway but the most gleaming Columbus 59th station is right across the street. As are the shops of Columbus Circle AND ultimate score free passes to the Equinox gym with steam/sauna/ pool and Khiels spa products in the showers .This hotel is 2 blocks from the to die for Dowton Abbey Exhibit/ Carnegie Hall/ one subway stop to Broadway and ( Disney nerd ) where Hayley Mills is starring in Party Face until April.The staff; Yulia, Nester , Caesar, Chris, Harrison, ( please forgive me staff.. I will ad names as my bear of Little brain recalls). Does this resonate with anyone ? I always try to find solutions and here on this platform offer constructive solutions... calling anyone ..a manger worthless ( Nicole took the time for a 10 minute sit down ) is far from that ..as former Assistant Cruise Director for the original Princes Love Boats ... I am a fiend for the Artsof Customer Service and Conversation ... I dare any guest to work at a Manhattan hotel and see if they come out alive ... I always see the disgruntled reviews and conclude which just basically reveals disgruntled folks who I wouldn’t care to travel with.

Not a great hotel. Our evening started out by showing up to the hotel and being told that our reservation was not entered into the system. The man behind the counter explained that when HotWire reservations come in, they need to be entered manually, and ours must have just slipped through the cracks (I booked three weeks in advance). He said it would just be a few minutes, which was fine, and the manager came out a few minutes later to offer my fiance and I each a free drink at the hotel bar, which was very nice of him.
