We happily accepted, and our room was ready within about 15 minutes. Unfortunately, that was the high point of our stay.The room itself was tiny. I'd be surprised if it was even 10x15. The bathroom was also very small, and the bed was only a full size, which I had no idea was even an option in hotels in 2018. I understand that it was “hotel chooses bed type" because of how I booked, but had I known anything less than a queen size was an option, I wouldn't have booked. I'm 6’5”. I can barely fit myself on a full size bed, and had to share one with my fiance in an allegedly 4.5 star hotel.Secondly, we had absolutely no view, our room faced out into the narrow space between ours and another building. Which, again, I know isn't a given, but when I'm expecting a 4.5 star hotel, I expect a bit more than that. Also, our TV’s sound only worked about half of the time, and would cut out and in without warning, which put a little damper on our downtime in the room.Lastly, and most importantly, the facilities themselves were miserable. The walls, ceiling, and door were all paper thin. We got basically no sleep all night. There must have been a water pipe above us, so we were woken up by extremely loud rushing water sounds intermittently. No matter where people were on our floor, it sounded like they were in our room due to how thin the walls and door were. I can also corroborate the reviews of others that the cleaning staff makes a huge amount of noise from about 6 a.m. on for no good reason. And there were some very loud pipes of some sort above our room that basically never stopped making noise all night.Had I been staying for more than one night, I probably would have cancelled and found a different hotel for the second night. As it stands, I just sucked it up.I would also very much suggest that 6 Columbus have its star rating downgraded. The amenities and quality of the room were less than I've gotten in a garden variety Holiday Inn Express.

Overpriced room was not made available until 7pm in blizzard like conditions, decore was in poor taste in the lobby and the room decore was not much better, tv remote had left over pizza jammed into the volume button and the aircon didnt work at all with blow heaters situated in the room to try and conpensate for the sub zero arctic conditions outside.... staff at front desk not very helpful or apologetic, location was good but overall you were thrown the key and left to sort out the rest for yourself. At around US $500 per night we expected a whole lot better. ... and were offered no compensation or discount off what was obviously a vastly overpriced rate compared to the local rack rate......we were only here for 2 nights at the end of our vacation so we put up with it instead of finding somewhere better.....which you definitely should.

Great hospitality by the hotel staff, the room was very nice and more importantly very clean, so was the bathroom.The hotel have an agreement with the next door Equinox gym which for us was perfect.Very good location, quiet rooms and not far from a subway station.

The price was right, the room adequate, modern furnishings. Poor reception area and public areas. It worked for a one-stay in NYC and we found a good discounted price. We will return there if the price is right again.

We are glad that we only had a one night stay at this hotel. The staff that greeted us and checked us out were not very customer service oriented in our opinion with the lack of greeting and conversation. The bed did not even have a fitted sheet (just a straight sheet over the mattress) and the shower handle fell off mid-shower. Would not stay again.

Needed a hotel near Lincoln Center and received a special offer from 6 Columbus where we had stayed once before many years ago. It was fine, although front desk staff could have been more helpful.There was only 1 drinking glass in the room and when we called for another one, was told ok but it would be after midnight, an hour away, before we could get it. Mirror light worked most of the time but sometimes would flash and go off. Told the staff who said they would send someone to look at it while we were out. Later that night, same thing happened so obviously they didn't/couldn't fix it. Otherwise, the hotel is well located, room was clean and fairly quiet. We were upgraded to a larger room as the first room they sent us to was already occupied. So that was an upside for us through their mistake.

Despite the cold weather we had a great time touring the city. We walked over 10 miles a day it was so nice to come back to a hotel that welcomed you in every time. The room was clean and very comfortable.

Professional firendly staff. Great price point on accomidations. Within walking distance or $10-$15 Uber rides to many cool sights. Next to Columbus circle with the park and the subway. Hard to beat. Great pillows. Wish they would selll them.

I travel often and I was NOT impressed with this hotel at all. The only thing it had going for it was that it was clean and we got gym passes to a gym we like. There was no bell hop around to open the fromt door for us upon entering, no one offered to take our bags up, the walls are paper thin and doors slam loudly, the hotel felt cold in decor, the pillows on the sofas were a mess in the lobby, our room though very clean was soooooo small ( and I know small, I lived in NYC for 12 years), 1 soap and 1 lotion in the bathroom. I needed a shower cap, I called the front desk and they did come up immediately with one but they can’t put that in the bathrooms???? And $10.00 for water in the room was annoying too. Wouldn’t stay here again.

My wife and I have stayed here at least twenty times in the past 5 years. It has a very convenient Upper West Side location and is reasonably priced. The rooms are a bit Spartan but efficient when it comes to decor but perfectly comfortable. The staff has been very good to us regarding arrangements and transportation. Because we come to New York so often, the absence of a concierge is not an issue for us but it might be for first-timers. Standard-speed internet is complimentary (often not the case in NYC) and there is a subway station across the street as well as short distances to some terrific restaurants and entertainment venues.
user_name:
Lawrence D
Augusta, Georgia, United States

review_body: Nicole from Guest Services is basically worthless. I never had so many problems during a hotel stay before and I stay in hotels almost weekly for the last 20 years! DO NOT STAY there unless you can get a rate under $150. Not worth a penny more. Only plus is the location but the hotel is a dump. The rooms are gross and my heat didnt work in dead winter! They told me there is nothing they can do for me upon check out. I have so many more negatives to write about but its just not worth my time. TRUST ME, pick another hotel. The GM and Guest Services should find new jobs out of customer service.

Nothing “contemporary” about this “contemporary” hotel. I’ve been staying at this hotel for over 8 years and am sad to report that it now feels kind of old and worn out. Ever since the Thompson hotel chain sold it to the new owners, there have been zero improvements or updates to the rooms or common spaces. They really need to freshen up the carpets and furniture.It’s in a great location, but until these guys update things a bunch, I’ll be staying elsewhere.
user_name:
jameswalshdc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was one of the most unpleasant hotel stays my wife and I have ever had. We went here because we were attending a wedding nearby and this was one of the hotels with which a break on the room rate had been negotiated. When we checked in the wifi was broken and at the end of our trip all the electronic keys to the rooms ceased to work.  The room itself was tiny. There was a queen-sized bed, fixed bedside shelves, an armoire and no other furniture. No chair, no footstools – nothing. Either you lie down in bed or you must leave the room.  Our most serious complaint was the temperature. The room was cold, around 60 degrees. We complained twice about the heat and it never was fixed. The bathroom was freezing – while the floor was warmed, there was no heater in the bathroom and a window which let in the outside air. The bathroom was about 55 degrees. Even the lobby was freezing because the outside doors don’t close completely. There was literally no warm place in the hotel. Really, this is not a good hotel. We would never come here again.

No desk, no chair, a sleep pod for 400 a night. No thanks. Nothing prepared me for this and I’ve been a road warrior for years. When I was forced to use my bed as my desk and chair, I said enough! Stay elsewhere.

Know what you are buying when you look into the boutique hotel class. 6 Columbus is a contemporary, Central Park adjacent location with small rooms, a rooftop bar, and excellent staff. We were there for 1 night only, aiming for a Macy's parade route view at Columbus Circle.The hotel itself has no view. We were at street level, and I can't say it was worth it.Brandon at the front desk was extremely accommodating in offering a larger, but interior, room over our original reservation (which was not yet ready). If you have never considered what it means to stay in an interior room -- literally no exterior windows -- you have not experienced boutique hotelling. The room was larger, though, and immaculately appointed, with fully stocked mini-bar you won't need because you are next door to a Starbucks and a Duane Reade. But ok.The rooftop bar is small, and the drink expensive. We couldn't afford the hotel's restaurant (enjoy your $90 steak, business folk!) but found food elsewhere. This is an expensive neighborhood, and I wouldn't recommend a long stay. But if your budget allows, and you don't mind the narrow walls and dark air shaft of an older building, the folks at the establishment are 100% professionals.

We stayed at 6 Columbus last month for a combination of business and pleasure....Great location of the Property for our multiple New York City needs. Super clean and comfortable -- very friendly service from Housekeeping and Hotel Services. VERY special shout out to Nicole D and Samara Y...2 outstanding Leaders at the Hotel who always make sure their guests are taken care of. Please extend a special Thank You to Nicole and Samara...they are true assets to the Company and the Brand. I would highly recommend 6 Columbus to NYC travelers. Thank you and we will be back!!

To sum it up.Location is great. I used Hotel Tonight app to book it. You can pay with Credit Card only.Very clean. Has restaurant on-site.Now apart of amenities, and good things, there are some that made stay almost horrible. First the AC / Heating device is louder that jet engine (honestly). Took me a time to turn it off - worked, but if you are staying with cold or hot climate - good luck.Then, the divisions or acoustic is so bad, that you can hear people talking in other rooms, and thats still fine, but the doors smashing when closing are incredible!Plus if you add to it people talking on hallway - and there is no way you can get a sleep.Had a room with no window.At the end - staff are not solution finders. Don't recommend it.

Again, I was very pleased with my (and Mary Lou's) visit to the Six Hotel on Columbus Circle! We stayed in the Loft Suite which was excellent. I have no complaints whatsoever. The room and view was magnificent. The service throughout the hotel was top notch.

Booked through HotelTonight which always quotes pricing for standard room with full size bed. Upon check in, Nestor and Ji were extremely helpful and gave me an upgrade to a queen size bed. Room was a good size and clean. The only reason for not rating a 5 is that it was very warm through the night...A/C didn't seem to be working.Would stay here again.

the room was extremely small and the beds were actually 2 full beds and not two queen beds, which made the stay very uncomfortable for us as a family. the stuff in the lobby were not nice and its seemed like as if I am bother them with my requests and questions.

Good stay. The room was in excellent condition and the air/heat worked this visit. The upgrade to a King Studio was great since my last stay was not so hot. I guess my only critique was that the door men could be a little more helpful/nice. They kind of ignore you.

I stayed at your hotel from Sep 29 to Oct 2 and Oct 7 to Oct 10. What happened on Oct 9 was the most terrifying expereince I have ever had. I left the room sometime after 2pm and came back around 9pm and found my rooom not cleaned. I went down and sought help. Finally I was able to talked to a "manager." This "manager told me that after 2pm no room service in available, and that since I did not notify the front dest, there was nothing to help, and that I had to sleep there as it was. And he said very condescenidng way. It was my first experience I had to sleep in a bet not cleaned. Kind regards, Kyung Jik Kwak kjk@knclaw.co.kr talked with a man at the front and a "manager"

I wasn’t allowed to check in early, so waited. 45 minutes later another customer was allowed to check in early with another front desk rep. My front desk rep also placed me in room with full sized bed. Won’t be staying at any of their hotels in the future.

The pictures on the internet are nothing close to reality. THe lobby is dark and dingy. The rooms are old with terrible furniture. The cleaning staff starts early in the morning by slamming doors and making excessive amounts of noise.

Returned to 6 Columbus for a weekend in NYC. The room was stunning and staff were outstanding, making for a spectacular stay. You can't beat the location - across from Central Park & a short walk to Times Square. The room decor was great, and the balcony a sanctuary from the crazy-busy streets of Manhattan. We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

There was a lot of noise in the hallway, you could hear the doors of other rooms closing (bad isolation) and too expensive for what you get.I had to pay 4 dollars for a toothbrush, unbelievable if you know the prices of the rooms.

The hotel is on a great location. New for me. The workers where not friendly like I would expect from a small boutique hotel . The rooftop lounge is AMAZING. The servers the food and the view where all very good.

Not happy - not a good or reasonable value at all. The overall building needs a major upgrade as well. I was shocked at how dated the room was. The staff was also average at best and I was not impressed. I don’t plan on staying with this Hotel group again!!!

GREAT sheets, very comfortable bed all around. Attractive bathroom, good shower. AC worked well, even during change of season. Good location. Pass to Equinox worth $30/day if you are inclined that way. Friendly staff. I think this covers the very most important parts of a hotel experience. the only negatives: the room was a bit small, and would have been cramped if I had not been staying alone for business. No view from my 4th floor room. Doormen were often AWOL, I had to stand in the street and (try to) hail my own cab.

We usually stay here when we visit New York. We enjoy the Opera which is a short walk away. The subway entrance is across the street. MOMA, Times Square, the Theaters, are all easy walking distance away. There is a whole Foods across the street if you want to keep some supplies in your room. We usually get a King Superior or King Deluxe room but they weren't available for the full two weeks we'd be there. The hotel gave us a deal on the King Suite instead. It was more than we usually pay, but having that extra room in the morning while my partner slept in was really nice. Next time we'll go for the suite again. In all the rooms we've stayed in, the bathrooms are adequate with enough room to store our things comfortably and not feel cramped. The shower water pressure is tremendous. The AC worked beautifully -- I could crank it to a colder temperature than most hotels permit. The staff was great and the cleaning staff was very accommodating to our needs. We'll be back!

A very shabby lobby is your first introduction to this hotel and, while the rooms are clean, tat least some of the rooms are so small, there is nowhere to put your luggage once emptied. I was there for work and certainly could not work in either the room (no desk, no space but the bed) or the lobby (see above, plus no desks or comfortable chairs or couches). Again, great location but ho-hum hotel.

I had a great stay. We did not spend too much time in the room so the small size was not a huge problem. The location was convenient to the places we planned to go. I would come back for another stay.

I accidentally left my prescription glasses in the room. No one could want these. No one will get back with me. So sad. I have left numerous messages. they say they will look and call me back but never do.

The walls are very thin between the rooms and i could hear the neighbours chatting and watching TV. The doors slam very loudly when they close, which is extremely annoying. I wouldnt stay there again despite the great location and acceptable price

Love the location of this hotel, friendly staff and excellent restaurant/bar. Hotel is a bit tired but room was quiet and comfortable. Good value for money. Plethora of nice restaurants and shopping within walking distance.

Had a great time. Very convenient location and had great access to my venue and the park. Will be back for another adventure in the future. The doorman and reception desk were fantastic too. thanks for a memorable experience.

I was excited about this Hotel very centrally located and next to my office branch. Unfortunately the I was soon disappointed due to the extremely small size of the room, quality of furnishing (very poor for its category) and overall lengthy check-out experience.It took 18 minutes with a single person in front of me and they couldn't be bothered to call someone else to help (I was in a rush for business appointments).

On a rate that had free cancellation up to 1 day in advance, they didn't refund me. I called -- no answer-- and emailed and eventually they refunded me some. I emailed and called, and finally got through to a person who hung up on me. So if you want to cancel for free, be prepared to take them to small claims court... or book somewhere else.

Front desk unhelpful, all the excuses in the world to not help you out. Room is ok, nothing great for the price you pay. Outdated and noisy elevators especially if your room is positioned right next to the elevator

New York City can be a hectic place. As soon as you arriveat this perfect location you can relax as the Valet Parks your carwhile you check in to a fabulous room. I urge you to get a balconywhich lets you feel the city.
user_name:
Mark B
key largo, United States

review_body: Beautiful little place right in front of Columbus Circle. Amazing price for that level of style, cleanliness, and location. Rooftop bar. Sushi restaurant. Midtown. All of it, stunning. Not more than 20 minutes from nearly anywhere in the city.
user_name:
Adrian R
New York City, New York

review_body: The location, the very pleasant desk staff, and the clean and more-than-adequate rooms are the strong points. The hotel is slightly dated. If you come to it with this understanding, is is NOT a detractor. If you come to it expecting a brand new chain hotel, you could be disappointed.

Used Hotel Tonight app and found this lovely hotel near where I wanted to be. I was given an upgrade without asking. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Loved it so much I stayed another night!
user_name:
Delores N
Whispering Pines, North Carolina

review_body: I’ve stayed at 6 Columbus several times. It’s always a great experience! Friendly and welcoming staff with very comfortable, pleasant rooms. Convenient location, Nice shopping right across the street. A terrific value! Happy to recommend.
user_name:
aoltrips
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location and Staff were awesome. The King Suite was perfect for our family of four, with space for everyone and two rooms at night. The room and everything else was very clean, but it is time for new sheets and linens that were showing a bit of wear.

Urban Retreat in the middle of the hustle and bustle, 6 columbus was a great hotel to stay. Generous sized king room with comfy bed. The fixtures like furniture needed at update as they were scuffed or falling off hinges. Overall really quiet with a small cool rooftop bar. Great place to stay-good location. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful. They seemed to love their jobs-nice work guys!

I am a planner and picky where I stay. I did something spontaneous and used Hotel Tonight at the recommendation of my friend. The reviews were mixed but we weren't going to be in the room much. It seemed like a cool vibe for 199 dollars , I gave it a try. We experienced what some other reviewers complained of . No bellman was present when we pulled up to valet and when we found someone he seemed confused . Check in was ok though the attendant admitted he was new and wasn't sure what he was doing. Interesting ! The room was very small , wouldn't mind that so much but there was a a very small window that was an alley. I felt like I was in a closet . I get we received the lowest room due to the way we booked it but the hotel seemed scarcely occupied why not offer an upgrade ( even for a fee) to potentially secure a new client ? Oh well. The room wasn't as clean as I'd like but I have to admit that they had a very clever use of space from the mini bar to the free standing closet. One night tolerable but I could never stay for more than that. Points of contention were a mildew smelling shower curtain, old robes and dusty furniture .The location was great , which was the saving grace. We enjoyed time warner , shopping on 5th , Nobu 57 etc. very easy access to the subway if you need it and Starbucks and Argo Tea close by for morning drinks and affordable breakfast . I would not stay here again.

I found a great boutique hotel, Sixty Columbus, it was highly rated and the rooms were available. Bonus, the hotel is right off of Central Park. Perfect location! We could take our son to the park to play, plenty of restaurants in the area and Whole Foods right on the corner in case we needed to pick up anything.  I didn't know what to expect of Sixty Columbus but was so pleasantly surprised! The front desk was friendly and helpful. The lobby is cozy with big couches. Many of the guests were hanging out reading and looking at magazines. There's also Blue Ribbon Sushi restaurant in the hotel. If I didn't have our son with me I probably would have gone in there for a drink, some food and to work on my blog MessyBun before my husband got out of work. I was excited to see our room, especially since they had upgraded us to a King Superior.The bathroom blew me away. It totally made me rethink color schemes. I always think white for tiles. The black was so dramatic and elegant. I felt so posh getting ready for dinner in front of the glowing mirror with the chic background.The next morning we woke up refreshed and excited to start our day.......

This is not a 4* hotel...rooms are tiny with no chairs (won't fit), It is dirty and service is terrible. I was tricked due to the location, which is good, and the fact that they said it was 4 star. Not even close. Stay away and do not go to this place.

My parents were booked at the Watson Hotel on 57th Street. After the hotel lost all water use (something on the block, not their fault) we were in a bind to find another hotel on with no notice for the same night- and not break the bank. I spoke with Katherine at the front desk of 6 Columbus-- who could not have been more helpful. She was informative, patient (my elderly parents were visiting from out of town and a bit overwhelmed by the situation). She also helped upgrade their room to a queen at no extra charge. Overall, her customer service and human compassion in a time of need was exactly what we needed in a stressful situation. Kind, helpful and thoughtful. I am very grateful to her assistance in settling my parents into their new room.The hotel is lovely. Very trendy (if small) but has everything you need for a comfortable stay.Very convenient to Columbus Circle and the trains. (just a little note- the front entrance has 3 steps up which is not easy for Seniors with luggage, but the bellman was helpful).
user_name:
MelissaM_NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent value for your money. Excellent location.Clean rooms.Recommended for a business trip or vacation.Good restaurants in the area.Very close to Central Park.Close to shopping for those who are looking for a good and quick purchase.

We stayed here for four nights and had a lovely time. We were very happy with our room and the Columbus Circle location could not be better. Everyone is super friendly and helpful, especially Nestor at the front desk! Will definitely be back in the future.

Enjoyed my stay in 6 Columbus. First off, great location. The front desk was helpful with checking in and recommendations for places to eat. The valet service took quite a while to retrieve our rental car when we needed it. We were told it would be 15 minutes and it took more than 30 minutes. Appreciated the security guy checking that all guests actually had a door key before entering to ensure safety.

Have stayed at 6 Columbus about a dozen times now.Its quiet and cozy - but central.Rooms are comfortable, beds are awesome, bathrooms are great.Sushi and bar (groundfloor and roof) are tops.When we have to be in NYC, this is home

for those who prefer to enjoy central park an surroundings within foot distance, the columbus 6 is the place to stay. everything is perfekt, friendly staff, excellent restaurant inhouse, rooftop terrass... very, very nice!

I booked a room for one night in NYC as I had to work until wee hours. Check in process was smooth. Room was small, but that's to be expected from an NYC boutique property. AC was broken. Bedding didn't feel super clean. Wouldn't go back.

I really love the both location of this hotel and the staff. OK, it's small, but whilst part of a chain (Sixty) it feels boutique. Again, it is pricey, but I would always recommend this hotel to anyone

This hotel is gross. The AC didn't work in my room even though it was turned all the way down. The room smelled like urine. They supposedly have a valet but I had to call the front desk 3 times and ask explicitly for someone to come out to my car to get them to valet it. Check in took 30 min and 2 phone calls to my credit card company only to discover nothing was wrong with my card and the hotels machines just weren't working. There is a disgusting "intimacy" kit on the night stand that had finger prints all over it.

pros:Great location near metroNice bath productsEasy access to rooms (12 floor with 2 elevators)Offers nice larger room optionsCons:smaller rooms are quite smallNot all TVs have HDMI connectionsLike most hotels, there are huge prices fluctuations depending on where you are booking/time of year. I've only books directly with the hotel; I've not used a 3rd party.

Wow. This place caters to tourists that don't know any better. I lived in NYC for 10 years and do but this was a cheap place on hotelstonight so I thought I'd give it a try. Jesus-hell this was the worst place I have stayed in the city. Loud, uncomfortable, rude (a given in this area), and a little surreal and creepy at the same time.

We had a bad experience with another property and was looking for a great value and we found it! We called after finding a rate at a booking site and then called the hotel. Ji was helpful and courteous and met all our needs over the phone. Then we found out all the promises were met. The hotel is in an excellent location, clean and secure. It was a high of of our 2 week trip!

We really enjoyed our stayed. Great location to almost everything! Subway, Mall & Market Place are so convenient just right in front of the hotel. Definitely highly recommend to all family & friends. Can wait to come back again to stay at 6 Columbus. Price is right!!

My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and selected this hotel. The hotel did a terrific job accommodating our request for a spacious room with a king bed, which is not easy to find in NYC. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. Having access to a terrific health club across the street was a huge bonus, too! The location of this hotel is great for vacationing and business.

I have stayed many times at this hotel but the service is always the best! I have noticed that some establishments do more in trying to bring in new clientele and they stop catering to their old one...well....this is not the case here. I have been staying there ever since the opening of the hotel and they treat me right every time. I don't have an unlimited budget when I travel and usually book the lower category which is the standard room. Even though I did not book the penthouse, I was greeted with a welcome amenity! Lawrence, the nicest bellman ever along with Ceasar, brought me chocolates and a bottle of sparkling water. Usually, hotels do that for their high end clientele but not this hotel. They cater to everyone and it shows the heart of this establishment. The whole staff, from the guest relations manager Nicole Dlugos, to everyone else in the hotel, everyone is courteous and professional. I called the hotel to let them know about my reservation and to ask for a certain room. I like the rooms that end with the number 7. They are at the end of the corridor and are very quiet. I asked Nestor, the front desk agent, about room 47 and he made sure I was booked in this room when I got there. Everyone goes out of their way to accomodate you. To top it all off, they have the best restaurant Blue Ribbon. The food there is great and, like the hotel, the service is incredible. Dylan and Keith make the best cocktails ever! See you on my next trip!

We Absolutlty LOVE the LOCATION so close to Columbus Circle and the Theatres and a Subway stop across the street. Its a very nice hotel but it was the staff at the hotel that made or stay go from nice to AMAZING! They were all so great, Rooms always clean, everyone greets you wih a smile and the doorman willing to run in the street to get you a cab at a seconds notice. We felt like we were leaving friends behind when we left. A big thanks especially to Donna, Nicole and Gerald for makeing our stay so fantastic. We even got a great room rate and an upgrade. We will only stay in this hotel when we visit New York again, I mean why would you want to stay anywherelse.

We chose this hotel as it looked lovely on the website but we were quickly disappointed when we arrived in our rooms.We knew that we weren't going to get a massive room considering we were staying at a hotel in New York but our room sizes were beyond ridiculous. We were absolutely crammed into our rooms with no room to breathe or turn around in. What's more is that when we arrived, the toilet and the shower hadn't been cleaned properly. There was bits of wrapping paper in the shower and the toilet cover was covered in dust which I had to wipe off myself. When I looked at the shower closer to inspect I felt drops of water fall on my head - they were coming from the ceiling. Nothing was done about this. The shower was ridiculously small considering three of us were sharing the room. Two people would not have fitted in that bathroom! Moreover after one of us showered the whole bathroom was soaking wet. Don't come here!

I wish I could give a half star. The only saving grace to this place was the staff. The room was unclean and extremely small. The refrigerator didn't work and a few of the towels were dirty....We checked out within 45 minutes of arriving. Again, the staff was pleasant and apologetic however, we spent $55 dollars for parking there for 45 minutes...

Here's my 6 Columbus story! A first time stay, so of course I'm judging it by the minute. Am only briefly in my room, when there's a knock at the door. "Excuse me, but you dropped this in the lobby." What?! There's Lawrence - and my wallet. Back in my hands so fast, I didn't even know it was gone There are lots of ways that a hotel can take care of its guests, but there's no greater service than Lawrence's. This was the most memorable thing any hotel has ever done for me. And yes, the facility was exactly as described - a reliable, chic boutique hotel. Clean, well-located, comfortable everything. Yeah, you might find a bigger room elsewhere, but you won't find a hotel with a Lawrence or a better heart.

Great experience at this hotel, gorgeous rooftop views. Close and easy to access everything through walking or close subway! Comfortable bed and surprisingly spacious bathroom, friendly and helpful staff!

The view of Columbus Circle and Central Park was awesome. The level of service was excellent. The room was aesthetically pleasing and comfortable. My only complaint was that I could not stay longer. I would love to return.

As always 6 Columbus delivers on value for price, comfort and locations. Located adjacent to Columbus Circle which is full of great shopping and a short walk to either Times Square or the Upper West Side the hotel truly is in the right spot for wherever you need to be and the people are great always accommodating always firendly.

The place is neat, right next to Central Park. The room was large with a very nice balcony. We were very happy with the service. The lady at the check in was very helpful. We were very happy with our stay.

My stay was for business purposes. The small room was clean and had everything I needed. All members of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is conveniently located and even has a great (small) rooftop bar!

Great place to stay for the price. Hits the sweet spot between cost and comfort and convenience. Columbus Square is a great place to base a stay in NYC. Easy access to subways and museums. This hotel is a great home base.

Really Friendly staff and best location near Central Park. My room was small but cozy. Perfect for exploring The area around Columbus Circle... good restaurants also nearby. I would stay there on my next trip to NYC

We love this hotel's vacation with short distance to Columbus circle and Central park. The room was small, clean, air-conditioned and has a safety box. We were offered complimentary access to the gym at Time Warner center, but had no time to use this excellent gym.

We were looking to visit the city for a night from New Jersey. We booked last second and were really pleased with the 6 Columbus. The location was fantastic. It was an easy walk to Central Park, Restaurants, Times Square and shopping. The hotel was very clean and the room was nice size by NYC standards. The bedding, pillows and room amenities were all very nice. A pleasant surprise was a high volume shower. We took advantage of the roof top bar. The service was good. Prices were rooftop NYC and the views were nice. It was relatively quiet and a nice place to relax.We also rented bikes around the corner on 9th street. If you negotiate a little bit directly in the store, you can get a very good deal.

Right behind Columbus Circle on 58th street. One block to Central Park. Subways and buses right there. Nice shops in new mall on the Circle. The rooms are small and the walls are thin. If the person above you is taking a shower you are going to hear it. Bathroom doors are glass. What is the purpose of that? It's an ok hotel if you get a good price.
user_name:
Peggy C
New York City, New York

review_body: I'm sorry but I wouldn't recommend this hotel, our room was very very small almost claustrophobic the base of the bed is longer than the mattress which I kept hitting my shins on. The bathroom wasn't too bad but it seemed bigger than the main room. Staff weren't over friendly. The walls must be made of paper, there was so much noise and the banging of doors frequently kept us awake....not a good experience.

This small hotel has a great location near Central Park. It is a small and cosy establishment with really charming rooms.I love the style of our room, a mix of modern and old style. The bathroom was great even if small.I really spent a great night there!

Trip was absolutely amazing.. loved the concierge.. absolutely loved the restaurant downstairs, the bathrooms were so well designed and the lighting in the room was very cool. The room keepers were always on point with keeping the room nice and clean. It truly felt like I was home. I loved the service I was given and the location was truly perfect. Right across the street from Central Park and I loved that!

Great location, front desk was helpful but the room was so small and not worth the money at all. I feel I can say this because I say in city every other month and have lived there too. I'm sure some of the room are bigger but I wouldn't pay that much for a shoe box. I asked for a bigger bed but I would have to pay extra for it. I think the bathroom is bigger then the room.

LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! Highly recommend for location. For Business the wifi wasn't reliable. Room and halls are very dark. Furniture is old. Dressers are stained but room is very clean. Hotel is small but again you can't beat the location.

Was upgraded to kings superior (i think it was?!) which had a separate living room-great solution for us as we were traveling with a toddler. Was also granted an hour later check out. Great location for a long weekend visit !

The location of this hotel can't be beat. Close to the subway and very central to tourist locations. The room was modern and had great snacks. The staff was also very friendly and helped me with extending my stay at the same rate at the last minute.

Well located near Central Park and close to broadway in Columbus circle. A few blocks from major tourist areas in midtown. Rooms are a little small but serve the purpose for sleeping and showering. Fantastic water pressure. Overall though a great value.

Try to get a room facing 58th street...you'll enjoy the view of the Circle and Central Park. Avoid the costly mini-bar and instead buy your water and junk foods next door at the 24 hr Walgreens next store

There was an error in their system and someone walked into my room and saw me nude.  I spent the entire night restless thinking that someone else was going to pop in the room and steal from me or hurt me.  This stay was very unpleasant and offering 'free drinks/breakfast' did not remedy feeling violated and unsafe in a hotel.

Great place to stay. Wonderful hospitality, great location next to central park, next to ACE trains and a few blocks from the N. Also they provide free gym pass to the gym across the street which is great!

Do honesty and integrity still exist? They do at 6 Columbus!I just went through every traveler's nightmare: a bag left behind in a public space, complete with passport, valuables and thousands of dollars. Thankfully it was found by Lawrence Angel of 6 Columbus. I recovered all of my belongings, and I am now able to say that I've been saved by an angel!Deuna Kopii of hotel management was the consummate professional, going so far as to email my embassy and letting them know that they had recovered my passport and belongings! Thanks to Lawrence, Deuna and everyone else at Six Columbus!

This is a lovely hotel to stay in, its location is ideal as its right next to tube station and across the road from Central Park. It is in walking distance to Times Square and lots of other attractions but far enough away to enjoy quiet at night. The rooms are very comfortable and cleaned every day. Staff very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again and is great value for money. Our only disappointment was lack of tea/coffee making facilities in our room, it would have been a bonus but a very small criticism for an overall lovely stay.

My wife and I enjoyed our weekend getaway at 6 Columbus in a King Deluxe with a view of Columbus Circle and the Time Warner Center. (I have stayed at 6 Columbus multiple times for business.) We liked that 6 Columbus is convenient for walking through Central Park and to Lincoln Center (and Whole Foods across the street). And, that there is a subway stop across the street. We enjoyed seeing the cityscape from the Blue Ribbon Hi-Bar: it's a hidden gem in NYC.

Booked this room last minute on Hotels Tonight for a great deal. Mixed reviews almost scared us away but it ended up being a good stay. We paid $20 for an upgrade to a queen room and early check in - got to our room by 1 pm and were able to get settled before heading out. A/C wasn't working when we came back to room to freshen up before going out for drinks - I stopped by the front desk and mentioned it on our way out and it was fixed by the time we got back. Definitely a bare necessities hotel, no complementary water, room was clean, a little small, and there was no top sheet on the bed which I found a little strange. TVs are also very outdated. Location was close to Central Park and in an area that was a little quieter which we preferred. Overall, a convenient and positive experience.

I was expecting a more boutique and funky experience here. Felt slightly tired and unimaginative, not how the pictures on line looked, made out it was like the glamour of travel from yesteryear but in reality was a far cry. Rooms were noisy, could here everything from next door. The contents of the mini bar were on the window ledge underneath the air conditioning unit so all items were covered in dust, not really appealing, even if you overcame the hefty price tag. I, for the life of me couldn't find the switch for the bathroom light so had a shower by the light from the mirror. Not ideal. The corridors smelt of cleaning products for the entire stay. Not exactly the sweet smell you expect from a design led hotel more of an institution. Comfy bed but the rest was all a bit blaghhhh!

Recently had a business conference near Columbus Circle and 6 Columbus was the home hotel. The staff both at the front desk and behind-the-scenes was quick, courteous, patient, and incredibly accommodating to special requests and the needs of guests. Great location on the edge of Midtown, especially if you want to be near Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, and Lincoln Center.

The hotel location was good for accessing Central Park and only a short walk to Times Square and Upper West Side. Check-in was smooth and front desk staff were nice. The rooms were a bit on the dark side with very small windows that didn’t let in much light. Also you could hear any noise that came from the hallways and even from the other rooms. If you are a light sleeper, this could be a problem. We were on the 5th floor and didn’t hear any noise from the bar but we had some late night party guests in other rooms on the floor which we could easily hear. The bathroom shower design seems to allow lots of water to pour out onto the bathroom floor. The floor is tile and there is a drain the middle so it didn’t cause any problems but I always had to throw my used towel down to soak up the pool of water. There is no breakfast available at the hotel but there are many places to eat nearby if needed. We did not try the sushi restaurant at the hotel but seemed to be popular. Overall, it was not bad but I think I may try another hotel on a future visit.

Location was very convenient for 10k race in Central Park, ready access to shows in Broadway area and a block away from major subway station to links everywhere. Ideal for Museum visits ( MET, Natral Science, Planetarium, MOMA, Guggenheim, etc., all walking distance.

Lobby looks like Goodwill giveaway. Rooms are very small, so we upgraded to queen. Very small also, even though we paid up. Staff is nice, which was the only salve.They have an online "concierge", once the room is paid. I asked for an early check in, but that did not happen

The rooms are clean and quiet but really average for what you're paying. The corridors and lobby are very dark and there is an odd smell throughout. The staff aren't exactly friendly. The location is, however, amazing.

The decor was overall a bit tired but I could live with that. The first room I was given did not feel especially well looked after as the carpet was stained and overall it was rather uninviting. I moved actually because the aircon on the roof outside was my main concern. The second room was better - it felt cleaner and more in order. What I didn't foresee was the aircon unit that was actually in the room seemed to be 30 years old - wow was it noisy! Ear plugs are required - especially when combined with thin walls and echoey corridors. I was here on business and my colleague had the same problem in a different room on a different floor. We moved hotels in the end.

When you make the reservation via Hotwire you do not have the opportunity to chose kind of bed, so I had to pay more on my arrive to have 2 beds, also I had to pay $400US for deposit and I have not received my refund. they do not give any receive and any information about the timing for the refund, I am still waiting for it.

6 Columbus is located in a great location with easy access to Central Park, Broadway and the subway. The rooms are straightforward and good value for Manhattan. The resident sushi bar offers great quality and selection.

I was in New York on business and took my wife along. As a result, I upgraded to a suite and it was worth every penny. The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom was luxurious (walk-in shower as well as a tub). The decor is super modern (black and white predominate). Lots of outlets for plugging in devices. New York can be noisy but our room was very quiet.

My room was feeezing and thermostat didn't work. Transferred to new room and tv didn't work. Really a hassle to check in but once I finally got settled in it was smooth sailing. Bed is really comfortable

The room was so small it was a shoe box,no where to put our suit cases.It was a double bed and not very comfortable. The room was always cold even with the heater on. The Hotel walls were mid night blue it was so dark & dreary. The Hotel position is amazing its right across from Central park & we walked everywhere. It was very expensive to stay there & that wasn't worth it. No Tea or Coffee had to buy it .There was a laundry matt & a supermarket near by which was handy.

Tub was plugged, air quility was horrible and size of room very small. Was not given towels or washclothes for two had to keep calling for them to bring more. No ice machine availabe had to keep asking 9them to bring ice. I can go on and on about how this hotel is terrible.

Ideal location and comfort in Columbus Square. Hotel is steps from Columbus Ciircle. Hip bar downstairs and we'll appointed hotel rooms. Gorgeous cobalt blue tiled bathrooms is paired with fantastic water pressure.

Friendly staff, good location, close to Whole Foods, metro, Central Park and walking distance to Broadway. The hotel was a little bit small and old (typical for New York hotels). But really affordable. Perfect if youre on a budget.

This hotel is incredibly well located, and the beds are comfortable great sheets. But otherwise, it leaves enormous amounts to be desired. I have stayed in 4.5 star hotels throughout NYC and the world, and I cannot imagine what they are thinking (who gives these ratings?). If you think of it as a serviceable 3 star hotel (and you pay a rate for a 3 star hotel), you'll be delighted--and you'll find the rooms that look into air-ducts or into alleys charming. But if you are thinking this is nearly a 5 star hotel in NYC, you will be bitterly disappointed.

My room was so small only a double bed fit, in it; no furniture , chipped nightstand ; soiled rugs in several spots; room view of wall; dark; elevator so slow . Mini bar was the windowsill. Noisy because multiple doors slamming in adjacent rooms throughout night and early morning

Very nice room in one of the best locations in the city. Blocks from Central Park and right next to Columbus Circle. Close to everything and nice subway stops. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable.

Staff was rude and aggressive, they treated me poorly and damaged my bags. When I was escorted to my room the porter threw my bags on the floor. When I asked if I could have food delivered to the soon he said " absolutely not." I felt unsafe and unwanted during my safe. When I asked for "ice" I was told to get it myself.

I was very satisfied with my stay. Nice hotel and great location. I loved being so close to Central Park. I would certainly stay here again. Good price for the location. I travel to New York regularly and rank this hotel high.

This hotel is unique and quirky . The dark and black reception and lobby area is most unsettling . It may be a personal choose , but this does not work for me. The service levels are fine , rooms clean and efficient. The best part is the location , at Columbus Circle and perfect to launch your day of exploring and enjoying the sights and sounds on NY.

Our family of 5 asked ahead for two rooms with room to spread out as we'd be staying a whole week. Nicole was kind enough to offer a discount, and after the fridges and honor snacks were emptied and removed, we had room for meals, hanging out, and sleeping VERY well on comfortable beds with the softest sheets. The best feature of all, was the hotel's proximity to the subway, with easy access from Brooklyn to the Bronx and everything in between. Though cabs were plentiful we subway-ed and walked every day. Being almost across the street from Central Park was wonderful as well - we went for runs in the morning, or took our coffee there. We felt safe enough to let our teens wander on their own. All in all the hotel made us comfortable enough to really enjoy our explorations and have a great place to rest at the end of each packed day. Free wifi was imperative for our teens!

This hotel was in a good location, opposite the road from the subway and 3 mins walk to Central Park. We stayed in the king suite for 3 nights which was spacious enough for a family of 5. There was a large sofa bed which my 11, 9 and 5 year old all slept on comfortably.We arrived at the hotel 3 hours early as we had a rental car to return to Newark airport. The staff took our luggage and it was stored safely until we returned.Upon our return our suite was not ready, but the person at the desk (think his name was Brendon) apologised and the suite was ready within 15 mins.We didn't choose the breakfast option as there is a Starbucks next door to the hotel and my children preferred this option but prices for breakfast at the hotel ranged from $14.50 - $30.There are many restaurants to choose from and just a few minutes walk from the hotel. We used the subway across the road to Times Square (1 stop away) and we ate at a few restaurants in this area. Getting around was very easy on the subway and convenient, just like the tube in London.The "headout" app is excellent for all giving you all the great experiences of the city at a fraction of the cost. For example a 2 day New York All City Pass cost $32 and gives you an uptown, downtown, night tour, Brooklyn bus tour, bike tour and a live tour guide. Unfortunately, I bought bus tickets on the street from a company called Top Ten and although my experience was ok, I will never use the company again as I saw customers treated very badly and people waited a long time for buses and in some cases missed their bus or cruise.

This hotel is in a great location. It is a short walk from Central Park and adjacent to a subway stop. There are also many restaurants within walking distance.The staff was nice; however, after an early check-in, we were brought incorrect luggage twice. We ended up accompanying a staff member to the holding room to attain our bags.The room was typical for a New York hotel--small but modern. The bathroom was a good size.The rooms are not insulated well. One night when temperatures dropped outside, we woke up to a 64-degree room, even though the thermostat was set to 72-degrees. I could hear hallway conversations and opening/closing doors throughout our stay. I also always heard the pigeons outside our window--this was cute at first, but got old after the first day.I liked the convenience and location of this hotel, but I can't say that I will return on my next trip to NYC.

Loved the hotel! Stayed for business but felt like I was on a vacation because of the cool room decor and super comfy bed. I also loved that for being a boutique hotel I had all of the amenities of any other hotel. I had a workspace and a living space. It was super nice.

This hotel was great. Very reasonable for New York. The staff said all the right things but didn't totally deliver. They were very friendly though. The location was ideal. Just on the corner of central park and a short walk down to Time Square. And there's a subway station right outside. The rooms are spotless with a decent size bathroom and room.

The hotel is wonderfully located, particularly if you would need to be on the Upper West Side. Small rooms as expected; but clean and updated. Staff is very responsive and agreeable. Great views from rooftop. Would stay here again.

I'm pretty sure their 'gimmick' is the 'you've been upgraded' that I got, and heard at least one other guest get. Not that it's a bad thing, it's not. We booked a superior King and got a suite out of the deal, and that means a lot to me. The room seemed fairly clean and is sporting a funky vibe. There's a good amount of space because of the living room, without which the room would be very small. There's no dresser just a wardrobe which held all of our 'hang up' clothes but there really wasn't anywhere to put underwear, socks, etc. Having driven to NYC, one of the first stops was the restroom, and this is where I noticed the first issue (not problem). The toilet handle was hanging off the toilet, so it was unflushable. I'd like to think that housekeeping would have noticed this and called it in, instead of me having to pop the top of the tank and manually flushing so as not to disgust maintenance. NOTE that I spoke to the front desk and this was fixed by the time we returned from our afternoon out. While showering I noticed that the light at the back of the shower was out and that the showerhead was leaking from where it attached to the pipe from the wall. More little things that someone should find upon inspection. Also, there were a few marks on the lightly painted wall, scuffs really. A magic eraser and 5 minutes work would refresh the room. Do these little things outweigh the overall experience...nope, not at all. BTW the restaurant is very very good, enjoy a meal there, and as far as the valet...for those who expect their car to magically appear in 5 minutes...get a grip it's NYC. 55 bucks a night is a good price. Call down for your car 1/2 hour early so it's ready when you need it, and if you are trying to beat the extra day fee, leave enough time. My car was ready before I asked for it, the doorman was always polite and the overall experience here was very friendly. I'd certainly stay again.

Perfectly located right on Columbus Circle and Central Park, with Time Warner Center and everything midtown has to offer just outside your room. I love this place! I called to see if I could get a better deal by booking directly with the hotel instead of one of the deals I saw online. So glad I did! They offered me an even better deal, and I ended up getting upgraded on top of that! My hotel room was the biggest, swankiest I've ever had in NYC. The service was excellent. The in-house sushi restaurant was a neighborhood hotspot. The bathroom was amazing and the products were good. When can I go back?

Ive been to 6 columbus twice so far. Back in January 2017 my husband surprised me with Broadway tickets and a night away from the kids by booking a room at this hotel. We had a king deluxe room and it had a private deck. The tub in the bathroom was amazing and the bed was comfy. Last week when wanting to celebrate my 10 year anniversary i decided to call the hotel directly and see what they could offer me. I spoke to a very pleasant guy named Steven, he was very professional and funny. I explained that i wanted to surprise my husband this time and that we were celebrating 10 years of marriage. Steven assured me that he would do his best to make sure it would be one we would never forget. Upon checking in, a nice young lady who's name i cant recall, greeted me and advised me that we were upgraded to the Sixty loft. This is by far the best room they have, its a 2 floor suite and was more like an apartment than a hotel room. It had 2 bathrooms one with a shower stall and toilet and one vanity sink. The upstairs bathroom had a steam shower and double vanity, it was perfect. They have robes and slippers for each guest, a hairdryer, and lots of towels; not much to complain about. If i had to list a negative it would be that the furniture had nicks all over it and that there was no iron or ironing board, also it had recently snowed and no one removed it from the balconies so out of the three balconies i could only utilize one that i was able to force open by pushing the snow away myself, a little bit of an annoyance but nothing worth packing up and leaving over. We ordered room service for breakfast by filling out a card that we left on the door handle and they delivered it at exactly the time we stated on the card. The food was good, basic breakfast; eggs, bacon, potato and toast. It came in a cute bento box and the coffee was good. All in all we definitely enjoyed our stay and will never forget our 10th anniversary. Thank you to Steven for listening and making it happen, to the girl who checked us in for beign so sweet and to Brandon for checking us out with ease and smiles; he was very funny and personable. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the location and proximity to EVERYTHING that NY has to offer and also for its great accommodations and price.

This was a last minute booking. The front desk staff were nice and quick to book us into the hotel. However, the heating system was unstable. It would blast hot and cool air throughout the night. It made it difficult to rest. In addition, you could the noise from the hallway and nearby rooms.
user_name:
nenapo7
New York City, New York

review_body: I do not recommend COLUMBUS 6. Be aware of how COLUMBUS 6 may charge you twice for your stay. On November 2016, COLUMBUS 6 charged my credit card twice for the same stay and told my credit card company that this was my fault. I was charged twice for the same stay and lost nearly $2000, 00. Here is how: In two sequential charges on the same day in November 2016, my credit card was charged twice. After I saw the wrong charge, I immediately called COLUMBUS 6 and alerted them. My stay at COLUMBUS 6 did not happen until December 2016. An entire month went by before the charges appeared in my statement and my stay at COLUMBUS 6. After I saw the wrong charge, I immediately called and alerted the hotel, long before I actually stayed at COLUMBUS 6 in December 2016. In December 2016, when I stayed at COLUMBUS 6, I reminded them about their mistake and asked them to correct it. They went ahead and charged me double. COLUMBUS 6 cheated me. I do not recommend COLUMBUS 6.

Comfortable hotel in great location for Lincoln Center performances and Central Park. Quiet though in busy area. Walking distance to several museums.Good value, helpful & friendly staff. Delicious, well priced breakfas.

Best location in Manhattan: connectivity, equidistant to all the attractions, great service of the people. Excellent sushi restaurant. Across the street from the Metro, the mall, museum, Central Park, delicious cafes, etc...

they didn't charge me when I did the booking and when they charged me (two weeks later) the acount was short of balance so they cancel my booking. They kept charging my credit card untill they got the payment and witgour allowing me to stay in the room. manager reaction to the incident was disappointing.

I have stayed at a sixty hotel before and this it's very poor cousin. The room could hardly fit my luggage, the bed was uncomfortable and there was noises at 2 am which woke me up every night. To top it off they are still holding over $1k on my credit card :/. They did move me rooms but they were not to concerned

Good location for what I wanted - close to Central Park for my morning run and close to multiple subway lines. However it's showing serious wear in all room appointments and the bathroom was both dirty (big clump of dirt in the sink) and half of heated floor tiles didn't heat. When I got in the valet made me wait and actually come find him, then he left my car unattended on busy 58th St for a LONG time; it made me very nervous. In the morning it took over 30 minutes for my car to be brought around - negatively affecting my drive back to DC. The front desk was very helpful however and apologetic about my car.

First of all everything looks just fine and the design of the keycard, I have to say, is great and cool. But then problems and issues start to come one by one, first is that the condition of all things in room is not quite well as it looks like, then is the service attitude and the efficiency is bad. Overall is not a terrible hotel, but it is definitely a terrible four star hotel.

I live too far from Manhattan to have late meetings, business dinners and events so every once and a while I have to stay in the City. This is the fourth time I've stayed at a Sixty property and the second time at 6 Columbus. I love staying at this hotel. It's a terrific location. Friendly professional staff. Well appointed rooms. It's small enough for me to think of it more like an apartment house or a private club than a hotel. I'd rather be one in a small group of guests than one in five hundred. G and Stephen at the front desk were accommodating and professional. Caesar helpful with my luggage. And, Mathias assisted me with an issue before I checked in. This is the perfect spot for those overnight stays in NYC - across the street from the Time/Warner Center, subway connections (A, C, B, D, 1) Central Park, mid-town businesses, theatre district, Lincoln Center and more, are ALL just a stone's throw from the hotel. It's great.

Cannot understand the star rating this place has! The bellboy who took our case was in a scruffy unironed shirt and looked borderline homeless. From the second we checked in, we felt we wanted to leave which we did the very next night! The staff at the reception are rude, seem irratated and untrained. They are in a rush to get you out of their way and continue their own discussuins omongst each other. The restaurant staff were so rude that we simply left our reservation. They looked and us and welcomed us as if we was wandering bypassers and not residents and it was just shocking. This place deserves one star i please think twice before going! As for the rooms, they will be the smallest rooms you can ever think of staying in with zero view! the bathroom is awful and outdated and just will ruin y0our holiday. Hated it with a passion!

At check in the staff was friendly and very helpful. We slept so well in the comfortable beds. The room was modern and had great decor. We didn't get a chance to explore the area, but it is right best Central Park. Wr will definitely be coming back!

awesome!!! so I'm a long islander and i frequently do one night sleep overs in the city that never sleeps. This hotel is the perfect choice for me. Its location is great, its right next central park and the beauty of Columbus Circle it self is great to look at first thing in the morning. The subway is across the street with major trains A,C,E, 1,2,3. So you can pretty much get anywhere quick. The room had a great view, it was very roomy. Fully stocked fridge and if you need ice you don't have to leave your room they bring it to you. From now on this will be where i will be staying on any of my future sleep overs
user_name:
danny n
Bay Shore, New York

review_body: I know I have written countless reviews about this establishment but people tend to look at the most recent ones so I am writing another one. I don't travel as much as I did a couple of years ago, I only make it to New York twice a year now, but 6 Columbus welcomes me back as warmly as they did when I used to go 5 or 6 times per year. From the management down to their employees, everyone is courteous and professional. There is a fine line between courteous, and too familiar, and too professional, that comes out too stiff, but they strike the perfect balance there. Their customer service is one of the best in the industry.The rooms are really comfortable. You have something for everyone. You can get a pod room, the smallest which is greatly designed to a suite that caters to more people, and a bigger budget. They treat all their customers the same, from the smallest rooms to the high rollers. They are represented on the app Hoteltonight which can come out to a great price. And to top it all off, you get Ceasar and Lawrence at the front door to welcome you back and chat with you a bit about your day!

Really poor sound proof! Couple front desk staff not friendly. Air/heat not working properly. Hard to move luggages without help at night time because of the stairs outside of hotel. However, the location is excellent and room is clean.

Great access to Public Transit and some shops. Staff are friendly. Lobby is small. Room is small but quiet enough and bed is comfortable. Good place for tourists if just sleep and bathe. Skimpy on soap (one handsoap, no shower bar).

This hotel is expensive and poor value for money. There are steps up to the front door and upon arriving with 3 heavy bags there was no one available to either help with the bags or bags he heavy doors. Fine in a cheap motel but not in a supposedly high-end establishment. The room was smaller than anticipated even though we had upgraded to a more expensive option and upon finding that there was no cork-screw in the room for our bottle of wine we rang frontdesk/housekeeping and after an hour and a half and 2 more calls still had not received one. Finally had to ask the lady doing the turndown service! Showers had no toiletries ( luckily we had our own!). All in all a poor experience. Wouldn't recommend.

I was put here on a business trip and the location was extremely convenient. Hotel was small and easy to enjoy the time I had. It seemed everything I needed or could have needed was in walking distance. I definitely recommend.

I have never paid for early check at any hotel ever. They always try to accommodate you. However, at 6 Columbus the front desk wouldn't even entertain my request (even though clearly they had rooms available) until I was willing to shell out extra cash (and even then I received the room after an hour of the request). What a crappy way to welcome a guest especially when you are staying with them for a good number of nights.Moreover, not even the faintest smile on the faces of the bellboys or the front desk staff. Room was also small vs. many comparable properties and the TV didn't work the whole time. I used to stay at this hotel regularly about 6 years ago and standards were definitely better then!Overall, disappointed and won't be staying here again with so many accommodation choices in the city.

Great location and a hip vibe at 6 Columbus. We were in NYC for a jazz weekend at Time Warner. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was small - which we expected - but was very comfortable. The only real downside were the towels, which appeared old, worn, rough and discolored, and the bathroom itself was extremely cold. I don't think the heat in the bathroom was working, which was confirmed by the front desk. Overall a nice experience - we will return (but I might pack my own towels.)

Consistently excellent. Staff was friendly and room was spacious, clean and priced properly. We have occasionly stayed at the other two Sixty properties in NYC. Those were excellent properties as well. Those are the LES and SOHO properties.

Visited NYC to see Book of Mormon, Live w/Kelly. This hotel is a great location to those venues. Also went to Museum of Natural History and walked thru Central Park. Hotel is in a great location, friendly staff, but very small rooms.

Well-appointed, neat, clean, if small, room in the middle of NYC. I liked the bathroom. Absolutely No view in our room (alleyway). Comfortable bed. Location, location, location! Courteous staff. Valet parking.

Don't depend on the free wifi and be prepared for a tiny room, otherwise a very nice hotel in a prime location. A great value for NYC. Close to subway, shopping, theater, restaurants, and Central Park.

Room dated and dark. Paint or wall paper peeling off walls. Hole in bathroom wall was badly patched. Not enough towels. No tv for first two nights of three night stay. Room was way too hot. Couldn't change controls in room to get air/heat working.

Perfect location amazing restaurant and everything I needed. The staff was accomadating on short notice and everything was seamless. From check in to check out it was easy and effort free. Blue ribbon was the best part
user_name:
alexlacey
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location, food and vibe. Staff was on point and extremely helpful. I will be coming back here for sure!! We stayed in the king suite and had a balcony which was incredible. The staff made us feel very special knowing it was our anniversary. Bathroom was huge and loved the over all space.

Overall, we enjoyed 6 Columbus for 2 nights over Super Bowl weekend. 1) We got an excellent price, first by checking out Hotels Tonight, then - instead - dealing with the reservations dept. and getting an upgrade to a 58th St-facing upper floor King Deluxe. Prices vary widely here, it seems. But it also seems they'll work with you on a not-busy weekend. 2) Very helpful staff. Ex: sent email to front desk with Stub-Hub PDF of theater tix and they printed them up right there. 3) Great location on the Midtown/UWS border. 4) The restaurant off the lobby is terrific. Check out the reviews for yourself. 5) Very cool roof-top bar. 6) Free passes to Equinox gym, 3 minutes away in the mall basement across the street 7) Yes, the hotel is a bit on the dark side, but so are a lot of NYC hotels. Really not bad at all. 8) Starbucks next door for coffee, snacks, etc.
user_name:
schulzwh
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Was only one night during Christmas, Room quit small than I thought in the pictures even I was upgraded from front staff. A bit old facilities especially elevator service. Staffs friendly and informative. Good location for transportation and shopping area.

The downstairs bar is a great place for meeting friends. Housekeeping and all staff very welcoming. Decent size room for NYC and close to Columbus Circle. We definitely enjoyed our stay and would like to return.

The Highlight is the location. Just perfect. Less than a minute from Central Park, even closer to a Major Subway station. The place is quiet and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. Only drawback was the size of the room. I don't know how I would manage if I wasn't alone. But I was so it was more or less OK. I would return gladly with my wife if only I could get a bigger room.

No heating in room, sticky carpet, and poor soundproofing. However, the restaurant in the lobby is very good and the price of the room was affordable. My overall experience was okay, but I wouldn't book there again.

near a lot. bed wasn't super comfortable. staff was nice. Equinox gym pass was a big plus. I would likely, depending on rate, stay again. get a room away from road. easy subway access. Bouchon Bakery is close by.

I stay in hotels all over the country fro business and this was by far the worst. Very small rooms, dark and my room had a bad odor that I decided that smelled like vomit. Elevator lobby was dark and had fake fur walls reminiscent of the 70's, what is crawling in there? The only good thing was the bed was firm but comfortable and the sheets smelled clean.

moving the office to a new location on 57th street required a two night hotel stay, (although for my weekly trips to NYC i will now be looking to stay here first)conveniently located to mid-town on a (relatively) quiet street with friendly staff it is well designed, quiet and cleanwith a starbucks next door

The staff was lovely, the room was lovely the entire stay was wonderful. Its convenient to transportation and within walking distance of lovely coffee shops and retaurants. I would higly recommend stating here.

6 Columbus was great when I stayed 2 years ago and simply out did itself this past stay. Don't think I would enjoy staying anywhere else as much. Great staff, so accommodating to special occasions, and just made our night that more memorable. Can't ask for a better place to stay.

Perfect location at Columbus Circle. The hotel is well-designed with helpful staff. Rooms are small (it is nyc), but you won't be hanging out in your room with everything that is at hand there. Good deals often.
user_name:
Rick1708
New York City, New York

review_body: My teenage son and I stayed 4 nights at 6 Columbus. I had made a mistake on my reservation, but Nicole, the guest relations manager, helped fix it. She was so nice!The hotel was great. Comfy pillows and mattress. Plenty of towels. Small, but big enough. I would suggest no more than 2 people in a room with 2 double beds. The staff were all great! Lawrence, the bellman, was extra kind and helpful. The A/C worked well in the room. The shower water was nice and warm, and powerful. It was a stylish bedroom and bathroom. They were great and stored our bags for us after we checked out until it was time to go to the airport. Great location! Starbucks & Walgreens next door. Subway train station across the street. Time Warner center with beautiful mall / stores across the street. Right next to Columbus Circle, and corner of Central Park. Quick walk to theater and Times Square. We will return!

The location of 6 Columbus is excellent, with subway access, shopping and Central Park right across the street. The room was cozy and clean, and the staff was friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. Great value for the cost.

I was able to get a deal on Jetsetter to stay at 6columbus for a quick weekend to visit family. The lobby in the evening is less than impressive and the doorman immediately told me to get my license and credit card ready. The front desk was nice but the staff didn't wear matching uniforms or similar suits as sometimes seen at high caliber hotels. On a positive note, blue ribbon sushi is adjacent and accessible through the lobby. I was upgraded from a Queen to King room likely due to it being a slow cold New York weekend. It was a nice surprise. The hallways of the hotel feel like an old townhouse but trendy dark and modern. I asked for a room away from the elevator and stairs and imagine if you had one close (which most of them are), sound could be an issue as it seemed to carry. The room was modern, and very clean, which is the most important thing to me. The only downside was the bathroom. It looked like a 60s chic but I think it just needed remodeling. The tile floor is extremely cold and the bathroom had a weird vibe to it. I can't describe it any other way. The bed was decently comfortable. The pillows were down and soft, which I like, but I suppose one could ask for other pillowsAll in all it was a good stay especially if you get a good deal. Location is phenomenal. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel to relax in, this is not the one for you. If you are looking for something clean, comfortable and in a good location and can get a good deal, it's a good find.

not comfortable for viewing TV and choice was poor liked staff they were very accamodating good location shower was uncomfortable restaurant food good but they were not very loved that subway was right across the street

The small flaws in this lovely little gem are easy to overlook. The location is fantastic, the beds are super comfy, and the decor is modern and cool without being over-done. There's nothing "sceney" about it, except the amazing sushi in the hotel restaurant.

I snared a great room on Hotel Tonight, and had a good experience with the checkin and other staff. The location is close to everything and yet the rooms are quiet. Good room set up, everything is well designed and laid out, even though the rooms are relatively small.
user_name:
David P
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed one night since I was attending an event. Manager was able to seamlessly address a check-in issue, which kept my inconvenience to a minimum. I truly appreciated his professionalism. Also, hotel location was fantastic.

The room was dark and cold. The sheets and pillowcases smelled of perfume so I had a strong feeling they were not changed from previous guest. I was not feeling well so I did not call the front desk. The bathroom was freezing so it could be felt in the room. This place has a weird vibe.
user_name:
molinslaw1
New York City, New York

review_body: My family stayed for three nights on three separate rooms (79, 64 and 61) at Colombus 6. We were not 100% satisfied with the overall cleanliness and smell of the rooms, but it was bearable. However, this morning my sister looked under the bed of room 79 to make sure we did not leave anything behind before check out. And as she reached the side of the bed her hand found and touched a used seringe. It was bloody and had been there for at least three days, since we had been there for that long.What if it had been a small child? What if she had pricked her finger? When house keeping came to pick it up, they wore gloves to touch it and take it away, yet they expose their customers to find these type of things with bare hands and feet. What if she had stepped on it while getting out of bed at night?This is serious. All I got from your staff were apologies and remakes that they had no authority to give us any sort of compensation without the general manager. I will be complaining to Hotel Tonight since we booked the rooms through them.Staff had no proper reaction to a crisis. Do not stay here. This is unacceptable. Horrible hotel.

Spent 5 nights here with my friends. Room was pretty small for 3 girls with 3 suitcases.. Our view was the building next door so that wasn't ideal. However, we were out most of the time and housekeeping did an excellent job! Additionally, it was close to the subway, and there's starbucks/cvs nearby which was convenient. Also very close to central park. Personally, I don't think it was worth the price we paid.

They had a scheduled water shut-off but never mentioned it until I called front desk letting them know I could not get hot water in my shower. Was late for a meeting and had to go without getting a shower. Poor lighting in rooms, could barely read or put my make up on. Good location but wouldn't stay again.

Not far from Lincoln Center, Whole Foods across the street. Restaurant in hotel is good, but not so many other choices closeby that looked great.
