Walk to Radio City and even Trump Tower if you really want for better or worse. Subway close by too. Only complaint is they take up MUCH space on the edsk with minibar and snacks they want you to buy. I was afraid to move them into the drawer that they would try to charge me. TV did not work well ecept for pay movies of course.

great location right across the street from the Time Warner center and Columbus circle subway station. Easy access to all of manhattan. Room was clean, but tiny. Not a lot of closet and storage space, great for a 1-2 night stay, would be tough if you had more need for hanging coats and clothes and relaxing in room. No desk, had to use laptop on bed and only place to sit is bed, no chair or other place to sit in room. Still I would come back and use again.

Would definitely recommend to a friend. Whole Foods, Equinox, Starbucks and the subway are all right there (not to mention Central Park). Staff were extremely hospitable and the room was a great size.

The check in and bar staff were all very nice and friendly. Spent 2 nights for work, as the hotel was near my meetings, I was upgraded to a king suite. From my experiences in NYC hotels the room and esp. the bathroom were huge. The decor was nice and the location was incredibly convenient. I got a good rate for the room so I think it was fairly and reasonably priced. The sushi at the bar was great. I would highly recommend both the restaurant and hotel.

I have no complaints. My room was clean, quiet, and comfortable - - a perfect birthday gift to myself. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff was friendly and personable without being overbearing - a huge plus. With the Columbus Circle station close by, travel throughout Manhattan was crazy convenient.

I wasn't satisfied due to the hotel service at check out. I also wasn't happy with the cleanliness of the room had dust all over walls that are visible and the heat wasn't working properly it was over priced for the stay

I highly recommend this hotel. Great location, good size rooms and great price. Having Blue Ribbon Sushi downstairs is a great plus. Booked through TABLET and got the best price available.Time Warner and Central Park are less than a stone throw away. Will be back for sure!!!

Spent a night in the city with my family, when we arrived to 6 Columbus, Lizbeth was so sweet at the front desk and we had a great check in..The lobby was so beautiful but when we got to our room we were in awe! It was so stunning, CLEAN and the biggest hotel room we have ever stayed in (that's a lot to say for the city). The whole staff was super helpful and nice.. especially, guest relations manager Nicole. We had 3 activities that day and she showed us all the subways we had to take, what restaurants to eat at and all tips for the activities we were doing. I can't wait to stay here again and would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone who is looking to be in the center and heart of the city. Can't even express how happy we were! Thank you 6 Columbus!!!

This hotel is small. The location is excellent as is the staff.I was upgraded to a fantastic suite when I checked in, made it even more fun.Breakfast came hot and inexpensive for NYC room service.The hotel is not for everyone. It has a small lobby, not glitzy.

Quick in and out for meetings in Midtown. Booked via Hotels Tonight, so not sure what kind of room was on offer.Lobby is pretty run down, but front desk staff cordial and accommodating.Got a double room with an interior view toward the back of the hotel. Amenities are standard, minibar is well stocked, bed and linens average, A/C functional.For all the talk of "modern, hip downtown style heads to Midtown" the truth is that the property is getting long in the tooth and a bit shabby.On the plus side the Blue Ribbon restaurant in the lobby is fantastic.Advice is that if you can get a rate under $300 that this is a good option in a great location.

My husband and I stayed at 6 Columbus this past weekend for my birthday celebration. This is the first time we have stayed at 6 Columbus and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The hotel staff; the room; the amenities and the location all exceeded our expectations! 6 Columbus is now our hotel of choice whenever we go back to NYC. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

After 10 years of family holidays we decided to go it alone and take a trip to NYC!!I read many reviews but decided to see for myself!The rooms are slightly small, but what do you need other than to sleep and get changed?They are comfy rooms with a great shower, bathroom and comfy bed!We went out everyday to be greeted by lovely staff opening doors and ordering taxis, then returning to the same hospitality and a clean room daily!For the price it's totally worth the money. Right next to Central Park and a short walk to Times Square.Subway station at the end of the street, a great Irish bar next door plus the on site restaurant and roof top bar.Definitely worth staying!I will agree with people about the doors. They need door closers updating but to be honest we were so tired from all the walking we didn't hear them at night.Don't let people put you off.Genuine review from a normal person!Enjoy

I stayed at 6 Columbus for a work trip. It's near the park, and an easy walk to Times Square, St. Patrick's and other NY hotspots. My only complaints- poor cell service in my room, and my co-workers were given FREE room upgrades, while I was offered one at $50 / night charge. Not sure what the difference was, perhaps timing? But seemed a little odd. I noticed another reviewed mentioned it's "dark" in the hotel, and I can say it is dimly lit, but that didn't bother me at all. I preferred the convenience of the hotel more than anything.

Comfortable (small) room with nice bath. Location is perfect if you are just coming to NYC for the Opera as it is within easy walking distance to Lincoln Center. We got to experience the NY Marathon finish line as a bonus! Japanese restaurant located on first level is also quite nice.
user_name:
Mark and Joung G
Lexington, Massachusetts

review_body: The hotel has a very good location at columbus circle, near to the Central Park and Subway... also good internet connection.. a nice sushi restaurant downstairs... but is still overvalued. You can finde better options around... just keep looking around.-

I was put up here for a work trip and could not have had a better experience. The staff was lovely and the beds were amazing. I also loved having a heated bathroom floor. My only issue was that there wasn't any coffee pot in the room but luckily there's a Starbucks next door and a little kiosk right outside the hotel where you can get coffee very easily. Overall I would absolutely stay here again!

Close to Central Park if that's what you want.Otherwise go elsewhere. I think I broke a kneecap walking around bed which was terrible sleeping on.The view was of nothing but trash between buildings.It was a room in a closet.

We had a lot of fun. Location was great, got to make full use of Central Park and all the great restaurants and shops around. Room was cramped but what can you do, it is NYC. Staff was helpful and polite, and very flexible with things like leaving luggage in storage after checkout so we could explore on our last day before leaving.

Had no issues here, room was very small but we got a great deal on it so can not complain, was only in NY for 2 days, wasn't looking for a luxury place to stay. Employees are kind and helpful of the city, was expecting a little better view from the roof (where a bar tender was waiting to accommodate us) but not in a bad location, very close to many of your classic tourist spots.

Had a standard day room booked 10.00/16.00 . Arrived at 10.15 told room was not ready.senior check in agent told him to give me a room as it was after 10.00 .was told I was getting a upgrade .room 49 if this was a upgrade I would hate to see the standard room.

We had an amazing visit to this hotel. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade and the room was spectacular. It was two stories, had two bathrooms, two balconies, and plenty of space for our family of four. The views were amazing. We could look at Central Park. The location is excellent, right in the middle of everything. It's just across the street from Central Park, easy subway access to anywhere, easy jaunt to the Hudson. We were spoiled when we were guests too. We had the chef deliver some complimentary mini-cupcakes, we had someone bring up some ice and chocolates (again complimentary and we didn't order it). We couldn't figure out the gas fireplace and someone came to manually turn it on and off (the switch was broken) each day when we wanted to use it. The front desk workers were friendly and helpful. The bartender in the bar was great too. It was a wonderful experience that contributed greatly to one of my favorite trips ever.

Hotel right in front of Columbus Circle - could not ask for a better location. Room quite small, but priced accordingly. Staff with very good attitude, but often not able to help (cannot give any guidance regarding use of Metro vs Taxi, despite being in front of a Metro station; cannot supply an adapter/converter for power plugs...).

Opting for a larger room is worth the small extra cost. Staff extremely helpful and Japanese restaurant off the lobby (and a Starbucks next door) real bonuses! Subway and bus stops very close by, Central Park steps away, and particularly well located for museums and shopping. Pity I was kept busy by meetings!

Was definitely impressed overall. The quality and the comfort of the room stands out the most. For making the reservation very last minute, 10 minutes before check in, check in was very quick and very courteous. Definitely going back
user_name:
Sean N
New Suffolk, New York

review_body: Great location, super attentive staff, nice rooms, thoughtful touches and amenities. Central Park is your backyard and the Tine Warner Center is your living room...who could ask for more! Did I mention great subway access and a hop and skip from wherever you're going.

+ Good location, + Good Japanese restaurant on ground floor- way over priced- No amenities (not even a complimentary bottle water for a $400+/night hotel) - and old smelly hallway- room is quite small for $400+, but I guess it's new york?!

When your experience is ruined from the start it's hard to turn it around for any reason. That was my experience here. Most hotels these days know and have sympathy that flights and room changes happen usually long before 3pm check ins. Even if they can't check you in they usually express sympathy and offer to inform you as soon as it's ready. Not here. The man rudely informed me: check in isn't even till 3 pm. Said in the most disdainful way. When I asked: any idea how long I could expect it to be ready? He said: definitely by 3 (check in time). No attempt to give any kind of customer service solution or sympathy. Utter rudeness. Beyond that their card hold for incidentals is 200$. This isn't a super fancy hotel. I stayed at the super fancy Soho Grand and they only held 150 for incidentals. This place is a less in terms of customer service and if they want to actually get return customers they should consider retraining their employees or firing those who express rudeness and disdain for clients. Especially the middle aged Indian man at the front desk.After coming from Distrikt Hotel (a not as fancyHotel) where the service was some of the best I've ever seen, this was a rude awakening.

We had a lovely stay at 6 Columbus - the staff were so accommodating and lovely! Our room was small and looked directly into a brick wall, but the bathroom was large and very modern. All was very clean and comfortable! The location is also great - right next to the subway and Central Park and easy walking distance to many sights. I really recommend trying the breakfast in the restaurant, we really enjoyed that and the staff there were also great.

Great location, nice service, exceeded expectations. Quality for the price was excellent and will definitely stay here again. Room was clean and sufficiently spacious, bathroom was all clean and shiny. No view and slowish elevators did not matter.

Small room. Great location. Our room was next to a loud shower in the adjacent room, probably because of the age of the hotel. Nicely remodeled bath. I would stay at the again but I would not fo out of my way to book this hotel. Value for the money was above aversge

I have stayed at 6 Columbus many times. The front desk and bellmen are very helpful and friendly. The rooms have always been clean and the beds are comfortable. The location can't be beat. I highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is in a perfect location. The room was nice if not luxurious. The front desk staff was less-than-accommodating at check-in. We booked a three night stay and they were unwilling to honor our request for a higher floor, instead placing us on the lowest possible floor, number 2. They never offered to move us to a higher floor during out stay. The fellow checking us in appeared to be reading from a script and was not very friendly at all.

The hotel is in an ideal location, adjacent to Columbus Circle and the subway station. The room was a very nice size, given most sizes of hotel rooms in NYC. The lobby and elevator areas are small, and the hallways are a little dark, but it is a good hotel for the value.

Perfect location in Midtown. Directly across from Time Warner building and Subway Hub at 59th Street and Columbus. Friendly Staff at Front Desk and Housekeeping. Blue Ribbon restaurant is excellent. I highly recommend the Fried Rice Oxtail.

The room was a closet, even by NY standards, and costly. The mattress was horrible, room temperature could not be controlled, and there was not a single chair or desk in the room. It was truly an uncomfortable stay. The view out the window was a deep, dark ventilation shaft, which was home to a large congregation of pigeons. The only positive about this place is its proximity to Central Park

We were given an upgrade since it was available, and everyone was very helpful. Did not matter to us but restaurant was cramped for Hotel of this caliber; however, the Whole Foods so nearby solved the problem. We loved staying at the hotel for the weekend.

The 6 Columbus - A Sixty Hotel is very well located in New York, near Columbus Circle. They also have a great japanese restaurant at the ground floor. I got the room 57 and it was very comfortable and clean.

If you're looking for a hip new hotel in the Columbus Circle neighborhood of NYC, then look no further than 6 Columbus. You're literally across the street from the Circle and Central Park. Once inside, the rooms are nice and new, and surprisingly quiet for a bust neighborhood. Everyone in the hotel wants to be sure that you have a great stay, which is different than other, larger NYC hotels. I highly recommend checking this place out!

This was a great location for central park and easy metro access to the rest of the city. Housekeeping was kind of pushy and I think they stole my pants... but otherwise staff was friendly and helpful.
user_name:
jmtravlr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location near Central Park & Columbus Circle! Subway station was across the street and the staff was friendly & helpful at this boutique hotel. Nice large bathroom and good size room for New York.

This is now our favorite Manhattan hotel. Staff is friendly, service is prompt, and answers to any questions readily available. Hotel staff is flexible to making last minute changes, for example, in extending your stay.

Great room for the price. Staff were really nice only downside was that it's not stroller friendly and I wouldn't bring someone in a wheelchair either. Its really tight in the hallways and I had to carry my stroller baby and bags into lobby.

The room quality was definitely average to poor. Furnishings are worn. Cracked sinks and showers. No sheets on the bed. Location good and starbucks next door. This hotel definitely needs to be freshened up.
user_name:
Mary Ellen L
Albany, New York

review_body: Clean, tidy and central location. Shame about the Staff, too stiff.Nice restaurant too but no breakfast or room service before 7am?? If you ask for a coffee...Starbucks is around the corner they suggested ! No spare charger as well!!

We stayed here a few years ago and thought that the value proposition was fine for a short stay, given the excellent location. Rooms are small but the beds are comfortable. However nothing has changed since our last stay and the furniture was looking battered and tired. The main socket for charging up laptops was damaged and potentially dangerous. We had a room overlooking 58th and it was quite noisy. The lift is tediously slow. Breakfast is still excellent and there's a welcoming bar on the top floor. Front desk staff are very helpful. So this is all about price - it's not worth paying top $ for but works as a mid range hotel.

The pics of the hotel are nothing like the actual hotel. Our room was the smallest I have ever been in, in New York. It was so small that once you put your luggage down, you had no room left over to maneuver. If you had to get up quickly at night to pee or something, you would most likely stub your toe or pull a muscle because of the lack of space. Speaking of peeing, the bath rooms are nice and the heated tile are a plus. I think what we paid for was location, location, location. The roof top bar is ok but the bar tender knows nothing about mixing drinks. He made his drink simply by what I looked liked i.e. He saw a big guy so he loaded the drink up with mostly alcohol when in fact I would have preferred very little alcohol. Bar tender please learn how to mix drinks.In summary, don't base your decision solely on the pics you see on the internet. The small pod room they advertise is best for one person only! Finally the location is primo

For New York - Hotel rooms are always going to be slightly cosy. I found our room was perfect, it was smaller but the design and interior of the room was quite quirky. Provides you with all your toiltries and wardrobe space etc. The location is pretty perfect and it feels very quite and calm once you're inside the hotel compared to the hustle and bustle outside! Perfect for couples who are intending to spend most of their time out and about in NY!

I have never written a review of any hotel but this one definitely deserved a warning. Let me also say that my husband and I never complain about hotels/service and usually just say everything is "ok" when asked. But this hotel was new to us and we decided to try something new given its great location for our reserved evening plans. We are very familiar with NYC and its hotel prices and usually know what to expect. We booked on the hotel website (NOT a third party which normally guarantees you an inferior room they cannot sell). We entered the tiniest hotel room we have ever been inside of and didn't say anything as we were only there for one night. However the room was exceptionally hot and we needed to put on a stand alone cooling system attached to the bathroom window that was placed inside the tiniest bathroom! The added cooling unit which stood upright (about the size of a human) completely blocked the sink and half the already tiny bathroom. I'm not even sure how a "boutique hotel" finds this acceptable? It was more like a cheap "motel 6" kind of fix. Again we didn't complain and thought it would just cool down the small room quickly. As the cooling unit was extremely loud, we shut it off after it cooled down the room and went out for dinner. When we came back from the sushi dinner at hotel (very good) to find the room excruciatingly hot. We knew that the weather was going down to 51 degrees for the night so we assumed the room would cool down on its own. After returning to our room, it was boiling hot again! We had to choose between putting on the cooling unit which was so loud we couldn't sleep, OR being so hot we couldn't sleep. Needless to say, neither of us got any sleep on one of our very few nights without the kids. Extremely, extremely disappointing. I actually wanted to just drive back home at 2:30 am so I could get some sleep. When asked the customary "how was your stay?" at the front desk when checking out, I let them know about the above and that I had never complained about a hotel in my whole life but this was beyond anything I had ever experienced. Room 64. How could they give someone a room with a clearly broken heating unit and a loud cooling unit? They said that a manager would get back to me but no one ever did. I had also emailed them about my experience the next day when I got received the customary email about your stay, but again, no one got back to me and this was two weeks ago. I'm really not sure why the hotel would place people in this room based on all the problems especially when the hotel was not at full capacity. But based on our very poor experience this hotel, we thought it deserved a warning to others especially since we tried to give the hotel the chance to rectify, remedy or at least explain the situation to no avail.
user_name:
pam4us
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel was nicely located midtown, fast walk uptown and to Times Square as well. So much places to eat all around. Service was good, food choices very limited though for hotel dining. They were so nice to upgrade to a suite so was very happy with the size of the room. The hotel and room was not new but refurbished and clean though. Bed was comfortable. Overall, had a good stay here and would Come back given the chance.

It doesn't have all the amenities and the elevators are slow but the location is great. Great shopping in the area and fairly quiet for NY. Although new it is a bit dingy but there's worse --- get it on a deal, I wouldn't pay full price.

Aside from being in a good location, the rooms were tiny, very dark, even the bathroom. It looked absolutely nothing like the photos from their website. The AC was uncharacteristically loud and the faucet was at a diagonal. In order to hear the TV, I had to turn off the AC. It was very disappointing. The check-in process was extremely long, even though it was paid through HotelTonight. There is a lot of construction you have to encounter on the sidewalks and that's where the ridesharing app co. want you to meet them.

I stayed at the 6 columbus 3 times this month and loved everything about it.The location can't be beat.The staff is great, very pleasant.Lots of new yorkers including myself stay on the weekends do you know it mudt be good.We are very discerning.I'm stsying again this Sunday night again

Conveniently located to Blue Ribbon Sushi, Starbucks, Columbus Circle, the subway, Central Park, The staff was the best! From securing a taxi for me in the rain to the most honest housekeeping ever, retrieving my lost jewelry and expensive sunglasses that I left in error in the room for me and mailing them back to me same day!!

It's definitely convenient, and nicely done up. But painting all the walls in the halls dark blue and putting 40 watt lights in the rooms (maybe less in the lobby) doesn't really hide the fact that it's an old building made up to be "cool". Great location directly across from Columbus Center, just down from another 'super cool' hotel, but honestly feel like I've seen this act a few too many times. And I can't imagine this place is accessible-- the front steps are horrible for a typical traveler, much less anyone with a disability (and no one at the door ever offered to help). There are weird staircases upstairs too, but it's easier to use them than wait for the slow dark elevator.

Great location, great food, great staff, not that clean and noisy rooms.Blue Ribbon in a great restaurant. People are great with you. I love to have the chance to run @ Central Park daily. But the rooms are noisy and I found other guest garbage on one side of my bed between the bed side table and the bed.

This hotel is close to subways and central park. Hotel staff is helpful and courteous. Rooms are clean with bathrooms that are large for NY hotels. The lobby bar is always buzzing with people and the rooftop deck is worth a visit.

If you are looking for a nice small hotel, reasonable rate, and very good accommodations check this place out. I arrived late after a long day, got a complimentary upgrade and had a short but very pleasant stay.

Lovely hotel, very friendly staff and in an excellent location for seeing uptown Manhattan. Originally booked for 2 nights but soon realised we'd like to stay an extra night in NY and hotel accommodated us perfectly

This was my second visit to 6 Columbus. Great location, Starbucks right next door, rooms are small but trendy, restaurant food was ok $$$, Central Park across the street, the door were courteous, parking stinks. Valet $55. I was charged and extra $55 11 days after I had left the hotel because my check out time was 12 minutes after the car was checked in the previous day. I called and talked to management, but they said they could not help me because it was considered and extra day. Really? $110 for parking? Very disappointed.

This hotel was quaint and cozy. I had a little hiccup as far as my bed was concerned but other than that everything else was perfect. The staff was extremely warm and helpful. The location of this property is perfect.
user_name:
dotnacesw
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved staying at the 6 Columbus Hotel. It is centrally located and reasonably priced for its proximity to everything and the quality of the rooms. I will definitely be staying there again in the future!
user_name:
loubro9
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is setup in a convenient location. It's close to everything. This is the upside. The downside. Concierge was not available to assist with our luggage, the elevators were extremely slow. The room has a not so pleasant smell and the AC did not cool the room. It was an uncomfortable night for me and my guests.
user_name:
noxiestudio
New York City, New York

review_body: Chic looking styling but the room was small and dark. Bathrooms looked newly furnished but I couldn't help but feel it was still cramped... it was however good value for the location - which was awesome.

A block from Central Park and few blocks from Broadway and Museums make this hotel ideal for an immersive NYC experience. Rooms are small but clean and well appointed. Work hard during the day and play harder at night. And repeat.

Hotel was nice. However, the room was unbearable because of the broken thermostat. Our room was literally like being in a sauna. They were able to fix the thermostat but we were checking out within the hour. This made for a very uncomfortable nights sleep. I was extremely upset that we had paid for a room upgrade and this is what we got.

We liked our stay at 6 Columbus, it has a very good location, CVS across the street walking distance to Central park and the Time SQ and shopping mall. There is a great 5 stars sushi restaurant opens the hotel ( its not part of the hotel) the food is excellent and the ambiance is charming.

Clean rooms, beautiful furnished, a little bit small but thinking of ny standard it's ok. The guys at the reception were gentle and helpful. Beautiful stay. I would stay here again if I'll come back to NYC

I have stayed at this hotel twice, both times I booked through Hotel Tonight, who guarantees rooms that fit two adults. The first stay was fine - room was decent, a bit small, but it's NYC so that's what I expect. The second time, we were placed in a room that was absolutely tiny, with a tiny "full" (I'd consider it not much bigger than a twin) bed. It was certainly not big enough to fit two adults at all comfortably. When we went to ask the front desk for a different room, they said they had plenty available but we'd have to pay a minimum of $50 per night to upgrade the room. This was extremely unsatisfactory since we were supposed to have a room to fit two adults when we booked, and the hotel wanted to blame it on Hotel Tonight, and Hotel Tonight wanted to blame it on the hotel, so no one was able to help it out and we were stuck in our super uncomfortably tiny room. I get that maybe this wasn't entirely the hotels fault, but at the same time, they were not full and had a bunch of more adequate rooms available, so I really feel they should have waived the upgrade charge and moved us to one of those, and then dealt with the issues with hotel tonight. I am an experienced traveller and I book through many services that don't guarantee a room type, and I am super used to being in cities where sometimes you end up with a super small room, and honestly I am not hard to please, I am not a suer particular guest. But this was way beyond anything I've ever experienced, and totally not acceptable.

Room was left with used tissue in draw! Water in bathroom was Runing for hours after flushing who make a terrible noise. View on a brick wall. And bed way to small for two people ! The LES one is way better ! Forget about this one !
user_name:
gregbau
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff were very friendly, comfortable bed & pillows, good service, when a request was called in, did need more soap, as bars were small, and more wash cloths. Towels were perfect and plenty of them. No noise from hallway.

I have only bad memories of this hotel because I did not sleep much because the room was so hot. The air con did not work and management could not fix it. The front desk guys were very helpful, can't fault them at all, but in August in NYC you have got have functioning air con in your hotel room.

I did not appreciate the small size of the room , the lack of a storeage chest for my clothing, the inability to store my luggage , and the position of the hanging cabinet which impeded the entrance to the bath.

Perfect Boutique Hotel in a perfectly fabulous location. Wonderful helpful and kind staff from the doormen to the front desk all wonderfully helpful and friendly . The room was small but it's NYC so that was to be expected for the money . The Hotel is a bit hip but friendly Hip

Small hotel but apparently recently renovated facility. Good location at Columbus Circle. Rooms reasonably valued (promotional). Limited services. Sushi restaurant was good but for general fare, we went across the street to the Shops at Columbus Circle. Friendly desk help but no concierge.

The hotel is ideally located to visit Central Park, Broadway etc, the staff are friendly and there are good views from the roof top bar but that's about it. OK, as the pricing was good perhaps we should have not expected more. Having said that, our supposed upgrade to a king sided deluxe room was a bit of a let down as it was far smaller than anticipated, it was dark and had a dated feel to it. The corridors were also poorly lit, the dark decor not helping. The ground floor bar is a bit sterile while the drink prices are very expensive. We were also a little disappointed by the roof top bar which had a cramped feel to it.Would we visit again. Afraid not!

Perfect location on the corner of Central Park, within walking distance of broadway and public transport. I loved it and would definitely stay there on return. Pretty big rooms for new york, very boutiquey feel to decor, very classy.

Really nice hotel.We stayed there for a week, it's really good located in NYC and close to Central Park and subway.The room is really nice and with storage under bed so it's possible to unpack something from the suitcase if you stay longer.There is also a good minibar which we not used.Great cocktail bar with a beautiful view over New York.

The location was great (Columbus Circle), bathroom and the room were very clean. This place honestly gave me a New York feel and style. Air conditioning also blows very cold if you want (50 degrees was the lowest)

My wife and I spent the weekend at 6 Columbus. A small hotel in a great location, across the street from Columbus Circle and a couple of blocks from Central Park. The best thing was the people. The staff bent over backwards to fulfill our every need and answer any question.The room, a King Superior, was small. There were no drawers for the clothes. a very small wardrobe that held less than ten items. Everything else stayed in our suitcase. The bed was extremely comfortable. To get ice you must call the front desk and have it delivered. Our view was of the alley. Don't be fooled by the rooftop bar with views of Central Park. There are no views. The metro is just across the street.

6 Columbus at 58th & 8th Ave is my go to hotel during any of my 15+ visit to NYC each year. This boutique hotel is well located (easy access to all of NYC via the major subway lines, cab, foot, bike share), has an incredible restaurant (Blue Ribbon Sushi) and is small enough that everyone remembers your name.If you want some boring, bland, corporate behemoth hotel stay elsewhere. If you want something with charm stay here.

Location of hotel great, as could easily jump on metro and walk to park, Broadway, etc. We were expecting a more modern, bigger room as per the adverts. Staff friendly and roof bar had good views. Thanks!

i would have loved this place if they hadn't made a few mistakes that were irritating and wasting my time. our room was only partially re-set and cleaned when we got to it, then later they charged me for 2 days of parking when someone else in our party had already paid for the one day that we used. overall, really nice staff, just ended up being a bit of a headache. the location and decor is great, the restaurant excellent.

Hotel was a good location and next to everything we needed to visit. We found the staff very helful in recommending local restaurants and comedy club. Overall it was a very pleasant visit and near Columbus circle.

Got a great rate for a King Superior room from Secret Escape for this well located boutique hotel at Columbus Circle. Hotel is right across from the Time-Warner building and a minute's walk to the subway. We were met by a friendly doorman who took our bags and led us to the front desk. Adriana, a delight, welcomed us and checked us in. Our room wasn't ready (it was 10:30 am) so we left our bags and set off for the day. Weather was high 90's and very humid. Adriana called my cell around 1:00 to say our room was ready. We returned around 3:00 to find a well appointed, clean, medium size room on the 5th floor. Room had outstanding AC, a must for the weekend. Faced the back, quietest room we've ever had in NYC. Took a nap and then heading to the roof for a drink at the roooftop bar. Keith was a good host and we enjoyed the views. Stayed two nights and had an easy check-out on Sunday. Hotel, room, staff and location were all top notch.

A great location (Columbus Circle), in a cool place, with a kindly staff that gave us an up grade for our three childrens (one king bedroom instead of a double queen and a deluxe doubble for me and my wife), contribute for an incredible trip of 4 days in New York Citi, .

We had an ok stay in the hotel although we were unpleasantly surprised by the fact that there were no common areas, and only a small darkish lobby. The rooms are very small but comfortable. But the nasty surprise came when we realized they had charged our credit cards a deposit for the room three times. We had three rooms and the same happened with each room. Plus I received a call from American Express warning me that this hotel had attempted to charge me over 500,000 USD, which Amex of course did not authorize! Unbelievable. All we received from the hotel was a free drink and a free upgrade on one of the rooms (which was of 75 USD in total). When I completed the survey I received an apologetic message from the manager saying that they would love to repair their image with us in a future occasion but when I wrote saying that we were travelling again in a few days and asking for a good price, I never received a reply. I will definitely never go again and would absolutely not reccomend it.

I stayed at 6 Columbus in late July 2016. I don't usually stay near Columbus Circle when I come to NY, but this trip involved an early morning work meeting near Columbus Circle, so I decided to give 6 Columbus a try. I was very pleasantly surprised by this boutique hotel. My room was more than large enough, the light from outside was great, the room was quiet, and everything worked. The staff members were also outstanding, from the people at the check-in desk to the bartender at the hotel bar. My only complaint is that the elevators could be a little slow at times. I should also note that the location of this hotel is fabulous. It is immediately across the street from the Columbus Circle 1/A/B/C/D subway stop, and only a couple blocks from a number of other subway stops. There's a Starbucks next door and you're only steps from Central Park. I would definitely stay here again, for work or for fun!

We stayed for location with business meetings. My husband just had surgery so we asked for extra pillows to help him comfortable. I asked for 4, they brought up 2 and said that is all they could find. On top of it, the pillows came without pillowcases! Definitely lacking in service! At least it was clean.

Lovely comfy beds at last and staff were friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble. Excellent location near subway , park and access to everything in Manhattan. Breakfast extra cost but plenty of it giving choice of eating in or going out for bagels etc.

I booked this hotel on Hotel's Tonight after getting stuck in the city an extra day due to flight delay. It was a good hotel in a fabulous location next to the park and Columbus Circle mall. The actual hotel itself was nice, but had some room issues. To be completely fair we were coming from an absolutely pristine hotel the three nights before so this might be a little skewed due to that. Our TV didn't work, which was OK since we got in at 10pm and left by 11am the next day. There were just some details of the room that were overlooked and issues with the water warmth. The staff was very helpful and warm during our stay and the room was huge. I'm not sure I would stay here again, but for the price point it's probably an excellent value.
user_name:
lauren c
Manhattan Beach, California, United States

review_body: We were very happy with the service from the staff and the location of the hotel. It was across the road from a big mall and very close to Central Park. The room was big enough for two of us and we were very comfortable.

The location near Columbus Circle is great for access to Central Park while still within walking distance of Times Square, but without the noise associated with the Times Square area.The rooms are a mixed bag of sizes, though. The first room I was given was essentially a closet that looked out into a chimney sized area. After speaking to the front desk, they quickly reassigned me a new room.Throughout the stay, the staff were all very polite and attentive.

The room was not ready when we arrived (16 pm) and we had to wait 45 minutes for its preparation. A little bit unusual and inconvenient, considering the time. It was compensated by the friendliness of the people in charge, Felicia and the rest, during the rest of our stay (six nights).

We have a wonderful time , the localization was fantastic and very convenient. the team of the hotel are excellent and the staff was very concerned about the guest needs. The Japanese restaurant are very good.

the room we had was a very nice room...only two things...one the balcony view wasn't that pretty, construction was all around us and two, our bathtub didn't let out our bath water...but i will come again...people were very friendly

The hotel was absolutely gorgeous! All of the staff, especially the doormen, were extremely friendly and courteous. The rooms were ample size for NYC and very clean! We will not stay anywhere else while in NYC!

#1 - a GREAT location across from Trump International which has shopping, dining and great people watching.#2 - a very helpful and friendly front desk staff and an equally nice support staff from the doormen to those who kept our room spotless both of whom all greeted us with smiles.#3 - a wonderful roof top that has a nice little bar for an "end of the day" cocktail and a second area to do nothing more than enjoy the view (or soak up some afternoon sun as I did)#4 - a very attractively designed room (loved the unusual navy blue bathroom and well pressured shower head.#5 - an actual quiet room certainly because it was on a high floor on the back of the property, away from the street#6 - a nice restaurant and bar on the property was convenient for a quick drink or app or a full breakfast, lunch or dinner unless you prefer Starbuck's, RIGHT NEXT DOOR! DON'T BE FOOLISH AND IGNORE THIS FANTASTIC HOTEL!

Wonderful Hotel with a Couple of Little Problems. We checked in at 2AM in the morning after a flight delay and then got our room which was a room /went back to the desk and it took them and hour to get another room ready, for two persons, reservation was for three persons, even paid extra for the room. Got the new room at 3AM with no A/C and 82 degrees. We went to bed and handled it in the AM. Nicely the hotel gave us breakfast and took care of the room change. The rest of the three day stay was totally awesome!!!
user_name:
King B
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: With a variety of room sizes, it helps to be specific with the extremely capable staff when booking. Other stuff: great sushi bar off the lobby and if you're a shopper, you're within feet of the Time Warner Center and a few more feet from Central Park. Great place.

We spent four nights at the Colombus and we were not disappointed at all. It is a very comfortable Art Deco hotel with a funky deco and roof top bar. We got an upgrade on our arrival which was lovely. The hotel is very well situated in a great and easy location in uptown, two steps away from Central Park and Broadway.It is reasonably clean and despite a little noisy I will recommend this hotel.

The hotel is right next to the Central park. Besides, it is 1 only minute away from my favorite Wholefoods supermarket in NYC. The only thing I did not like about our room - it had virtually no window (the room faced some sort of backyard a couple of feet wide), an ugly view, had to have curtains down all the time. But I guess it is quite usual for a big city. Otherwise a very nice hotel, good housekeeping.

The location is very good and very close to Central Park. The deluxe room is very spacious. However, there's no view to outside, the windows were blocked by a wall. And there's no shampoo in the bathroom.

We loved this place. We're upgraded to a suite which was beautiful. Very chic, clean great location, very nice staff. Fun roof t lounge. We had a nice porch on our suite for lookin at the star at night. Comfortable beds and huge bathtub.
Stellar staff- they go above and beyond - from the bellman Lawrence- to the management staff of Samara and NicoleGreat LocationRight in the heart of Columbus CircleEasy 2 block walk to Central Park

I've stayed in 3 Manhattan hotels till now and this the best. It's a small hotel but is lavish. Their staff is very helpful. I don't remember the receptionists name he was an indian guy who upgraded us. And it was a beautiful stay. It's very near to the subway station, cycle rental, Columbus circle, central park and the times square. The room is quite bigger than other hotel rooms in that area and is very modern too. A must stay in new york. This was the first hotel where there was no traffic noise coming inside the hotel

6 COLUMBUS CIRCLE 6-24-16 > 6-30-16LOVED this hotel. Location: Columbus Circle - steps from the south end of Central Park - Subway entrance directly across the street - Hotel:- Hip vibe - Lively, but not noisy - Blue Ribbon Sushi Restaurant off lobby - Small boutique feel - Reasonably priced - I upgraded at check in to a fabulous room the had a private terrace off the very large bedroom, which made me feel like it was my home and not just another hotel room - Staff: Very professional and accommodating - I primarily interacted with Felicia and Chhristian, who were both delightful.I lived in NYC for 30 years, and now have a new home when I want to go back to visit.

For a stay close to opera theatre or a walk in park, it's here!Work-out, swim or just sleep, it's here.If you enjoy New York nightlife and meeting nice folks it's here!I had always wanted to live in the very area I was a business professional for years, and I got that experience. Great shopping and all, carriage rides all within reach! Disappear here!

Friendly staff, the intimate scale of the place, and the lovely roof-top bar (with especially friendly and pleasant bartenders) were all very pleasing. The location, just off Columbus circle, can't be beat, and you don't have to invest in one of the giant hotels near the Park. Only issue: our room had its window on the airshaft; next time we'd probably pay more for a room with an outward-facing window

The hotel is nice. Staff is accommodating. Restaurant is awesome with the very best service I had on my whole trip. But the lobby could be nicer and more welcoming and the hall doors slam loud which woke up my baby every morning -- which meant a lack of sleep for us.

Well located close to Central Park, Museums, Broadway and shopping areas, the general conditions are just ok, a/c was extremely noisy. Atentive personnel, very quiet and accessible area. It is a good combination of minimalist style in an old building.

Great location, friendly staff. Our room was booked through Hotels Tonight and was kind of small but overall nice and worked out fine. Equinox access around the corner a big plus! Arrived on a red eye flight from LA and our room was not ready until after 2pm but they held our bags and we washed up in the clean lobby bathroom and walked around the city until then.

Hotel is steps from the Shops at Columbus Circle/Time Warner Center and Central Park. The staff are super friendly, helpful and eager to please. We stayed in a King Deluxe on the 7th floor. I wouldn't recommend anything smaller if your travel party is more than 2 people. The room worked well for 2 adults and a toddler. Very clean place and my standards are high in this category. The shower felt amazing after a long day in the city. Only drawback was the noise in the hallway. The doors are loud when they close. We were able to hear a considerable amount of street noise but that didn't bother us. Check In/Out was quick and efficient.

Chris Ortega the doorman, is a star.gregarious, profesional, extremely reliable and helpful.(He once found my wallet and saved my trip !)!We hope to find him promoted to some sort of management position in the near future.

Found myself in NYC for an extra night, and took a chance on 6 Columbus using the Hotel Tonight app. 6 Columbus was clean, inviting and surprisingly quiet for being right on Columbus Circle in the heart of NYC. They were even kind enough to grant me a late checkout, giving me time to explore the city a bit before heading to the airport. I would highly recommend for anyone looking for an easy, clean and well located option in NYC.

We had a great stay at this hotel! Big thanks to Adriana for some great recommendations! All of the staff was nice and responsive. Will definitely come back! Great location and really good sushi in the restaurant.

Lovely boutique hotel with a fantastic location. Rooms were well sized (esp for NY) and very clean. The hotel sports a more modern look with atmospheric colours but these were chic and not dreary in any manner whatsoever. From the time of my booking Samara provided excellent service and communication. Across the road was the Time Warner Shopping centre for those inclined, but even better was Central Park, literally opposite. Touristy areas (Times Sq etc) were far enough to keep happy snappers and alike far away, but never far enough for a walk down.All in all a tremendous stay with nothing but praise for all their staff and the hotel itself.

From the moment we walked in, we were taken care of like VIPs. We got to the hotel very early (10:00AM) and was able to check in. We were offered an upgrade for a very reason rate, and I'm glad we took it. We had a king size room with a great view. Adriana at the front desk was friendly, helpful and just a pleasure to talk to. The location is perfect, directly across from Columbus Circle, the subway also right there (which we used a lot). There are restaurants within steps of the hotel, shopping right across the street, and you are literally only minutes to Central Park. The room was spotless, the beds and pillows comfy. The only nitpicky thing - the elevators are so dark, was hard to even see the numbers for the floors. But, we never waited for elevators, so that was a plus. We've stayed in many hotels in NYC, this was definitely one of our top favorites. We will definitely stay again.

The staff was very helpful. Room was very clean. It was not a very big room, but was great for our needs. Had to ask for another trash can. There was only one in the bathroom. When we got back to the room it was there. It was really no room in the refrigerator to put anything in there. It was loaded with drinks and alcohol. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

The room design is awkward and unsuitable for business travelers. The desk is unusable - barely room to get a chair jammed between desk and bed, no way to occupy the chair. So it was in the hallway. There was just one dresser drawer - yet there was a huge minibar taking up space that could have held a few more drawers. Doors opened the wrong way. Clearly whoever designed the rooms never stayed in them.

Adriana made our reservation and checked us out. She was helpful and great with recommendations for restaurants (we asked about Thai food in the area and her suggestion was close and delicious!). Alex checked us in and gave us a detailed description and rundown of everything the hotel has to offer. The reason for our stay was to spend time in the city for my fiancés birthday. Adriana made his birthday extra special with a room upgrade. We stayed in a King Studio (Room #114) which was spacious, chic, and clean. We're glad we chose 6 Columbus. It's in a prime location on W58th Street and a short walk/cab ride from attractions, stores, and eateries. Since it was a rainy day, we weren't able to take advantage of a walk in Central Park but we'll be back for that - and because Adriana was so accommodating we look forward to coming back to 6 Columbus!

The location of the hotel is really great. It is across from Time Warner with all of the shops and across Central Park. The subway is right across the street so it is convenient, it's also not far from Time Square if you take the subway. I stayed here on business so I was rarely in the room. The room is very dark though and I didn't open the shade because the window was facing apartment windows and I could see people in the other building. Even with the shade open the room was extremely dark. The room is small, but it wasn't so small that I felt cramped for me the size was fine. The side I stayed on was quiet, wasn't facing the street so that was nice. The issue for me was that the bathroom was made for a very tall person. I could not see in the bathroom mirror, whoever put the mirror up must have been like 6ft tall. Even standing on my tippy toes I barely saw my forehead. I am petite, but I would have thought I could at least see in the mirror! Luckily there was a retractable makeup mirror that I could use. There is also a long mirror but it was so dark I didn't want to use it for makeup and risk looking like a clown. The water pressure was on super high, my skin didn't come off but it was rough. I tried adjusting it but it was either a trickle or high intensity. Because it is so high the water also goes everywhere. It is also very loud, I could hear when the person next to me was showering. The faucet also was strange, I didn't know which way was hot or cold, so I had to let it run for 3 min to figure it out. The sink area is small but there is a shelf above the toilet for all my things. The bed was ok, the AC worked good. I did have a lamp next to the bed that wouldn't shut it off, I would turn it off then I would wake up in the middle of the night and it would be on, it was dim, but odd that it would just come on. There was additional storage under the bed, it had draws which I thought was nice. There was no iron in the room, but I called and got one. There are two elevators, one is small the other is big. I checked in pretty late so for me check in was fast. I checked out early and it was fine also. I did go up to the roof top and it was like a cute covered patio, it wasn't really outside, it was covered with windows, it was cozy and had a nice ambiance. Overall for business not bad, if you aren't going to be in the room much, it's fine. If you're visiting NYC you shouldn't be in your room anyways. Rooms are small, but wasn't crazy small, I stayed in smaller. There is free wifi and paid wifi too, pick free and you get it for a certain amount of hours. Location is great though!

This is the worst and smallest room I've ever seen, even by New York standards. The room feels even smaller given a bed a foot from the loud wall, tiny elevators, and a window facing a sad little "courtyard" just a few feet wide. While the window offers some semblance of natural light, the window is best kept closed to avoid looking a wall just outside, leaving you in a tiny, dark room.Two stars because this was also the slowest check-in I've ever experienced.

Wonderful experience in a really exceptional hotel. Great upgrade to a suite like none I'd ever seen in NY. Beautifully furnished, great views, most comfortable bed. I highly recommend this hotel. My new go-to for NYC visits!

Not a terrible place to stay but there are way nicer places for less money. They were doing some kind of testing in the early morning which involved an extremely loud alarm going off. It's a great location though, just down the street from Columbus Circle and close to Central Park. I just wouldn't recommend it if you're staying for longer than a couple days.

Very well located. Confortable although some rooms are small. Double bed room tend to be more spacious and we had to change. We staid six days and had a great time. Good quality service and equipment.

The room was EXTREMELY small. Probably the smallest room I've ever stayed in in NYC. Pictures from hotel tonight we're not representative of the actual room we got. We had one tiny window facing a brick wall that barely got any sun light. The decor was ok- not the biggest fan of wooden paneled walls- if you're going to have a small dark room, you can't have dark walls as well- it makes the room appear smaller then before. The experience was ok for what it was. Probably won't be back though

I highly recommend this hotel, for location and price point. It really cannot be beat - accessible to everything. Room decor pretty nice, and staff have personal touch and care about their guests and making their stay nice and comfortable

6 Columbus was a very nice room for the price in NYC. Rooms were clean if a bit small, lighting in bathroom could be a little better. Staff was very nice and helpful. We had a king junior suite so we had a little extra room, regular rooms are very small. Located in a good area, walking distance to Central Park, Broadway shows and lots of other attractions.

The location of this hotel is excellent. However, the room was smaller than most other NYC hotels we've stayed in, and the staff had a "can't-be-bothered" attitude. Nobody helped us with our bags when we arrived, and I had to hunt down the valet to park our car.

We cannot say enough great things about 6 Columbus. We knew nothing about it. Chose it from a list of moderate priced hotels near Lincoln Center. Wow. What a find. The location tucked behind Columbus Circle, less than five minutes from Lincoln Center and Carnegie Hall, was terrific. The welcome was warm and professional. But the best thing was our room! A Room with a View from its own private terrace with enough space for everyone that we know in NYC. The decor was minimalist and chic, the artwork was contemporary and the bed was one of the most comfortable we have encountered in our years of traveling. This place is a gem. We will definitely return.

You know that episode of "Seinfeld" where Kramer laments he cannot get a good shower due to poor water pressure? He needs to come stay here. The shower was EXCELLENT. The powerful water pressure and piping hot temperature made it feel like a luxurious spa. Nice amenities, too. The A/C is powerful and provides a nice buffer if people are talking in the hall. It was very quiet - no street noise. Yes the rooms are tiiiiiiny, the whole place feels a bit shabby and there are no frills to be had here. There's this giant clock-radio thing with an iPhone adapter .. circa 2008. It's not suitable for phones past the 3G. So your dinosaur phone will work but not a current one. Want some ice? They send a bellman to your room and will return with a few cubes. What? Water is free but whatevs.. The bed also is tiny - a "full size" mattress, not even queen-sized. If you're tall your feet are going to hang off the end and you and your spouse will need to make adjustments if you're used to lounging in your big ole king size bed at home! A few more shelves would be handy since there's so little storage (plan to stack your suitcase on top of the small wardrobe to save floor space). The rooftop bar was not operating when we were here but it was a nice place to go sit and read the paper. Also: there are bathrooms on the top floor, in case one of you is hogging the bathroom to take one of those luxurious showers! Given the good location and reasonable price, I'd definitely stay here again.

Hotel is across from aol time warner mall. With lots to do. Small but comfortable room. Although the air conditioner is a portable one it works well. No gym but they will provide a gym pass that will allow access to Equinox. Boutique hotel flavor.

We've been guests five times at 6 Columbus. For many years we considered this hotel "our home" in NYC. Extremely well located, it filled our expectations for long time. This year things has been different. The overall appearance is not good, furniture looks old and there were no renovation at all. Cleaness is not the same. Rates were too high, out of proportion for what it offers.

Great location,Strong value in New York City. Small hotel feel, card controlled elevators add feeling of security- but, rooms are showing wear and service is lacking. That said, we would stay once again.

Some of the rooms are ridiculously small and the others are much too expensive. For what they charge you'd expect at least breakfast to be included and the service to be great, which it wasn't. Would not recommend this hotel.

Staff was extremely courteuous, available 24x7 on every need we requested, Restaurant and Roof Top Bar is worth going to - Location is perfect in NYC -- Near to everything. Room was spacious and clean. The hotel is worth the price and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting NYCVIPcontacts.com

Decor is modern and sexy and loved the vibe of the hotel . Great staff gave me an upgrade for a reasonable price as I did not care for smaller room. The room was beautiful and service was prompt. I had some issues with ac and they fixed it immediately and it was fine. Also morning tea was piping hot and did not take any time. Very helpful and friendly staff and recommend this hotel to all.

Just love this place. Convenient to everything. Friendly staff. Just the right size! Highly recommended to anyone coming to New York City. I haver stayed here many times over the last 5 years and never look elsewhere. This has truly become my home away from home in the city. And with Blue Ribbon Sushi right downstairs, there is always a great midnight snack a phone call away!! Thank you team.
user_name:
Barney G
Old Tappan, New Jersey

review_body: Our ceiling leaked, we could hear everything from the hallway, the space was ridiculously small for two. The lobby smelled like urine by the elevators. Elevators are incredibly old and small. Staff was nice and the decor was trendy but because of the issues explained earlier I wouldn't return.

Nice property in a great part of NYC, lots around and transit nearby too. Rooms aren't too small, on the darker side but well appointed. Blue Ribbon sushi downstairs and Time Warner across the street, with Equinox nearby.

Haven't stayed in many Manhattan hotels. Pricey, but on par with surrounding area. This room was adequate; clean, but small. Nice location, easy to get to, close to subway lines. Friendly staff. No complaints.

The location of the hotel is fantastic. It's across the street from Time Warner center and central park. The rooms are pretty small for the money and there is no natural light from the outside. The room was quiet but no reason to stay in it other than to sleep.

Understanding the property is a premium in Manhattan. I can forget who the size of a room, but not the comfort or lack there of in the quality of mattress and bedding everything from the lobby to the furniture in the room looks like it needs to be updated.

This is a great hotel In a terrific location. The hotel lobby decor is very nice, though not top of the line. There is a cozy bar on site. The location can't be beat. But the real reason for the 5* is that they offered a complimentary upgrade to the most fantastic room I've ever had at any hotel in all my travels. A duplex loft with 2 balconies and views of the park. The furnishings were very high style and high quality. It made an ordinary NYC work visit into an experience of a lifetime. This is really above and beyond customer service - totally unexpected and for no reason but to thrill a customer. They have won my loyalty!
user_name:
Gillian E
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We decided in the morning to book a hotel for one night and found this one through the internet. It was a very fair price for New York and the location - at Columbus Circle - was great.Check-in was great and when my wife mentioned it was my 40th birthday we even got an upgrade from a queen to a king room.Very modern rooms, great bed and pillows and the hotel has a very nice vibe to it.Would recommend this hotel!

The hotel is located in a super convenient spot - right around the corner from Columbus Circle and 5 or 6 blocks from Lincoln Center. The room was average in NYC terms - I was on my own so the double bed was more than adequate and the bathroom was much roomier than expected, particularly in NYC. The heated tile floor was a nice surprise. The room was on the 9th floor and was quiet. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful, and very responsive.I was in town overnight to see a show at Lincoln Center, and it could not have been more pleasant and convenient. Highly recommended!

I travel to NYC at least once a year to visit our daughter and have stayed in a different hotel each time. Some have been better than others, but 6 Columbus is definitely the best and will be the one I hope to choose again! It is conveniently located to Columbus Circle with all it's shops and restaurants. There is a subway stop across the street and Central Park is a short walk away. The staff were all very friendly, especially Adrianna at check-in, and were very helpful. Our room, #64, was small, but that is to be expected in NYC, and there was adequate room for the two of us. After all, we don't travel to the city to hang out in a hotel room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom, was well-equipped. Loved the heated bathroom floor as it was chilly during our stay.

Adriana at front desk was very helpful as was all the staff. Hotel is nicely located on W 58th street across street from 59th street subway station. Walking distance to Central Park and dining. Room was large enough and had ample storage for our clothing in either a closet or drawers under the bed. Bath was spacious and has a heated floor which was a pleasant surprise.

We choose this hotel based on size (boutique) and location. I'd rate it tops for both categories. We loved the location across from Central Park near Columbus Circle. Subway access was perfect for our plans to travel to Yankee Stadium and attend a show at Lincoln center. The hotel was exactly what was advertised. Rooms are small but we were not in the room much. There was a nice lounge at the hotel and on the roof. I would definitely stay again. Staff was professional and helpful when needed, Rooms were clean and quiet. I would give this property 4 stars.

We are currently resident in this hotel and feel extremely stuck because we have paid up and have planned things in and around this area and are not in a position to shift out.Guests - Family of 4.Room - King suitePrice - US$635 a night all inclWhat didn't work - (i) temperature control non-functional. Had to open the window and sleep on checking in at 11pm after a long flight.(ii) venatian blinds - roller broken; wouldn't go up(iii) table laptop plug point - broken(iv) lobby non-existent; support non-existent. The bellman doubles up as an engineer and housekeeping at night.The next day we requested the engineer to fix the issues. As he couldn't fix the temp control, in the evening, front office called us and said that they could shift us to another room. Can you imagine a king suite where the temperature control does not work. With 2 kids and many pieces of heavy luggage, to gather our stuff and shift to another room was not possible, so we asked for a senior manager. But no senior manager was available even to speak until 9:00am on Monday morning. The front staff were doing their perfunctory duty by offering another room.Housekeeping - the morning staff did not inform the afternoon staff that we wanted our room cleaned up at 2:45pm. So, cleaning happened at 6:00pm when we requested the person who had come to put ice in our room that we needed the room cleaned.Please avoid this hotel, esp if you are a family. Having lived in many other New York hotels like the W, Waldorf, Grand Hyatt, etc., I can tell you that this will probably be the worst value for your money you will ever get.

I recently stayed at 6 Columbus for the first time in a studio king and it was a great experience. Huge room, hardwood floors and even a balcony. Definitely a pleasant surprise. I booked on the hotel tonight app which can be hit or miss. I have ended up in some pretty bad rooms in the past but not this time! The manager, I believe her name was Nicole, upgraded our room and allowed us to stay in the studio king for three nights at the hotel tonight app rate which was crazy cheap! The location was perfect as well and so close to everything. We walked everywhere and had the best time. I would highly recommend the studio king room. Thank you Nicole!!

Whilst the room is not large the location is brilliant for Time Square, Central Park and the subway. Starbucks also right next door. The staff were real fun and very efficient, caring and helpful, and the room very clean. What more would you want. Just do it, then get out and about and enjoy! Only downside no free WiFI in room. Thank you 6 Columbus for your hospitality. Jennie New Zealand

I know the quality-to-dollars ratio for Manhattan hotels is unusually low but even so, I did not have a good experience at this hotel. It's in an old building that I found cold and drafty, even the premium wifi option was spotty, the room service options were limited to the overpriced Japanese food downstairs, and the staff's service was just bad. I feel a little guilty writing that but that is my honest experience. I let them know up front that I'm allergic to feathers so I would appreciate four new pillows and blankets and two hours later the bell hop came up with two new pillows. When I let him know I needed two more pillows and a blanket, he never returned. I later let the front desk know about the problem and they delivered a blanket but no more pillows. I called down but after two nights, those additional pillows never came. And, ok, I don't want to be one of those people who just complains endlessly about small slights but these were not difficult requests and it all just really added up to a disappointing experience of the establishment.
user_name:
JCHQ1
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice hotel, good location. Price was great for the weekend, also we had to pay more so the room would be ready before 3:00pm. Bathroom was leaking, we did not let them know till check out and they did not offer any discount
user_name:
galya k
New York City, New York

review_body: We got a Small room even when I booked a larger queen size bed..........When we got surprised, they only tryed to make us change to a larger BUT with a fee..?The only positiv was that you got access to a gym on the other side of the street.

I stayed here for three nights, and booked through online 3rd party. The first room had a bed so small it wasn't fit for two adults, so we upgraded to a bigger room. The only thing good about the bigger room was 1. The bed was bigger and 2. It was on a lower floor facing the Columbus Circle shops, so in the morning, if you were quiet, you could here the click click oh horse hooves as the crazy horse & buggy drivers of Central Park went by. The bad: terrible housekeeping staff. We stayed 3 nights and only had our room cleaned once, and they didn't clean the bathroom. Disgusting. The good: Good bar, great bar tender Dylan, and very good Japanese food. Best rolls I've had in ages. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. Too many other places to try that might have decent housekeeping. Plus we spent too much with the upgrade and parking, but I suppose that's my fault. Good location toward Central Park and the theater district. But homeless everywhere. I've leaved on and near Manhattan for 14 years and have never seen so many panhandlers and homeless. Very sad.

Good location and a fair price for the area (in front Columbus Circle and close to Central Park). Room size ok for a couple, comfortable bed and well equipped. I didn't use other services but staff was kind and nice.

Found the staff very helpful, and the location is great - close to Hells Kitchen, Central Park and Times Square! Metro 1 just outside front door making it easy to go downtown. Rooms are fine, good size bathroom and comfortable bed.

One of the worst experiences I have had in an NYC hotel. Bed is very small and does not fit two adults . Rooms have a "window" that looks at a wall barely a few inches away. Staff is not helpful at all either.
user_name:
benbC1709KT
New York City, New York

review_body: This palace ahsn't had an upgrade in years. It looks tired and worn. Staff is pleasant but average. This place is just skating long on a good location and a lack of reasonably priced alternatives in the neighborhood.

Great location. Warm and welcoming staff. Great food options. Close to every form of transportation and to the park. Quiet. The sushi restaurant is great. What's not to like?I'll be returning to the hotel.

First, let me say we were booked at this hotel as guest for a meeting. We did not pay for it, but I am aware of the price of the rooms. This is my 4..5 trip to NYC and my room at the Fairfield Inn back in Jersey would have been preferred in "some" cases.I would recommend it to people who want to be near a shopping area and who are not visiting on business. Pluses: the rooftop bar was really cool...drinks kind of expensive.. 12 bucks for pineapple juice with a shot of Cognac, the mini mall across the street including the whole foods, proximity to Central Park and the Starbucks next door. Also the bed was comfortable, the shower was amazing. Loved the tiled walls and heated floors. Free wifi.Minuses: the room was VERY small. My view was dirty inter workings of the air system I believe. No coffee, microwave, refrigerator (one was there stocked that was ridiculous expensive) accessible in the room. Also no iron/board you had to get it from downstairs, the bathroom had no ventilation..thank God for the small window to let the steam out. There was no business center with computers and printers that you could work on, nor gym (you could use one across the street). So thus my title...depending on your expectations...its ok. I've stayed at the Fairfield, the W, the Marquis etc...so I may be shaded. This facility just has a little more work to do to market to my genre...but perhaps I am not the target customer.

It is a bait and switch scheme going on in this hotel. Buyer be aware!!i had to pay an extra $40+tax to get a room with a desk that was semi comfortable and still very small.I would not recommend this hotel unless one checks the exact room they will be staying at.

Great hotel with ambiance, quaint bar and rooftop sitting area. Good restaurants and bars nearby. Central Park accross the street which makes it easy to take a run/stroll and enjoy the city. Room was small but met all my needs with large bed, mini bar at flat screen tv
user_name:
jimwX6913BL
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location (across-ish from Columbus Circle & Central Park and super close to several subway lines), great price, and an AMAZING room. Maybe I got a lucky upgrade, but my room was large with its own outdoor terrace! I don't mean a balcony, I mean a terrace with deck furniture. Made me wish I had planned a party. I could see that most rooms don't have this feature, and most floors have more rooms/floor, so this may not be representative. I could not believe what I got for my money.Even if you don't get the terrace, the room was in great condition, stylish and comfy. The staff were nice and helpful. I would have been happy based just on the location, price and room quality.

The service is friendly but the hotel is uncomfortable. There is insufficient lighting in the room. No desk lamp. The most annoying thing is that the safe can only be accessed by getting down on the floor. It is dark and quite difficult to see the numbers, not to mention crawling around on the floor. Bathroom is okay, but the room is not great. Everything is dark, dark. Maybe this is stylish, but it isn't pleasant.

The reviews on the internet looked great and the location is superior, right by Central Park and many other attractions; great location for a walk about.We stayed in a king suite, which was a nice sized. They subscribe to modern furnishings-the bed is on a pedestal which houses a suite of drawers. This might be ok, but the mattress slips off and you can bang your leg if you get up in the dark. This also makes it uncomfortable since there is no support; reminds me of a bed in a hotel in Mexico.The furnishings were extremely worn and the carpet was worn and dirty; it is a shag style and housed several pills, etc. I think the housekeeping staff did a job of cleaning the bath, etc. Do you like a coin sized bar of soap to share? Well, that's what you will get to share with your spouse/roommate/partner. Towels we had were threadbare.General lack of maintenance-burned out light bulbs, plugged drains which contributed to a waterfall drain that was ready to flood the floor below.The room wasn't cleaned one day. Well, they say they clean the move outs prior to the stay overs. We were out of the room for over 5 hours; don't buy this argument unless you are in a Holiday Inn.Your choice...

Loved this place- a nice small and trendy hotel.Nice roof bar that is great to spend time in, also a downstairs bar and restaurant that is very cool.Love the location- very near the park for running, around the corner from great bars and of course the theatre district.No cheap, but good quality.

The rooms are typical of new york: small but well appointed without direct light through corner windows. Great for a dark place to sleep and the location is ideal. However, the internet at this hotel is HORRIFIC. You will need to pay $15 extra for barely operational internet, the free internet is not actually fully functional. It is a bit of a scam for what is otherwise a great deal.

Great service from the door men and people at the front desk (luggage, getting ice for my sprained ankle, getting cabs for me, etc...). The restaurant has amazing sushi and fun drinks. The location was ideal. The decor was lovely. The bathtub was nice.
user_name:
Carmen L
Santa Fe, New Mexico

review_body: Rooms are spacey, decor is simple and elegant, amenities are sufficient, Ren products in the bathroom, staff is very friendly.. And location is just perfect.. Literally few steps form the subway station with a lot of train connections.. I just would and should not expect more for the price.. Would definitely come back to stay..

The hotel is located near Columbus Circle and is close to shopping and Central Park. The hotel experience was excellent. The front desk, door person, and housekeeping staff were friendly and professional. The hotel public areas and the room was clean and modern. The room was comfortable. We would return to this hotel.

For not too much, you can get a VERY nice European style room, close toall things Lincoln Center/ Central Park/Carnegie Hall... You can walk to the park halfa block away, but pay half the price of park view places. Very nice and clean, secure.Great sushi restaurant on the first floor (and they say the rooftop is a real dazzler).

Great location and great surroundings. You can have anything at columbus circle! 10 mins walk to central park. Easy to walk to anywhere. Blue ribbon sushi at ground floor which you can have dinner all the time. Staff was helpful and next to 59th columbus circle metro station!

Went to New York to attend a taping with a group of friends. The 3rd party booking site we booked our hotels through thoroughly screwed up our reservations. However, the management at 6 Columbus was very accommodating and even supplied up with an upgrade for our troubles! Will definitely go back!
user_name:
MyNuLuvIsJamaica
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stayed at the 6 Columbus Hotel during a trip to New York for a show at Carnegie Hall. Location was great right on Columbus Circle with the mall and subway access right across the street. The staff at the hotel was very efficient, helpful and welcoming. The room was tiny bit served its purpose and was very clean. My only wishes were for a gym and for the next door neighbor to not smoke at night. I was able to go for a nice run through Central Park in the early morning to make up for the lack of the gym but there was no way to get the cigarette smoke smell out of the room! Had we stayed longer I would have notified management but I hate to cause a commotion and we were checking out the next day. Wish other customers would abide by the "no smoking" criteria.

Arrived at the hotel and checked in, no real direction to my room, just handed a key card and subsequently found myself wandering the hallways (which I initially thought was a dingy apartment block but was reassured these were hotel corridors).
