Only one key card out of two worked. This was a common theme. The room was very compact, views of air con vents and other peoples windows. Clean with a nice bathroom and one robe though two guests. When I went down to fix the other key card I got stuck in the lift as the door jammed. Rang the bell button which didn't work so had to force the door open. Told an attendant who put a cone outside it but did not shut the lift down. The next day we had renewed our stay for another two nights through lack of wanting to switch rooms after a day in the office. Was told they had upgraded our room the day before so we would either have to pack all luggage and store it downstairs until we could be downgraded, or pay an additional fee to keep our room. They said "we are fully booked, but for a fee I can bump someone down" which was absolute rubbish. After going back and forth with the receptionist I eventually lost patience with the mindless argument and had to pay or risk being late for a meeting. Not a great start to the day! I then asked for an iron and ironing board for my room to be told they could give me an iron but no board. I declined. To top it off they charged my debit card three times for deposits and I had to raise a dispute with one of them as the same receptionist who told me they were "fully booked" told me he would not be charging my card and did so anyway. Overall, the room was good, comfortable bed, clean, and fresh towels everyday. The service was terrible, no personality, or rationality for that matter, and would recommend staying elsewhere if in NY (as we did for the rest of the trip).

Pros: - Right near Columbus Circle & major subways. - Great restaurant in lobby- Cute rooftop Cons: - NO LIGHT. It was like waking up in a dungeon. Totally depressing. I'm sure this depends on your room. - Room was tight for two people (this coming from someone who has lived in multiple small apartments in NYC) - Bed - Not very comfortable - this was just a mattress on a wooden plank. We kept hitting our calves against the sharp corners of the plank. - No breakfast room service. Was advertised as having room service, but this is only for evening, and only includes sushi. Would not return again.

Quiet, great rooftop bar, comfortable beds, clean rooms, close to subway, Lincoln Center and Central Park, across the street from Time Warner Center, nice staff, spacious baths, room service til 2 am.

I stayed in the King Suite and it really impressed me! The size of the living room was huge, it was very modern and comfortable, and definitely felt more like a one bedroom apartment than a hotel. I really liked how it was decorated, with dark hardwood floors and modern furnishing to match. My only regret was that I only stayed there one night!!! Cannot wait to go back.

Pod style room is great value for a single person. Location is near Columbus Circle and Central Park. Lots of options for subway lines. Across from Time Warner Building. Around the corner from Paris Baguette for breakfast.

The hotel is located just in the centre of Manhattan opposite the Columbus Square subway station, which makes it a good starting point to explore the city. During our stay there was some issue with the elevators, so we had to take the stairs to our room on the 7th floor a couple of times.

I've stayed at 6 Columbus solo, with my wife, and with my family and a pack of friends. Wonderful every time. If you want a no stress, comfortable, super-service, perfectly located, reasonably priced NYC hotel, you can't beat it.

Title says it all: good boutiquey room, great location for going to the Met, nice and clean. I've stayed here twice now, and would stay again. I booked on Tablet Hotels and paid $200 + tax for a Saturday night. Solid deal.
user_name:
italialana
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stay here for work and it is convenient, safe, friendly and affordable. The bar of the lobby is great fun and the sushi restaurant in the back is jumping! He front desk is very professional and works hard to make sure your stay is comfortable.

have stayed here on several occasions and have always been pleased with the room as well as the staff. As a single woman I like the security of not giving access to the elevator without a room key. nice on site restaurant. close to all subways and buses. next to Tine Warner building with shops and restaurants

You know great Service when you get it! And you feel a terrific experience when it comes your way. That's 6 Columbus for me: a home in NYC away from my Boulder, CO. home. I stay at the 6 about 5-9 days per month, for so many tangible reasons: nice rooms (nada awesomely fancy, just "right"), clean, suitably quiet in a busy/fun part of town, proximity to my office, terrific shopping at TW Shops next door (plus Whole Foods...yep), and then the access to Equinox (can you say ROCK in it???). Good pricing too. But it's the intangibles that keep me coming back: Waliek at the front desk (terrific attitude, genuine caring attitude), sweet sushi restaurant called Blue Ribbon (as wonderful for breakfast as their delicious dinner fare) with excellent service, it's location at Columbus Circle, and even the nearby coffee shops (Starbucks next door, but make the 2 block walk to Mayson Kaiser. Going back, many times... see YOU there.

My sister in law and I we're splitting this room for a girls weekend, when we arrived the front check in area was full of confused guests. The beds were comfortable but the concierge was slow responding to any requests, and when the fire alarms started going off all night on a SUNDAY night we were not called by the front desk to even let us know it was a 'false alarm' and we're not compensated for the lack of sleep. When my SIL left for an early flight at 6on Monday morning she had the concierge make a note that I was not checking out until 11, however every 20 minutes from 6am on a housekeeper would bust into the room and shout 'SORRY THEY SAID YOU WERE GONE!' (Even after I called the front desk to remind them again)

The location is great if you are trying to stay by columbus circle... and my compliments of this place ends there! If you value self respect and pleasant attitudes - STAY AWAY! First, the hotel receptionist was not helpful and unfriendly. I was asking about local transportation and some room upgrades but the receptionist just hit me with attitude with every question. But by far what killed my experience at this hotel was the valet parking. The valet attendant was rude, unhelpful and just nonexistent. Waited about an hour for my car. Maybe i should clarify; i waited an hour before i physically went to the parking garage and drove the car out myself. I should have disputed the valet parking charge because i'm pretty sure going to get your own car is not considered valet parking but whatever. Safe to say I am not staying here again!

Enjoyed the stay. Great customer service. Clean establishment. Could improve the room service prices and menu. I loved the heated floors in the bathroom. Maybe more cable channels would be accommodating

We live outside Princeton, NJ, so an overnight in NYC is about value. For us, 6 Columbus was a great find: at Columbus Circle across the street from the Columbus Circle subway stop (A/C line), near Central Park, and within walking distance of the restaurants/clubs we wanted to visit. It's a smaller boutique hotel but has all you need: we were upgraded to a king suite with a separate sitting area (additional TV). Access to snacks, fridge, and a fully functional work desk (While this was not a business trip, I travel for work so I always look for this). Bed/shower were great. FREE WIFI The front desk staff was exceptional--the clerk remembered my husband's name after we returned from a walk to retrieve our bags. There's a nice downstairs bar and the small rooftop bar was partially enclosed for a late night drink, with food available. Intimate but affordable, clean and safe.

Our 2 queen bedded room looked out into an dark interior courtyard where you saw into other windows. No reason to raise the blinds. We stayed one night to see a show and for that reason the location was great. Easy access to theaters and public transport. So close to park, etc. Our room was clean and the bathroom was large. One weird thing was the lotion bottle was more than 1/2 used.

The hotel was wonderful and the staff was super nice, efficient and professional. I loved my room and the overall location of the hotel. It was very close to the conference center I needed to be at AND the park for my morning jogs. Having valet parking was an added bonus and took the worry out of my stay. I'm so excited to have a "Go To" place in NYC!

It must be difficult to remodel older buildings in new york, but just a note of fair warning. We stayed here for one night while in town to see Hamilton (worth every other experience on the trip!!), but were a bit disapointed given the previous ratings and promotion as a luxury hotel. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and ready on time. However, the shampoo/conditioner in the bathroom were not entirely filled which was odd, and the shower had such a slow drain that within a minute or two you were ankle-deep in wash water. The killer though was the sound of the central air unit. Closest approximation is the noise of a small jet engine. This woke us up multiple times during the night and I basically got only 1-2hrs of sleep because on top of this there was a tapping/rattling in the duct that sounded like a very loud and irregular clock. We reported this and the front desk said maintenance would take a look. In such an old building though not sure how much can be done. If we had stayed more than one night would definitely have asked for another room, it's possible that we were just unlucky with this stay. Other things to note: the room was incredibly small, and the view out our window was of a concrete building approx 1 yard away. Lighting is kept very very low, and there's no in-room coffee. If youre ok with small spaces, though, and are either a very sound sleeper or can get a room without the central air noise issue, the hotel is in a pretty good location and the rooms are tastefully designed.

Lovely staff, clean and cosy and retro furnishings to suit my mood. If you think its dated then you're out of touch, this is a cool spot, you can curl up quietly but you're in the midst of it, I'll be back! Adriana was a star sorting me out. Love it.
user_name:
Pia P P
New York City, New York

review_body: My partner and I have been guests at 6 Columbus several times for the past 7 years. We have always found it to be comfortable, friendly and a great option for the price when we don't feel like "breaking the bank"! After our last visit this past week 6 Columbus has become our Hotel of choice in NYC!!We went into the city to celebrate our joint birthdays. When we pulled up to 6 Columbus the birthday magic began! We were greeted as return guests by the helpful and incredibly friendly bellman, Carlos (How special to be remembered as return guests!!) and were efficiently helped to valet our car as Carlos took care of our luggage. At check in we were both greeted by the EXTRAORDINARY duo of Adrianna and Maritza. We told them we were celebrating our birthdays and were upgraded to a room that was EXCEPTIONAL!! The rooms at 6 Columbus are always clean and well stocked but this room was UNBELIEVABLE!! We were sent birthday cards by Adrianna and Maritza and a lovely snack. We were both made to feel like old friends! Isn't this exactly what one is looking for when traveling? Especially in NYC!! My partner and I stay in the city at least 3 times a month and have stayed everywhere!! We have NEVER been treated better!! And we will probably NEVER think of staying anywhere else in NYC other than 6 Columbus!Our birthday experience was almost "too good to be true"! BUT it WAS!!6 Columbus is truly a wonderful NYC hotel gem! If you are lucky enough to be greeted by Carlos, Adrianna and Maritza it is EXTRAORDINARILY MAGICAL!!!WE ARE HOOKED!

My wife and I stayed overnight when we had business meetings in NYC. Hotel is very nice for a quick stay. Great rate on a third party booking site. Room was small but very clean and well appointed. Service was uneven, 3 credit cards were declined when we tried to check in and we were told to call our credit card company as a solution. After the desk person moved to another terminal and started checking other guests in they realized it was their terminal and not our credit card that was the problem and checked us in. The TV did not work in the room. They sent maintenance up but it was never fixed. More surprising to us was that the next day when we came back to pick up our bag before leaving, we heard the desk person talking to the person that got the room after us about the TV not working and saying he would send up a maintenance person as if no one else had been made aware of the problem. Would definitely stay here again, but would book a larger room if it was longer than one night.

I stayed in one of the basic rooms for less than $100, and for that price this hotel is a great deal. The room was small, and furnished with Ikea quality and style, but fully functional, and the bathroom was fine. The location can't be beat, and the staff were very helpful.
user_name:
David P
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed here overnight on our recent trip to NYC. We were able to check in at 11:30am which was nice! The location is great! We walked to numerous destinations (like Central Park, The Met, & the American Natural History Museum) with ease. The room was clean and pleasant. We had a crappy view but we never heard any exterior noise which was nice. The room was small but adequate and we left with nothing to complain about. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay!

The staff was very accommodating and attentive to our needs. It was a great experience. I had a personal issue. The management went out of their way to resolve the issue. They did not have to do this, but they chose to do the right thing, a choice that is not common today.

Superb service on all levels. Tiny room with no desk. Chic/retro/ Asian decor. Bath floor was heated which was quite nice. Odd issue wirh bedding. There was no top sheet. Just a duvet comforter. So unless they wash the duvet comforter between guests this was not the cleanliest feeling. I was too tired to call the front desk to inquire.Otherwise clean room. Only other comment is a wish for better lighting in the elevator. Hard to see floor numbers amidst chic mood lighting. Plus hall noise was a bit disruptive but not too bad as I was exhausted

Right in Columbus Circle you couldn't ask for a better location central to everything by train or walking. Service was great. We got in too late to take advantage of the lobby bar or the rooftop lounge but they looked great.

My wife and I enjoyed our stay at 6 Columbus. The rooms were nicely furnished, quite clean and cozy. The restaurant served perhaps the best continental breakfast that I have ever had. Who would have thought since it's a Japanese restaurant. Overall a very good stay.

Staff was at all times helpful and accurate in their recommendations. The room was clean and well appointed. Good value. Parking was below market rate. It was convenient and fast. Very close to Lincoln Center and excellent diner (Flame) on the corner.

I stayed on the 7th floor in a small, chic room. Great bed, with nice cotton sheets. Good shower pressure in a small but stylish bath/shower. The heated bathroom floor was great! The room was very quiet, cozy and comfortable. Delicious breakfast.

So i stayed in a "pod", and compared to the Hudson a couple doors down the decor, and hotel in general is not as cool. The location though cannot be beat! Staff was nice, bar at the sushi restauraunt was good. Main complaint is that pod rooms had NO view (not uncommon for NYC), just a brick wall, and the rooms were really hot, even for January. All that said, th bathrooms were great and had Wen products, which was a nice touch for picky sorts like me. Bottom line, if you go above a Pod i think 6 Columbus is good choice, if not, go to the Hudson.

I had stayed in several rooms in this hotel. I like the convenience of location, but I like also the warmth friendliness of the staff. I had a bottle of sparkling water and two chocolates with a welcome card handwritten!

My first room was tiny, and dark. Which was okay. But the shower didn't work! I couldn't get the water to turn on, and...No towels. And the entire floor reeked of marijuana. I am grateful to the manager, who kindly upgraded me the following day.

If you want to be in the heart of the action this is the place to be right across the street from the shops and restaurants at Columbus circle. The staff was courteous and helpful. We were there on a Friday and the lobby gets a little night clubby after hours, but the room was quiet. The room itself was small, sufficient for an overnight but not much longer.

We had a perfect 1 night stay in February at this hotel. I booked the day before directly on their website and got a great rate for the superior queen room (was less expensive than the "pod"!) The front desk lady (Adriana?) was incredibly pleasant and professional and helped us secure an early check in and late check out which made our stay easier and more comfortable. As for the room itself- comfortable bed, heated floors in the bathroom, great lighting in the bathroom, amazing water pressure in the shower. Modern & clean room. It was perfect.Sadly we didn't have a chance to eat at Blue Ribbon but definitely want to next time! There is also apparently a rooftop bar but we didn't check that out on this trip.Would highly recommend and happily return! Ideal location near Columbus circle, Lincoln center, Central Park and Times Square.

Great service - upgraded the room without even asking. Definitely go to blue ribbon and even try hi bar the bar on the rooftop! Totally empty when we went up and had a great view and bartender to ourselves.

Lunch at the Sushi restaurant, "BRS" was excellent, followed by a relaxing afternoon in the lux 60's era style rooms. The service staff is attuned to your needs, and make it easy for you enjoy the time spent. The bathrooms are really nice, and have robes if you feel the need post shower.

Steps from Columbus Circle and Central Park West! Very nice and accommodating staff. I had some papers that I needed printed and faxed, and the front desk helped me get it done! My room was reasonably spacious by NYC standards.My only negatives...I was in a room with a LOT of street noise, meaning sirens blaring on an off all night. Police, ambulances, fire trucks....Also this hotel is quite dark. The lights are very dim, and the hallways and floors are all painted and finished in dark colors. I found it hard to see the buttons in the elevator, and the lights in the hallways are very dim. My room also seemed very dark, and a bit depressing. Almost to the point of being a little creepy...
user_name:
Judith B
Berwyn, Pennsylvania, United States

review_body: The lovely Christian Laskaros greeted me at check in and sorted out a misunderstanding with my reservation in no time at all. The room was clean and bed was comfortable...the wonderful thing about this hotel apart from the location and the very friendly staff, is the attached sushi restaurant and rooftop bar. Prime location with ultra friendly staff, from the doormen to the desk, to the lovely housekeeper who showed me where my room was.

Booked a Deluxe King room for a stay-cation this past weekend. The location is ideal. Across the street from 5 subway lines and Columbus Circle shopping. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The roof top wasn't open due to construction but we still enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and quiet but on the small side. I guess that's normal for NYC hotels. The bathroom was clean and a good size. There were two robes and hair dryer in our room. The mini bar was stocked but I think it's better to pick up snacks from near by places. Overall a wonder stay. I would book this hotel again and I'll certainly recommend to friends.

I was at the six Columbus for a week. From the moment Nicole Dlugos checked me in, to the expedient and gracious way a heating issue with my room was resolve with an easy move and upgrade from Christian Laskaros, my stay here was great. Along with Nicole and Christian, the customer service was wonderful and greatly appreciated. This hotel was the perfect location for my needs, including the subway entrance just across the street and Central Park just across the Circle. The rooms were clean and I appreciated the classic sixties style. I felt the rates were very reasonable for the room size, especially considering some of the others I've stayed in throughout Manhattan in the past. It was a fantastic trip for me, and a lot of it was due to my choosing to stay at this hotel. I look forward to staying here again in the future.

Very accommodating clean all personnel was perfessional bar was very nice area was nice also housekeeping came around at least one to make sure everything was good decor was not tacky price was very reasonable

It was a great hotel with great service. Location we loved being so close to Central Park and very handy across the road from Time Warner shopping complex. There was a whole foods there as well which made it affordable to eat breakfast and grab some food on the run.

My hat goes off to another fabulous stay at this terrific hotel! We stay here fairly regularly (about once every 2 months) and each visit is as welcoming and comfortable as the last. From the moment you enter the front door and are greeted by the friendly and helpful staff to the efficiency with which they check you in or store your bags until your room is ready, the experience is a good one. If you are looking for a convenient location with great accessibility to the subway and many local attractions --this is the hotel to consider. The rooms are very streamline and may not read as luxurious to some travelers who are not accustom to the sleek Manhattan flare this quaint property offers. However, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are nicely stocked and modern. From top to bottom for location and feeling welcome, I will keep returning to 6 Columbus.
user_name:
robindfg7
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The check in staff was superb ( I wish I could remember the gentleman's name)! Upon arrival, the hotel staff responded to a previous telephone request to upgrade the room. The "standard" is a mod and extremely small. The "King" suit would be what I consider to be a standard room. But the staff was precise in explaining the size differences and accommodating in changing the room. The room was clean including the bathroom which was very nicely designed. The room did not have an iron however one was brought to the room upon request.The concierge staff was hospitable. The snacks and drinks in the room was almost quadruple market value which was a bit shocking. The hotel is conveniently located next to a Duane Reade and CVS. This was helpful. The location is great for public transportation including the subway and taxi cabs. The hotel is a short cab ride to Times Square (10-15 minutes max). I was pleased with the hotel fare SINCE IT WAS BOOKED THROUGH EXPEDIA and not directly through the hotel (which is more costly).

I landed in NY very early in the morning, not expecting my room to be available yet,not looking forward to killing several hours in the cold after a red eye.Not only did they have a room but they upgraded me to a king, what a pleasure. The location is great, central to many places and trains but kind of under the radar.Blue Ribbon Sushi room service is a plus as well.I would definitely stay here again.

We always enjoy our stay at 6 Columbus, the rooms are not large but this is a boutique hotel in NYC so that is what you expect. Staff is friendly and room works for us. Great location near my son and daugher-in-law. Hopefully it will not get sold before they move from the area.

This is a very nice little boutique hotel in a great location. Our room was clean and comfortable and surprisingly quiet. The rooms are small, but that is not unusual for a boutique hotel -especially in NYC. The price was great and made our trip more affordable. We were comfortable walking distance to Central Park, Columus Circle shopping, the ballet, and tons of restaurants. The staff was very friendly and found my kindle and helped arrange for its return when I left it behind. My only complaint is the bathroom didn't have a fan and when I rolled my hair it fell flat from the humidity. But it wasn't bad enough to prevent me from staying here again.

Great location and very accommodating. Front desk was easy to work with and check in was easy. Because it was New Years Eve the noise from the bar did overflow into the front desk area and make it hard to hear what was going on; but the room itself was quiet, clean and trendy.

nice hotel overall. The staff were all extremely helpful and easy to contact. conveniently located, right opposite the Time Warner Shopping Mall. the only problem was with the heating and there was also no chair in the room.

we got there through hotels tonight. great prices and sizable rooms, has good air condition , good staff and very good location we got a small room with no view but its not something that matters too much

Great location. Rooms nice size but that's about it. Problems with the heating system. Heating system deficient so either you freeze or the fan never goes off so you have to live with terrible noise or freeze! Bathrooms in the standard and deluxe room lack room for toiletries. There is only a tiny shelf. Staff is very helpful, but the hotel lacks some primary aspects of a good hotel. Cleanliness not exceptional. Robes in room only for petite women. Not worth the visit.

We discovered this boutique hotel a few years ago and have been regulars ever since. First of all, it is conveniently located near Lincoln Center where we often attend Met or Philharmonic performances. The doormen are excellent as is the staff at the front desk. The rooms on the higher floors are spacious and quite comfortable. The Blue Ribbon Japanese restaurant off the lobby serves a delicious bento box breakfast that is a bargain by New York standards. Another plus is you are across the street from the Coluumbus Circle Subway station that has many lines that will bet you easily to anywhere in Manhatton and beyond.There are two negative for this hotel. 1) the elevators seem to be quite dated. On our most recent visit both elevators were out of service for extended perods of time, forcing us to walk up 10 flights of stairs to our rooms. 2) the hotel is on a one way street (58th) and there always ssem to be paucity of taxi-cabs. It sometimes takes quite a while for the doormen to get a taxi for hotel guests.

Check in was courteous and the room was nice but small as is typical of NYC hipster hotels. But the alternative are big, giant hotel factories that are always too busy with too much going on and bad service. This is a good place to stay if you are going to see a show or going to Lincoln Center for symphony or opera.Also has a great mid-century modernist flair.
user_name:
NewDemRex
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: No control of temperature in the room. No bottled water except $8 Evian. Tired scrungey towels. Room very small. Noisy hallway. Friendly enough staff at front desk. I had a discounted room from Hotels Tonight. Perhaps they gave me their worst room!

Rooms a very specious and nice. Wonderful location, right behind the Columbus Circle Time Warner Shopping Mall. Has Valet Parking at a very affordable rate for NYC standards. Sheetrock over bathtub collapsed while I was away and I was offered to be moved to another similar room. I declined to move, so maintenance took care of it immediately while I enjoyed a cup of coffee at the next door Starbucks.

Carpet in the room was very worn...furniture showed excessive wear...no drawers in the room to put clothes...There was a desk in the room, but no chair and no room between the desk and the bed for a chair...Running water(pipes) in the wall was so loud, when the room next to us ran the shower, we had to turn up the TV....when the other room next to us flushed the toilet during the night, it would wake my wife....Doors close loudly so you could hear every time someone would leave their room....on the other hand, the bed was great...service was great and the staff was extremely friendly and attentive...liked the bar and restaurant as well...good location...which are good things, but we've stayed at many properties in NYC that were much nicer for the same price.

On the coldest day of the year (-10°c) they should teach their staff how to put on the AC properly. Never recommending this hotel to anyone, called the reception twice during the night and all of them together didn't manage to turn on the heating. And when I asked to be compensated in the morning, they simply said no way. Terrible. It's a breach of confidence to let me pay for a full priced room when in the contract there'd is a promise of Heating.

We have had a very pleasant stay at 6 Columbus, nice staf, helpfull and correct.Location is perfect also surrounded by enough breakfast spots and restaurants, Central park is a 2 minut walk.Room was clean and beds were verry comfy.

We were moving my daughter into her apt. in NYC and 6 Columbus was the perfect location and price. Great restaurants and right across from Central Park and Columbus Circle shops. We will definitely stay there again.It was small, of course it is NYC, but worked out well for the two of us.

The hotel is in an excellent location- right across street from Time Warner Center with shops and restaurants; off Columbus Circle. Close to theaters, Lincoln Center, and Central Park. The staff at this hotel is super friendly and helpful- very professional and courteous.The reason I rated it average is due to the rooms. They were small but I'm ok with that in NYC. The issues: temperature was very hard to regulate- it was either too hot or too cold; extremely noisy- room doors are set to close automatically and they slam echoing off the marble staircase (it's annoying at 6:00 in the morning), only one waste can in the room- and it's in the bathroom, refrigerator is impossible to use for your own goodies- it's too full of costly snacks and drinks, and the rooms have insufficient lighting- it was too dark to work on my computer at the desk- even with every light on and the window shades open. Because of the dim lighting, it felt more like a hostel than a hotel. There is a very nice bar on the top floor with a great outdoor seating area that locals must not know about- wasn't busy except for our business colleagues. This would not be my first choice if I was staying in NY again. It needs a little color and a LOT of light- too modern and minimalist for my taste. I would rate it very good as the staff made up for the lackluster and dark rooms.

1 star down only because the rooms are small, but frankly it's the case for whole of the Manhattan. Other negative is a bit if a noice through the walls from the corridor and other rooms. Overall it's a great hotel and i strongly recommend it. Thank you Sixty!

It's a really good hotel, small but cosy with a perfect location. You will get a lot of stores, cafes and restaurants, and also Central Park. Different lines of subways available. Room is clean, even though small, but modern.

The young man who gave us the room was so smug and treated us like trash and when asked why we're getting the worst room in the hotel, I was told that since I have booked through hotwire. com, I would be given the standard room and the all the standard rooms have loud air-conditions and tiny beds. He was so mean and asked for 150 dollars more a night. After hopelessly trying to sleep all night beside my 84 years old dad in the tiny bed, I went to the front desk to beg for another room and the same smug young man said this is the best he can offer. I cried - I have never been treated like I were trash before by a person who is supposed to be respectable - my room was not for free - I paid 200 dollars a night and could have stayed elsewhere for much less. I was forced to pay 100 dollars more a night to get some sleep. I hate the hotel. I'll tell everyone I know that I was robbed and ill treated just because I was too exhausted and my dad was too old and tired and needed a place to sleep.

6 Columbus lobby is always full so it's tight trying to get around people. 6 Columbus is located in an old building, so tiny elevators. We used the marble stairways when we had no luggage to haul. The front desk staff is so-so, but the room service staff is much better. Like the bar on the rooftop with a pretty view. Rooms are modern and clean.

The nice staff is the best, all of them but specially the conciergerie and the doormen.The location is realy perfect, with the subway and a commercial center in front of the hotel.Rooms and common spaces are perfectly clean and comfortable.Free wifi in rooms.All perfect! I absolutely recommend this hotel!

Wow! If you're seeking a truly magical experience, STAY HERE. This hotel is modern, chic, sexy, beautifully appointed, and the best part is the STAFF!! Every member of the staff is incredibly helpful and truly interested in helping your experience be as wonderful as possible. Nicole D is by the far the most AMAZING person I have ever dealt with in any travel experience, bar none. She is so knowledgeable, kind, sweet, and her generosity of spirit is unmatched. Nicole and the entire staff helped make our Christmas vacation in NYC unforgettable. Now about the specifics regarding the hotel....-- We stayed in the Sixty Loft. INCREDIBLE. Pics attached. Can't say enough. WOW.-- Location is PERFECT! You walk out the door of the hotel, go forward across the street, you're in an amazing mall with lots of great restaurants and shopping. CENTRAL PARK JUST ACROSS COLUMBUS CIRCLE. TAKES ABOUT TWO MINUTES!!!! TAVERN ON THE GREEN RIGHT THERE!!!-- Subway stops everywhere around you.-- Pharmacy, bodegas, restaurants, ANYTHING YOU NEED within steps of the hotel's front door.-- Concierge always willing to help.-- Rooftop bar = MUST.-- The views are amazing!!-- Housekeeping staff always prompt, always willing to go above and beyond, very thorough.-- Beds = comfy, luxurious, warm. LOVE the pillows!-- Room service = yummy food. Just don't let your 9-year-old pay. Long story. She's a generous tipper. ;) -- Water pressure in shower = PHENOMENAL. On point. This is a big deal for me, and the shower in the Sixty Loft is counterproductive to getting an early start on your day....you won't want to get out of the shower. Yes, it's that good.-- Fireplace via switch on the remote. Yes please. Nice touch.-- TWO FULL BATHROOMS. Huge plus for families.-- Ballet fans...The Lincoln Center is just around the corner. I could go on and on and will probably add more in a separate review when I remember anything I'm forgetting. Pics attached. STAY HERE. SERIOUSLY.

Small and dark hallways and rooms. Not really the "boutique" hotel I expected. Long wait for the elevator but that seems to be a common experience in NYC. Positives = clean, modern look (if you like that) and great location. Won't return...too many other, better options.

Convenience, friendliness and cleanliness. Terrific staff from top to bottom. Anything you need is within a block or two and it's away from hectic Times Square - a neighborhood feel to vendors on 9th Ave. and 57th St. Amazing Whole Foods right across the street and major subway hub a 2 minute walk. Staying there is like having your own apartment on a great block.

Our room was hot when we arrived so we turned on the AC. It didn't work. With great effort I could open the window at night to cool the room down. The electrical outlet on the desk was hanging out with 110 volt wires exposed. When we checked out we had been charged for breakfasts even though they were supposed to be included. Although a corrected amount was charged the original amount was not refunded. I called the hotel and they said they had not made any mistake. I then had to go to my credit card company to dispute the double charge. All in all a pretty poor experience.

The front desk people were excellent in dealing with a lost Fed X package but there were a few problems with the room itself. For example the drain in the tub did not train until your friendly repair man fixed it.Then the lighting in the bathroom was insufficient to shave with. Then the curtains could not close all the way to keep the light out in the morning. Otherwise it was a nice stay and the staff was great.

This hotel never disappoints! Location is perfect! Edge of the park, subway across the road and a dozen attractions minutes away! Our suite was amazing! Comfortable, balcony and a view to the park! Fabulous customer service! Extremely helpful and sincerely happy to see you.

Excellent location. Steps away from Columbus Circle. Friendly staff. Clean room. Cute rooftop bar/deck with partial view of central park. Would stay there again. Walking distance to major city sites and great restaurants

Not a five star by definition, but we were here to see the Thanksgiving Day parade. I did not want to pay the prices of the hotels on the route, so we chose this hotel very close to the beginning of the parade. The rooms were clean and small. No complaints at all. Parking was as expected, but there is not in and out privileges at 45$/day. I like that it was 5-6 blocks from Times Square and felt quiet. Also very close to major subway stop.

Location is what makes this hotel a wise choice. Neighborhood offers fancy shops, restaurants, drugstores, cafes and theaters nearby. Many touristic atractions are close by, as well as subway station and bus stops. The hotel has helpful and friendly personell. We felt wellcomed at all times.We were given an earlier room, after our long international flight, as we have asked for.Room cleaniness, amenities and fresh towells, when needed, were provided everyday. Shower with abundant hot water was just great!

Over-priced and under-quality. Room was clean but very small (even by NYC standards). Wardrobe doors didn't work properly as it was too poorly made for hotel usage and no shelves/drawers for clothes. Female staff were too cool to actually bother being friendly and there was none of the cool-chic vibe the website suggests.Location is convenient, but at that price I expect far more. I've experienced far better value for money at other hotels in the city and won't be going back.

I stayed in the hotel for one night. I've arrived very early after long flights and the staff were very kind to check me in early. the hotel is 50 meter from the metro 100 meter from central park and next door from Starbucks. GREAT LOCATION!!! the room is a bit small but very nice and clean.

We enjoyed this hotel's convenient location, 1 minute to Columbus Circle, the best hub to visit museums near Central Park and shopping at fifth ave, and a musical in Brodway. They are all in walking distance.

Perfect location for our trip to New York. Convenient to theaters, museums and Lincoln Center!!!! Rooms were quite large for New York Standards and well appointed. Front desk staff were very good and the restaurant in the hotel is a Must Try!!!!

We stayed two nights. The hotel was in a great location, the rooms were lovely-very clean and nicely appointed. Typical size for rooms in NYC but more than enough space and the space was well utilized. What sets this hotel apart from all the rest, is the wonderful staff. From the very first person we saw to the very last person who wished us farewell, they were ALL amazing-professional, helpful, pleasant,kind and just all around great. I look forward to my next visit!

Fantastic location right off Columbus Circle - lots of convenient shopping and food options nearby. Room was *tiny* - just room for the beds, no desk, no chair. A couple of teeny tiny drawers to maybe hold your socks. Window opened onto a dark airshaft between buildings, so you couldn't tell if it was sunny or cloudy out.Housekeeping was pretty good; room was kept clean.Noisy hotel - slamming doors, yelling in the other rooms. Had a problem with the TV audio - had to hit the thing to make it work and it would periodically drop out; told the front desk, but over four nights it never got fixed.iHome alarm clock was all busted up. In short - a really mediocre stay - would not recommend.

My 13 year old daughter and I came in for the night. We arrived early but the room was ready so they let us check in early and upgraded us to two queens instead of a king. Room was at the back of the hotel and so quiet! Being on Columbus Circle, I thought I wouldn't get a wink of sleep. Beds are so comfortable; we slept soundly! Room and bath were updated and clean with plenty of space. Staff was very friendly and very attentive. Would definitely stay there again!

The hotel is located a block away from Central Park, which makes it a great location. My room had a partial view of Central Park, which I didn't expect considering the low price for a hotel in the city. The staff was very nice and helpful and the room was amazing! Huge room, big soaking tub, large shower, very comfortable overall. I will definitely go back!

Using Hotel Tonight I snagged what I believed would be an excellent deal at 6 Columbus for a two-night stay in December. The hotel is a little tricky to find as most uber and taxi drivers dont understand it is actually on E 58th. An early check-in meant that my room was not ready... but when I returned at 3 my bags were in my room waiting... alas, even for NYC the room was tine... no really tiny, with a view of the light shaft. The hotel was fully booked and there was no opportunity to move until the following day. But I must say the front desk staff was a joy. The arranged for my bags to be moved while I was out shopping and when I returned I had been moved into a much more lovely room.Having said all this I have the say the the first room, while indeed tine, was well appointed, and had a heated marble bath floor... heated! The decore is very hip and sleek. The hotel is intimate. The staff were all first class, fromt eh doorman, to the porter, to housekeeping, and of course the standout front desk team.I will certainly return!

Perfect location, close to theatre district and Central Park, but no noise ( this is unusual for Midtown:) Very helpful and nice stuff, clean. The only problem - it's always dark in the room. But New York is not for sitting in a hotel room:) A lot of attractions around. For example we saw Macy's Parade and we could get good place to see everything. And it's easy to meet Bruce Willis after show

The Review Title says it all. my second visit to this boutique hotel, situated just behind Columbus Circle, with friendly and attentive staffWhy didn't I give it 5 Stars? Well it's just that being New York, the $ per Square Foot Ratio is incredibly high!I thoroughly enjoy staying here though and will return soon

My wife and I stay a 6 Columbus several times a year, and our visit in early October was as good as ever; it is reliably consistent. LIke home. The shear friendliness of the staff is phenomenal. The rooms are comfortable but not cushy or busy. 6 is at the epicenter of our regular pastimes in The Apple: the Metropolitan Opera, theater, Jazz at Lincoln Center, walking in the Park, museums,Frankie and Johnnie's Steakhouse at 45th and 8th., and Bar Boulud and P.J. Clarke's in Lincoln Square. The neighborhood has excellent coffee and hot chocolate meccas as close as a stone's throw. We walk to everything except East Side and downtown museums restaurants and friends. For these there is the subway and cabs are plentiful. Except when they aren't, of course, at which point an enthusiastic young door person races out and snags one promptly every time and assists. JALC, Bouchon pastries, and a magnificent cavernous Whole Foods are across the street, as is a convenient subway junction. Next door is a comfy neighborhood New York bar and grill, The Coliseum, which has WiFi, surprisingly good food, and a convivial bar.  We'll be back next February for, you guessed it, operas, plays, a jazz concert, and also the terrier trials at the Westminster Dog Show down on a midtown Hudson pier... The hotel bar is intimate but at times noisy and/or dominated by the ebullience of young high flyers and/or high flyers manqués. On the other hand the rooftop bar, "this small rooftop lounge gets you just far enough out of the city to appreciate it once again." notes New York Magazine is a gem. Overall: Nice job 6!

Despite the price and the location my room was a depressing little box. Not having a window that looks out side and the darkness was depressive. The air condition of the room was very noisy and the rooms are not noise proof, the bathrooms of other rooms you can easily hear. The staff was helpful and kind. The location is easy to commute around the city.

We were in NYC for Thanksgiving and originally had a room at a luxury hotel around the corner. We didn't get the room/view we expected for the parade so I cancelled the rest of our stay and booked the remainder of our trip at the nearby 6 Columbus with less than 12 hours notice and little scrutiny. Based on how much money we saved I'd give it 5 stars just for that. Pros: the sushi place, which doubles as breakfast as well for those who choose breakfast option, was good. The hotel service was quick (more towels & ice). In and out access with ease. Cons - the rooms are small (although we had the middle of the road size), view was to a weird interior space and either the A/C was broken or it was just a fan mode...not sure, but it got stuffy so we opened a window. The whole place is dim but that seems common for boutique NYC. All in all, for the price (~$250), I'd do it again in a heartbeat.

I have stayed at this hotel several times now. The rooms are small but this is the case all over NYC and in particular at this location. Other than that the service is very good, the restaurant is amazing and the staff are very nice and always ready to help. For anyone interested in performing arts the location is perfect due to its proximity to the Lincoln centre. I will certainly try to stay there next time in NYC

Only stayed one night at this hotel but really enjoyed the stay. Has a cool vibe. Very comfortable bed and the room was pretty large for New York. Staff was very attentive but not overly so. Only complaint was the lighting in the bathroom. Not very good for applying makeup. Other than that really enjoyed the stay.

I confess I was disappointed when I arrived--the reality (an old building converted) seemed out of sync with the photos etc. on the website. However, the room was comfortable and the bathroom adequately supplied with plenty of hot water, towels, lighting, etc. The sushi bar was good, IMHO, and the staff friendly. One annoying thing is the WiFi. There are 2 options, free or $15 charge for higher speed. I chose the free option and grew old waiting for it to load. I never obtained access--it would just churn and churn. So I paid for the $15 access which was okay if not brilliant. Why even bother pretending there is free WiFi access?

The staff was amazing. They were the best hotel staff I've ever encountered. The room was very small but pretty. The view outside my window was of a big pipe. The mall across the at the street in the Time Warner building was very upscale with great restaurants. There was a subway station directly across the stree .

This is our third stay at the 6 Columbus and they all were exceptional. Friendly staff, great service and unique Japanese food. We have stayed at several hotels on the mid-east side and Time Square and the 6 Columbus is the best. We will be back.

Second time back at the hotel and it did not disappoint. Staff is friendly and casual as ever. The room was super comfortable- loved the warm bathroom floor! Super clean- would recommend highly. Being on Columbus Circle puts yip right in the center of everything.

I always enjoy staying at this place when in NYC, because the beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms are nice. It's a beautifully designed hotel, and the location is incredibly convenient. The check-in staff, while professional, is always rather unfriendly and incredibly unwelcoming. I've never, ever been greeted with a smile by any of the check-in staff during any of my stays at this hotel. The rest of the staff is generally friendly and nice, though. Perhaps there is something about working the front desk that is really unpleasant in comparison to any other staff position?

The staff at the hotel are super nice and helpful, which was true for every single person. Equinox, the gym across the street that you get to use, is wonderful. The room is good too. The internet went down several times and the water kept running in the toilet, both minor inconveniences. I'd definitely stay again. Great price too.

Wondetful boutique hotel near Columbus Circle. Close to lots of action in Midtown. Rooms are small but nice. Small wardrobe for clothes, small bathroom, two double beds. No fridge in room. The shower was hot and strong! Perfect after longs walks in the city! We even received a bottle of fizzy water courtesy of the manager! We were there for the NYC Marathon. The hotel was very close the finish line! Much appreciated by sore muscles!

Loved my stay here. Great little gem right off central park! 10/10 would do again! The rooms are small, euro style but great for a single or couple who want a great location and access to the city. I'll be back.

We had a great stay at 6 Columbus. The front desk girls were friendly and outgoing. We were expecting to share a double room but when we arrived they did not have any available so they split our reservations in to two single rooms at half price. Win! The beds and bedding are super comfy. We normally wouldn't stay there due to the price range, but certainly if you can afford it, I would recommend it.

first time staying at this hotel..very good location, easy to walk anywhere in midtown or upper west side..decent japanese style restaurant in lobby area..room was average size for the city but clean and a bathtub! yay!

Worst mosquito bites I have had in a hotel and have stayed all over the worldRooms are small and dark, 2 of my colleagues had to move as their rooms faced a wall, there is no value to be had here as the room rate even on a deal was pretty expensiveOnly good thing is the blue ribbon sushi barNever again!

The staff was welcoming, friendly, attentive, and professional. The location allows easy access to Central Park, Lincoln Center, ant Times Square. But the rooms, although well appointed for the typical small NY hotel rooms, were too dark and I could easily hear the conversation going on in the room next door.

From the moment we checked in we knew it was going to be a great stay. We were greeted by Donna, whom we later found out was the General Manager she was warm, welcoming and truly made us feel more like we were guests in her own home rather than a hotel. The front desk staff and bellman were great and even the housekeeper we met on our floor was gracious and said hello. Our room was IMMACULATE and we loved the shampoo and soaps. The cherry on the cake was our midnight dinner at Blue Ribbon Sushi in the lobby. Simply wonderful.we can not wait until our next visit. THANK YOU to Donna and her staff of a most enjoyable visit-we will see you soon....
user_name:
davey67
New York City, New York

review_body: Staff is nice, but rooms are nothing special and barely big enough for one person. The view from interior rooms are the people across the alley, so shades will stay drawn. Rooms are clean, but disappointment for the rates. Dark and loud as others have noted . One might feel like they are sleeping or showering with the neighbor. rooms

Overall 4 starsCleanliness 5 stars. No dust bunnies. Clean linensSize 4 stars- its NY, what do you expect?!? It has space for a queen bed with drawers at the bottom, bedside table, a fridge, a small wall closet with a safe at the bottom. Full size mirror. A luggage table. But its small. Its good for someone who plans to just sleep there. Quietness - 2-3 stars. Thats where i call it. The good thing is i cant hear other rooms at all but the doors closing is loud and if people are talking along the hallways, you can hear it but i did sleep like a baby with earplugs and some melatonin. Doormans 5 stars. cute cute cute. ;)Toilet 5 stars. Its small but cute and just right. Location 5 stars. Right in front of time warner. Steps away from the subway, central park and about 10 CVSs and walgreens :)

Go for a higher level room with an exterior window. The room is tiny to begin with and I got an interior window so the only lighting I had was the gross yellow haze from the wall lamp. It just had a poorly-lit-TV-room vibe. No coffee, but it's next to a Starbucks. No iron either, and $20 to press a shirt was nonsense, my travel policy doesn’t allow for laundry services for stays less than 4 days so I had to eat that. Overall the room felt drab and suffocating.On the positive it was quite and the people were very nice.Tip - get a highter outerfacing room with Natural Light, and I’m sure you’ll be much better off.

We stayed here for a girls weekend. There is a subway station directly across the street which was great because most of our weekend was spent near Greenwich village. The room was nice. Room to move. Modern hip decorating. The washroom however was designed by a man. The mirror was too high, the water splashed out of the sink every time you turned the tap on, the bathtub was a very high step up and in, but the rod the shower curtain hung on was too low causing the shower curtain the lie on the bottom of the tub. They also installed a glass shelf in the wall of the shower head causing the water to splash off of it and out of the shower. We got a good deal on the rate, but would not want to pay full price. I have stayed in other NY hotels in great neighborhoods, with great prices and perks for guests like wine hour!

Rooms as small as its gets for NYC. The hotel web picture I think are nothing to do with the hotel in its state. Room small and smelly. The only good thing was the size of the bathroom. The roof terrace holds about 6 people with ok fire into private apartments. My room 57 was dark and at the back of the hotel. The public areas of the hotel were horrid with creep stairs like the bates hotel. If you need to stay in this area try the Hudson. Glad I was only in for 2 nights and out all day as its non welcoming as a hotel. Dirty and like student digs. Poor very slow wifi u less you want to pay.

6 Columbus is a great option on the edge of Central Park. Great hotel and amazing staff. Would stay here again and again. Hotel feels slightly dated but by far all benefits outweigh this slight weakness.

Went a two day visit to New York This hotel is very nice and in a cracking location Staff were great first off and room though pricey was really nice with comfy bedOnly problem with room was the air conditioning unit on wall was a bit noisy through the nightRoof top bar and cocktails were very nice

Poor wifi reception, very slow; front desk service hit or miss; smallest room like a closet, double queen barely ok, upgraded to 11th floor which was nice (but we were lucky to get it). We wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Loved the location and the vibe of the hotel! Room was comfortable. The front desk assitants to the housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. Could get a little loud in the morning due to the doors in the hallway opening and closing. Would definitely stay here again!

Firstly this hotel suffers from the afflictions of many so called 'hip' hotels. Small, cramped spaces with tacky design that uses an overdose of black and dark accents, are passed of as 'hip' and come with a hefty price tag. The standard rooms are tiny, the window sill is used as a part of the minibar, the corridors are small and smell strangely of stale food, the grey walls, low lighting in the room with dark curtains make the room morose and dull. The bathrooms, in black tile with low light don't give the impression of being clean. On the plus side, the location is fantastic. Right in front of Columbus Circle Stn. So getting anywhere in Manhattan is easy. It's literally at the corner of Central Park so a pleasant walk through the park - to The Met, if you want. It's also far enough from the manic chaos of Times Square and Midtown.Le Pain Quotidien is a block away, for a wholesome breakfast, besides many food van and diner options close by.

front desk people were great! Other than that hated hotel! The room was small. Bathroom was not nice. Bed was too small! Elevators were slow! When we checked in it was late and the staff were very nice and made check in easy!

The room was electronic, compact yet clean and functional. If fact, very compact, colorful. Bed fine yet no side room. Very young and hip. The longer you are there the more you like it. Great location.

I had a great stay. The front desk people were awesome. The location can't be beat.go into AOL building across the street. Central past is right there and you a jump away from broadway. Drinks at the Hudson hotel down on the corner is a must.have a great trip

Nice hotel, small room but it's NYC. The room setup works and it was comfortable. The restaurant gets pretty busy on Friday. Next door to a Starbucks which end warmed my heart. Whole Food in the mall across the street and a decent bar next door.

Located on the edge of Central Park with Columbus Circle shopping and restaurants across the street. The subway is also maybe 50 feet away. This alone made for a great vacation. The room with two double beds (haven't seen one of these in 20 years) was quite small for 3 adults, but we survived and didn't spend much time in it anyway. It was very clean. Starbucks next door was a bonus as well as a very nice rooftop bar with fabulous wings and sushi. The staff was very friendly and helpful in every way.

As always the entire team are welcoming, friendly and helpful. Walking into 6 Columbus is like walking into home away from home. Always nice to stay here.The rooms King and above are spacious and always trendy. Try the restaurant for a nice breakfast or some late night sushi.

Very clean and nice, excellent location, able to walk to most needed places. Staff was wonderful and especially the cleaning lady! She was a very nice and lady and did a wonderful job!! Extra thanks to her!!

I stayed and had to fight to get a desk in my room, business traveler needed to work from my room, we were out of Wi-Fi for two days. Location is great, service is very good and people are friendly, but the building has some architectural challenges and rooms need an uograde.

We really loved the customer service at this hotel. Our room was small, but very cute and cozy! My only complaint is that they should switch to different mattresses and headboards. Overall, it's an excellent location in Mannhattan with great service!

NYC rooms tend to be smallish and this is no exception but the owners pack a lot in it. Everything you need but would generally expect only in a higher priced hotel. Room also include well stocked minibar and snacks. Great location, reasonable price

Very well priced on that day, great location, the staff surprised me by being attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly... this is quite rare in NY. Room was all I needed, will stay there rather than at the Hudson.

nothing to brag about this hotel.indifferent staff at check in, room is tired, and furniture is in need of replacement.Bed and sheets were good though. i used to like it for the price and location, but it really needs a remodel.

Very small room without even a chair at the tiny dressing table. No mini bar or any such facilities except bottles of water on the dressing table...for purchase! Bit dusty too. Really expensive for a tiny room with a tiny shower room. Good situation very near to Columbus Circle and Central Park and very accessible for many places.

We have stayed at 6 Columbus many times and each time we leave feeling even happier and more satisfied with this hotel. The entire staff is lovely and friendly! Although NYC is a big and bustling city, the people here take the time to make the guests feel welcome and at home. The location can not be beat and the restaurant is such a treat to have right there in the hotel. The beds are very crisp and comfortable and the rooms are sleek with a modern flair. I can't say enough favorable things about this hidden gem in a great area of the City. We can't wait to be back again soon for a visit to 6 Columbus.
user_name:
robindfg7
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Small, older facility has been modernized and supported by friendly, fairly knowledgeable staff always willing to provide advice and information. Concierge service provided by front dest staff that changes almost daily so information is irregular.

My wife and I use to spend a week in New York every year.This was our fifth stay at 6 Columbus.What to say about a place where you feel at home? I'll tell you: I am sure that next year we'll be back...

We enjoyed our stay, but for the price the room was quite small. Maybe we should have requested an upgrade, or perhaps the desk could have recognized us as frequent guests. We'll try to upgrade again on a later visit.

There was an error in my reservation and while I was out at dinner I received a call to say that the hotel had me scheduled to check out, though I'd booked for the week. Though they apologized for the mixup, there was no effort made to book me elsewhere. Then, after a very long day of meetings and dinner + drinks with partners, I returned to the hotel to find my things in trashbags, yes multiple trashbags. I then spent the hours of 1-3am looking for a hotel, in New York, during fashion week, toting around my trashbags.

Reason why I chose this hotel is it is super close to WholeFood. It is just across the street. So convenient.Actually it is also close to Central Park and walking distance to 5th Ave.Staff is very friendly.

We were looking for the closest accommodation to the Lincoln Center. The location was perfect staying within walking distance for that reason. However, the rooms are extremely small - bumbed my legs into sharp edges of the bed many times ripping two of my tights before getting dressed. Claustrophobic size, one narrow window with view into a shaft that never saw sunlight but pigeon droppings. Dark, narrow hallways with fish smells invading the chambers that kept me away from hanging out in the hotel bar. Room service knocked twice in the morning to start with cleaning even though we were in good shape with checking out schedule.

Excellent time in this hotel it is close to the park and the service is great.My family enjoyed every moment. Love New York and this is my second time in the hotel always happy.We will return soon. Thanks

This is one of the best hotels and staff we have stayed at in NYC!! Great location, rooms, staff and $$$. Quit looking and book. For icing on the cake, I had a family emergency and they treated my daughter (although 18 and very independent) like she was staying at a friends house! They went over the top to make her enjoy her stay!

The room was LARGE for NYC-- with a big living room, which would have been a huge plus if the space overall wasn't so CRUDDY and poorly appointed. It made you just not want to be in there.Furnishings were weathered far past their prime, and just not well matched with the room. The vase right next to the bed was covered with dust. I mean, really?! The ultimate vibe was dark, depressing, and trying to be something it was not.Was supposed to stay a week but checked out after one night and headed for the Essex House nearby which is about a hundred times nicer-- and CHEAPER, believe it or not!!
user_name:
teeveepro
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I don't know what other guests think but we found the hotel-wide "pumped" smell awful...The staff is friendly and helpful.Location is ok for NY.Great food market just across the road.No tea/coffee making equipment in rooms.

6 Columbus was a nice surprise stay for a business trip. Having lived in NYC previously, I had not been familiar with this hotel, but was immediately impressed by it's location (steps from Columbus Circle Central Park, and the subway). The staff was very friendly - none of the snobbery people talk about with NYC hotels. They were above that nonsense, even upgrading me to a bigger room. Keep in mind that it is still NYC and "bigger" means something different if you're staying in the suburbs. The rooftop bar was lovely and the sushi at the restaurant was outstanding. It was the perfect mix of sexy city and comfort for the out-of-towner.

Our stay at 6 Columbus was not only convenient but a wonderful experience! The king suite more than met our expectations and the staff was very efficient and friendly. Executive Coordinator Nicole Dlugos was professional and so very helpful. Everyone really accommodated our needs and made our stay quite memorable! We will absolutely be returning to this hotel every time we stay in the city as well as highly recommending it! Thank you for an amazing trip!

Stayed one night for a quick visit to NYC. Hotel was very nice, beds comfortable. Only drawback was the sink and tub drains were very slow. Asked them to be fixed, they tried, still backed up. Great rooftop bar and nice sushi restaurant. The staff was very helpful! Would stay there again.

Room was small but not tiny. Didn't come to NYC for the views from my hotel room --which was a brick wall. Lobby was cute and front desk was friendly and efficient. Minibar was stocked to the brim. No chair in the room. Bathroom mirror is not for short people --only saw my shoulders and head. Best feature was the heated bathroom floor!!In my opinion, if you've decided on this location and room size is not an issue and are deciding between this hotel and the Hudson, take the Hudson.

The hotel is located right at Colombus Circle across the Centarl Park. In my opinion the best loaction for a short stay in Manhatten. It is within easy and short reach from almost every part of the city. A short walk to Times Square, 5th Ave, Lincoln Center etc.  The Hotel is surrounded by multi restaurants, shops, cafes and bars open all nightNow, for the hotel itself. It boasts with 4 stars and relatively expensive. I have been to several other 4 stars hotels in Manhatten and I have to say it does not compare. It is a very small boutiqe hotel with not a lot of guests. But - it is soooo dark! The rooms have almost no lighting and the furniture is all dark , including curtains and carpets. My window was blocked by a brick wall so even in day light I could not see a thing in the room.The room also can use an update though mine was quite spacious and had enough storage space. One very majot set back - there was no phone reception at my room. You can also use wi - fi which is at a 15$ per day priceI did not get any calls or texts while at the hotel if not for the wi - fi:Now for the positive thingsI have to give credit to the very good and efficient staff and service. They are very hospitable and ready to assist in every way. Nice breakfast at the hotel , and not pricy in comparison to other hotels There are 2 bars at the hotel. One at the roof and the other one at the lobby. Did not try them by judging from the crowds every night - they probably have good reputation.

I reserved a King Superior room. Upon arrival the front desk said "No, that was only a request and we are full" so ended up with a shoebox for the same price. That's OK as NYC rooms are often small, however be upfront about it. There is quite a lot of noise throughout the night. Doors slamming (they have springs that close them quickly and loudly) The decor is shabby and warn. It's a 2 to 3 star property at best.
user_name:
Deadsalesman
New York City, New York

review_body: I was greeted by Matthew and Brandon. I had made a mistake and making my reservation, and showed up a day early. These guys could easily have shown me the door and told me to come back tomorrow. But they went out of their way to accommodate me. They went above and beyond the call of duty to help me as I arrived at roughly 3 AM. I had an extremely difficult trip, and these men could see it in my eyes. They took care of me, and made my arrival experience wonderful. Without these two men, and the hospitality they afforded me, it could've been disaster. It's employees like these that guarantee customers will come back for repeat business.  This hotel is located directly across the street from the A,C,1, B, D subway trains. That me if you can get anywhere in New York City by walking across the street in jumping into the subway. You cannot beat this location. It's across the street from the Time Warner Center, which has a Whole Foods in its basement. It's a 45 second walk to Central Park, where horse and carriage rides or bicycle rentals await you.  The rooms are clean, and the custodian in that cleaned our room was a wonderful woman. The doormen are extremely friendly and helpful as well, even at 3 AM.  If I return to New York City, and I plan to do so, I can't imagine staying anywhere else. I've stayed here before, and they continue to earn my repeat business.  And don't forget the wonderful sushi restaurant located downstairs in this very hotel. It's called blue ribbon sushi, and it is absolutely stupendous. I can't get this hotel a better review. If I have one recommendation, it would be to put micro refrigerators and microwaves in each of the rooms. And I guess one more suggestion, I would put a curved shower rod in the bathrooms as the showers are quite small, and the curtains blow in and take up half of the shower space. A curved rod would eliminate this problem.  Thank you for a great stay, and please recognize Matthew and Brandon. They really took care of me.

Selected the hotel for its location close to meetings in the city. Enjoyed the hotel for its location close to, well pretty much whatever I wanted to do, and loved the hotel for the great design and comfort of the room.Upgraded to a King Suite so had the luxury of being in a well designed, big space in the center of the city!

I read some bad reviews here from Hotel Tonight users but still decided to reserve. I got the simplest room with no view but it was great and nothing like in the reviews! Everything clean and new, great service and we had just enough space for a couple. Exactly what I would expect for the price. + amazing location.

Great location but the room that I had was unfortunately very dark because of it's location within the building.Generally smaller dwellings than hotels in lower Manhattan of similar star rating.Absolutely fine if not spending awake time in room, but not so much if you want to have a chill out day as quite closed and dingy.

Place is a bit quirky (very hip) but in a great, great location. Staff friendly and helpful for NY. I don't usually stay in a boutique hotel but this was a good experience. I didn't get a chance to try the restaurant/bar but it looked good.

Too much noise from the corridor ! The walls seem to be made of cardboard, which caused a lot of noise inside the room - doors slamming (walls would shake), people talking, housekeeping making noise, etc...The Deluxe Queen Room was ok, but rather small for the price paid. The Standard Room is said to be even smaller...No free internet in the room, which is a shame nowadays !Location was very good, south of Central Park...Over all - an overpriced hotel, compared to what you get.

I have been coming here for years and it now feels a bit like a home from home. The rooms are relatively inexpensive (for Manhattan) and are also a decent size (again, for Manhattan). Helpful tip: Try and get a room on the front, the rooms on the back don't get much natural daylight. It's right on Central Park - a great location - and perfect for anyone in need of green open spaces for the occasional walk, run or bike ride. The hotel is friendly and it has a really nice vibe. The restaurant is a particular favourite (I know of locals who eat there, which is always a good sign) and the rooftop bar is good too. The one downside is that the rooms are starting to feel a bit too well-worn. The place could probably do with a refresh but it's still on my shortlist of places to stay.

Our stay was uneventful and comfortable. It was convenient to the subway, nice restaurants, and Lincoln Center. We have been in this area for several years and had no idea there was a hotel there. It was convenient to have a Starbucks next door. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous. We were given an upgrade with asking which made our stay more comfortable. The only negative would be there was no handrail on the exterior for assisting going up and down the steps to the sidewalk. This could be hazardous for the older clients.

This is an odd hotel- especially given its great location.Reception, bar area, staff are all fine (no major impression either way - just what one would expect). Overall impression is very poor - décor is very dull, rooms are very small and unwelcoming. Looks and feels more like a youth hostel - with a few nice touches. A/C very loud, which led to poor night's sleep.Travel a reasonable amount and have stayed in about 10 New York hotels. This is the only one I would never go back to (though if you are a Goth or a Hobbit - paradise awaits!)

Had the king suite which is super roomy, had both a tub and walk in shower. Some great restaurants close by on 9th, a shopping mall across the street, and a 15 minute walk to times square and the theatre district. Staff was also really friendly and helpful in helping us get around. While the description says free WiFi, it's only free in the lobby and on the roof, otherwise $15 in your room for up to 5 devices.

I stayed at this hotel for one night and the service was excellent not to mention the location of the hotel..(a 5 minute walk from Central Park and a huge mall right in front). I definitely recommend it

The room(4person)is very very very small,our luggages even can't all open! The room service is poor, the didn't give us the new shampoo on the second day.The only point we are in favor of is the convenient situation, we walk through Manhattan and go back to the hotel for a rest.

One of my favorite hotels in NYC! Close to Central Park, cafes and restaurants and a club or two! The staff are amazing at this hotel, always friendly and courteous and the rooms were delightful. And who knows... if you are nice enough you may just get yourself an upgrade! :) Thank you! What an amazing stay!
user_name:
Lisa C
New York City, New York

review_body: Rooms are nice, the location is great , service of the staff is friendly and willingly and the food at the hotel restaurant is great.Its close to central park, to Time Worner Center,Colombus Circul and Broadway

We stayed here for 5 days for vacation, and booked it through Hotel Tonight like we usually do with any hotel in the city.When we arrived they had known about our engagement and upgraded us to a king room with champagne, it was in the back corner of the hotel so it was nice an quiet. Our bags were brought up, the minibar was cleared for us, and the room service hours were very reasonable. In a city like NY, you'd be surprised how many hotels we stayed in that didn't offer room service or if they did, it ended very early in the night. We tried the breakfast with eggs, toast, sausage, hashbrowns and coffee. Very delicious. The Rooftop bar has spectacular views, great for a nightcap and enjoying the view, it's pricey of course but it's a great way to start a night out exploring or to end with it.Overall, it's now one of our favorite places to stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.They only complaint we had, wasn't even the hotel's fault at all, someone booked the two rooms next to us in a little alcove and all we heard at 5 and 6 a.m on the last two nights was them going back and forth from room to room, slamming the door. The doors closing are a little loud, but if you have a courteous neighbor it shouldn't be a problem...we however did not have courteous neighbors but it didn't dampen our mood or ruin our trip.

A very nice boutique hotel in a perfect location, friendly staff, and if you arrive late - a fantastic restaurant (sushi/grill) open till 2am!The only thing is that when booking you should really pay attention to the bed size: we booked "double" but it turned out to be a bed which in Europe is never offered above "one-and-a-half" = maybe for 2 teenagers???

Lovely SMALL hotel. Great location. Can use more space in bath...drawers & closet. Also should have coffee makers in room..the staff was very helpful  But comfortable & quiet. We will definitely return next year

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and highly recommend to anyone wanting to stay close to Central Park! A boutique hotel, very clean, great locations and staff were amazing. Nothing was ever an issue! 5* !!!

I paid several thousand for the penthouse, the A/C vents leaked destroying my laptop containing a ton of sensitive data and lost client work not to mention slipping on the water And cutting my shoulder and arm with glass in them. Sixty hotels made zero effort to rectify the situation

This is a very nice, smaller hotel on the West Side at Columbus Cir.,Across from the 59th St subway station. The room and bathroom were clean and attractive. Overall a great deal for the $$$. It will remain on my list of NYC hotel options.

I needed a hotel for one night close to Columbus Circle. I had read reviews of the hotel so I was aware of the tiny room, loud AC, the badly lit bathroom, the thin walls, the heavy doors, and that the room would include no fridge, no complementary Internet, and no ironing-board. (Last one was available upon request at front desk.) So, if you are OK with all of the above and want a clean room and bathroom just to crash, this is the hotel for you.

We stayed only one night, but wish we had more time. 6 Columbus was clean, friendly & a fabulous location. Right at Columbus Circle, we could walk to Bdwy shows, Central Park, MAD museum, shopping and more. Great place to stay!!

Last minute stay - booked that morning in June to stay that night. The Front desk people were in tune to their guests, friendly and responsive. There is a cute bar street level that I took advantage of while waiting for my room and a rooftop bar that we checked out later that night. Both bartenders were fun & accommodating! I took the stairs down from my room the next morning and at each floor level bumped into a friendly & professional housecleaning person :) Really glad I stumbled upon this little gem on Columbus Circle!

I did get a smaller room, but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. I was happy to not pay as much for a larger room, since I spent most of my time out exploring Manhattan.
