The hotel is across the street from a subway that is a hub for many other lines, which makes travel really convenient.

We accidentally chose this great hotel in a great location. Central Park is literally right around the corner. Starbucks literally next door. CVS just a block over, highway is just down the street. Broadway is just a few blocks down. Very quiet and clean hotel, tho small. Service is A+, front desk is very accommodating and very friendly, they got me extra towels, iron+ironing board at 2 am. $45 a day valet parking, very hip, Time Warner building literally across the street, subway stop across the street. Mini fridge full of snacks(snickers bar $4) and tons on liquor(very pricy). Overall I was very pleased, I would definitely go back!

Came to nyc to enjoy 3 nights with my boyfriends childhood friends. I am not a fan of nyc so my expectations were low, but my stay was made much better with the suggestions of wale, our front desk concierge . It was great to get away from the tourist traps and see a different part of the city. The rooftop bar was ok, open til midnight, and the bar downstairs in the lobby stayed open a little later. I didn't like the menu at the lobby bar. The mini fridge was so full of stuff to buy that there was no room for our leftovers, and there was no microwave. Thankfully the front desk was able to microwave our food in the employees break room.All in all the trip was ok and the hotel was great.

We have stayed here several times. This is a really great property. This last visit we stayed for 6 nights in room 101. Spacious room, comfortable bed with a big, lovely terrace. Huge bathroom with deep tub and shower. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Wonderful location with Central Park and great shopping nearby. Maison Kaiser across the street for fantastic pastries/breakfast/coffee.

Let me start off by saying I live in the area but booked this room through Hotels.com. It came to like $266 with taxes which was a great value. I was staying with my boyfriend overnight because we had a race in Central Park the next morning that I needed to set up for early. I am very familiar with hotels in the area and this was an excellent price for the location. I have see reviews complaining about the room size. Yes, the bed does take up the majority of the room, but I don't think most people visit NYC to stay in the room. The shower was great. The water pressure was amazing. The only thing I didn't particularly like was the lighting in room. Both the bedroom and bathroom had a bit of distorted lighting. The service at this property is outstanding. They knew we were doing a race and extended our checkout time so that we could shower afterward. They also made sure we had a bathtub in the room (we didn't ask for this but sincerely appreciate the gesture, so nice). It was pouring Saturday night and we went up to the rooftop bar (has a retractable roof) to hang out and read up on things to do on the trip we're taking this coming weekend. Bartender was very nice. Would have loved to have had a nice night and the roof open but Mother Nature had different plans. Anyway, if you want a big room, upgrade to one. We had a great stay.
user_name:
jillapallooza
New York City, New York

review_body: I couldd not believe I was looking at a bathtub in my bathroom! It was a pleasant surprise and the bathroom was big for NY standards. My room was just the right size and I actually had a closet! The hotel was clean and smelled like a beautiful garden. The roof top bar was cozy and the view was great! Bartender could've made some money that night if he would have came over to my table! So I left! But with that being said the front desk made up for it. I only stayed 1 night so the front desk let me show my luggage until about 10 pm that evening! I thought that was very accommadating and it was much appreciated! I would def stay here again! Very close to CP and other restaurants the price was great also!

Ok let first say that reviews are just reviews take them for what they are worth. Had we chose a place to stay based on minimal negative reviews then we would have never discovered this neat place. With that said here we go.So we chose 6 Columbus based on location. Did a lot of site seeing in Midtown and Downtown. We also wanted Central Park as home base. With a family of 4 (2 kids 2 adults) arrived at check in (3pm) we were greeted and waited (20min) for our room to be prepared. During our wait I asked for an upgrade not because of the wait time but because I felt that we were gong to need it. Room was upgraded and on the 7th floor. Didn't have a view but that was no concern since we wanted to see the city from the outside not in. Valet available and lobby is staffed at all times. Elevator wait time not an issue and there was easy access to stairs if needed. Room size was good,clean and all of the bathroom amenities were there. No climate control issues in the room. No lack of customer service. To the management staff we extended our stay an extra day to site see some more and the need was met. My family and I would like to thank Amanda Felicia, Chris, Carlos (our daughters still talk about you till this day), and the gentleman that checked us in on Thur June 25th. Excellent customer service!! If your looking for an expensive, posh, uppity place where you drink with you pinky in the air then please continue your search. If your looking for a down to earth place to stay that won't break the wallet in a good location with a great staff then give this place a shot.

Excellent, helpful and knowledgeable staff. Nice place to stay with a great location. The sushi restaurant and bar served great cocktails and food. I look forward to staying there again in the near future.

I paid $400+ tax on a Wednesday night for a super tiny, poorly outfitted room. I travel often for business in the area and chose this hotel due to proximity to my appointments. As a single traveler, I am OK with a small room. However, this room was so small that every time I walked around the side of the bed, I banged my shin on the bed and am now sporting a fantastic bruise. There is no ironing board/iron in the room, no desk/chair, limited plugs/outlets and the toilet ran all night. Toilet paper holder is positioned directly outside the shower so if you didn't hold the shower curtain shut, the toilet paper got soaked. Heating system was antiquated, it took several tries to get the appropriate temperature for a 70 degree spring day. The bathroom had heated floors, which honestly was the only true amenity in the room. I requested a room away from the elevator and was assigned a room directly adjacent to the elevator. The final straw was calling for my car, after being assessed the valet parking charge, being told 5 to 10 minutes, and having to wait almost an hour. Great location but poor experience all around.

High-end boutique hotel that's dimly lit. Its got a very exclusive/private feel to it. The rooms are quite small, the bed takes up most of the space. Its steps away from Central Park and Columbus circle. Its great for the more adventurous type see a hotel as just a place to sleep and not a place to linger. The downstairs Blue Ribbon restaurant is quite good.

I chose to spend a night at 6 Columbus because I needed to be close to Central Park and it fit the bill. Also, it popped up at a good price on the Hotel Tonight app, influencing my choice.First, just a clarification. The hotel is not on Columbus Circle. Rather, it's at 58th and 8th. That was a little confusing and it took me some time to find it. Because I booked through Hotel Tonight, I was given a "pod" room, which was quite small. There was room for a full-sized bed, two narrow end tables, and a small desk with a TV over it. That said, it was fine for one, or even two if you're not planning on spending much time in the room. Perhaps their other rooms are larger.The bathroom was really nice and featured a lovely stall shower with a showerhead that offered lots of water pressure. Yay! Everything was very clean and smelled fresh.I have two small complaints: For some reason, there was no top sheet on the bed. The only cover was a comforter. I checked a few times to see if perhaps I was sleeping on top of the top sheet, but that wasn't the case. So, when it got hot overnight and I wanted to remove the comforter, I had nothing thinner to cover me. Also, every time the air conditioner fan would come on, it would click two times first. Then it would do the same when it was ready to turn off. That became quite annoying through the night. Extra kudos to the front desk staff and the bell hops for being very nice. They were talkative and friendly and always smiling. Nice!

Loved the rooftop eventhough I didnt mind the public visiting the rooftop but knowing they came via the same lifts we did made it a little uneasy. Very good value!!Was happy to see Central Park from our window and bed was sooo comfortable. Peter is the guy, very helpful and kind, so welcoming and warm friendly guy, thanks Peter from Australia, Melbourne

The suite next to us had a constant trail of people in and out from 1am to 6am, each without a key so they yelled and banged on the door to get it. Not that many people could even stay in the room... so why did security let them pass through all night? It was not subtle that they might be professionals of the evening perhaps, so I really did not want to create a cat fight at 4am, so I did not get out of bed to call security. Just saying, it's perhaps gone a bit seedy since it opened. I slept maybe 2 hours in total. All the doors shut with a resounding slam as well.
user_name:
jvsnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for a night and had an awesome stay. The front desk were really helpful and gave us an upgrade to our room when we mentioned we were visiting for our anniversary. There's a cool bar downstairs, an awesome sushi restaurant and the location is perfect- with everything pretty much a short or slightly longer stroll away. Also need to mention that the staff were all very friendly and attentive. Thank you- we will be back.

My husband and I stayed this past weekend. Our room was quite small and dark, and there was a distinct smell of sewage coming from the bathroom sink. Shame on us for not complaining and having our room moved - I honestly hoped it would just go away! View was depressing of the back of another building, and the rug buckled in places. The last morning of my stay they lost my breakfast order so I never received it. Annoying! Best part by far was the location and the Blue Ribbon sushi downstairs. Other than that we were quite disappointed with our queen size room.
user_name:
Jocelyn U
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Rude staff, small dirty rooms. Crappy wifi. Need I say more, def will not be bringing my biz here again. The website is a poor representation of what you actually see. The only saving grace was the location,

Having just checked out of the intercontinental (at a similar cost), I felt quite depressed entering my room. I booked through hotelstonight and based on the photos wasn't expecting what I was offered. Honestly feels like I'm sleeping in a closet - very dark and dingy. The attempt at the room decor is to be chic although portions of the room resemble a hostel. If that doesn't bother you and you get a good rate (Under $200), then the hotel is in a GREAT location, the check-in was quick and seamless, nice amenities, bathrobe, bed linen, etc. I'd only consider staying here again if I purchased a larger room that resemble what you see in the photos.

I have stayed at this hotel before and love its location, right next to the Time-Warner buildings, across from Central Park, just a few blocks from Lincoln Center. Courteous staff, great restaurant, Blue Ribbon Sushi, who handles room service too! Sashimi after late-night is great. Specials are always worth a look for upgrades, and in general this company understands hospitality. People from all over the world like this spot, never a bad sign

The good: I booked this room through Hotel Tonight, scoring a price-tag of $260 before tax -- a bargain in Manhattan. Although management reserves the right to assign you to a pod sized room, I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a "deluxe queen". This room was still cozy, but in a good way. A flat Wi-Fi fee of $15 buys you access for up to 3 devices. I loved being a block away from Central Park. if you stick to oatmeal you can get a reasonably priced a la carte breakfast at the adorable Asian style restaurant adjoining the hotel. Besides the usual egg dishes, an Asian breakfast is offered.The bad: No view, windows do not open, and as with all moderately priced hotels I've stayed in in mid-town horrible air conditioning. The kind that blasts freezing air when on, and is positioned right over the bed. Grossly overpriced minibar items -- stay away from these! Very few free TV channels.The ugly: Inadequate shower curtain meant that water flooded the bathroom
user_name:
Davida W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The most helpful and friendly staff ever allowed me to check in early, gave me the best standard room available, brought me amenities, gave me great directions, and made me feel at home. This small hotel is in the heart of Columbus Circle yet it is tucked away to keep it cozy and quiet. Literally across the street from Central Park, you won't find more convenient access to subways and buses that will take you everywhere in the city. Although wifi in the room is not free, it is available in public areas like the lovely roof deck. And although there are no coffee makers available for guests, there is a Starbucks right next door and a Whole Foods across the street in the multi-story mall. Beautiful black wooden floors and lovely bathroom tiles create an elegant room environment, although guests who keep shoes on tend to be heard. I would definitely return the next time I am doing business or want to be on the Upper West Side.

I booked this through hotel tonight for a quick overnight and was really impressed. It was a holiday weekend and they still upgraded me to a bigger room AND let me check in early (around 11:30AM). Also, the staff members were extremely friendly! Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable, bathrooms were big (and not just for NYC standards), and the shower was awesome! I just wanted a quick night to relax and it really did the trick. Great location right in Columbus Circle near everything. Got a run in at Central Park, and did some shopping at the shops at Columbus Circle. Next time I will definitely check out the hotel rooftop lounge and the restaurant, both looked great but I didn't have time this time around.Thanks for a great stay!

My partner and I live in NYC but wanted a night away. My 9-year old son was on a camping trip with his class so we booked a room at 6 Columbus through Hotel Tonight. We arrived and checked in to a room that was very small, sort of defeating the purpose of escaping our too small apartment. So, we went to the front desk where I told the lovely Florinda my sad "mommy escape" story. She upgraded us to a huge room on the 11th floor with a marvelous bathroom and a nice view. Just what we needed. We went to the roof for a great Blue Ribbon Sushi dinner and when we returned to our room, Florinda had sent up prosecco and a box of chocolates which we promptly inhaled. Thank you for our great escape and extra special thanks to Florinda.
user_name:
mommainNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: A gem in NYC.. Great location, excellent services!! I stayed here with my boyfriend last week. Location is perfect, just across the shops at Columbus Circle, steps from good food at Hell's Kitchen and a stone throw away from Central Park which makes for a romantic walk. The staff were great! They made us feel so welcome. Special shout out to Peter and Carlos as well as to Yan! Our stay was perfect!

Convenient Boutique Hotel located in Columbus Circle. Staff was excellent. Rooms are small but clean and modern. Walking distance from Times Square and Central Park. Drug Store and Starbucks next door in case you forget anything.

The rooms are very small but clean and updated. The building itself is older but has under gone a serious face-lift. Location is great, with 4 subways lines across the street. I wish they had a fitness center but other than that it's a good value for $110 a night in NYC..

I will echo the recent reviews. The hotel is perfectly located, has good character, with people who genuinely care about your stay. I would return to this hotel with no reservations. I will say, we had two rooms that faced the street. Good light and view and not noisy enough to disturb. These are the best. I was initially offered a room at the rear and refused it. There is no view.
user_name:
William Q. S
albuquerque, United States

review_body: Very pleasant staff. Front desk, doorman (Peter), room service, all very nice and helpful. Great location walking distance to theater district, Times Square and Central Park is right across the street! Rooftop lounge, very cool. Nice place to hang out.

This hotel offers good and CLEAN (!) rooms and has a perfect location directly near central park!! The hotel is very stilish decorated and offers a great place to relax after a long day in the busy city. The public rooms offer free WIFI, which is very handy for the foreign clientele. Most of all, the always friendly, professional, and personalised service at the hotel is reason for its excellent rating. My mother and I were celebrating her 50th birthday at the hotel and the staff was very facilitating in arranging we had an unforgettable week at their hotel and in NYC! Especially, the concierge (Derica) and the doorman (Peter Erasme) were really great in ensuring we had a great stay at their hotel.We would most definitely come back to this great hotel and would highly recommend this hotel to everybody!

We spent 3 nights, combining business with family/friends get togethers. We come to NYC once or twice a year and have stayed in quite a few different places. We love the Columbus Circle location and being so close to the park. Bed was super comfortable, shower was great. Wonderful hotel with excellent service and a roof top bar!

We had a reservation for 2 night, ended staying 3! We arrived very early, not expacting our room to be ready. Not only it was ready, we were upgraded :)On the third night, they matched the price to hotels tonight and gave us an even better upgrade.The service was great and the location was perfect.

The hotel is in a great location, just off Columbus Circle and Central Park. Great neighborhhood for dining, walking, shopping, its all here. Great restaurant in the hotel and rooftop bar. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms are small, which is okay, but know they are small. Yes, its NYC, but these are tiny rooms and they are a little dark. Having said that, they are well appointed with very good amenities, great water pressure and a well stocked mini bar. I would stay here again.

I have travelled to NYC several times, staying at various hotels. 6 Columbus is the best hotel I've ever experienced in NYC-well-decorated room, friendly staff esp. Doorman, and nice restaurant at the lobby. I would recommend you to try staying here as, also, the location is amazing - opposite of Time Warner building and just right next to the beautiful central park.

Found myself in need of a Manhattan hotel room after a business dinner ran longer than expected and booked this last minute on Hotel Tonight, mostly for location. So it was only for one night. The room was small and it seems as if there should have at least been some other place to sit, other than the bed. But my real problem was with the thermostat, which didn't work. While someone came up to try and fix three separate times, he couldn't get it to work. I don't know if they reserve non-working rooms for last-minute sites or this happened to be a fluke, but the room should be fully operational if it is rented out, even at a discount. When I checked out, I saw an HVAC van parked in front and some workers doing work, so it seems as if this wasn't just my room.
user_name:
MavenNyc
New York City, New York

review_body: For anyone who feels that NY hotel rooms are small, try the Deluxe Queen. It's absolutely worth the upgrade, especially if you are a couple and staying for a few days. This felt like an apartment with a cleaning staff! The room was immaculate, with beautiful hardwood floors and all amenities I require, plus two cotton robes. I had a full-sized bathtub, another rarity much appreciated in NYC, and had two terrific nights' sleep. I love having the telescoping magnifying mirror in the bathroom and REN toiletries, just like the other Sixty hotels I've experienced, and the sashimi at the Blue Ribbon restaurant is just as wonderful as Sixty LES. This is a 4+ star and I'm looking forward to my next trip to NY so I can return here!

My wife and I love hotels where you can come and go without dealing with large lobbies and crowds. This location created a certain level of coolness without seeming contrived. Great little bar with sushi restaurant adjacent was always lively at all hours.Room was excellent with very nice roomy bathroom, very comfortable bed,immaculate.Checkout time of 12 was a plus, and the subway entrance literally across the street was a welcome plus, especially in bad weather. To be so close to Columbus circle and Time Warner center made our late night walk back from Jazz at Lincoln Center fast and safe.I hope this location can keep up the quality and the price. Will definitely stay again

Typical NYC hotel in on great location. My only complaint is the level of noise that can be heard through the walls. Easy parking next door. I suggest paying in advance. Great price. The entire staff was very polite.

Boutique hotel was in a great location across from Time Warner Building, subway with multiple lines, Central Park South and convenient to good restaurants. Staff was efficient, courteous, and accommodating both at the front desk and door. We had a clean quite room and the bathroom large.

My mom and I went on a quick trip to NYC to see the Kelly and Michael show. We only stayed one night in 6 Columbus, but they upgraded us to a suite. We were able to check in early and stay a little late on check in day. It was conveniently located at Columbus Circle, so we were right in between the studio for the show and Times Square. We did a lot of walking, but that is what we expect when we go. The staff were very helpful. The bed didn't have a top sheet when we went to go to bed, but they quickly brought us a sheet to put on the bed. There were robes and slippers in the room to use while we were there. I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

loved hotel. location was perfect. and service was not bad. sleep room had not much windows. rooom was super clean and elegant finishing. sheet was changed daily. bathroom was large for new york. starbucks just below you

We booked this hotel last minute for a GREAT price on Hotel Tonight app. The location is FANTASTIC! We did not experience any attitude or poor service at all. Upon checkin, they graciously upgraded us to a superior Queen, when I politely asked if a larger room was available. The room was small and cozy, yet very clean and well appointed. We would not have been happy in a Pod room. Be aware that all photos online make lobby and room appear larger than they really are. It is probably the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in but was ok because bed was super comfortable, design was stylish, great tv, and they managed to thoughtfully squeeze in everything you needed. The bed even had pull out storage underneath. The spotless Bathroom was compact yet had great lighting and heated floor and great REN products. Overall, for the price we paid, we were completely satisfied and pleasantly surprised. As in all hotels in NYC, especially with older buildings, the view will always be hit or miss and luck of the draw. We were thankful that the windows in the room and bathroom provided some natural light. The hotel has a hip and stylish design but overall is on the dark side especially the hallways. Also, yes, you will hear noise from other rooms and hallway and they will hear you. We enjoyed great drinks and friendly service from the very friendly bartender, Dylan, at the bar in the sushi restaurant. He made excellent appetizer suggestions and the food was outstanding! He was also happy to give helpful local suggestions. The atmosphere in this bar was very warm and cozy. This is a high quality sushi restaurant and the place became packed, especially with locals which is a good sign. If the price is right, I will absolutely stay here again. We are picky and usually stay in very high end properties. While this place is not a grand 5star style property, if you are looking for an intimate boutique property, you won't be disappointed!

I usually don't leave bad reviews simply because I understand that hotel workers are human and can make mistakes this weekend however left me speechless and really upset to start off The rooms are smaller then my own homes bathroom, there are very little amenities in the room itself we had to pay extra just so we don't suffer from cluster-phobia I'm not sure why this a 4star hotel? The hotel has minimal space to move about making the guest feel like there invading someone's private home, We were convinced to use there valet with no heads up of the way they operate at checkout We were overcharged for the parking and when we asked the manager Amanda at the front desk to help us out we were met with a very no can do attitude.

Just checked in to 6 Columbus for the first time, and within a few minutes they made a huge impression. As we were checking in I casually mentioned that we were celebrating my girlfriends birthday. They warmly wished her a happy birthday, and then they informed us, that because of this, they would upgrade us to a suite. This was completely unnecessary, but it was such a nice gesture. Then to top it off,about 5 minutes after walking in our suite, we get a knock on the door and it was the same friendly people bringing us a complementary bottle of Prosecco, and a few chocolates as well. It was a super nice thing to do and made us feel special and appreciated. For our next night in the city together I know exactly where we will be staying.

Small but stylish, clean and mostly modern with great staff and relatively affordable rates - this is NYC.. Our 11th floor king bed room was very clean, comfortable and warm (it was -20C when we arrived); and the room and bathroom were both quite spacious for a non luxury NYC hotel. The location, just feet away from Columbus Circle is great for mid town and the Park, with good subways to downtown. Our room had a very comfortable bed, mini bar good TV, plus a street view but I think some rooms haven't been updated so be sure to ask when you check-in. We found all the staff friendly and quick to respond to requests. One note is that the heating/air conditioning, while efficient, isn't all that quiet, although it is built in, not one of those aw afoul window boxes. We paid just over $200 a night for a king bed and we were delighted with our choice. Not what you'd get at a 5star like the Trump hotel across Columbus Circle, but for the money, better value.

I don't normally write review, but I stayed at this hotel three time, must same have the best housekeeping, rooms are spotless, MISS SHAFAN keep up the good work, always smiling and full of energy, will definetly be coming back and will be staying on the third floor.

I've been staying here for several years now, as it's the best location for where I need to be for work. It feels so comfortable and familiar, and a good deal of that is due to Peter, who always has a smile and a hug for me when I return. I can see that the years are showing in some areas, but that's true of all of us. I still haven't found a place as friendly, inviting and homey, and will definitely be back next time!

I so wanted this hotel to be awesome but as I sit here in the frigid lobby (which resembles a sexy DMV office), I attempt to access the free WIFI. It's a no-go. I stay in NYC quite a bit and I can honestly say it's the 1st time I have had to pay to get WIFI on my phone, in my room. UGH. When I pick up my latte from Starbucks next door, I'm soooo posting this. I am not a scathing review kind of person. I generally have a great experience just about anywhere I visit...unless it's rotten. Ok, it wasn't ROTTEN but is IS 24 hours of my life and $200 clams that I can never get back. We had tickets to The Met and this location is great. Although note, midtown pretty much closes up shop post-theatre. We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Lincoln Center. Usually, we bank up at the Soho Grand and it's a palace compared to this place. The only reason I make reference to the SG is that the room rates are similar when not booked on discount.We booked through the Hotel Tonight app and clearly that is not cool. Check in welcome was both condescending and rude from the male and female staff at the desk. The bartender at Blue Ribbon Sushi was also rude when we ordered a cocktail ($24 for two drinks btw). She was clearly behind on side work. But I believe "rude" behavior is probably a requirement to work here. This Beaux-Arts style building boasted smaller than average hotel rooms for NYC. After the front desk clerk unsuccessfully tried to put me and my wife in a room with double beds, we were "upgraded" to a queen superior with a city view: rubbish under a tarp, building wall, and a view into someone's apt. I think it was my tweet that landed the upgrade. Decor is somewhat contemporary but falls short of hip. Black and white laminate, cobalt drapes and a pair of Z. Cavaricci jeans in the wardrobe. Opened in 2007, and touted as "futuristic", this black hole is showing signs of age.Pros: We DID NOT have working heat. How is that a "pro", you ask? After an hour of cold air blowing of us (NYC temps were in the single digits that night), we called the desk. A tech was promptly sent up and provided remedy within minutes. YAY!Cons: It was 2:30am and they didn't offer a late checkout. BOO.The old adage: You get what you pay for, don't stick here. A stay at The Hampton Inn, Chelsea for half of 6 Columbus' retail, will get you a larger room and a hot breakfast.

About 5 days in advance we decided that we would drive from Boston to visit my sister on the West side of NYC. We tried hotels tonight and was excited to see a hotel in the same vicinity as her apartment. The hotel was Six Columbus and it has a great location.Let's start with the good things. The service was great. The staff at the front desk to the doormen were all helpful and very friendly. The restaurant is blue ribbon sushi and its great. The bar on the roof top is also pretty cool even though not many people were up there. Ok, so we first had got a POD room which is a room with a full size bed. I'm 6'3 and did not want to crush my girlfriend so we upgraded for $50 to a king size bed with a "view". We were on the 9th floor and our view was an office inside the time warner building. The room was very bland and beginning to look a little outdated. The floors must have been treated because they were so slippery that we kept on falling and slipping in the room. The bathroom was very small and the shower was average to say the least. Needed a water late at night and all they had was an $8 bottle of Evian in the room. I think a complimentary water would have been a good touch rather a rip off of a water. The bed was very low to the ground and semi comfortable. Practically little to no space to manoeuvre around in the room. Overall the hotel was Average and that's why I rated it 3 stars. I don't think I would stay there again as I would look for a little more luxurious place.

Just keep coming back again and again. It's nice to be remembered by the team here and every time I come back the same excellent staff are in place. That's the sign of a venue that rewards excellent service. Love "Blue Ribbon" restaurant in the hotel. It gets more popular every time. Ensure you dine in. Thanks to the team for a really fantastic room upgrade and doing everything to make us very comfortable yet again. Now firmly our must stay venue for New York.

I want to give this hotel five stars...I really do. But there were some little things that just shouldn't happen at a hotel stay that are preventing me from doing that.I'll start with the positives.1) Location. This is really in a great area! So close to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square, etc. Really in the center of it all. 2) Decor and atmosphere. Very modern, very clean, very posh. The rooms are cozy - don't expect anything large. With the king bed, a chair, me and my suitcase - it was a full house.3) Staff. Employees were great, friendly and helpful.And now to the negatives...1) The room keys only work some of the time. My business colleague and I were down at the front desk about once a day to get our keys reprogrammed. 2) It's FREEZING! I had the heat in my room cranked up the whole time just to be comfortable at night. I slept bundled up in a robe b/c there weren't extra blankets that I could find in the room. I heard other guests complaining about this too.3) The shower didn't work or drain properly. My day there I couldn't get the shower to turn on. A maintenance man had to come up and use some elbow grease to get it to turn. But then it wouldn't drain. I stood in water up to my calves every time I took a shower. My colleague had a similar problem.Again, I really want to give this hotel a higher rating. But I feel like the issues I had are pretty basic to keeping guests comfortable at a hotel.

Located across from Columbus Circle and short walk from Central Park, Broadway (0.3 miles), Times Square(0.7 miles), the Metropolitan Museum of Art (1 mile ) and a 20-minute walk from the hotel from The American Museum of Natural History. A flat-screen TV and iPod docking station, a minibar and the hotel has 24-hour concierge service The rooftop bar is very pleasant and serves a variety of cocktails. Also you can dine at the Blue Ribbon Restaurant, that serves great sushi Internet WiFi is available costs $15 per day. Parking is available on site, costs $ 55 per day.

The hotel is small and modern, the staff are great for the most part, (although no one seemed to know what tonic water was), however when I selected the hotel I did so because it was pet friendly, and I needed to stay with my small dog. When I arrived, late at night with 4 suitcases, 3 large bags and the dog, I was asked to fill in my details and the dogs details which I did. When I checked out I was charged $250 'pet cleaning fee' and told thats what the pet details were for. I disputed this and pointed out that at no time was i informed of this charge and was simply told to fill out the pet details, not that the form was a consent to pay this charge. I spoke to the manager and he was smiley but not alot else; he would'nt waive the fee and just said they would take my comments on board. Wouldnt go back because of this and wouldnt recommend the place to others with pets - you are better off staying somewhere nicer for the money you will have to pay for the stay. I also had constant problems with the Wifi which you are charged for, I was told they would deduct the cost of this from my bill as a result of the problems but they didnt.

I know I have written countless reviews on this hotel but I have to write one more!I usually stay at this hotel when I am in town, unless it is out of my high school teacher's budget's range, and am always glad I do! Some hotels offer bigger rooms and better amenities than this one but the 6 Columbus offers the best service in town! You are always welcomed back like family here. First, there are the bellmen at the door, I am not objective here because I love them all, that are there to welcome you. Peter, Ceasar and Lawrence, even if I don't know the others by name they are just as nice, are always there to welcome you back and treat a guest like they should be treated. They go above what is expected from them. I was published in the Zagat hotel edition a couple of years back that they treat 40 something women like they are 20 year olds supermodels!! I always love that;-)Then you get to the front desk and you are greeted by Adriana, Wally and the others who upgrade you if there is availability. Of course, if you stay during a slow time of year there is greater chance of being upgraded! I stayed in almost every type of room in the hotel, except the penthouse, and they all have something great to offer! I always go back there and will keep going back because of the incredible staff and service they offer!

Location - Perfect, Hotel rooms, - Clean and nice for NYC. All good... The decor is 60's style. The decor and lighting is little bit dark, and the Hotel is a boutique style.Again, The location is Fantastic.

I booked a night's stay on Hotel Tonite and checked in at 10:00 pm after a full day of museums, galleries and theater in New York. It was very cold in NY that day - 10-20 degrees F - and I was tired. Pleased to be upgraded to a larger room with two double beds after reserving a pod room. Room was very nice, no signs of excess wear and tear, spacious bathroom with nice amenities. Tucked into bed, exhausted, and noticed the HVAC on high fan, lots of air, no heat. Too late to ask for a room change or repairmen, so I spent the night like an Eskimo in an igloo with two toasty duvets - one taken from the extra bed. Bed was very comfortable, and linens had a wonderful fresh, clean laundry scent. Still, the room was freezing. Such possible occurrences seem to come with the territory of older NYC hotels, so buyer beware.

I chose this hotel based on location, which is one block away from Central Park west, and the hotel website photos. I was very disappointed with the very small size of the room (compared to the photos) and the view (back view of a net between building containing a discarded sock and old tie!) There was no door man available to assist us with carrying in our bags.

I stayed here for 9 days with my family. Amazing hotel!! The service was amazing, and the people who works there was so nice and friendly, and help with everything we needed. If I go back to New York City I definitely stay there again.

Recently had a five night stay in thisrerty whilst my partner was in town for business. Location was fantastic as on the corner of Central Park and walking distance to midtown shopping. Small rooms even with an upgrade. Free wifi was appreciated. Otherwise a $15 USd charge applies. Service or lack of was interesting. No real engagement with the customers from both from front of house and doormen even though we where in house for a week. Would we stay again??? Location great but let down by service.

The perfect spot to stay for the New York Marathon. Right off of Columbus Circle. Steps to central park. Rooms are small but perfectly functional. My room was on the back of the hotel and was VERY quiet. Hotel staff were great, helped me track down materials to make a "cheer sign" for the race (felt pen and cardboard, you'd think in some places it was asking for the moon) and happily extended me for an extra night's stay. Rarely waited for an elevator (this can be a major issues at skinny/tall hotels), open stairs (vs scary closed stairwell) were a nice alternative. Better IMO than the similarly-priced Hudson.

I stayed here for 4 nights and had a lovely experience. Staff were friendly and helpful, check-in was smooth and the room was spotless. We had booked a pod room, which seemed from other reviews to be on the small side so I was expecting a matchbox however there was plenty of room for 2 XL cases and 2 girls to get ready without bumping into each other! The bed was comfy and the bathroom large. We were offered a room upgrade for $30 per night upon check-in to a larger room but decided we didn't need it, the room was more than ample space for 2 of us. Like many people we had come to New York to see the sights rather than enjoy the hotel. Perfect location for Central Park, Times Square and subway connections within a few minutes walk. Really good Thai restaurant in walking distance too.. Chai Thai Kitchen on corner of 55th St 8th Av.

I was at this hotel for 1 night. I was awaken early in the am by a knock on the door to which i acknowledged that I was occupying the room. The next thing that happened was someone was on my patio violently shaking the patio doors hollering "let me in..let me in". I was frightened and screamed for the person to go away and the jolting and banging on the doors continued. I called the front desk and ask for help & assistance as I scrambled to get a robe to run down the stairs. I felt my life was in danger. The phone rang and the front desk informed me it was the bldg. engineer who was trying to check the doors that housekeeping had reported were broken and they thought the room was empty. if he thought the room was empty why not use a key and come through the door. Moments later this person was in the hallway still screaming. I locked myself in my room for several hours before going downstairs to check out. An apology was offered, the offered to comp incidentals, if I had charges and they proceed to tell me if I decide to ck into the hotel in the future they would comp my room. I left this hotel in tears. I advised I would be reporting this incident, starting with my employer. Later that afternoon the hotel called my employer to apologize and offer to comp my room. HELLO people, I was the one frightened, crying and offended. A little humanity from one staff member would have gone a long way. I felt I was treated less than a dog. I am a business professional who travels regularly and I have never experienced anything like this in my life. My colleague noted that his balcony room door didn't lock. So glad I wasn't in that room! The staff here will do nothing if you are in danger.

Regular visitor to NY from uk. Booked this one for a change on booking.com - a standard room having seen the lovely pictures. Checked in and given a pod room (42) on a v tired floor.. Tiny and scruffy - No desk no chair, nothing like the photos - not worth the money paid. Asked reception about it and they showed me one photo of one wall of a pod room that they had on their website. Not representative of the product. Be careful. Perhaps other rooms are nice - restaurant / bar on ground floor look good.. But after a long flight I am very disappointed so far and not looking forwards to my next two nights.... Ps hope management read this and realise that their pod rooms are not shown to people booking on websites like booking.com - this leads to disappointment when people spend good money for a product they don't receive. This is a misrepresentation of what is being offered. Jonathan

I recently stayed at 6 Columbus while in NY for a business trip. Overall, the hotel was clean and inviting. Check in and out was simple and fast. The room was very small, but OK for one person. I can't see a couple in this space. Bathroom was contemporary and clean - spacious for a NY bathroom. I didn't realize until the last day that there was a refrigerator in the closet. Small and black, it was packed with honor bar waters, so I wouldn't have used it, but it would have been nice to know it was there. Lighting in the room was quite dim. Hallway noise was bothersome and all doors in the hall slammed shut quite loudly. No free WIFI in the room

Good location, on Columbus Circle and within walking distance to Central Park. You can walk to Times Square and there's a subway station across the street. 24hr CVS Two doors away, and a starbucks right next door. THere's free fast wifi in the lobby - with ample seating, but wifi in the room is charged for. The room is on the smaller side, but you don't visit New York to spend time in your hotel room! The bathroom has underfloor heating (fab for November!), and REN toiletries. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, as across the road at the Times Warner Centre there is a rather large Whole Foods - as well as loads of other shops and restaurants. I enjoyed my stay, and would stay again.
user_name:
JustJacci
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: I stayed here one night with my husband for my birthday. I got the pod room on a special and I was worried it would be very small. It's small but decently sized clean and has a nice tv. The hallways are painted blue which made it look dark and old. If you are staying here more than one night and have kids I would recommend a bigger room.Overall good location, clean and service was good.
user_name:
NYCITY2317
New York City, New York

review_body: I found this hotel at TA. This hotel is exactly as described.I would not take the POD rooms they are interior rooms with no view.I changed my reservation to King Deluxe which gave me a decent view with a slight angle view of the Central Park and Columbus Circle.The hotel is centrally located to Columbus Circle where you get on the subway and get anywhere. Just walk across the street and downstairs and you can travel any where.Its just a five minute walk across the Columbus Circle and then onto Central Park South or West and you are in the park.In the lobby there is free WIFI. But in the rooms its a charge/day.,

I really like to write favorable reviews, unfortunately there is nothing about this property that would draw me back or allow me in good faith to ever recommend it to anyone. Basically, no matter how great the staff is, this hotel lacks comfort, amenities, working fixtures, reliable card access to rooms and features a depressingly dim lighting design even after burned out bulbs were replaced. This was not the hotel we expected based on their advertising and on-line pics. I was embarrassed to have brought my wife and son and his family to this hotel. Never been happier to check out of a hotel...and we have stayed at others in NYC over the years as well as hotels in Europe, Asia and the Pacific Rim. We do not expect or seek opulence for which we do not pay for, but we do expect to receive the value promised or portrayed. We have experienced better stays in NYC for a quarter of the cost. Maybe it's just me, but I do not think convenience is defined by being close to a coffee shop to run out to for morning coffee as opposed to in-room coffee makers of any style. But then, considering this hotels many failings, in-room coffee does seem a little petty.
user_name:
Jeff S
Muskego, Wisconsin, United States

review_body: Great location , extremely clean room with beautiful, clean bathroom. The housekeeping, front desk and doorman very helpful and friendly. Everyday was a pleasure to stay there. Definitely Will stay there again.

Location, location and location. This is the biggest drawing point of the property and you will not be let down. The location is perfect. The rooms are of moderate to small size, but good for a weekend city break. The concierge service was great, finding a trendy place for a Friday night dinner and summer drinks on a rooftop terrace.

I picked this hotel for business trip based on the description and the pictures on hotels.com. We stayed in superior king room for 3 nights and let me tell you - these were 3 nights more than we needed to. This hotel has 2 good things about it - location and the bed. Everything else is not what they sell to you. 1. The room is so small you cannot put a chair against the table to work or do anything. 2. Everything is old, carpets are worn and dirty, light fixture was torn. 3. No natural light comes into the room. 4. the thermostat is probably 40 years old. 5. You can hear any noise in the next room as if you are literally there. When someone opens a tap in the shower you feel like you are standing there, this is how loud it is.Overall for 300 bucks a night I would not recommend it to anyone, there are plenty hotels in NYC that are really renovated and nice to spend time in when you need to. Not this one.

I was in New York for a week for work, and stayed in this hotel after finding it offered at a reasonable price online. The price was good (for New York), but there were some housekeeping issues. The first room I was given had dried urine on the toilet seat, and the sheet on the bed had a small hole in it. I went downstairs and asked for a new room. The second room I was given had a used bandage on the floor by the bed, and the toilet ran after being flushed. I had to change rooms a third time before receiving a room that was clean. All this changing of rooms took some time, and I had arrived fairly late in the evening, so by the time I actually got to bed it was pretty late and I was quite frustrated.The upside, and why I have given this hotel a 2 and not a 1, is that the hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating both times I asked to changed rooms. And they were apologetic about the condition of the first two rooms I was given. That made the situation easier to deal with, but overall I was quite unhappy and frustrated. I don't mind small hotel rooms (especially in New York), but I expect the room I am given to be clean.

First stay at 6 Columbus. Booked on Tablet Hotels as a last minute special, so rate for first night was good. As NYC hotels go, room was very small with very small uncomfortable bed. Carpet and bedding had a musty odor. Window looked out to a brick wall. The sound proofing in the room is non-existent. Was constantly disturbed by hallway noises and noises from adjoining rooms. It maybe worth it to get an upgraded room?The service from front desk and bell staff was excellent. Excellent JapaneSe restaurant in Lobby - " Blue Ribbon".The location is excellent! At Columbus circle with quick Subway access and Columbus Circle shopping across the street. Quick walk to Central Park and mid-town attractions.

My sister and I just stayed here over the weekend and had a wonderful experience. Our room was very clean and although it was small, it had everything we needed. The shower was nothing short of magnificent with great water pressure. The beds and bedding were super comfortable and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful, especially Peter, the doorman/bellman, who went above and beyond to make our visit relaxing and warm. Quick walk to subway, quick walk to Central Park and lots of great places to eat in the immediate area. Will definitely stay here again.

I recently stayed for the New York marathon - and this hotel was exactly what we needed: a modern boutique close to the subway and the finish line. We were upgraded to a small but cozy room with clean, modern details - bed was comfy, bathroom had heated floors, loved the art and decor. The staff was so helpful and I can't rave enough about it being a great location. It could get loud in the hallways, but that was due to other guests. We plan to stay there again at our next visit to NYC.

Moved to this hotel from the Hudson down the street! Wonderful staff, beautiful mid century modern large suite! This hotel is a small boutique property that has has everything you could ask for including the perfect location near Central Park. We will stay here again on our next visit to NYC and will recommend to all our friends!

While the location was extremely convenient to the Time Warner Center -where we had evening plans -- the hotel was dreary. The front desk staff was fine - of course our key didn't work, but a nice porter escorted us up the second time to make sure we could gain entry to the room. The very small room! Ugly grayish carpet and drapes - room overlooked an airs haft but at least was quiet. Bed was comfortable but the towels were thin, rough, frayed at the edges - unacceptable! Bathroom small and no shower cap. And there was a really weird smell in the hallway - kind of like vomit.Took a peek at the rooftop lounge and it was crammed with people eating Japanese food - really stuffy and hot in there. Didn't look comfortable. All in , a must-miss. Would rather stay at a host of other places and cab it to Time Warner.

I've been staying here for years. Weather it's business or with family, this hotel is my home in NYC. They always remember me and are always so friendly and helpful (unlike many other hotels in the city). Frequent upgrades and the best drinks at the roof top bar. Rooms are a good size compared to other NYC boutique hotels. The location always has cabs available, rain or shine. And is not too fare from Chelsea, Meat Packing or Time Square. The mall across the street is awesome. Wholefoods in the basement allows you to have cheap healthy meals without always eating out. My favourite is having a picnic in the park, weather permitting. I would suggest this hotel to anyone and I would be very upset to hear if anyone did not have a good experience.

We enjoyed our visit to NYC and staying here was the icing on the cake! Loved our room ,especially the very comfy bed , and all the lovely food on the Terrace. A big thank you to all the friendly staff!
user_name:
Lois M
Rancho Santa Margarita, California

review_body: Took my wife to NYC for her 30th birthday and booked 6 Columbus due to location and price being better than all the other hotels I was considering. Despite pricing being a factor (on a budget) this didn't reflect the level of service and attention we received while staying there.The staff were dutiful and looked after us in the best possible way for our 5 day stay. The location is perfect. The roof top terrace for drinks at night is great. As is the sushi bar downstairs.If/when we go back to NYC and the area - we will not be looking anywhere else for accommodation!

My partner and I went to NYC for a quick 24hour getaway, to catch a play on Broadway. We were received by the bellman and quickly escorted to our room. Because of the last minute nature of the trip, we didn't make any plans. The concierge recommended and madedinner reservations for us and also booked us on a day trip around the city. The hotel is beautiful and across the street from the Central Park, all leads to a romantic getaway. I can't wait to go back!

We were upgraded from a King Suite to the Penthouse Suite for $250. This was quite a deal as the Penthouse Suite is a duplex apartment with 2 over-the-top bathrooms, a fireplace and a kitchen. The double height ceiling room was quiet and spotless and comfortably accommodated our family of 4. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and wanted to spend much more time in our hotel room than we normally would. Thanks to the staff for getting our room ready for us and the wonderful Blue Ribbon sushi restaurant for accommodating a 10:30pm reservation. All in all one of the best stays we've had in New York.

Central Location with friendly staff - special mention for Mark who was so calm and helpful with passport problems.Room too small for a six night stay and storage inadequate for that length of time. Lighting depressingly low and this was accentuated by lack of day light. Less stuff to buy would release space for a coffeemaker/kettle for welcome early morning drink. Free wifi and phone signal in rooms would also be a welcome addition.

The location is perfect; very close to Central Park and within a minute from a subway station. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Rooms are not very big, but they offer everything you need for a city trip. One remark: paid wifi is not from this century.

Staying here solo for 2 nights. Room is small yet sophisticated. Very chic guests. Staff has been fantastic, friendly and accommodating. Free wifi in lobby and rooftop lounge, where I'm writing this while enjoying being above the bustle of Columbus Circle. I'll be back!

I just stayed at Six Columbus last night (10/12/14) with family. I had been to the hotel to go to Blue Ribbon Sushi, (the amazing sushi place in the lobby) but I had never stayed over. The room was small, but very nice. We did not have a very good view, but that isn't something that I personally care about. The bed was very comfortable. One of the best parts of my stay was the staff. They were very nice and friendly! They were also very helpful. Every time we walked outside, the doorman asked if he could get us a cab. We always took the subway, which is conveniently located right across the street (The B & D trains, the A & C trains, and the 1 & 2 trains). I love this hotel!

For a boutique style hotel this is nice. I have conflicting feelings about this hotel. As a travel critic, I am very fair but strict and feel everyone deserves a second chance but I look at check-in to be the beginning and most important impression. This can make or break your stay. Adriana, front desk helped with a reservation and was fantastic. I cannot say enough about her she is warm, welcoming and just a perfect. Flo is also accommodating and very nice. Unfortunately, on the day of check in, I missed Adriana and Felicia checked me in. Upon entering the hotel, Felicia was cold, unwelcoming and just not interested in accommodating me with any needs or questions, it seemed I was bothering her. I really felt like I should turn around and walk out, again first impressions are the most important. Flo was there but busy, however she smiled and seemed warm, so because of her I decided to stay. Our room key had difficulty with, it worked after several tries each time.I had a Deluxe Queen room, it was nice and clean. Lots of space. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice too. Love the shower, strong and nice bathtub too. Windows did not open but still nice, no real view. There was a mini bar that was very costly but nice variety. A bit noisy in the early mornings with workers. A very cute rooftop lounge, very small, but comfortable for a little out of room get away. As for my tests that I give to see how accommodating for my needs, like extra towels or pillows, they are slow, but ok. Front door staff and bellmen very nice! But understand that because of my first impression at check in I still have a bad taste in my mouth. In all honestly I do not feel that the rooms are worth more then the high 300 to 400 range I did find a special and paid under 300 and felt that was perfect. Maybe a little bit higher in price I would've went but again in all honesty did not find this to be a luxury hotel or boutique style luxury hotel like they indicate. But after all, this is New York City and we are right by Columbus Circle. I did meet with the sales manager and did advise her of my situation upon check-in and my feelings. Hopefully things will be better next time around since I always like to give second chances.I know the sales manager was shocked when I told her what I felt and maybe insulted but I had to be totally honest. I also did find that there is only one wastepaper basket in the room and I felt that was inconvenient.Bottom line, would I stay again maybe down the road for a really good price and hopefully I can reevaluate. Please note that they do not offer a business center only a very small laptop at front of desk to use. If you need a quick stay and need to be near Columbus Circle and eighth Avenue then this is a good location.

With some simple kindness and attention, Heather immeasurably improved my stay. Great room, great staff, great everything.Would strongly recommend taking one of the rooms with a balcony, even if facing the back. Small, quiet roof deck also a huge plus.

David198444444
New York, New York, United States

review_body: pro: great location (subway, central park, lincoln center), excellent very helpful staff (the toilet was running and they immediately fixed it, concierge got us theater fix but with hefty surcharge), delicious restaurant (but very noisy at lunch or dinner, breakfast perfect), very comfy bed and pillows, nice touch to have separate magnifying mirror in bathroom for makeupcon: no free wifi in room which is ridiculous in this tech age; room lighting is very dim, could be romantic if you're twenty but otherwise just annoying; doors slam and are thin so you hear every word in the hallway (not room-to-room though); room key cards often didn't work.I would love to give it 4 stars since there is much that is very good. But it's very expensive and i think overpriced considering its limitations

Great location just across the Times Warner building and Columbus Circle, 6 Colombus is a neat little hotel that combines a Blue Ribbon outlet - great japanese fare.It clearly used to be appartements that were turned into a hotel. Rooms are comfy, bed was nicely done with small shower (good pressure). Doors have a tendency to slam and there is always one person on the floor who does not care. The key card to operate the elevator was broken so it was fast. I hate those elevator key cards, so annoying for nothing.Evening/night staff were welcoming and helpful. Morning/noon staff were cold and uninterested, always on the phone like you are second grade. Doormen were always very nice and quick.There is a small rooftop bar but it barely holds 20 people so it caters mostly to hotel guest and their drunken entourage.I paid $350/night so I give it a 4 based on value as it is too expensive for what it offers at that price. Would not return on that basis but well run hotel and nice staff.

Can't wait to stay at the Columbus. Right down the block from Fordham College at Lincoln Center.Location is great when visiting your student or college visits in NYCTime Warner Shopping Center and Central Park are steps away.You're guaranteed to have an enjoyable stay.

First the positives: Very nice staff - went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The location is steps away from Columbus Circle and Central Park. A short walk down Broadway and your at Time Square. Easy access to subway system. Areas for improvement: a mid-week stay in a standard room was $400 a night. The room size was small but adequate. There was a stale cigarette smoke smell and the bathroom although very stylish with new tile smelled terribly of mildew and mold. The toilet ran constantly. I closed the door to the bathroom to dampen the noise and the smell. The heat/cooling system ran on/off all night making it impossible to sleep.The last issue - $15 for internet. This should no longer be conceivable.

My wife and I love to visit New York City. So, in the last twenty years, we use to stay at least a week yearly in this incredible city.In the last four years we stayed at 6 Columbus Hotel (at Columbus Circle) and I have to say that it s getting better and better!Extremely well located, near everything important, but out from the crowd, you are treated as a family's member. Reception, concierge, doormen, all of the staff contributes for a well-being sensation.At this particular time, the weather was great and we could have dinner in bistros nearby, sitted outside, with tables located on the sidewalk. But if you don't want to go out, you can have dinner at the hotel, in the Blue Ribbon. Very good.Finally, you're just in front a subway station, located in the Time-Warner Center. Inside, among many fine stores, there is also a fantastic supermarket.Next year we will be back!

I frequently visit New York City but I hadn't stayed in Columbus Circle in quite a while. I've stayed at 6 Columbus a few times in the past. A few hits, couple of misses. My previous stay was a disaster, but it was only for one night. At the time, the hotel still allowed smoking, and the only room available was a smoking room. What a disaster that was. So, I was pleasantly surprised that the hotel was now smoke-free. I gave it another shot, and I'm glad I did. Heather, the front desk manager, was extremely pleasant and she even upgraded me to a King suite! I enjoyed the room. Comfortable king-sized bed. Good furnishings. The front door staff (particularly Caesar and Peter) were amazing. Very friendly and hospitable. Even the cleaning staff was friendly and smiled as you passed them in the halls. I ended up extending my trip for an additional day. Once again, Heather went above the call of duty to get me into a good room! Thanks for renewing my faith in this hotel! I'll definitely stay again!IN SUMMARY...Pluses: King-size bed, large room with nice amenities, Excellent Service (especially Heather, Caesar, and Peter), convenient location.Minuses: Too dark with little control over the lighting (--at least need dimmer switches and brighter light options in overall room and bathroom); I couldn't get the AC system settings at the optimal conditions. (My programming of the system didn't seem to kick in as I desired.) I also had several issues with my key cards, which was annoying. I was told that they'd recently implemented a new system and they were still working out the kinks.

This hotel is ideally located near Columbus Circle, across the street from the Time Warner building (shopping and food) and every subway line on the west side. Some other amenities include a rooftop patio. You can't go wrong with this hotel. The staff are so nice. As a boutique hotel you will be impressed with the size of the rooms.

When you are in a big city isn't it great to find somewhere that just makes you feel at home. Every time I come back here the front door staff and the front desk are fantastic. They remember you and the welcome is really special. The Blue Ribbon restaurant is one of the best sushi places in town. Superb upgrade this time to a fantastic penthouse. Thank you everyone at 6 Columbus once again - real home from home

This is the primary hotel I stay at when I'm in NYC! I stay at least once a month and I have never been disappointed. The staff is accommodating helpful and friendly. I couldn't ask for a more well rounded experience in a great location. I truly do not stay anywhere else unless they are sold out and even then I ask to be out on a wait list. It's like home away from home to me!

Great hotel and staff. Modern and clean and well appointed. The rooms are small and although they range by size so does the cost. I stayed in a queen and even that was small by any account. Very convenient to anything in midtown. Close to Central Park, Lincoln Center, subways etc

This hotel is very close to Central Park. You pay $45 for 24h parking which is a good value for your money. The service us good. Staff are very courteous and accommodating. Starbucks is just beside this building as well as CVS. Room is clean with a classy style. Will definitely go back if ever I will be in NY again.

Maybe I just had high hopes, but this hotel didn't quite meet my expectations. The hotel was nice and service good, however the hotel was very dark and the rooms were dim with no way to light them up well. Additionally the key card to open then door often didn't work and required many tries.
user_name:
Shadowshadi
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: 6 Columbus is in the most spectacular location! From the windows of the hotel you can see one of the busiest subway stops in the world, but you won't hear a thing as people scramble every which way in hordes. The room was quiet, and the curtains solid enough to black out all the hubbub. You could enjoy a spacious and elegant room in peace for a while--even take a nap at evening rush hour. Then, when things quiet down, you could stroll out onto 59th street and be in easy walking distance of literally hundreds of restaurants, not to mention the theaters of Times Square and Lincoln Center, and the running paths of Central Park. Quiet, busy and completely safe neighborhood, even for the less than confident traveler. Or, for the more confident, hop on the 1 and go anywhere in Manhattan within 20 minutes. Then, retire to the bar in the Sushi restaurant downstairs to enjoy a nightcap, before going to sleep to start a day of exploring all over again! Staff is not only ostensibly personable, but actually recognize you and ask you friendly questions about your adventures, or offer gentle suggestions for fun to be had. Service requests were handled quickly and with a smile. Great deal for the price--especially for the King suite where we comfortably accommodated 2 couples. We'll be coming back.

My impression of this hotel is that it is trying to cultivate a nightclub atmosphere and you really need to be a part of that scene to like this hotel very much. The decor is very dark and the rooms are dimly lit with no option of improving the lighting so it isn't everyone's taste. It is a very masculine decor but our room was fine or mostly fine except for plumbing issues.The problem we encountered was with one particular desk clerk who had absolutely no customer service skills. She was very attractive and I'm sure fits in nicely with the nightclub atmosphere so they may want to think of moving her to the bar area after they train her and coach her to smile a bit. We were charged an upgrade fee when I asked if they could give us two beds, or a queen with cot or a King. Most hotels in NYC try to accommodate and don't charge. Now it is annoying to be charged extra but we were myself, husband and daughter and we were given a room with a King bed. The room itself was ok but the toilet wasn't working properly and the sink wasn't draining. They should never put people in a room that isn't ready for guests. Upon reading further reviews I don't think the plumbing issue was the first of it's kind here. My husband spoke to the clerk and asked for another room but she ignored that and said she would send a maintenance guy up. My husband said well that is fine but we want another room, we were anxious to rest a bit after a long drive. The clerk sent the guy to fix the toilet, he was very nice and just went to work as we had to sit through the repairs. My husband called the desk again and asked for the room he had asked for, she was very rude and said she had nothing but a suite and she'd have to charge even more. My husband asked for a manager to call, 20 minutes later he called again to the desk and ended up getting some guy who said he was the manager ( we aren't sure if this was true) and he told him that he wasn't told he needed to call a guest. My husband expressed we weren't happy with this but were basically told that there was nothing they could do. He removed half of the charge from the upgrade fee but it was more about the lack of customer service and how much this annoyance took away from our experience. I notice that the manager seems to respond to the positive reviews only......this is never a good sign. Overall, the hotel was clean and most of the staff were nice, the bellhop, maintenance guy and other desk clerks were very friendly and more in keeping with what we have grown to expect from a nicer hotel in NYC. One more positive note, the shower was great....water pressure is wonderful.

6 Columbus has an amazing location directly across from Central Park. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant to deal with and consistently went out of their way to ensure my stay was nothing short of extraordinary.I will definitely be back.

This hotel had an excellent location, outstanding breakfast and king or queen beds. That sums up its virtues. The lighting was dim, both in the halls and in our room. We were upgraded to a king bed, but it took up most of the room. Only one chair was present, in the “hall” which was part of the room. The air conditioning was noisy, and it allowed the room temperature to fluctuate too much. The service people were very helpful, but it was not possible to get through to them by pushing the housekeeping or room service buttons on the phone. Calling the front desk or going down there worked. The breakfast was very well cooked; the bacon was crisp and the eggs were just the way we liked them

My wife and I stayed here a few years ago and then again the week of July 1, 2014. Had a great experience each time. Location and staff were excellent. Room was fairly small and a window view of an interior brick shaft, but we don't go to NYC to stay in our hotel room. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the front desk to the maids. Will definitely stay there when we go back to NYC to visit. Right at Columbus Circle with close access to subways, cabs, or even walking to Times Square. Three cheers to Ben (Concierge), Peter (Bellman), and Felicia & Florinda (Front Desk) for making our stay at the 6 very pleasant.

I wish it was possible to give this hotel somewhere between an average and a very good rating. I've stayed here several times for business and the main drawback in the rooms I've had is that they were all quite dark with views of machinery on top of nearby buildings or just walls of neighbouring buildings. I've stayed in a pod, a queen and an executive queen so perhaps if I'd stayed in a suite the views and light might have been better.The halls are also a bit dark and slightly rundown looking but the bedding is good quality and bright white and the bathrooms are very clean. New York is generally not for hanging out in the hotel room anyway. The hotel is just across the road from the Time Warner building that has a Whole Food downstairs and a great Bouchon Bakery on the top floor, where you can grab a coffee and look out over the southern edge of Central Park. It's steps away from Central Park and a 15 minute walk from things like the American Museum of Natural History or shops like the Bloomingdale flagship store.Like many hotels in NYC the prices go up and down considerably depending on the week but will definitely stay again for convenience. Not sure why it changed from being a Thompson Hotel to a Sixty Hotel. The front desk staff said it's still owned by the same company overall. The concept has stayed the same with the slight change in name.

Located in a convenient location with access to transit and stores. I stayed in one of the basic rooms on their 2nd floor and was quite disappointed with the experience.There are certain likeable features in the room such as the bathroom mirror lights, floor heater, and powerful air conditioning (which was perfect for a hot day in June). However, the carpet was dirty, the toilet broke down, and the design of the bathtub and shower curtain was hidicous causing flooding on the bathroom floor. While I loved how power the shower was, the water did not go down the pipe quick enough causing back flow of water accumulating in the tub. That was bad design.Also, there are handles on the bed-frame to open up drawers for storage; however, those handles had cut me a couple times while I was walking by or getting off the bed. I personally thought that was also a bad design.I suspect that the employees were underpaid and weren't well-trained since the messy janitor room/house-keeping storage units were left open, which indicates lack of care to customer experience.While the broken TV and toilet were fixed, the other complaints addressed to the the front desk at checkout weren't even apologized for - it didn't feel that the employee whom we checked out the room with cared about the issues at all.I do want to thank to bellman for allowing us to leave the suitcases with them for hours since my flight was late in the evening, hours after I checked out. They were courteous and professional.For a tourist, it may not be too bad of a choice if you just want to a convenient place to back to after a long day visiting New York; if you are expecting to stay in and relax, then the it's may not be the place for you unless you go for the upgrades.

I stayed at the 6 Columbus for 3 nights while in business attending a conference at Javits centre. I used the metro from JFK and the express A line runs all the way from Howard beach to 59th Street Columbus stop. Great service and staff were very friendly. This central location has easy access to restaurants and NY attractions.

I had to go to NYC last minute for a job interview two weeks ago. Most hotels were already booked, and I had to go through several bookings with hotels that, after reading reviews, seemed horrible. I landed at 6 Columbus, and I'm so glad I did. Granted, I had to pay a little extra, but it was worth it. Location wise, you couldn't ask for anymore...it's right next to Columbus Circle, a walk to the park, or midtown. The rooms were extremely clean, the bathroom was great, and the staff was really courteous. I checked in at 2am, and they didn't seem to have my reservation (an online booking error from a third party website) but they were really nice, and understanding. They booked me in at that hour without a problem! The doormen also rule. He sent me off to the airport with a newspaper, which is a nice gesture.Additionally, I really liked the security aspect of the hotel. You use your key card to get access to any upper floors in the elevator. The only few issues I had that could make this hotel so much better (not that it needs to be) but I would have coffee makers in each room (you have to go downstairs to starbucks). The wifi is not free...and I figure if you're paying that much per night, it should be complimentary. Also, there was a lack of drawer space for foldable clothes. I had to pile it up in the wardrobe. Again, minor things that aren't deal breakers!

What the room lacked in size it made up for in upgraded finishes and stylish design. Very cozy and modern, and the location is right next to the Columbus Circle Subway, and a block away from Central Park. Good value for an NYC hotel.Rooftop bar is overpriced and small, with not much of a view or menu, but the staff is very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very clean. Do yourself a favor and get sushi place 2 doors down - MUCH better than the sushi at the hotel restaurant.

Had a wonderful weekend in the city at 6 Columbus. Perfect location, good price, and nice amenities. Rooms are smallish and don't have a view unless you spend more, but NYC is about getting out and about. Highly recommend the rooftop bar! Highlight of the stay.

Despite a welcoming staff and a nice small sushi restaurant, the hotel is really not special. Small rooms, not as small as Hudson but close and nothing fancy. Old furnitures, Low lights, small queen bed, bad tv signal and hectic wifi. on the 6th floor, I have a view on a big pipe covered with pikes and a dirty courtyard. Room is clean though and quiet.

We booked a room through hotel tonight. With all the fees, it ended up being just under $400. The staff was super friendly and helpful and it was great to have Blue Ribbon right downstairs for food and drinks. Location is great. The main issue is the room size. I mean, I get it. I've lived in the New York area almost all my life. Space is limited and everything is expensive but to charge approx $350 for a room that can only fit a full size bed and barely anything else is a little much, even for NYC. Though for the size of the room, the bathroom was a decent size. One thing we wanted to check out but didn't, was the rooftop lounge. That sounded pretty cool.

I booked through Hotel Tonight and for $375 + tax. The tiny window looked into a "tunnel" of cement blocks with no light. The room was so small, there wasn't even a desk or chair. Also, no iron.ironing board in the room. Carpet was very worn. You can do better for that price. AC was incredibly loud.
