This pretty much sums up the level of care and service and would have earned the hotel a much higher rating but I felt like some of the details were overlooked.There was a bit of mildew in the shower, I couldn't change the level of the heater on the bathroom floor, the phone was missing the paper that indicated which button was for the front desk, etc, the room was a pit of death for cell phone service, and on my last morning the hallway wreaked of vomit.Many in my company use this hotel on a regular basis and have never had any issues so I will be giving them another chance and chalk my experience up to just being a one-off.

I preface this in all my reviews: I am a consummate traveller, spending over 200 nights a year on the road and staying in over 100 different hotels each year. I have stayed in over 1,000 hotels in my life, everything from high end chains to boutiques, so I have a good baseline and realistic expectations for a hotel. The pro's: staff was friendly and attentive, nice clean rooms is a good location. The con's: as is typical in NYC, the rooms can be a bit on the small side. The design is a bit dated, almost retro, but not quite. The first room I had didn't have a desk in it (a hotel room without a desk? even budget hotels have desks) so that was disappointing, they did however move me into a room that had a desk once it became available. In summary, this is a decent hotel and I'd have no problem staying here again. In that price range, there are other hotels I like a bit more, but the location of this hotel is quite nice and the staff were great and accommodating.

I have been staying at this charming place, on and off, since its opening. I am a business traveler and appreciate the central location, proximity to the subway and a panoply of good, well-priced restaurants. The rooms I stay in are sometimes spacious, sometimes not, but always tastefully appointed, quiet and clean and many steps above pleasant.Most importantly, the service staff here go out of your way to make your stay flawless and enjoyable. Need an umbrella? They have many to share. A cab? Relax and let them handle it. This is not an industrial-sized facility with cab-lines and long waits for the bell staff.May I also say that the sushi restaurant, just steps from the cozy lobby, is excellent and a nice spot for a glass of wine and friendly conversation before calling it an evening.I highly recommended this hotel.

My wife and I have just completed our fifth stay at this boutique hotel nestled on 58th Street between the Time Warner building and the Museum of Art and Design. Besides having a near-ideal location for attending events at Lincoln Center, the Broadway Theater district, and dining at a raft of fabulous restaurants, 6 Columbus is a literal hop, skip and jump from the running routes of Central Park. While the run-of-the-house rooms are small, the higher tier rooms are reasonably spacious and feature very comfortable beds, ample closet space, and art Deco bathrooms. For a New York hotel, there is good noise abatement. Lighting is satisfactory but subdued A major strength of this property is its on-site staff, front desk, concierge, and door stations who provide the kind of friendly and personal attention that makes each visit a real pleasure.
user_name:
Lawrence D
Augusta, Georgia, United States

review_body: For a Thompson hotel, I would have expected a bit more in the decor/ design of the rooms. We got a double deluxe and the room was poorly lit, small, no tub, bathroom amenities were low quality, and to keep the heather turned on at night, was a weird combination of loud, dry air shooting over our heads, and heat. Not returning to this hotel, albeit good location in Midtown.

we planned our trip to Manhattan 3 month before, carefully weigting all pluses and minuses of the hotels around. Finally choose this one. At the final, we found that the rooms are quite small ( this is not tiny London hotel, but it is NY hotel I believe!), and we were disappointed by paying 300 USD per night that we get less for this money. But sushi bar on the 0 floor was one of the most popular in the town, so it was the best staff I`ve ever had. Also I would recommend to go to the "Quality meat" restaurant on 5th avenue- it is great!

Great location and great to see another old building repurposed.The staff is friendly and very helpful.The issue is the room, small, cramped and did I say small?Bath was large but needed to run the water for a few minutes to get it warm -hot, control didn't really work.My rating is harsh but it is NYC and it should be better -COMPETITION is steep.Location, great so if you don't mind close quarters probably OK.

Nice rooms. Great sushi restaurant in lobby and hotel just seconds from central park. Price was reasonable too. Service was good. Convenient. Only problem was they couldn't switch reservation rates with other Thompson hotels. They are run independently, it seems ...

My daughter and i just had a 4 night stay here. This hotel is excellent value with the best location to get to everywhere in NYC. The staff were fabulous- Lesley at the front desk handled my minor problems with ease and completely to my satisfaction (thank you). The housekeepers and front door staff were also excellent, respectful and kept a close eye on things. Close to restaurants uptoen and midtown, either way and shopping galore. Wholefoods across the road was within easy reach. Walk to Times Square and Broadway shows and 40 paces from the subway station on a major line...what more could you want? Thanks for a great few days

I just returned from my stay at 6 Columbus on 58th St in NYC. The location was perfect for me, as I had a conference at Jazz at Lincoln Center. The vibe is very young/hipster. The staff were all very efficient and friendly. Check-in was a breeze. There is a bar/restaurant on the main floor and another bar on the top floor. I had a basic queen-sized room (not the pod). It was small but functional. Only storage for clothing is an armoir..no drawers, which was a bit of a pain. Bathroom is nice with pretty tile and omg heated floors! Loved that. The lighting stunk for putting on makeup but I made do. The biggest downfall for me was the blanket on the bed had what appeared to be, shall we say, stains of male bodily fluid. I mean, for this price point, I can't fathom why I wouldn't get a freshly washed blanket that I would be touching. I didn't discover this until the second night and I was already showered and in my pj's, so I didn't call. Want to add that the bedding itself, sheets, pillows and comforter with beautiful duvet were all very nice (and clean). I also enjoyed my continental breakfast which arrived in a bento box! All in all, I had a good stay, especially for the location. I might look at different places for next time, as it didn't exactly blow me away for the price.

The room was nicely decorated, but showing some wear. The dresser had spots were it was just wore out. It was also on the darker side even with the lights all the way up. The room was so tiny, I thought I was in Europe. There was very little closet space. If we stayed more than one night there would be no room for our luggage.The bed was surprisingly comfortable. It was just a mattress on a platform, but it was a pleasant surprise. We were in room 63, not much of a view. All we saw was the duct work from the building next door.The shower pressure is great at this hotel. With long hair sometimes it takes a while to rinse the shampoo from my hair when I travel. This was definitely not the case.The other thing I really loved is that there is a Starbucks right next door. I need that morning coffee.The hotel restaurant was good, but rather pricey.I would stay again, but not for an extended stay. The rooms are too small.

At first I was a little taken aback at the unusual room decor. It grows on you. Amazing bathrooms, great breakfast room service. You can't beat the location. Staff went above and beyond to be helpful.

We stayed here at the end of a business trip with the whole family. Upon arrival the front desk upgraded us to a much larger suite, which was unexpected, but much appreciated with two little kids in tow for this trip. The room was spacious, clean, with nice amenities, modern design and furniture. I had to contact the front desk when I discovered a bunch of cigarette butts at the bottom of a small decorative vase next to our bed (this was a non-smoking room and any cleaning person would have been unable to notice them through the opaque glass). I called the front desk who were very apologetic and just placed the vase in the hallway. Two minutes later a manager was gently knocking on our door to apologize profusely and offer us some complimentary drinks at the bar. A nice gesture, which showed this hotel's commitment to customer service. A very pleasant stay.

For the money, this hotel could not be beat. We had an excellent two night stay here over a weekend. The staff was fantastic (special props to Peter at the door and Carolina at the concierge desk). Polite, pleasant and helpful without being officious - my idea of perfect service.Room was small but clean. I'm not the kind of person who spends alot of time in their hotel room when I'm travelling. I look for a clean place to stay in a good location with comfortable beds at a decent price. This hotel is the whole package.We were on the 7th floor facing 58th so we had no noise issues from the traffic (king deluxe). I will agree with some reviewers that the HVAC system is noisy but we turned off the fan and slept like babies. Water pressure in the shower was incredible and well appreciated after a day of tromping through Central Park in the rain. This will definitely be my go-to place for future trips.There was a slight "stale cigarette" smell in the bathroom in the mornings - just enough to be unpleasant. It was gone by the time we got back at the end of the day so we're not too sure where it came from and it was more of a momentary irritation than anything else. All else was fantastic. (Did I mention how great Peter was?)

The room was tiny--supposed to be 300 sq feet, but at least 50 ft were wasted in the entry way. The closet was ridiculously small & inconvenient. The electrical outlets were old & not working properly- couldn't get a proper charge on my IPad and the super mini hairdryer (provided by the hotel) over-heated multiple times and thus barely dried my hair. There was a hole in the worn out carpet. The shower created a puddle on the floor after each use. The hotel claimed to have Frette linens & Kiehl bath products, yet never saw them. Worst problems: extremely loud heater & very loud HVAC system outside our tiny window. When I asked for a new room, I was told all rooms are like this, unless I want a smoking room. Since when are smoking rooms still available in major US cities? A huge disappointment and not what one expects from the Thompson brand.

Everything about the hotel was great - room, staff, etc. I was not expecting amenities like the heated bathroom tile but it was much appreciated.Linda at the front desk was pleasant and very accommodating.Will definitely be staying here again.

My husband and I spent last Saturday night in NYC and I was looking for a hotel with good reviews in a good location. We had tickets to a Broadway show on Saturday night and also planned to do brunch with family on the UWS. 6 Columbus was a perfect choice. We wanted a hotel with character but without a noisy club atmosphere. The hotel is located on 58th street right near Columbus Circle. It was a 10 minute walk down to 44th street for the play and dinner in the theatre district. On Saturday we had brunch and then walked through Central Park over to the museums. Very easy to get everywhere we wanted to go. The room was clean and comfortable. However the rooms are small. Loved the radiant heat in the bathroom. The staff was truly excellent!!!! Very pleasant, helpful, and friendly. Parking was a breeze. Used the valet service and the cost was $45 which I thought was reasonable for the area. The valet\door\bell staff took care of parking the car which made check in easy. Shower had great pressure and amenities were nice . The hotel was quiet and we had no problems with noise. I would recommend as long as you do not mind a room on the small side.

NYC is the greatest city in the world, and what a better place to dial down than 6 Columbus. It's botique, so everything is easy. I travel frequently to NYC, and 6 Columbus is the full package. As others have stated, Great location, Great service, and well priced. The vibe is right, and everyone who works there 'delivers' in a sincere fashion vs. trying to hard/overcoached. LOVE the 6 Columbus../I want to live there!

True, the rooms are reasonably priced for the Columbus Circle location, but beware which room you request and/or are assigned. We stayed here while in town for the birthday of a friend and chose this hotel because the dinner party held was across the street. We reserved a queen superior room for a very good rate $175, but even for New York it was TINY! Can I emphasize tiny. I can't imagine how anyone could manage in the even smaller pod room. However it was not the small room size that was per se horrible. The room completely reaked of cigarette smoke (to the point I was having asthma like symptoms), dark, dingy, and the only window that opened was to the inside vent shaft which was full of pigeon sh** and looked directly into the room of a naked, oversized man doing horrible things to himself. I am traumatized...but I digress.My husband called down and begged for us to be afforded another room. Management refused. We tolerated this room for a bit, but after another hour of us not being able to walk to the bathroom or the closet without stepping on each other, and my having an asthma attack from the smoke, my husband went down to check us out. At this point the manager offered us a Suite on the third floor which overlooked Columbus, the Galleria and voila, my memory of the creepy oversized naked man and pigeon doo doo wafted away into the air like New York sewer steam. God I love New York....But again, I digress...the suite was bright, airy, spacious, which a comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom, separate living room and although noisy being on the third floor and overlooking Columbus...was terrific. So - unless you book a room with a window that actually opens to fresh air or a room large enough for you and your partner...look elsewhere.

I'm often in NYC for business and when meetings are scheduled early in the morning or late in the afternoon, I'm reluctant to travel the 100+ miles to my home in one day. 6 Columbus was a great find for me. The service was terrific. The tidy room small - but - no matter as there was plenty of room and a really great clean bathroom with good products. Quiet is very important to me as I often work in my room prior or after a meeting, lunch etc. and I can't stand to hear noise from other rooms.

I needed one night in NYC next to Lincoln Center. The Trump Tower and the Mandarin are out of my budget, and the Empire is simply a dive. I stumbled upon 6 Columbus via Priceline. I was skeptical, but needed a place. Since it wasn't flagged on bedbugregistry.com, I decided to take a chance. What a find! I booked a "pod" (small) room for $190.Greeted upon arrival by the doorman who took my bags, "announced" me to the front desk who was all ready to check me in. This is a small hotel. Small but comfortable lobby, small elevators, and my room was small, but I knew it would be. There was no view, which wasn't important to me. But it was no smaller--and the view no worse--than any room I've ever booked at the Algonquin for more than twice that amount. And the bathroom at 6 Columbus was quite big, relative to the room and beautifully done in navy blue subway tile with a full sized tub, spacious sink, and deep return at the window, so there was plenty of room for everything. (And the water pressure was fabulous.) This set-up may be a little tight for two people, but for me it was just fine.The staff were always courteous and helpful, always making the extra effort. One note about the attached restaurant/bar. A group of us gave an order of cocktails to our waiter that included a vodka Gibson, a gin Gimlet, and a vodka martini. The waiter had never heard of any of those drinks, and they all came back mediocre. So, while staying at 6 Columbus, you may want to do your cocktail socializing elsewhere. Also, your cab driver may not have ever heard of this hotel, so be aware, "6 Columbus Circle" is actually to be found on 58th St. (right across from the 58th st. entrance to the Time Warner Center.)I would definitely stay here again. And again.

4th time I stayed at 6 Columbus and once again very pleased. Great location, reasonable price and excellent staff. Based on previous experiences 6 Columbus is the first call Iake when planning a stay in the city

As a former NY transplant, I love the upper west side. This hotel is the best kept secret. I have stayed here on a couple of occasions and the staff and rooms have consistently exceeded expectations. Location is the best. Subway across the street and Central Park is a block away. The staff is amazing. The men at the door are fabulous. They always greet you, are very warm and super friendly. The rooms are small, as expected, but bedding is great and bathroom floors are heated. Extremely clean and very trendy. The bar in lobby is great and sushi is yummy. I will book future trips here. Love this hotel and staff. Would absolutely recommend. Will hit rooftop bar next visit.

6 Columbus is among the finest boutique hotels in Manhattan. It's location speaks for itself. Add a wonderful restaurant, a lovely downstairs and upstairs bar, and Startbucks as a neighbor and you have the perfect spot to call home while in NYC. Most memorable and distinguishing however is the entire staff, from the front desk to housekeeping.to the bell captains. Everyone is welcoming, warm, friendly, and patient. I have stayed at over 20 boutique hotels in Manhattan and 6 Columbus is by far my favorite.

This is a real gem of a hotel. The staff are all genuinely friendly and try very hard to make you feel welcomed and special. The rooms are nicely decorated (with beautiful bathrooms), and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The location is definitely special, and while there are many great restaurants in the immediate area, you'd be hard pressed to find a better one than Blue Ribbon which is located off the hotel lobby.

I have stayed at 6 Columbus a handful of times both for business and personal travel. I’ve not had any negative experiences in any of my stays there. The staff are always friendly and more than willing to help out in any way. The rooms are modestly sized but it’s NYC and that’s just the way it is. The rooms have always felt clean and inviting and I’ve never had that “eeeew” factor that I’ve occasionally had at other hotels. The restaurant has great food and is very reasonably-priced. The brownies from Bouchon Bakery are a nice treat. The location is tough to beat; southwest corner of Central Part at Time Warner Center. It’s within very reasonable walking distance of quite a few NYC places to see. Lots of very thoughtful touches add up to make a stay at 6 Columbus very enjoyable. I will definitely look to book a future stay at 6 Columbus.

Located across the street from the Time Warner building, it was ideal for our purposes. The front desk staff were efficient and friendly. Our room was a deluxe queen, OK for one night. Small is OK but there was virtually no storage besides the closet. Our stay was pleasant and my main quibble is with the lighting in the room.The bathroom was large and almost adequate. Little things make a difference. Here there was no body lotion provided - a must-have especially in cold weather. Yellow fluorescent light above the sink made it impossible to apply make-up. Even the lighting in the bedroom was very dim.The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and we both had a great night's sleep.We had breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, where the waitstaff was genuinely friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied.

I have been staying @ 6 Columbus since it first opened. The staff is friendly and extremely professional. They always seems to remember me and make me feel welcome. On last visit, I received an upgrade which was much appreciated arriving after a long flight and a snow storm.The location is close enough/convenient to the Theater District and the UWS but just far enough so you don't feel part of the tourist crowd. The rooms are cozy yet hip and the hotel itself is the perfect size where you receive personal attention when needed. I have sent my boss, family and friends to 6 Columbus and everyone had a great visit. You will not be disappointed in choosing to stay at this hotel while in NYC.

The location of this hotel can't be beat! Close to Central Park, shopping, and a short walk to theaters or Lincoln Center. The staff is friendly, courteous, and well-informed as to places to go and how to get there. They have a variety of rooms, from small "pod" rooms, to spacious suites, and they are all clean, functional, and well-appointed (and how much time do you spend in your hotel room when visiting New York?!?). A wonderful experience, and terrific place to stay.

The staff is the best, The service is outstanding. They Remembered my name. Very professional. The restaurant isn't my taste, but if you like Asian food it's probably good... (blue ribbon)Most importantly--->>> If you tipp your hotel front desk person THEY WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU!the location is perfect too.It is right on Central Park
user_name:
Noshortz
New York City, New York

review_body: On Thursday 12/13/12 I had the pleasure of staying at 6 Columbus. I had a client in from out of town so I reserved two king suites, with plans to show him around town after we had our meeting. We were impressed with the spacious room and the attention to detail from every member of the staff. We had arrived early and the staff made every effort to accomodate us. My client and his wife took a walk every morning in Central Park which is only a few feet from the hotel door! We had drinks at the rooftop lounge before dinner each night, its quiet there and we were able to discuss our business with privacy and few interuptions. During the day our wives walked to 5th Ave and did some Christmas shopping. Great location!! I will definately use Thompson Hotels again!!!

First, let's sum up the strong points : . The location : midtown, 5' walk from Central Park , 15' to the Rockefeller centre, a very nice mall in front of the hotel. The staff : helpful & friendly. The design : nice and contemporary. The terrace barNow, the negative aspects :. The rooms are very small, even by NYC standards, and are not any cheaper than the average!. The soundproofing is poor, as you can hear people walking in corridors, and above all, the noisy vents from outside. The breakfast is nothing to write home aboutFYI, there are ca. 10 rooms per floor. if you're aiming at single room, the serie ending in 9 overlooks a grim courtyard up to the 8th floor. On the 9th (room 99, which I was first assigned), the window faces a huge and noisy vent on a rooftop... I asked to change room and was assigned 74, which is on the other side of the building and has a relatively clearer view, although vents can still be heard. As a single traveller, I think the best view & quieter rooms must be the 7 serie.

very clean, cozy, and customer oriented hotel. all that you need if you are traveling in NY for the first time. the location is fantastic, you will reach every museum or attractions in 15 minutes of walk.the staff is very friendly. i would rate it as good 4 star hotel.

We chose this hotel based on value and location (near the A train to visit friends in upper west side). What a wonderful find! It's a half block from the subway, across from a indoor mall (with a whole foods downstairs), on a reasonably quiet street (for NYC) with a good deli and convenience store nearby. Rooms are tiny, which is expected, with the least amount of storage for our stuff we've ever encountered. We had to tuck a throw pillow at the bottom corner of the bed to keep from hitting the bed frame, which worked perfectly. The room was filled with trays of snacks, which we promptly consolidated and stored, and the minibar stocked with drinks - we prefer an empty frig for storage. Spacious, modern bathroom was a big plus, as well as nice bedding with down comforter and the in room safe. Service was very good - bellmen greeted us, helped with luggage and had a cab waiting when we were ready to leave. Based on the same conditions, value and location ease without the glut of tourists, I would definitely stay here again.

Honestly as soon I walked into this place I regretted booking this hotel! Was super dark no light anywhere. It just gave it bad energy. I knew the rooms would be small but 'NY small' is an understatement for this hotel. The walls and door were paper thin. I could here the person in the next room cough and when they showered in the am it sounded like the shower was by our bed. Their 'roof deck bar' is more of a common room with small windows and some fairy lights. I've stayed in a lot of the Thompson group hotel and I've always loved them so this place was a huge disappointment!

It's a hip little place, attentive team, bar and perfect location at a great price! Shops across the street, Starbucks next store and friendly helpful staff always available. Check out Dizzy's Jazz on the 5 th floor in Colbus Circle and run the park and reservoir on Sunday morning!

I stayed at 6 Columbus the first week of November and was delighted with the hotel. I was there on business and it was a perfect location to jump on the subway to get down to the garment center. The sushi restaurant was excellent, even eating alone at the sushi bar was pleasurable. I have already booked a room here for my next business trip in January. The rooms may be small but for 1 person they are more than adequate. Loved the heated bathroom floors.The staff was extremely helpful with whatever I needed. Cute doormen too!!! Great value for the price.

We booked a modern POD room for our stay. The room was 175 square feet with a double bed, but hey, it's New York. Sometimes size does't matter. We were not planning to be in the room much so it didn't matter. The room was efficient and well laid out, but the best part of the room was the bathroom. It was modern with sleek blue tiles and a large four foot walk-in shower. The room had windows in the room and bathroom. However, our view was less than stellar. The view was of our building's interior air shaft. Could be an issue for some, but we've stayed at many NYC hotels over the years, you just need to take these things in stride. If it was the TRUMP Tower, I'd be upset. Hotel staff was attentive and pleasant. We had an early flight, so when we arrived in the morning our room wasn't ready. However, the front desk stored our bags and asked for my mobile phone number. The front desk called a few hours later to notify me our room was ready and that our bags would be taken to our room. Nice! 6 Columbus is conveniently located one block from Columbus circle which has access to Subway lines 1,A,B,C and D and the TimeWarner building. TimeWarner Center has many shops, and restaurants. You can find the top rated and my all time favorite restaurant Per Se at Time Warner Center. You can also find a large Whole Foods with a full grocery store on the lower level that also offers healthy take out options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. If you're in NY and want to stay in a small boutique hotel near Central Park with convenient access to transportation, shops and food, check out 6 Thompson.

Strange little conservatory type bar. Very cool music, chilled atmosphere, and there's an outside area too for smokers I guess. We just stopped by for a quick drink. It's ok, but only for a quick drink....a whole evening would be too much! Very nice staff.

I stayed there with my friends and had a great experience. The staff was really helpful and friendly. Excellent location, just across the street there is a subway. It was the best hotel I ever stayed in New York. The restaurant has a really good japanese food.

We were in New York from Oct 27-Nov 1, during Hurricane Sandy. The area was safe from harm, but even staff stayed overnight, so that guests were comfortable. My sister and I were there because we won the trip from a local radio station, so the location was not our choice. It is very close to the upper west side, where we spent a fair bit of time. Not much damage in that area and we were able to find restaurants there that were open on the Sunday and Monday. Staff were very friendly and accommodating-especially Carolina and Lawrence! Unfortunately they charge $15.00 per day for internet and if it weren't for the storm we could have just gone to Starbucks next door for a coffee and free internet. When our flight was cancelled on Tues we were able to extend until Thursday with no issue. I don't know about pricing because this was covered by the radio station. All items in the minibar were well overpriced, but there was a store on the corner where you could get almost anything you wanted. Buckets of ice were delivered upon request. The room was clean and comfortable, although a little small. Bathroom was functionally fine, but quite small. Beds were very comfortable, and we spent a lot of time sitting there, as during the storm we were told to stay in. At night we did, but not during the day. There are many good restaurants nearby and we could walk to Times Square, Central park and everything in between without needing a taxi. They closed the Sushi restaurant during the storm, but did offer room service. We did not use this, and it was a bit expensive, as room service usually is, but preferred to venture out and see what we could find that was open. We found a nice coffee and crepes place about 2 blocks away on 8th ave, near W57th or 56th St.. It was really busy because they were the only place open-even McDonald's was closed. The hotel is directly across from the Time Warner building and subway station. There is a local restaurant right next door which has good pub food-The Coliseum, plus Starbucks and Subway all within a few steps of the front door. Did not see or use the roof top patio/bar-actually did not know it was there till we got home. It might only be open in summer, not sure, but it was fairly warm during that time, so it would have been nice to go and sit up there, when there wasn't a hurricane going on!

I stayed at the 6 Columbus hotel during Hurricane Sandy. When I tried to extend my staywhile the hurricane was still going on, I was offered a rate nearly 3 times what I had justpaid. Instead I had to head out into the storm and try to find another hotel. I understandthat the hurricane created challenges for many hotels, but this uncaring approach wasjust not acceptable, when the airports are closed and you are stranded.Also, they closed the hotel restaurant, Blue Ribbon Sushi and only offered room service. The only problem with this is that even a simple breakfast would cost a fortune, and there were few alternatives. Rather than New Yorkers trying to pull together through a tough situation, this felt like the usual short-term ripoff approach that some shortsighted managers take.I normally like this hotel and their location, but this experience just left a bad tastein my mouth. I had some great experiences of hotels and restaurants helping me outduring a difficult time during the hurricane, but this wasn't one of them.

The location was excellent and we really loved our room. Good quality linen, fairly new bathroom and hardwood floors were the best. It was also nice to see a little bit of sky from our window... The staff was really friendly and they did their best to help us with all of our needs. We would like to stay here again.

We stayed here merely because we needed 1 extra night before moving to our hotel booking and we needed somewhere cheap (got a good offer on hotel tonight).It's a silly hotel. it looks vaguely nice from outside, but it's one of those that when you enter you know exactly what you're going to get. You're plunged into darkness, the lobby is small and mopey, the reception is lacklustre. Our room was on the 2nd floor and the corridor actually smelt of vomit. The room itself was very small and had very little natural light. And you know what, fine it's small, it's New York, but don't then put extremely sharp corners on your beds - it's just silly and means people are going to get hurt. The bed was also very small, I'm not sure it was even a full double. The bathroom was remarkably big, but very cold and lacking in any heating system.A 20 or early 30 something would be okay with this, but if our parents checked in, god forbid - don't do it.

Any place that had room for a Sandy refugee was going to get props from me, particularly one at a very reasonable rate (for NYC)....That said, being a huge fan of the Thompson Beverly Hills, I sort of knew what to expect room-wise. It isn't super posh. It is, rather, dark and slick and perhaps in need of a little bit of primping. The location, however, is phenomenal and the atmosphere is great if its what you want. There's an aesthetic for every taste in Manhattan. Along the same lines, if you are coming to NYC for a view, make sure you ask for one (and be prepared to pay for it). Many of us go through life in the city staring at elevator shafts and brick walls. The staff was very courteous and helpful, despite it being an insane week in NY given the storm and, I'm sure, running short on sleep and support. My only critique is that I would suggest that management fixes the VERY squeaky bed in the Thompson Penthouse, and that they make sure that all the little amenities are there (I was short some bathroom products, etc.). However, they get a pass because I'm sure things were a little off kilter due to the circumstances.

We were refugees from our lightless and power-free block in lower Manhattan due to Hurricane Sandy for three nights. We were lucky to get a room anywhere in Manhattan. Still, it was pretty bad of this hotel to go on charging 15 dollars a day for wi fi Internet access when not many people staying in hotels were there by choice that week. I think it was pretty bad to go on raising the price to the weekend rate on Friday night, too - the manager agreed not to charge the full 605 dollars, but to lower it to 545 - still 150 dollars more than the night before. A friend who stayed here two weeks before got the identical room with free wi fi and breakfast for 350 dollars. I don't think they were deliberately gouging customers in a difficult situation. But some flexibility would have created a lot of good will. We stayed here when we had no alternative. When we do have a choice, we'll go somewhere else. The kKimpton is a good chain.

Great location close to central park. Excellent customer service from check in to bellmen to room service. I was there for a bachelorette with 8 girls, so we had 4 to a room with sofa bed. Bed was great, but the sofa bed wasn't the most comfortable. Rooms were large, comfortable and clean to accommodate all 8 of us in 1 room for getting ready and bachelorette games/festivities.Free wifi at Starbucks next door. Across street from subway. 24 hr pharmacy next door. Whole foods across street.

I stayed there for three days on business and whilst the staff were helpful and mostly friendly I found the general atmosphere opressive and gloomy, from the black scuffed floorboards to the brown fur skins on the lobby wall. There was a perpetual smoker on my floor and so it smelt of cigarette smoke and my window looked out onto the kitchen extractor shaft. They kindly swapped my first room to another, but it had the same problem! The Japanese restaurant was excellent for lunch and Whole Foods is just over the road if you are craving something fresh and wholesome to eat for breakfast, rather than more waffles or pancakes. It's location is great and the rooms were clean with nice shampoo! Only other thing was that the iPod dock made my iPod crash and the wi-fi wasn't free. Don't think I would stay here again.

My wife and I stayed at 6 Columbus last weekend. The staff was friendly and efficient. The room was clean, well equipped, and nicely decorated. Bed was very comfortable. Location is great- a block away from Columbus Circle. Have stayed at other places in NYC on previous trips but now that I've stayed here, I'm sure I'll be staying here again when I'm in town.

Let me preface this review by saying that my wife and I have been huge fans of sister property 60 Thompson for 10-15 years. Given the fact that a pre-Christmas visit to FAO Schwarz for was on our itinerary, we decided to try 6 Columbus (a five minute walk across Central Park South to Fifth Ave. We could not have been more pleased with our experience which exceeded any and all of our expectations. First, the location cannot be beat; steps from Columbus Circle and a few crosswalks from Central Park. Our experience with the hotel/staff itself was a pleasure from the moment we pulled up in our car. All staff members were a pleasure to deal with and provided any assistance we needed. The 6th floor room was spotless and very quiet for such a busy part of town and we had a great meal at Blue Ribbon just a couple of steps off of the lobby. The bed was extremely comfortable and my wife said it was the most restful night's sleep she has had in months. Needless to say, we cannot wait to book our next stay at 6 Columbus. The hotel and staff are top notch.

6 Columbus is a great little boutique hotel on West 58th at 8th Avenue. It offers a host of unique benefits:1. LocationCouldn't ask for anything more perfect. The hotel is right across the street from the Columbus Circle subway station (ABCD and 1 lines), caddy corner from Central Park and a quick walk to a majority of midtown landmarks. Absolutely perfect for any travelers, be they businessmen needing to get downtown to the financial district, couples heading to a Broadway show, or a solo traveler looking to cover everything and anything.2. Comfort/Lack of NoiseAlong with tasteful, bit not opulent, furnishings and very comfortable beds, the rooms in the back of the hotel isolate you from any city noise whatsoever. In my room (68), I couldn't hear a single horn or siren. The air conditioner was a bit loud but was powerful and gave a strong, solid cooling through the night. The bathroom is perfectly fine is NYC with a strong shower and good hot water consistency.3. ServiceThe staff at 6 Columbus was attentive, polite and aimed to please the guests. The front desk answered any questions and offered help, the doormen gladly hailed cabs and helped with your luggage, and the maintenance staff were extremely kind and outgoing when encountered in the hallways or elevator. The positive demeanor of the staff and efficient service made an already pleasant stay even more enjoyable.For the prices you can find on tablethotels.com for 6 Columbus, one would be a fool not to stay here. Sure, it's not the Waldorf=Astoria or the Ritz, but almost any traveler to NYC would be happy they stayed here. I will be sure to go back to them for my next trip to the best city in the world.

I leave close enough to Manhattan that it is a 90 minute train ride...and far enough away that the ride can seem very long at 1 am so... I often stay overnight in the City and often at 6 Columbus. The reason? It's a great location, it has some nice staff members and the adjoining restaurant, Blue Ribbon Sushi is overpriced but has solid sushi--and is deservedly favour (oddly) for fried chicken. They have a good saki selection, creative cocktails and... did I mention the Marrow Fried Rice? Fantastic. Most important, the restaurant closes relatively late--around 2 am, so it is a good post-show option. The rooms are spartan (watch out for the corners of those beds!), with Frette-style comforters and a revived mod-style. The mini-bar is small but diverse, though I have to warn that room service is limited, in both selections and service times (for those desperate, there is a Starbucks next door if you run into am problems). Also next door is Columbus Circle and of course Central Park. If you want a more upscale experience a drink at a time, go to Bar Masa or the Mandarin Oriental. THere's also jazz at Lincoln Center... in short, if you're looking for activities, research Columbus Circle because that has lots of possibilities, many iconic NY, and it is right across the street. Downsides: The decor and its concept is not to my taste, though I don't think it is wretched. The room service is, as I mentioned, spotty, the lighting is good for an orgy but bad for practical things like getting dressed for an am meeting etc. ALSO: do NOT stay at this hotel on New Year's Eve. It is a terrible choice because 1) their restaurant/bar/social scene shuts down for a staff party at around 8 and all the surrounding scenes are in hotels for the most part and around New Year's they won't let in those who are not guests of the respective hotels. The result? You're out in the cold, no place for a drink at 11:30 on NY Eve. Just say no.But, on the whole, this is a good value, good location, reasonable restaurant. It's not going to have the high service profile that caters to your whims like other places (go to the Mandarin for that), but it is a great choice if you're stopping in, need convenience at a good price.

My husband and I wanted a low-key hotel but one with upscale amenities. This hotel was perfect. Located right at Columbus circle we were across the street from Central Park West and within a short walk to the theatre district so we didn't have to find cabs to go anywhere. The staff was warm and welcoming and the room was spectacular.

The location (although on 58th st, not actually columbus circle - rather confusing at first) would be extremely difficult to beat here. The air con was amazing, but essential and too noisy to have on at night, which meant the room was pretty stuffy by the morning (no means of opening the window). No view whatsoever, but wouldn't have expected a view of central perk with the prices we were paying!After reading about how small rooms tend to be in NY, we opted for a deluxe queen room (35), which was completely adequate for us. The quality of the bedding was great for a chain hotel and the shower was lovely and powerful. The ipod dock was unplugged and didnt seem to work.Aside from the location, do not expect any freebies at 6 columbus. We have spent 3 weeks in the USA so far and this is the first place to charge us 15 dollars a day for WIFI. The room is stacked with drinks and snacks, but are ridiculously priced. Overall, I would rather pay a quarter of the price to stay in the other B&B we stayed in NY in Chelsea - free wifi, tea and coffee go a long way (and surely wouldnt cost the company that much...)

First of all, the location couldn't be better - Five minute walk to the opera, ten-fifteen minute walk to Broadway shows and restaurants, across the street from from several subway lines, diagonally adjacent to Central Park. I paid twice as much for a smaller room at the Essex House last time I was in NY (Essex had a park view, but having done that before, I don't feel the need for that expense any more - especially since I'm out and about most of the time anyway). Plus, 6 Columbus felt more personal than Essex, because the staff was very friendly and helpful. I had a King Deluxe room which had a nice big window at the front of the hotel. I pre-paid to save a little money.I will stay here next visit!

from the first phone call my experience with 6 Columbus was more than a pleasant one. They gave great suggestions of dining places and did something a little extra each day to make the experience personal. the rooms where very nice and surprisingly very big. thanks Daniel for providing a great experience.

BE FOREWARNED: 6 COLUMBUS IS NOT ON COLUMBUS CIRCLE, JUST CLOSE TO IT. Its actually on 58th which can be confusing for people who you tell to meet you there.I was recently at a W hotel which has improved upon the idea of boutique (see review of W in Boston). The reason for staying at 6 Columbus is its location. It is a typical boutique in style, which is dark, contemporary and lively, with an overall modern feel. I have been in some boutique hotels that have small rooms, yet they were very functional. I was in room 66 and it was small and very non-functional, Poor task and room lighting, a desk that is unusable and a bed that is sufficient, but with lousy pillows.Room: The room is cramped in a NY style kind of way. It has adequate power outlets. The TV was just okay with a poor selection of channels. There is sufficient (barely) storage, but it would be inadequate for two people. The view is not much to talk about. There is a desk with very poor task lighting and the windows let in very little light. The worst part is that to use the desk you have to sit on the bed and have your laptop sit in the drawer. It is simply unacceptable. The bathroom is small, but otherwise adequate. Location: If you are not staying at this hotel for location then don't stay there. The hotel’s location is near Columbus Circle a block from Central Park. Food: I only had a snack at the bar, but having stayed and dined at this hotel previously I was pleased with the food. The bar is small, but very lively and overall enjoyable. The menu is not expansive and is Asian in nature.rHotel Overall: The lobby is small, but has a nice seating area. The staff is young and friendly. I have stayed at other Thompson hotels and have found them to be better choices than 6 Columbus, though the location is hard to beat. For the money, if you don't have to have a boutique hotel i would recommend staying at the Le Meridien which is nearby. The money is about the same on many days and the experience is a lot better.

Stayed here for 6 nights. First night I had some issues with noise, I spoke with Adriana at the front desk and she graciously arranged to have me upgraded to a King Suite which was quieter (and larger) than my original room. The doors do tend to slam shut so you can hear some sporadic noise in the hallway. Overall, I had a great stay. The staff was always friendly and welcoming. The rooms do tend to be on the smaller side and a bit darker but it fits the hip-boutique-vibe. I tried out Blue Ribbon and the sushi was fresh and the staff were also great even though they were rather busy for a Thursday night. I've been to the original location in Soho years ago and didn't realize they opened up a sister location. And, if you're a tourist: the location can't be beat. It's right near a major hub of subway lines, Central Park and walking distance to midtown east.

When we arrived in 6 Columbus, we definitely felt the enthusiasm of the personnel (who were all very friendly). Very professional assistance at the reception for our room, questions and tips & tricks to do around in the Big Apple!During our stay our room was always very clean and if there was a small problem with the ventilation, it was directly taken care of! And I mean by that: within 5 min. it was fixed - very good assistance and cooperation between reception and engineer!We twice took breakfast and that was really good, lots of choice and very good quality of the ingredients!The doormen are also very friendly and were always able to provide you with assistance if needed!For business or for leisure, this is your location at New York. Close by metro-station (Columbus Circle), shopping locations (shopping mall across the street, walking distance to 5th, Broadway around the corner...), and very good service overall!

I had a wonderful 1-night stay at 6 Columbus. I booked the room on the day-of using the Hotel Tonight app, and the value for the money ($145 for a pod room) was fantastic. Check-in was a breeze - the bellman and front desk staff were friendly and efficient. I dropped my bag in the room, which was small but clean and cozy with a future-retro vibe, then headed back downstairs for dinner in the lobby restaurant, Blue Ribbon Sushi. The food was excellent, authentic Japanese cuisine.Back in my hotel room, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom tiled floor was heated, and the mini-bar was well stocked with quality snacks (including Dean & Deluca!), drinks, and other items. Water pressure in the shower was excellent. However, there was no iron or hair dryer in the room, and although there was soap, shampoo and conditioner in the shower, there wasn't any body lotion. The room got warm at night, and I couldn't find a thermostat to adjust the temperature. I had to open the window, which faced another building only several feet away.In the morning, there was a New York Times at my door, and check-out was a breeze.
user_name:
ncegrl
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location, rooms are very clean, a bit small but larger then some hotels we have stayed in Manhattan. The bar was bustling, bartender was awesome, the sushi wasexcellent, best we have had in a long time. Will definately stay again!
user_name:
Donna G
Fishkill, New York, United States

review_body: I was alone in NY for a couple of nights. I chose this hotel because of its location and good quality/price ratio. I was not disappointed, on arrival I was upgraded and my room was very comfortable with all the ammenities necessary for a good weekend. Clearly this is a great location, with easy access to subway or train stations, central park or the museums. Being so near the Lincoln center was a great idea. Only complain, the room was a bit too dark, but if you go to NY for a weekend please don't stay in your room, even in the best palace!Andresmac

I’ve just returned from a wonderful weekend in NY -- and with such mixed feelings about this hotel that I want to like very much, but with which I really have to be very honest.Always good to start with the positives. For a weekend centered around the Tatzu Nishi Discovering Columbus installation and a concert at the NY Philharmonic, the Columbus Circle location can’t be beat. Hotel staff, from doormen to desk staff to houskeeping ladies were unfailingly kind and helpful. The room furnishings seemed nearly brand new, sharp (literally), spotlessly clean, and well maintained. The bathroom sparkled. Great water pressure and endless hot water. Towels were probably some of the thickest I’ve had in a hotel. Bed was comfortable and I actually used the bathrobe provided in the closet (stocked with a small refrigerator, various styles of hangers, a safe, and an umbrella.) And finally, something smelled really nice in the room. I still can’t tell if it was, perhaps, some sort of housekeeping product or if it was, in fact, my own hair from the shampoo provided in the bathroom. But man, it smelled nice!And now… The down side.I opted for the ‘pod’ room on QuikBook ($249 + taxes) and, in a way, don’t regret that choice. As the smallest room type in the hotel, I found the size itself to be just right for a single traveler staying for two days/one night. It was cozy and in such good repair, so to speak, that it was a pleasure to be in the room. an issue at all, and I’ve certainly stayed in smaller hotel rooms in my life.However. As the weekend continued on, I began to become increasingly bugged by having paid, ultimately, nearly $300 for such a small room. It started as I continually walked right into the edge of the platform bed, whose corners protuded into the limited walking space. I now have quite a large bruise on my shin from one such encounter, and I really am not a complainer.It continued as I searched for some surface area on which to rest my phone, wallet, book, and cup of coffee. There were literally no available spaces in the room on which to put anything. The night stands, while sleek and minimal, are so tiny that not a thing can fit aside from what the hotel has already placed there (a phone on one, a clock radio on the other.) What put me over the edge, however, was the space available on the window sill. While one quarter was covered by two glasses and a small ice container (perfectly fine), three quarters of the sill was splayed with outrageously priced chips, candies, mints, chocolates, water, and wine. $3.50 for a Snickers bar (that I have no desire to eat) and I can’t even find space to put my wallet down next to it and its over-priced companions. Finally, interrupted sleep was impossible because of the design of each and every room door on the 5th floor (and, I assume, throughout the hotel.) At first, I thought my neighbors could have taken more care to close their own doors more carefully, as I heard the consistent bang-banging of heavy wood and hardware. But in the end, it is impossible, even with the greatest care, to close those doors without waking up the hallway. As my ‘pod’ room was sandwiched at the end of the hallway between two other rooms, I heard this several times throughout night. Then, I myself created equally loud noise for the neighbors in the early morning as I went for and came back with my coffee. So while there is much to like about this hotel, I left feeling sort of ripped-off and taken advantage of. Like the joke was on me, actually. The larger rooms clearly offer more space, and perhaps have better sound insulation and offer a greater distance from the bed to the door/hallway. I felt that the price/quality ratio for my ‘pod’ was not in my favor this time around.

6 Columbus is a fantastic location if you wish to be near Columbus Circle and the lower part of the Upper West Side. But that is the only positive thing I can say about this hotel.My wife and I stayed at the hotel for two nights in mid September. I am amazed that there are positive reviews on Tripadvisor. It does seem that the hotel draws either very positive or very negative reviews. My view is firmly negative.The hotel is in an old building - presumably a converted old hotel. It should not be considered a new hotel. Thompson seem to have kept all of the narrow corridors and small spaces. It reminded me of the inside of a two star hotel in Paris. Poorly laid out and cramped. There is one normal size lift and then a tiny lift the size of a cupboard. The colors are all dark and the place looks rather cheap.We stayed in a king room the room was still very small - even by New York standards. There was no where to put the luggage bags and the only seat faced the door to the room. You could walk around the bed but there was no other space. The bathroom was very small and the shower was in the bath. The bath has to be the narrowest bath I have ever seen and it was an effort to not continuously stand on the plug. The bath was no narrow that your feet were partly on the curved sides.We woke up one morning to no running water in the room. Apparently there were water pressure problems on the upper floors. It was fixed a few hours later. But I think it shows the limited job which has been done by Thompson to create this hotel.The bed was comfortable - nice linen.There was only a curtain across the window - no sheer, so you had to have the room in darkness or the people in the adjacent building could see in.The room was poorly appointed. The only toiletries were soap and shampoo. No conditioner or body lotion. No ironing board. my wife could not believe the tiny hair dryer.Our room seemed tired even though the hotel is new. It did not appear to be particularly clean. There were several marks on the furniture and one light bulb was out. The air conditioning was very noisy.When I checked out I had to ask if the desk person was going to ask how my stay was. She seemed surprised when I told her how disappointing it was. I have stayed in other boutique New York hotels like The London and The Crosby Street hotel and 6 Columbus is a poor comparison. It is not worth $400 per night. It's rooms are tiny and the building is cramped. I would not recommend it. In hindsight, I should have more carefully looked at the website photos - tiny rooms with basic furnishings and a tiny lobby. Not good signs.

I've stayed at 6 Columbus a number of times and have always had a great experience. The location is handy - subway station right across the street - and the bellmen have always been able to get me a cab - even at shift change to Laguardia. The rooms are great and I've stayed in both the pod and the King Suite. The pod is small, but all you need in the city. The elevator works with the key card which is nice security. Couldn't be happier.

First time my wife and I stayed here to celebrate anniversary. Received upgrade and the room was wonderful. Service was great and very friendly. Lighting in bathroom was very dim an my wife was frustrated when trying to apply her make-up. A lighted make-up mirror would be a good addition. Also, the tub is narrow and the bathroom certainly was spacious enough to support a larger tub -- stand-up shower would've been nicer (who takes a bath in a hotel?)Blue Ribbon Sushi in their hotel is a big plus as we love sushi and this restaurant never disappoints.Would highly recommend!

I've stayed in hotels around the world, and this is by far the best experience I've ever had. My flight into NYC arrived early, way before check-in. I arrived and they rushed getting my room ready, and actually gave me an upgrade. A++++This trip was for business, and I arrived and was greeted warmly, which is really good for NYC. I had great experiences from not only the front desk, but also the bellhop and the bar. The room was extremely clean and cozy. The hotel is in a great location, right at Columbus Circle, and Central Park, and close to everything. It also came in handy the subway stop is right across the street. This was a great trip, and this hotel will be at the top of my list of places to stay when I return to NYC.

The location of the hotel is fantastic. Essentially right on Broadway, spitting distance from Columbus Circle and the Park. Hard to imagine better! The hotel is small but has a nice, somewhat "boutique" design. Nice little bar next to the lobby. Also a very cool little rooftop bar, which as of August 2012 was not yet open.We booked same day on HotelTonight and we got a Pod Room for $110/night. For that price any decent and clean room on Manhattan is a steal. So we were happy. Fair warning though - the Pod room is just about the smallest hotel room I have ever come across (though I haven't been to Tokyo yet). It fits a bed with barely enough space to walk around it. If you open a suitcase on the floor, you will have to jump over it to get to the bathroom. The latter is perfectly fine, and relatively not as cramped as the room itself. Props should be given to whoever planned out the room. The little space they have is used well and there is actually quite a lot of storage due to the drawers under the bed.I got a chance to see a Queen room, and it is significantly bigger. So I wouldn't pay more than $200/night for the Pod room.

With the size of the room, and the condition/service of the room, the price ratio of this hotel is poor than a 2 start hotel outside the city. In room# 26, the air conditon works like a heater, blow hot air instaed of cold air, but can not open the window to let cool air in because big blower is installed outside the window, and makes big noise. No coffee maker inside the room, 175 sq feet will cost you nearly US$550/night incl.tax.

I stayed here for the labour day weekend. On arrival I was upgraded from a pod to a queen which was a nice surprise. Room was small but perfectly adequate for one person. Bathroom was great and was supplied with toiletries. The bed was the star of the room as it was incredibly comfortable with the softest pillows and bedding I have experienced in a hotel. The place was also very quiet at night, despite being a busy weekend. The room had no view at all, but I paid for location, so was not overly bothered by the room overlooking the roof of another building. I had a couple of issues with controlling the a/c and with the phone making random noises but the excellent staff at front of house were very apologetic and resolved the issues right away. Would have been nice when I was shown my room to have been shown how to control the ac but otherwise, the place was perfect for my needs.

I recently stayed with my wife, three children and parents-in-law for a three day weekend. What a fabulous first time experience! From the reservations staff to the desk to the concierge, everyone was extraordinarily polite and friendly. A special mention for Peter who works the front lobby: Peter made us feel like VIPs the whole weekend. From taking our bags at arrival before check in time to having our bags in our room when we came back to hustling outside to get us taxis - Peter gave the extra service that we didn't expect and made our trip so much more memorable. The king suite was a one bedroom with a sitting parlor with a great bathroom. Very spacious for the money and location. Our other room was upgraded to the Thompson Penthouse - amazing! To sit one block from the park on a balcony in NYC was an experience that we will repeat. The location was perfect, on the quieter side without too much traffic, 1/2 block from Columbus Circle, one block from the park. We walked to the zoo, the boathouse and all of the subways were within 2 blocks. The rooftop terrace was closed for renovations but we are looking forward to seeing it on our next visit.

I recently stayed at 6 Columbus with my boyfriend for a romantic getaway and it was the PERFECT hotel for us! We were upgraded to a studio suite with a terrace that overlooked the city and central park. The room was a great size and the terrace offered us a gorgeous view for breakfast each morning. Kristine was WONDERFUL when I made the reservation and made me so excited for a trip to NYC! Daria at the front desk was incredibly helpful the entire time, she checked us in, assisted us with our bags, told us about the hotel, and even gave us a great breakfast recommendation the next morning. The only downside was that room service did take a little too long one day, but when Peter delivered it, his cheerful attitude and positive demeanor TOTALLY made up for any delay. GREAT staff... Beautiful hotel... Perfect location. I will definitely be staying at 6 Columbus again!

Great location for central park and close to theater district, extremely friendly staff. Easily accessible to the subway and convenient to the Time Warner shops where you can get anything you need. A great location for many attractions in the upper west side. Would definitely stay there again.

6 Columbus is a wonderful boutique hotel on a great location,midtown, a few yards away of central park and a subway station,so every part of town is in reach.staff of hotel is friendly and helpful,blue ribbon their sushi restaurant has outstanding foodmy next stay will be definitely 6Columbus

This is an incredible find in a perfect location just off Columbus Circle. The architect/ designers of this boutique hotel did an amazing job maximizing the usable space. The rooms were incredibly clean --especially the bathrooms/shower/tub. We had a large deck outside our room which was perfect for morning coffee. As with every other hotel in which we have stayed through Jetsetter, the staff here was really on their game. They remembered our names every time we came in or went out of the hotel !! They were courteous, personable, knowledgeable and not intrusive. The location of the hotel is perfect for a run in Central Park, fine dining, bar hopping or just relaxing.

We had a perfect stay at 6 Columbus in August. My sister and I shared a deluxe double room. The room was not huge, but we had enough space. It was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location is perfect - subway across the street, bus nearby, Central Park across the street, food shopping steps away. The hotel staff is amazing - everyone is so friendly and helpful. This hotel is highly recommended. We will be back soon!

Stayed here for a weekend trip. The hotel is well located near Central Park and shopping areas. It is within reasonable walking distance to the theater district.The room we stayed in was spacious and had a balcony with a seating area overlooking Columbus Circle. It was clean and well furnished with a seating area to relax in after a day of wandering around town. The bed was extremely comfortable. It was very quiet considering its central location. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

We booked on hoteltonight.com and were met by the friendliest staff from the doorman to the front desk and chamber maids. We were upgraded for free to a larger room. Perfect amenities, right amount of floor space, size of TV and super clean bathroom. Mattress was comfortable and sheets were european chic. The location of the hotel was convenient to subway, Central Park, and shopping. Starbucks next door,what more could you ask for?

A fabulous hotel! Steps away from the Theatre district and across the street from Central Park. The staff were very friendly and courteous, I did not have any complaints while I stayed there. I was able to walk from the hotel to see a Broadway Show. Five stars!

6 Columbus is located right in Midtown Manhattan with easy access to restaurants, subway and a mall just accross the street. The staff and service was excellent from arrival to departure. I definitely recommend booking this hotel for your next trip to NYC.

From arriving late and not feeling well, I found 6 Columbus the perfect place to rest for my three days of work in the city. From greeting you by name, to reminding me to call my daughter who had contacted the hotel looking for me, the visit was both personal and professional. When leaving for market in the city the doormen each wished me a good day and greated me back by name. The room was very comfortable and clean.....and well worth the money. This is one hotel of hundreds in the city, but if you are looking for a place to rest your head at night and feel at home, this is the place for you.

Just stayed here for a few nights with my fiancé. Great location and rooms but oh MAN the staff were the best!! Relaxed and friendly and really down to earth from the bellhops to the front desk manager. Everyone seemed genuine and kind. We loved this hotel and will definitely be back!!

My spouse and I have stayed twice at this hotel in the last 6 months. Very good location for visiting Central Park and the Upper West Side or Lincoln Center and the theater district on foot. Good Japanese/Sushi restaurant. But for a pricey hotel , it is missing some basics that we'd expect to have in a hotel in this price range, or even in a somewhat less expensive NYC hotel. 1) No complimentary coffee in the hotel at any time. No coffee makers in the rooms. No coffee in the lobby at any time. Yes, there is Starbucks next door, but we want coffee right away in the morning, and in a hotel this pricey, it should be available in the room or at least the lobby.2) No hair dryer, no iron/board in the room. Does Thompson think people don't use these items enough to warrant them in the rooms? We use them. Yes, you can ask for them, but why aren't they available in the rooms?3) Concierge works very limited hours. She left at around 1 p.m. on both Sat. and Sun. After that, there is a sign saying to see the front desk for concierge serices. But front desk is checking people in and out, and they are not a conceirge.4) No courtesy bottle water in the rooms. Even the Four Points hotels in Manhattan give you a bottle of water. At this hotel, you must buy the Voss water that sits prominently on the desktop, along w/two solid feet of minibar foods and drinks on top of the desk.5) The doors to the rooms are very close to other doors to adjacent rooms (the rooms are clustered together on the floors) and you must pull the doors hard to shut them. This makes a very loud sound when closing the doors. So when your 3-to 4 neighbors go in and out of their rooms, you are going to hear it, big time. 6) No free internet. These are basics for a hotel in this price range, and in fact many lower price NYC hotels offer these amenities. I guess they think it is trendy to have to pay for water, coffee, and internet. We think it is lack of basic services for this price point.

Stayed at this small property last week while I was in New York on Business. I had quickly booked the hotel through HotelTonight 5 minutes before arriving at the property and they hadn't received my data yet. They called HotelTonight and it was all sorted out quickly. Rooms are small but average for New York. The Bathroom is nice, clean and modern. Bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. Was very surprised by this hotel and will definitely stay here again. The receptionist also gave me a late checkout at no extra charge cause I needed to switch hotels at a later time then default checkout.

I stayed at 6 Columbus for business a few weeks ago. I really liked the hotel. It was super easy to get everywhere from the location. All the staff were really nice and super helpful. Even though business wasnt as good as I hoped the hotel was great! Hopefully next time my meetings will go as well as my stay there!

Great hotel all around. My colleagues and I often come down to nyc from Canada on brief business trips and choose to return to 6 columbus whenever possible, even when our meetings are on the other side of town. I feel appreciated as a repeat customer and the staff make a genuine effort to ensure our comfort. Very personable service from Kristine, front office manager. Also Linda and Adriana at the front desk were friendly and accommodating. Suites are modern and spacious for new york city. I look forward to my next stay.

We stayed 4 nights at 6C travelling into the city from Toronto. The check-in was flawless – Brandon (bell staff) greeted us right at curb side with a welcoming smile, front desk was friendly and informative and in no time we were in our room. Our suite was modern, spacious, and very clean! The concierge service was amazing – she had a list of different spots we could check out on a daily basis and all of her recommendations were GREAT!! The hotel is located in the heart of mid-town with lots to do and see, and if you want to travel elsewhere the subway is right across the street. I travel to NYC many times a year and 6C by far has the greatest service I’ve experienced!

Ever think you've been managed instead of taken care of? 6C is unfortunately one of those .. :-( First, let's state the positives: great location, near Equinox (Gym), next to Whole Food, FPB (coffee shop), and excellent bell staff. The Sushi restaurant is also quite good. The rest of 6C is quite disastrous :-( My wife booked a boutique so I wouldn't feel like another business trip. The elevators are slow, and the hall way narrow with tacky blue paint over. For $630 per night, the suite is modern but not functional. The couch & chairs were so uncomfortable we literally couldn't sit through the Olympics. Then came the disaster. The wireless internet did work. The front desk, the IT firm, etc. were ALL consistent about a) apology, b) promise of promptness, and c) promise of resolution. Well, none happened. I asked for an Ethernet cable and ended up going to front desk after 15 minutes. Apparently the PREVIOUS guest also had problem because he/she actually tried to disassemble the Ethernet cable-jack-box to make it work. Turned out the power in the Ethernet port wasn't even turned out. Anyway, I had to go to my one meeting unprepared.We eventually checked out of 6C & into Intercontinental. For $450, the room is much nicer and of course the internet works. But what really got to me was the professionally trained 6C staff who said all the right things but did none of it. Why over-promise an outsourced IT service when an honest answer of ... we think it will be fixed in 6 - 10 hrs, how about coming down to the lounge ... turned out to be the truth (yes, internet was fixed at 6PM, literally minutes before our departure).
user_name:
Charlie C
Los Altos, California, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed at 6 Columbus on 8/4 for the Coldplay concert in NJ. We picked 6 Columbus for the location and due to our history of staying at other sister properties. It's a great location for shopping, restaurants, Central Park, access to public transportation and not far from the Henry Hudson Parkway if you are driving in. We booked a room with a king bed, but while checking in, the front desk told us we were upgraded to the Penthouse! This was completely unexpected and let me say the suite was amazing. 3 balconies with 2 overlooking Central Park. It was a loft style setup with the 'bedroom' on the upper level. The room was very clean and the amenties were impressive...several large flat screens, kitchen and an awesome master bath which included a huge walk in steam shower. The front desk staff and bell men were very friendly and remembered our names hroughout the stay. The bartender at the adjacent Blue Ribbon restaurant was great and so was the sushi. Overall our stay was great. We even debated about enjoying the suite versus going to the concert. I highly recommend this hotel and I continue to be a Thompson Hotel fan/customer.
user_name:
Scott K
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at 6 this past weekend for two nights, checking in on Friday Aug 3. I barely had a chance to lift the luggage off of the sidewalk before the bell man raced to ensure he lugged it up the front steps for me. Checking in was a breeze and was very pleasantly surprised to learn that my room had been upgraded to a Double Studio on the 10th floor. Room was clean, refreshed and the decor was super fun. I had a terrace that was probably the size of what my original reservation was for overlooking the Columbus Centre mall/ corner of Central Park. Front desk staff (incl. concierge and bell men) were unbelievably friendly in a very relaxed manner (this was especially important for me as I was travelling alone). Unlike most other hotels I've stayed at, the staff at 6 are completely unpretentious, make you feel at home, are knowledgeable and very helpful. I had to call front desk for some assistance and the maintenance person was at my door within a few short minutes. I usually stay closer to the eastern part of Midtown (5th/ 6th Aves) but decided to try this side of the Park for once, and was taken aback by how beautiful it was. There is tons to do and is still within reasonable walking distance from attractions on the east side. Overall, my stay was incredible. I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here for my next visit to NY!

Amazing staffs. Not the most kids friendly hotel but the staffs and location made up for everything. Close to the subway, great selection of restaurants around, not to mention museums and Central Park are just around the corner.

My friends and I stayed at 6 this past month and thought the staff was fantastic! We forgot a few crucial items when packing (i.e. toothbrush) and when calling the front desk for anything it seemed as though the bellman or housekeeping was at our door within a minute. Same goes for requesting ice, seeing as how the hotel doesn't have ice machines on the floors. Overall it was a great stay and wonderful location, right by Central Park. The staff here sure provide quality service with a sense of urgency.

My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at 6 Columbus in early July 2012 for a week. I am a huge fan of trip advisor as it generally tells it as it is, and 6 Columbus is no exception! 100m from Central Park (and you need this to escape the fast paced city), 30m from the underground, 20m from a really good convenience store, 10m to a great coffee and much much more. The staff make the difference, from the door man to the cleaner - they are all great. Rooms are well appointed, clean and very comfortable. Only gripe was that the roof top bar was closed for renovation, but there are loads of bars on your doorstep.One of the few places I did not bother interrogating the bill and we will be back!Gavin & Gillian Muller, Johannesburg South Africa

From the very moment I hopped out of the taxi and entered the door of this hotel, I had a truly amazing stay at 6 Columbus. From Brandon and the boys on the bell desk, to the exquisite in-house Japanese restaurant and the simple, yet amazingly comfortable rooms, the edgy and homely feel of the hotel made my trip to New York City.I was at 6 Columbus for nine nights (split into two separate stays). The hotel rewards loyalty. Subsequently when I arrived for the second part of my stay, I got upgraded to a larger room and received complementary snacks throughout my stay.Despite not technically being located on Columbus Circle (really cnr of 58th and 8th), the location is perfect - close to Subway, Central Park, Upper West Side and a short walk to B'way etc. I have already recommended this to a number of friends and family and would not hesitate highly recommending it to anyone else looking for affordable luxury in the heart of Manhattan.

I booked this hotel at the last minute for my daughter. They automatically gave her an upgrade hours before she arrived. After showing her the cool pictures, she couldn't wait to stay there. It was a huge success. She loved it. Her text to me said, "you rock!" The hotel is beautiful, modern and you can't get a better location! The price was perfect for my daughter and her friend. Would def. recommend this hotel - I am so pleased she and her friend enjoyed it!

The best part of this hotel was the service. From Peter at the door who was so helpful with getting cabs, directions and basically catering to our every need to Nadia at the front desk, everyone was friendly and ready to give a hand. This hotel has that small town feel in a big city like New York. In addition, the location is great. It is central to everything with the Subway station right across the street, a Starbucks next store and shopping walking distance.

pros- room decor was very nice, bathroom was cool- location was very good columbus circle- staff was friendly- spacious for the price and for nyc hotel- bathroom products were nicecons- biggest con Smoking room! didnt realize it was a smoking floor,thts why i gave it a 3 on cleanliness. everything reeked like smoke.staff gave me an ozone machine which helped a little. no non smoking rooms available.- minor quibbles - shower was way to powerful, wastful, no way to adjust down- few outlets, and are not near the bed, nice for charging ur phone near bed- tv is at weird angle to bed??i am not understanding why people are saying the rooms are small. perfectly fine for what you pay.

The first thing I noticed when arriving at 6 Columbus was the amazing location. Midtown Manhattan, right in the middle of Columbus circle and a minute walk to Central Park and the subway?! Score. Second, the service from the front desk, housekeeping, door/bell men, to the concierge was 110% Everyone always had a smile on their face and was ready and willing to help with anything you needed, reservations, directions, towels for your room, cab, whatever - you name it.
