They upgraded my room last minute, got us in before check in - this is just to name a couple things. The room was very clean, small yes, but its a boutique hotel and everything was comfortable. What a hotel experience should be like! Really pleased!!!

I stayed for the first time at the 6 Columbus hotel when they were in their soft opening a couple of years back and have been going back ever since. I travel quite a bit and have never encountered a hotel with such great customer service. Everyone goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. Here are some of the great points for this hotel:*I am going to repeat it...the staff...they welcome you back warmly. From the bellmen, Peter and Cesar just to name two, and the front desk staff, Adriana and Linda who often give me upgrades, everyone is professional, courteous and efficient. I was quoted in the Zagat hotel edition as saying that the bellmen greet you like you are a 20 year old supermodel even when you are a 40 something high school teacher;-)*The restaurant...Blue ribbon serves incredible food and cocktails. Keith makes the best yuzu margarita but the others make incredible cocktails also. Everyone in the staff is professional and the food is great. I always have dinner there for the dumplings and the sashimi.*The rooms......I always book a pod room. It may be small but it is well designed and the beds are comfortable. There are not too many rooms per floor so it is usually quiet. I was upgraded quite a few times, even though I don't expect it I am happy when it happens, to incredible rooms. They are very clean which is important.*Location...you go out of your hotel and you have subway and bus lines just a few feet away.*Restaurants....many great restaurants in the vicinity*Cons.....I have to leave to come back homeI love going to NY for a couple of days and am lucky enough since I am able to do it a couple of times per year and I don't even consider staying anywhere else now!

My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to NYC in February for our anniversary, and we stayed in this awesome hotel. He ended up getting a great deal on it from Hotels.com. If you're like us, we don't always need outlandish, extravagant hotels with crazy amenities - but 6 Columbus suited us perfectly. The staff was welcoming and helpful and the accommodations were clean and tidy, and considering it was winter while we were there - the heated bathroom floors were great. The one hiccup was when the housekeeping disposed of our "empty" shopping bags and boxes and we lost a couple of things (none of great importance, necessarily, just inconvenient). Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel and would most likely stay again.

My husband and I stayed here in July 2012. STAFF- We were promptly greeted by very friendly staff including the doorman and the front desk person. We arrived very early but they held our bags for us and when we returned later, promptly checked us in and notified us of an upgrade. We also had drinks in the bar and found the bartender staff to be very attentive as well. We also asked for some recommendations from the concierge and were given some great tips. THE ROOMS - The room was very modern, with excellent linens and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was clean and well stocked as well. the King Suite had an amazing living room with hardwood floors and a separate bedroom. The living room was very spacious even with a little table. Prior to checking into our room, we did look at smoking optional Queen room but declined it bc the prior guest had clearly smoked in it and we aren't smokers which was fine. The Queen room is just as it looks on the Internet, the room is just bigger than the bed by a few feet in each direction with a nice storage closet and a tv. It would have been fine for the two of us for a weekend but cozy for sure. LOCATION - you really cannot beat the location. It's at 58th street between 8th and 9th with the park just one block away and a subway station directly across the street. OVERALL - Given that it is NY, I expected the room to be tight on space and storage but was pleasantly surprised. What drew us to the hotel originally were the great rates ($200 per night for the weekend) but will have us coming back was the exceptional staff and the fantastic location. 6 Columbus just became one of our favorite NYC hotels.

In the madness that is NYC, there is no better oasis than the 6 Columbus. Over the years, and many business trips, I've stayed in every hotel in the midtown area, and need to look no further. Every hotel in the area left me wanting more or dissapointed. Once 6 Columbus opened, I've found home. Boutique in size, sophisticated yet comfortable, exemplary staff, every detail managed well. Great bar & restaurant downstairs. Rooms are modern, comfortable, very clean. Incredible value. I look forward to my return.

We had booked a room with 2 double beds for me, my husband, my son and my daughter. When we arrived the hotel staff said they had a surprise and upgraded us to the penthouse suite! Needless to say, we were thrilled!The location is kitty-corner to Central Park which was great as the weather was beautiful and we always enjoy the park.The staff was friendly and courteous every time we met them.My only regret is not eating in the sushi restaurant. I liked the vibe every time we walked by but unfortunately we didn't have time.I would stay here again.
Think this was my 5th trip to this hotel. Exceptional value and brilliant location if you like midtown, the park and The Met Opera. Love the bar too

I got our room off an app called hotels tonight for $99 a night. Got here and they had us in double bed. They upgraded us for free to queen bed based on availability. We traveled with our one year old son. Rooms are updated and very clean. Throw the door man a nice tip, they are truely the most considerate hotel staff around. We came from Miami and have high standards. Our standards were exceeded. I actually for the first time ever feel I should offer more than what I was charged for our stay. Great location! You can walk to alot of the top attractions. Happy 4th of July from their roof top bar!

6 Columbus is a trendy hotel in a great location next to the Time Warner Center and 8 th Ave subway. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small even for NY standards. Unless you book a deluxe room, you can't walk around the bed without moving the desk chair into the entryway. The sushi restaurant and bar was fine. If you can score a special rate, 6 Columbus is a good choice. Otherwise, look elsewhere because under all the hipness, it's a small room, which is what you pay for, right?.
Used hotel tonite and paid $120 for a sunday. Exceptional value for price.

the rooms are beautiful and very invitiing. also rooms on higher floors in front part of building have fantastic views and many have terraces the style is retro 60's and its very attractive but perhaps a touch too masculine. as long as u don't get stuck w/ a "pod" room odds are you will enjoy immensely the luxurious spa style amenities which are promised and upheldb.all in all its a very enjoyable stay but by no means frugal. if u can get a good deal or want to indulge and spend the money u wont be let down.

We cancelled out reservation by phone and it wasn't until we received a $504. Charge on our credit card that we realized an error had been made. I spoke with the assistant manager and she offered to cut the fees. I felt they should completely be dropped them as we had cancelled, and she said she would check and get back to me. When I didn't hear back I thought it was resolved until I got a letter from our credit card co., Saying that they refused to refund any part of it. After that they basically ignored my calls and did not do anything. When I spoke to the manager Ralph Renz, he barley asked any questions nor wanted any information. He just unequivocally stated that they did nothing wrong and nobody talked to you or said any thing. Well the truth is we DID, and that is what they said. Ralph Renz does not care what happened, he just doesn't want to deal with it. How easy would it be for a manager to look into it himself, and if there is even a slight chance a mixup could have occurred, the great managers would have been magnanimous and offer to remove or reduce the charge in the way of good public relations. So why stay here with attitudes like this when you can stay at any nimbler of superior hotels with management that cares about it's patrons.

Stayed there twice and very pleased. Excellent location and friendly service at reasonable price for area. As a side note, fiancee left her kindle in the room; housekeeping turned it in and it was at the front desk waiting for us when we returned. Hope to make it a regular stop when we stay in the city

Location is great, Service is great, My room was spacious and comfortable, the bed facilitated a great night's sleep. The shower and bathroom were wonderful. The only drawback is outlets in the room. I was a tad disappointed at the access points for the electrical outlets.

I stayed here last month for a long weekend. This hotel has a great location, really close to central park and right across the street from the subway. It's always easy to get a taxi out front, too. The rooms are great, very mod feeling. We were upgraded to a suite for a birthday celebration and we loved the layout.What really made our stay was the staff that works here. The door guys were really friendly and relatable, the girls on reception were sweet and nice, not stuffy at all. Everyone seemed genuine and down to earth, even the manager who checked us out. Service was exceptional.Overall great hotel and we will definitely be back. Thanks for everything, 6 Columbus!

Everyone from the doorman, to the front desk agents, to the concierge, and even the not very oft mentioned housekeeping staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, and knowledgable about the area. My room was a bit small, but it is New York. I pity anyone that goes to New York to hang out in a hotel room, no matter how glamorous. If work brings me to this side of Manhattan again, 6 Columbus will be my number one choice. If I go to NY for fun, I'll likely end up trying out one of their other hotels.

Recently stayed here during my daughters graduation. Had a wonderful experience. The staff is exceptionally friendly, the continental breakfast was superb, and the blue ribbon sushi is not a bad way to end the evening. Our king suite was chic and modern, the sheets were very lux and only the best kiehls bath product. Way to go Thompson hotels!!!!
user_name:
sanaz19
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolutely LOVED the location. Directly behind Time Warner Centre and Central Park just across the street. If you love living in the middle of it, this is it. Loved the fact I could wake up and walk over to Central Park for a jog.Rooms are on the small side but still tolerable, but our room faces the back of another building, so our room is very dark. Decor is interesting and the staff are all good looking and young, and of course with some kind of an attitude. Not overly annoying as long as you don't have to deal with them too often. There's a roof top bar which is supposed to be very popular but didn't have time to go. Did pop by in the morning and looked ok.
The personnel is great, but rooms are small (but it's NY), noisy (with poor sound proofing) and poor window view.

I had a great time at 6 Columbus on a recent work trip. My room was comfortable and stylish with good amenities and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They did a great job restoring a dowdy old hotel and have really transformed it into a calm, beautiful space.I got a fantastic deal on Priceline and will definitely be back, both for work and for play.

I've read mixed reviews on 6 Columbus in the past and was reluctant to book. I decided to give it a try for a one day trip into NYC in March. It was a very good choice. The staff is amazingly attentive and is willing to accomodate even last minute request. The hotel is situated in a great location adjacent to the Time Warner center. The hotel itself is nicely decorated and has a very chic boutique feel to it. The warm tiles in the bathroom floor were a definite plus for me. I have upcoming travel to NYC in the near future and will be booking here again.

We stayed here as it is really close to the Lincoln Centre. Rooms are 'compact' (this is NYC!) but with all amenities. There is no breakfast, but across the street, taking up all the basement of the Columbus Circle Centre, is a huge Whole Foods Market store that has great breakfast variety. There is a lively bar in the hotel, and a fine Japanese restaurant. The 59th st. 7 line subway interchange is across the street, it would be hard to find a more convenient place to stay.

We stayed at 6 Columbus for its proximity to our concert venue. It was a wonderful experience I would recommend to anyone. The staff was both curdious and friendly. Quickly making us feel comfortable and welcomed, Peter the bellman, was always waiting for a chance to help us further discover the city. In a hotel of its caliber I would normally feel intimidated but we actually felt like "guests".

I recently spent about 5 days at this Thompson location and it was one of the best ones I have had the pleasure of staying at. This is the 5th different Thompson property I have been to and I have to say, the staff here were definitely well ahead of all the other locations. The front desk staff were more than accommodating with check in and my room was ready for me within minutes despite the fact I had arrived early. There was no attitude whatsoever and they were probably the most friendly front desk staff I have dealt with in years. We had a few different people arriving at different times and they had no problem gaining access to the room once their names we added to to reservation, which was proactively offered by the staff. The Bellmen were also fantastic. They took the time to meet me and find out a little about me without being too prying. They were able to walk the fine line of getting personal and maintaining a high level of professional service. The location was also great. I really don't like mid town but this place is just north of all the tourist traps and right on the corner of central park. It was great to be able to grab a coffee in the morning and start my day within the tranquility of the park.I will definitely be staying here again on future trips.

6 Columbus was a pleasant experience. The staff and managent were very friendly and helpful. They had many recommendations for food, drinks and sights to see. The rooms were very spacious but my only concern was the lighting was a little dim and could be bit brighter. Above all it was a great hotel and I would recommend anyone to stay here while visiting NYC.

We wanted a small boutique hotel near the park for this trip to New York, and I was lured by the location of this hotel and the nice photography on the hotel website. We negotiated a Queen Deluxe room (which was supposed to have 250 sq ft.) and breakfast for about $325 per night. The lobby is small a modern, with a cozy seating area. We arrived a little early, about 1PM and went across the street to the TIme Warner center to shop for a few hours till the room was ready. Even though the staff took my cell #, we didn't get a call and returned after 4PM to find that the room still wasn't ready. After waiting a few more minutes we were able to get into our room. My first impression was dissapointment at the size. I specificlly picked the Queen Delux for the extra space, but this room seemed more like 175 sq ft than 250. Storage space in the room was minimal and my wife and I struggled to find space to unpack our two carry-on bags. The bathroom was adequately large though, and nicely appointed with modern fixtures and black tile walls. The one window had a view of the space between two buildings.Internet access is a pricey $17 per day, even in the lobby, so we went next door to starbucks to get our wi-fi fix. I was also disappointed in the rooftop terrace, another selling feature of the hotel for me. Turned ou that this terrace was about 90 sq ft and had only a sliver of a view toward the park. Both times I went up there to get some air, nobody was around.My wife and I both agreed that the high points of the hotel were the doormen and the breakfast. The doormen greeted us every time we passed by and chatted us up for our plans each morning, giving advice. With the Columbus circle subway stop right across the street this location was very convenient for getting around midtown. The continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant was free for us (but normally cost $25) and included a very nice fruit selection, granola, yougurt, and juice, milk, coffee.Overall, we felt the room was too small for the price paid, and the hotel amenities were minimal.

Stayed here for one night a few weeks ago. The hotel is very modern and has all the ammenities that you need. The room size was good, actually bigger than I expected. The hotel was very clean and up to date. What really made me happy was the staff. The staff was very kind and very helpful. Even the doorman was so polite and recommended a very nice restaurant for a late night dinner. The price is not cheap, but it's worth every penny. You won't get this type of service in a budget hotel.
user_name:
MarcinTravels
New York City, New York

review_body: 6 Columbus is as you would expect right by Columbus Circle but not so close that you have to endure non stop traffic. I got in from a long flight and was given room keys at 3pm. As I wanted a bath and was given a room with a shower I talked to the bell hop and then reception. Within fifteen minutes I was in a room with a huge bath. The rest of my stay was a joy. Great, responsive and friendly service at a great location in midtown right by Central Park. The sushi bar in reception is very atmospheric (unusual in hotels these days) if a little pricey. Next time I'll be heading right back to Number 6. Thank you.

Everything at this hotel just misses the mark. Their website list square footage for each type of room, but they seem to very generous in their measurements. We checked into #39, which was supposed to be 200 sq ft, but I think 150 would have been closer to the mark (and I'd guess about 40 of that is bathroom). We ended up paying for an upgrade to #86 (even though it was on a smoking "optional" floor). #86 was listed at 300 sq. ft, but it felt like it was barely over 200.Closet and drawer space very limited. Ended up with my suicase on the window sill.Bathtub/shower was also really narrow. Nice toiletries, but no shower gel. Bathroom lighting too fluorescent/unnatural.HVAC really noisy, so we turned it off most of the time (OK in spring, but wouldn't work in summer or winter).Sound from the shower in the adjacent room also very loud.Decor dark and gloomy.On the plus side - service was pleasant, location it excellent. But I wouldn't stay here again - there are lots of better options in NYC.

Recently stayed at 6 Columbus and enjoyed every minute. The room was spacious and the bathroom design was awesome. Breakfast was great and the drinks at the bar were wonderful too. The hotel staff was very accommodating when we needed early morning car service, a place to store our luggage, and even when we needed to print out some documents. Got a chance to meet the General Manager, Ralph. We hit it off chatting about triathlons and marathons- I was very impressed with his 2:58 PR in the NYC Marathon! A must stay place if you are visiting New York and definitely if you are looking to go for a run in Central Park!

This hotel is located in a very good location. Its in midtown.. next to central park... Many restaurants around the hotel... which is very common in Manhattan. Rooms were tiny with no scope of any sunlight. we spend $200+ per night. i dont think its worth that money. Later we stayed in other hotels in New york which were better than this one.
user_name:
yashmi
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked this hotel as we had an additional night to spend in NY on our way back to Europe. The check in clerk was friendly and efficientThe overall deco is a bit bleak and darkThe Pod room we were allocated was very small and dingyThe bathroom was clean and ok stockedThe price we paid was ca. £170 for one night incl. taxLocation is good within easy reach to the Metro Station and Columbus Circle

Loved my stay at 6 Columbus and hope to stay there anytime I am in New York. Staff was nice, room was clean. Loved the bathroom design - using same subway tiles in my bathroom upgrade. Bar in attached restaurant on first floor is great too. Can't say enough about location, obviously.

Stayed here one night (intended to stay longer but checked out because of experience.)The location was perfect, Columbus Circle, really close to Central Park. We were told that we got a "standard" room. However, our room was incredibly tiny, overlooked a brick wall (less that a foot from the window), had a bed that most people would be hard pressed to call a twin.In fact, we were laughed at by the cleaning lady when she saw the bed and realized that it had been assigned to a couple. She showed us a few other rooms on the same floor which looked significantly bigger.The bathroom itself was bigger than our room and very modern. The front desk service was spotty with some of them being way nicer than others. Given NYC's usual hotel room sizes, I wasn't expecting a huge bedroom. This can be a good hotel provided you get the right room.However, the size of our room was simply unforgivable.
user_name:
SunshineGi
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I've now stayed at 6 Columbus several times on business trips to NYC and its quickly become a favorite. The location is great, the hotel has everything you need and the staff are very focused on catering to your needs. If you like stylish boutique this is a good choice.

As a business and leisure traveler who spends 100-130 nights a year in hotels, I've come to really appreciate certain things---cleanliness, location, amenities, and warm service. This hotel delivers!First, cleanliness--this is my BIGGEST concern when I travel. I cannot stand anything that feels like it might be unclean. At 6 Columbus, my room was absolutely spotless! It was also apparent, by design, that they avoided "dirt traps" like carpet, bedspreads, etc. that don't get cleaned regularly, by nature. My room was decorated and designed beautifully with hardwood floors--a REAL treat for cleanliness snobs and germophobes! I wish all hotels had hardwood floors like this one, rather than the dirt-masking darkly patterned carpets most hotels use. This floor gets an A+++ with me at 6 Columbus!The bathroom was also spotless--and tiled floor to ceiling with a gorgeous contemporary feel. I love the black, gray and white contemporary feel of my room with touches of wood to add warmth. The bed was quite comfortable and I loved the freshly washed duvets and nice sheets. I was exceptionally surprised by windows on BOTH opposite sides of my room! Views on two opposite sides? That RARELY happens! What a treat! I could overlook Columbus Circle from my wall-to-wall, floor-to-ceiling window and peek at Central Park from my office chair... neat! I also had a nice little balcony, complete with chair and coffee table. I've NEVER been to a NY hotel with a balcony like that. Superb!For ladies---you will LOVE the high-end brand, Kiehl's amino acid shampoo and conditioner at this hotel. FINALLY a hotel that gives you ample shampoo and a conditioner that ACTUALLY CONDITIONS your hair! (Instead of that goop that rinses out leaving your hair no less conditioned than before you started.) It was WONDERFUL...to the point I want to go online and see how to purchase more! The service at this hotel was superb. Always friendly, helpful, and they memorized my name within minutes of checking in---and people greeted me by name throughout my 4-night stay. Brandon, one of the doormen, was especially courteous and helpful. They made me feel right at home.A nice, large flat screen TV and a full snack and mini-bar that was stocked well-beyond-mini status was a nice treat when tired feet and long work days extinguished some of my energy for getting to the nearby drugstore for a beverage or snack. The prices at the mini-bar weren't bargains, but weren't total rip-offs, either, given the convenience. For a business traveler, internet connectivity is always important---and I notice at a lot of hotels these days, the bandwidth is severely lacking given the multitude of devices and data-heavy use put upon them in the evening hours. At some points during recent stays, I've literally had to go without internet or tether from my phone as the hotel-provided internet (even for a fee), couldn't support the user demand. At 6 Columbus, the internet, though a bit pricey ($15/day), was rock-solid the entire time. Additionally, they offered ample outlets for charging my multiple devices.I've been a loyal member of the Hilton chain of hotels for years (Diamond level), but I chose 6 Columbus hotel for it's location to business on this particular trip, and it's price (a little less than other nearby hotels), plus other reviews I read about its quality. For me, not staying at a Hilton chain is a deviation from loyalty that I rarely make. That said, whenever I shall return to NYC again, I'm definitely going to consider the 6 Columbus. It's been a true pleasure from start to end to stay here. Thank you, Thompson Hotels, for the excellent service and experience at 6 Columbus. I will definitely consider you again next time I am in NY or another city that has a Thompson hotel. It was wonderful.

we had the best time at this hotel from the moment we checked in, to moment we left! The front desk was very pleasant and very helpful, the doormen were great, the bar and restaurant were fantastic... the restaurant suggestions were spot on and the rooms were immaculate!. room service was prompt and reasonable... we would definately go back
user_name:
david g
Forked River, New Jersey

review_body: This was my first stay at 6 Columbus and the price was incredibly fair considering it's a Thompson Hotel. I originally booked the Pod room (which I knew would be small, but I was traveling alone on business and not worried) and they were kind enough to upgrade me to a larger room at check-in.The bed and bathroom were heavenly (they are always my primary concern), the staff was incredibly friendly, and the location was great (with Columbus Circle and Central Park just steps away).Definitely would stay here again.
user_name:
Greg Y
New York City, New York

review_body: Very quiet, nice one night stay! Included a newspaper in the morning :-) but I don't think wifi. The staff was very nice. The room was clean, a little small and dark, not too luxurious feeling, but it was fine. We booked this according to a good price, also had a good location.

If you are looking for a good value in this area, I would highly recommend 6 Columbus. I booked my room through a last minute travel app, so the price was extremely reasonable. The room was the typical NYC tiny size, but it was spotlessly clean, the furniture appeared to be new, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious, had a heated floor, and quality Kiehl's soap/shampoo/conditioner was provided.I was a bit surprised not see an iron or ironing board in the room, but I'm sure the hotel staff would have brought one to me had I asked. The staff were quite prompt in providing the extra bed sheet that I requested.The front desk staff and doormen were extremely friendly and gave me some excellent tips on nearby entertainment options. On my next trip to New York, when considering my hotel options, 6 Columbus will be at the very top of my list. I cannot emphasize enough how pleasant my stay here was.

From check-in to check-out the staff at 6 Columbus was top notch. The property reminded me of a stay in a boutique hotel in South Beach Miami. I booked with an internet travel site for a last minute deal, and was supposed to move to a different hotel for the last two days of my stay. I enjoyed the first night so much, I asked if they had availability to extend, and they did, so I cancelled the other stay. The location is amazing, at the top of W 58th just as you enter Columbus Circle. It was an easy walk to Times Sq/Broadway and Hell's Kitchen resturants, A subway stop is directly across the street. I was in a king room and did not find the room to be loud from street noise as I have in past NYC hotels. Also found the room size to be bigger than what I normally expect from NYC. Room was nicely decorated, not over the top with a good color scheme. The heated floor in the bathroom was a nice surprise. Be sure to check out the roof deck, it wasn't open for the season for service, but was open to sit and work from, it was a nice quiet "retreat" from a busy day of work. As others have mentioned the restaurant is supposed to be amazing, but it was full each night I wanted to try it. People waiting to go in did also rave about the food. The staff can truly make or break your experience, and as mentioned in the opening they were just amazing. Welcoming you back each time you returned, and consistently checking to make sure everything was top notch.I'll be sure to return.

Location: Fantastic! Right on the south west corner of Central Park, across from the Time Warner Center and Columbus Circle/59th Street subway stop. Easy walk to most Broadway theaters and Times Square is just a smidge further. Seemed like there were several great restaurants nearby as well.Service: Superb! All attendants were very responsive and enthusiastic. The concierge also provided two great recommendations as well.Room: Very nice. Decor was fabulous. The bed was very comfortable.The main unfortunate thing was that the bed platform juts out just enough to make a sharp edge. Both my companion and I hit our shins on the edge---ouch! The other issue was the lighting in the room was a little dim for anything detailed, but sufficient for general use. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious. And the tiles were heated, which was awesome! WiFi: Unfortunate---$15. There's a Starbucks next store with free WiFi and ample seating.
user_name:
atxgal718
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: BRILLIANT: Blue Ribbon is the hotel restaurant. You will stay in a lot of hotels. Very few of them will have a hotel restaurant as good as Blue Ribbon.NOT SO BRILLIANT: A television that didn't work for my stay, with the wrong remote provided and no access to cable channels. APPRECIATED: The hotel offering me free wi-fi as a result.NOT APPRECIATED: That it took talking to two different managers on two days to get that discount taken care of. The first manager offered an upgrade to another room the following day, which isn't really all that much fun when you've already unpacked two suitcases. GREAT LITTLE THING: Heated bathroom tiles! No, really! There's a little knob in the bathroom to adjust the heat, although I couldn't figure out how to work mine. UNGREAT LITTLE THING: No public ice machine, so the doormen would be summoned to bring up ice (requiring a tip in the process)GREAT BIG THING: A nice variety of pillows, both firm and soft, even for a full-size bed.UNGREAT BIG THING: The stairs smelled like vomit. THE BEST THING: The hotel's location, facing the Time Warner building, means that you're about 20 yards away from some fantastic restaurants (including Per Se! Come on!). There's also a Starbucks next door and a 24-hour Duane Reade (and a NY food cart that's open till 3 AM!) on the corner, and multiple subway lines are within two blocks. So it's a great place to stay in the sense of having both things around and ways to easily get away.

My first trip to NYC and I can't say enough good things about it, and the stay at the hotel was a great bonus. I went in Feb so super low season in NYC so hotels were having sales left, right and center. (On a side note, if you can put up with the cold, great time to go! all the good things NYC has to offer without the pesky tourists)I wanted to shop in NYC so as a concession, I decided to cut the budget for expensive five star hotels and opted for more affordable boutique options. 6 Columbus was suggested to me and i booked a pod thinking that if I can survive in Tokyo living in their pods, I can definitely survive in New York. Fortunately, I didn't have to find out. I was upgraded without asking as I checked in. Room didn't have a view but was spacious and clean. For one night, it was great. The service was extremely good and everyone is super friendly. Would definitely stay here again. Only one little thing, you have to pay for wifi... felt a little 2008ish. Who charges for wifi anymore? Forked over my $15 and that was that.

This is not my first Thompson hotel nor my last. There seems to be a formula that works for my demographic in these hotels, with distinguishing characteristics defining each individual property. This hotel is perfectly situated for the subway, which is 1 minute away, the Time Warner building, Lincoln Center and other Upper East Side attractions. Rooms are small but charming in a minimal but comfortable way, great sheets and bath products, etc. My only complaint is a $15 charge for the internet, just can't understand why a hotel with such classy aspirations would stoop to this charge, especially because there's free wi-fi in an adjacent Starbuck's. Apart from that quibble, everything else was fabulous, with very attentive doormen/valets who actually act as concierges, and an obliging front desk staff. I had a great rate, I guess because it was off-season, and was upgraded to a larger room, which really made me feel I was getting something for nothing. The bathroom was under heated,In summary, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who chooses this area as a desirable one in NYC. I will definitely be back in the future.

Fantastic hotel in a location that can't be beat. It is literally across the street from the subway and half a block from Central Park. Ralph is a fantastic manager and is very willing to address guests' inquiries. Front desk staff was attentive and the valets are among the best I've encountered in NYC. For the people saying the place is small, welcome to New York! Every hotel room in the city for less than $500/night is small. This is a boutique hotel, not a Hilton. If you want a mega hotel, stay elsewhere.Clean and wonderfully decorated as well. We'll be back.
We have stayed at other Thompson properties and this was equally nice. Nice decor, great location, clean rooms. Really friendly and helpful staff. Reasonable rate.

From the gentleman that greet you to the entire staff, I have to say this was one of the more memorable hotel experiences I've had. After 3 nights, the Columbus 6 felt like home as the staff even remembered my first name!The hotel is perfectly located at the southwest corner of Central Park. From the shopping, restaurants, entertainment and even the Whole Foods across the street, I could not have asked for more convenience. The rooms are clean and modern, yet charming and quaint. The level of respect for the guests from top to bottom is really unparalleled when compared to my other stays in NYC. I am looking forward to my return next month.
user_name:
Sean B
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Great location and price. The king superior suite eas delighful with a nice outside patio with table and chairs. really enjoyed the outside space in NYC!!THe room was a good size too. I really like the wood floors in the room, it seems cleaner than carpet. The front desk was very accomodating with late check out too!The only negative was the front desk staff. They werent so friendly, they were very good at what they did but not overly friendly.Mayve aI just caught them at a bad time. Besides that I would recommend the hote and would stay there again.

Our stay at this hotel was perfect. Friendly staff, great price on the room (Priceline), immaculately clean, chic bath & decor, fantastic location for our evening at Lincoln Center. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Horrible service, no wifi working on all my stay, dirty and old ann bad decoration. no closet enough.The restaurant too noisy anmd took j¡hours for the food to come. No people at the front desk. the looby and the entrance of the hotel full of people drinking or smoking. not a hotel to go!!!
user_name:
Marcelo L
Buenos Aires, Distrito Federal, Argentina

review_body: I travel to NYC on business at least 2 times a month and have stayed in numerous hotels all over the city. After staying at the Columbus 6 I will no longer stay anywhere else. From the extremely good location (on Columbus Circle with best Subway access in the city and Whole Foods across the street), incredibly large and clean rooms, and almost overly polite staff, there is no better value in the all of Manhattan. Also, the restaurant in the lobby, Blue Ribbon, has arguably the best Sushi in the city.I recommend this spot to anyone visiting NYC on business or pleasure.

First, you should know that they gave me an upgrade to a king studio (from queen superior), so obviusly we enjoyed the room! The hotel is in a stark 1960s style with great tile bathrooms. The location behind the Time Warner complex provides access to Carnegie, Lincoln Center, Broadway, and to Per Se and Jean Georges (or to the pre theater $30 something special at Nougatine), as well as Central Park. The staff are really special. Coming back to the room with two cups of coffee from next door Starbucks, the doorman follows me to use his key (the elevator requires room key to operate) because my hands were full! At check out as we come down with suitcases, bell captain approachs and asks if we want storage, has it arranged instantly. As we leave, a very pleasant housekeeper immediately straightens up our room after a pleasant greeting. Great place to stay in NYC!

Let's start with the good:- I liked the 60's airport theme that is going on inside,- It's cool that the sushi bar is tied to the hotel from the reception area,- The hotel is very well located (that is if you're a midtown/uptown sort of a person), - Prices were reasonable for the location- Problem-less house-keeping; timely papers in the morningMoving on to the dark side:- I had to arrive at 7AM in the morning, and I only got my room by 3PM, the regular check-in time; nothing off the books there, but they could have tried a bit more to accommodate me...- The 'complimentary upgrades' that are being referred to in all those reviews is either a lot of very lucky guests, or a smell of self-promoting reviews... (I hope that's not the case and that I'm sensing wrong) I would assume so, because I didn't get one, and I had to wait 8 hours for the check-in and it was my birthday, and they knew it from an email exchange. - The room was cold in appearance and mood (lack of carpeting plays a big role in this)- It looked right into an old residential building just a few feet away; got no sunshine and I had to keep the curtains covered at all times in order not to be face-to-face with the other building anyways...- You could hear absolutely everything from the rooms on either sides, as well as any little sound on the corridor- No complimentary Wi-Fi anywhere in the hotel?! What century is this in? - There was a permanent smell of manure on the corridor of our floorOverall, I guess it was OK... Would I stay there again; not if it will replicate the first experience.

We stayed in a King suite ( couple with 18 year old son) for a week in early January 2012. We asked for a nice room and we had a great view over to the Time-Warner building, so we could see how the day was shaping up weather wise and just look at all the street life. The room was really quiet. My son was happy as on the sofa bed in the living room with his own TV. All the staff were amazingly nice and the concierge got us NFL play-off tickets at short notice which was hugely appreciated.We love the vibe of small boutique hotels. You feel like you are coming home. The bar is great and the sushi restaurant is brilliant in the hotel.The location is fantastic. My husband would go running in Central Park. The subway is 100m away. The Whole Foods shop in the Time Warner is brilliant to have across the road. That whole place is great actually with brilliant restaurants.The hotel has a great terrace for drinks with fab views.The only downer is the $15 for wi-fi every day.We all have iPads and computers and to log in all would have been a waste but we love our own devices!We had loads of luggage because we were travelling with all our snowboard gear and we had plenty of space. We got a great room rate by booking on-line and loved staying at this hotel.

Very disappointing experience overall. I have stayed at other Thompson hotels and this was a total surprise at how poor the quality was. The lobby is shabby and tiny, as are the rooms. The customer service is awful, and that was one half of the problem. The main issue was that it was EXTREMELY loud in the hallway next to my room (43) beginning early in the morning. I got no sleep. Finally I called down at 9 am to ask for earplugs. I mentioned the issue for a second time during checkout and was given absolutely no recourse or reason to come back. The girl said a flippant 'sorry!' and turned away. Absolutely surprising and terrible. I have spent a huge amount of money on events, parties, celebrations and nights out at Thompson properties and do not plan to return after this experience.

On one of the coldest days of the year, a little boxwood in a tall black planter shivers in the wind outside of the lobby of 6 Columbus. Tufted leather banquettes sparsely populated with bursts of bright pillows afford a bit of seating while I wait for my room to be ready. Two complaints of rooms with no heat have already been lodged at the front desk, and as the wind whips by the window this doesn’t seem to bode well. The lobby, fronted by two very friendly door-men, is a balance of light and dark – coolly modern in style, like the rest of the hotel, but warmed by the staff. A sushi restaurant (Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill) is set off to the side, affording a tantalizing glimpse of a light wooden bar. While Columbus Circle is not usually an area in which I’d stay while visiting New York, an online special ($140 a night, before taxes) lured me to 6 Columbus, and I’d heard good things about the parent company that runs it (Thompson Hotels). A slightly dim elevator and hallway, the textured navy blue walls and dark floors eating up much of the light, lead to room #77. Like most New York accommodations, the pod rooms here are on the slightly smaller side of things (175 square feet), so it might be worth it to upgrade to a larger one if possible. The bathroom is more ample, backed by glossy navy tiles and brightly polished Waterworks fixtures. Bolstered by Kiehl’s hair products and white fluffy towels, it is a modern, elegant space, even if an over-hyped Frette bathrobe errs on the side of starchy rather than soft.Above the bed is a large Guy Bourdin print, echoing the proclaimed“60’s modernist” inspiration point for the hotel. The bed itself is comfortable, but not laid out with any top sheets – only a duvet. I’m neither picky nor grossed out about such things, and, as long as the heat was working, didn’t have need for extra bedding. A word about the heat: despite my concerns upon hearing the complaints of other patrons, the heat in my room worked just fine – but it didn’t make it into the bathroom, which was a great deal cooler (not the ideal situation for January). I had to overcompensate in the bedroom to warm the tiled space, but it was nothing a hot shower didn’t fix. On a Sunday night, the room remains pleasingly quiet, affording an uninterrupted evening of sleep. The next morning, as I make my way to the elevator, the unmistakable odor of pot hangs lightly in the air, while knocks and calls of “housekeeping” go unanswered. Another average day in New York has begun.

They call their rooms pods and rightfully so. The nice things are: friendly staff from the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping staff to the restaurant. The decor is lovely and ultra-modern. The bed and linens are comfortable and all are clean. The location cannot be more convenient to buses going in every direction and the NYC subway which can be taken to any part of town. The size of the room prohibits any more than the bed, 2 small night tables, a very small closet with a good-sized safe at the bottom (makes it difficult to set your code) and a dresser/refrigerator within one console. The top is covered with all sorts of snacks and other conveniences as well as a complete stock of beverages. There are no vending machines or ice makers on the floor. No sitting area other than the bed nor a luggage rack. The bath is blue tiled with a fair sized shower and very deep sink. The small size makes it hard to bathe, do makeup and get dressed. The door to the bath is opaque class and the mirror over the sink emits a blue light when it is off. The room is not completely dark. It was OK to stay a couple of nights especially if you used the room primarily for sleeping but any lounging must take place in the lobby or the restaurant/bar which is right in the hotel. We didn't use these services but they both seemed to be busy. Access to the internet is at a cost but there is a Starbuck's next door.

My boyfriend and I reserved the king deluxe room. When we arrived, we were surprised to have the front desk girl upgrade us complimentary to the king suite!!! It was like our own little modern apt!!! The room was so clean, the bed was super comfy , the pillows were like heaven, the staff was extremely friendly, and the restaurant at the hotel, Blue Ribbon, is DELICIOUS!!! This is a must stay hotel if you are traveling to NYC.
user_name:
janine a
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at 6 Columbus for a couple of days before Christmas. The sta were just terrific. We arrived before noon, and we were allowed to check in early. The girls at the desk one day had terrific recommendations for Thai restaurants. The bellman seemed to read our minds about storing our luggage for several hours when we checked out. Great in all regards! The rooms are small, as we expected. But the beds are as comfortable as our bed at home, the linens are top notch, and the location can't be beat. I loved the heated tile floor in the bathroom. I do wish that they had free wi- fi. We used the Starbucks next door instead.

My boyfriend and I stayed at 6 Columbus right after NYE and we couldn't have been happier. It is in a great location but isn't one of those big, touristy hotels. Decor of a hotel is very important to me and 6 Columbus was sleek and modern but still welcoming. The staff was very helpful, and even gave us a complimentary room upgrade so we could stay on the same floor as the other couple we were meeting there.Being in NY and so close to Columbus Circle, we expected the usual city sounds at night. I was shocked that we could not hear any noise inside our room; I am not exaggerating, the room was completely sound-proof. We are excited to try the rest of the Thompson hotels in NY and other cities.
user_name:
Gina N
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a perfectly located and perfectly priced little hotel. It's right near a subway that will get you uptown and downtown, near Central Park and all the shops at Columbus Circle. The rooms are spacious enough and there is plenty of storage space if you're staying a couple of days (look on the side of the bed - the drawers are there). Rooms and bathroom were spotless. Bed was super comfortable. And best of all - and despite its super central location - the room was exceptionally quiet. We had a rear facing room, so no view, but we didn't care about that. Quiet was more important. Cute little roof bar as well. And we didn't spend a fortune.

The rooms are in dire need of a re-touch and handy-man.The bathroom plumbing needs an overhaul so that toilets do actually flush first time 'round.The staff when presented with any slight issue revert to a patter of meaningless excuses.Overall - so dissapointing. There are other hotels with good locations mid-town, better priced and properly trained staff.

Location, Location, Location! 6 Columbus is located on the southwester corner of Central Park. It's within walking distance of many classic sites, 5th Avenue, Broadway, and you can spend any downtime just sitting in Central Park! The subway entrance was located across the the street which is really convenient. Starbucks is right next door and a pharmacy is two doors down. Great for last minute snacking, water/soda etc. Time Warner Plaza is across the street with a variety if higher-end retail stores and a few restaurants. The hotel is trendy, and on the small-side like any older, boutique hotel in a big city. It was clean, updated, cozy, and quiet. The staff is very attentive and helpful with our "first-timer" questions. We plan on returning for another visit and would stay here again.

We stayed at the 6 Columbus on a lively weekend just before Thanksgiving. We wanted a hip vibe that was as close to Central Park as possible but with a price tag we could afford, and that's exactly what we received!This hotel is right on the south-west corner of Central Park and it was so wonderful to wake up everyday and stroll through. You are also walking distance to all of the fabulous shops like FAO Schwarz, Tiffany, and others down 5th Avenue.Each of the staff members we meet were so friendly. Form the hostess, to the doorman to the bellhop- each so accommodating and warm. We even received a complimentary room upgrade when we arrived, with out even asking. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an affordable-yet shiek hotel in the middle of it all in NYC.

I really like this hotel. It's hip but not snotty, the rooms are varied in sizes from small to not so small (it's a NYC boutique hotel so that's what you get!) but they are nicely appointed, have great bedding and lovely tiled bathrooms. The lighting is the only thing that needs work. The rooms are very dark but I'm sure if you asked they would offer more lamps or brighter bulbs. The location is terrific if you like midtown. You're across the street from Columbus Circle shops, the subway is steps away, great restaurants (including the hotel's own Japanese eatery) are within earshot, and a 24 hour Duane Reed is on the corner.All in all, a thumbs up for another fine Thompson hotel.

The location, staff, and cleanliness of this hotel are fantastic. However, at over $500 per night for a standard King size room, I was not overwhelmed. This hotel is located just off Columbus Circle, making it very easy to catch cabs to wherever you may wish to go in Manhattan. You can easily walk to Central Park, or Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, etc. The room itself was spacious enough for two people, but the decor was an attempt at 1960s/1970's era styling; instead it looks more on the side of inexpensive, second-hand furniture store. The hallways and hotel room doors are painted black, which makes the small hotel hallways appear even smaller, even giving it a creepy and tenement house feel. The room was extremely clean, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and soft, the shower stall was large enough to not feel cramped, and there was endless hot water available with excellent water pressure to relax after a long day. The staff was always extremely accommodating and helpful. My biggest complaints would be the very high price for a not so glamorous room; and can you PLEASE install electrical strips for the business person who has to plug in and charge multiple electronic devices? I had my cell phone, blackberry, Ipad, and laptop, and there were not enough plugs in the room so I could charge/use all at once. I would probably stay at this location again, if some of my other favorites were booked.
